reviews.review:
Love this place. Zen, which is the department store here, can take a few hours itself as there are so many floors and a huge variety of products. I'd recommend buying everything you need on the one day so you can maximise the amount of VAT refund.
Good variety of shops and love the food court upstairs.

Big shopping centre . This place has it all!.. I mean everything!.. it's huge!.. ice skating rink, VIP first class cinema, all the name brands and non name brands you can think of!.. Huge number of restaurants... it's clean and tidy great for shopaholics and good for a rainy day in Bangkok!

Huge shopping mall. I went to this shopping mall about 1 or 2 time a month because there are many shop in side both brand name a local brand I also like to prey the Ganisha statue in front of the mall

Ice skating @ Central World. There's ice arena at Central World, the cost for full day entrance is about 700 baht. It's a great experience to have a skate here although the ice is not very cold (warm). It would be a great place for you to try it out. You may need to prepare gloves, jacket and socks.
Dittapan Ch.. It looks old. I don't like it. I only have coffee at the Starbucks because I have made an appointment with my friend. But I can see many people in here.

Big big big. A really big shopping mall.Separated in the floors you find almost everything. In the upper floors are a lot of restaurants for all kind of food. In the mall itself you have parts for electronics, parts for furniture, and normal shopping as clothes and all you want. Of course it is air conditioned, so on a hot day you can come in and cool down a little bit.
A must!. This place is really amazing. It is a all in one shop and the lengthy operating hours make shopping a breeze.

Huge!. This was my first time in Bangkok and Have completely loved it.I have never been to a large scale shopping mall and this was my first time and going to central world plaza was really great because there was a lot of variety of shops and different restaurants.It was truly clean and the staff was nice.
Classy mall. I ain't rich but I love this place. Especially the foods. And the fancy stores. And they got lots of AC.

Food!. I came here to eat every time I travelled to Bangkok for business trip. A lot of food varieties especially Japanese food. You can also watch a movie here at night if you've nothing left to do in Bangkok.

Has everything. Pricey Shopping. . This was a massive Mall very spread out and tons to offer with a nice movie theater and several eating areas. Things cost more here then other shopping complexes and considerably more than out on the streets. And never did find the designated 'center area' as it felt like there was quite a few 'centers'. So challenging to meet up with people if you're only using Wi-Fi. The skating rink was beautiful.

Confusing. Huge shopping mall but don't know how they differentiate high ends product and middle - low products as everything are in the same place. A bit confusing. But if you want to check out local shopping mall cos this place is in the middle of the most crowded place in bangkok which nearby MBK,SIAM,etc.

Great choice. Among all the malls located next to each other this is a one of the best options. It has absolutely everything under one roof from clothes to cars. Large space, lots of walking. Good eateries.

One of Our Favorites. This place has never disappointed us in terms of shopping or just people watching. There is everything here under one roof. It is so huge that a shopoholic will find that just visiting it for a day will not do justice. And when you are tired from all the walking there are always plenty of restaurants and food stalls to tantalise your taste buds. It is clean, spacious and very diverse in its tenants. A must visit if you are in Bangkok !
Great shopping . Loads of shops and good quality restaurants. Ideal for escaping the heat of the day. Plus large cinema complex.
Very attractive mall. This mall has different tasteYou can find franchise shops and local shops You can enjoy food corner And so many coffee shops

Air conditioned shopping. Nothing distuingishes this mall from others in the area, except maybe housing a unique boutique. It's not disappointing if your mission is to shop but don't expect to find bargains here.

Typical Mall but very large & great food options. We visited here on our last night in Bangkok. Easy to get to via Sky Train - well laid out over 8 levels. Good mix of everyday brands to shop at and high end boutique also lots of electronics stores. Food options here are mind blowing and they have multiple areas. We chose to eat in the outside area called the 'Groove' area - It was brilliant! Great place for a cool walk around.

Big Shopping mall. This Shopping mall is just opposite of Arnoma Hotel. You could say the biggest shopping in Bangkok and in wiki it said the sixth largest shopping complex in the world. Varieties of luxury brand available this shopping mall. Food mall are in 6th & 7th floor.

This place is MASSIVE. . Central world is one massive shopping mall, probably the biggest I've been in. The top 2-3 floors are full of Resteraunt's lots of choice but you can eat a lot cheaper and better in the food markets just outside. Lots of designer shops but not the traditional Thai shops we were looking for. Came here 15 years ago when it was the world trade centre, I think they knocked it down to bold this place. A good shopping experience by a bit soulless and boring after a short time

Large. 15 years ago not a shopping mall in sight, things have changed. The malls are on a par with anywhere in the world, BKK is not all about cheap imitations and knock offs. Worth a visit and you will see how BKK has moved forwards (or backwards depending on your perspective)
Great shopping. We wandered around, had great food, and snipped! Lots of high end retail stores, we would go back! Not really for the budget shopper.

Visit again this shopping mall . Visit again this shopping mall after coming from siam paragon. The shopping mall are more comforable for all visitors. Thai and farang. Shops on international and thai price level and quality. Further is a ice skating place inside for childrens and adults

Elit shopping mall. I was never see to selling car at shopping center :) ıts not reflect the reality on Bangkok, directly another culture. Should be visiting for see Thai capital rich and impressive style.

Usual Shopping Mall. A shopping mall with almost everything inside. There are shops for all ages. However price are pretty standard unless there are ongoing promotions. They have tourist privilege but not much of usage as there are lots of limitations
Visit to thailand... land of smile. We have enjoyed a lot , did lot of shopping and enjoy the thai food and thai culture did boating in the river

Cheap foods ... Good Finds. On our vacation at Bangkok , from our hotel we walked our way to the Central World Plaza ... And how we got so excited to see different kinds of yummy Thailand Foods ... You will go crazy over their delicious Thai Noodle called Pad Thai , their spicy Tom Yum Soup ( with large shrimps) their sticky rice with ripe sweet mangoes . Oh how i loved their super yummy coconut ice cream with the soft coconut meat beneath the ice cream .. Grrrr... Luveeet !!! There are other good finds as you walk thru & thru ...

Huge! . This place is really lovely. Huge variety of stores with a massive footprint - come prepared to walk! Not much for kids in the way of toys or clothes. No bargains here. You'll pay as much or more as you would in Aussie/NZ (same as all imported, real clothing brands in Thailand). Awesome food court with view over downtown. You have to ignore all the sit down places & walk all the way through the food market to get to the cordoned off food court.

Happy Visitor Experience. The center is really very big, a lot of shops and Brands & many restaurants.Connected with Chid Lom BTS Station. Must visit Naraya Showroom on the Groung Floor. UniQlo also has a very nice Showroom Setup. Good Location. A bit high range Shopping Location. Visited several times. Everytime a Happy Visitor.

Huge Mall with lots of stuff. This is a gianormous mall with almost everything you can think of. They even sell lamborghinis and rolls royce cars on the 5th floor. Many nice food outlets. Movie theatre has nice reclining seats.

Big big mall. The center was very big, a lot of shops to see and many restaurants to choose from. However the price for dining was not cheap, especially in the outdoor market right in front of the Central World. Not sure if they accept bargain but you should try asking for discount though.

Not your average shopping centre. This is a place to go to if your not into large crowds like some other centres. Well laid out and a good variety of retail shops and a lot of restaurants. It's hard to pick the rigt one to dine in.

Huge. This place is huge that you could get lost. It has so many shops. The place is very clean.
We entered from the Siam BTS skytrain and it took us to a very nice eating area.
There are concierge counters that can help you.

Another mall. Some shops are closed here. Except for the event held in and outside of the place, traffic definitely does not meet up with Siam. We were looking for a place for foot massage at the mall. We asked Information booth and went in the direction instructed to get inside Isetan!!! We are unable to find a directory. So we gave up and left. The best thing about this mall is the hawkers on the side. We have a bowl of noodles and a few skewers of BBQ and a bottle of juice. Very nice and inexpensive.

Upmarket shopping. This is another of the upmarket shopping complexes in the Bangkok CBD. Lovely specialty stores and nice coffee shops for that little well earned shopping break rest. Easy to get to by rail, or if in central CBD by foot along the overpass under the rail link. A genuine upmarket shopping experience.
All in one roof! . Huge and very spacious mall, where you find everything you need! I love to come here when in Bangkok either for shopping , eating or watch a movie!

Not as great as before. Before the place burned down, they used to have really great sales - like you could scratch and win 40-80% off on some gds in the central dept store which was wonderful because imagine playing only $30- $40 for something that was $400++. Now it is just an overpriced, white elephant...the Naraya there is always crowded with ehem, a certain nationality who push and shove everyone out of their way and shout and scream across the store...not to mention sitting/squatting in front of the shop and blocking everyone's path.. If you come during fashion wk, central may have some catwalk happening which can be quite entertaining. A lot of food options there so you will be spoiled for choice.

Great shopping mall in Bangkok. Must recommend for shopping in Bangkok has all the stores you can think of, 7 stories high and had a great food/shopping mall as well which we went to and had a great lunch.
Biggest mall in Bangkok. amazing place, super big and can find almost all famous brands with top quality. and it has direct access from sky walk. excellent must visit place
my fav shopping mall in bkk. this place is huge! i love shopping there because all shops is there, you can spend your time for a whole day!

Big mall. Always visited this mall when we in Bangkok,variety of shops,restaurants inside. Easy to access as connected to bts sky train, taxi also no problem. Highly recommend to all who visits Bangkok

Best shopping Mall in Bangkok. This places is amazing, more shops than you can ever visiting a day & we were there 7 hours. Great options for food & drink, really cool & pleasant on a hot Bangkok day.
Forget the markets - this is the place to be & really easy to access from a sky bridge at Siam stop.

Very big mall, many eateries on almost top floor, supermarket, cinema, night life@Groove. Visited Central World Plaza which is located between Siam and Ratchadamri BTS station (please do not mix this station up with Ratchathewi) for the first time this month. From Siam Square area, you can use the sky walk (elevated pedestrian walkway which is a level lower than the BTS station platform) to access Central World Plaza. It is a very big, modern mall with a nice atrium where zig-zagging escalators creating a pattern when looking down from the eatery floor. Supermarket and cinema are found on the same floor where the eateries are. There are Thai, Japanese, Chinese and other restaurants on that almost top floor. We patronized a Thai restaurant here and will review it later. We think there is an Isetan in here when we saw its logo on the facade of the building the following day but we didn't have a chance to walk past it during that evening when we visited it. For those who like pubbing or to listen to some music while eating/drinking, can pop by the Groove, it's on the 2nd level. You can also walk up to the Groove from ground level via flights of outdoor steps. Note that alfresco dining is available@the Groove and we notice there is at least one restaurant which offers both alfresco dining and air-con dining place. For those who like to buy stuff made from Thai silk, there is a <Jim Thompson> on the first level, nearer to the Groove side.
Great mall. If you are looking for your favourite brands then here it is in one air conditioned location Not much savings but the variety is far greater here. Easy mall to get around.

Great place for cheap eats. The food court on the 7th floor is a great place for quick meals on a budget. Caters for all ages.Good selection of local cuisine, but not suitable for Muslim patrons as they serve a lot of pork dishes.Try the papaya salad (not as spicy as some places) and the stewed pork leg rice

They have McDonald's!!!. After a few days of eating rice, noodles, fish & vegetables I started to crave normal food again... like fries, burgers, pizza etc etc... you could only imagine how excited I got when I saw the McDonald's sign!!! The central world plaza have a relatively small McDonalds but the portion size of there food is huge!! The lower floor has a market type of feel to it with its open stalls down stairs, it has a huge grocery department store, bubble tea shops, banks, clothes etc. I really enjoyed seeing new things and trying out Thai food (stalls give samples) the people were helpful and friendly around. They have a lot of security in the mall which made me feel safe and everyone's bangs are checked before going in. So no need to worry about "being robbed".
one of the best malls in Bangkok. This is one of the best malls in Bangkok city, girls like to spend the whole day, going up and down and in and out..

Shopping and good food. Central world is a one stop Shop for food and shopping, I know all the malls are nearly the same, but not really ,every mall is defined by its food court ,and I spent a lot of time going through their food in this particular food court .

Good choice of food . It's a bit funny that I go to Central World for food, not for shopping, :)You can try dimsum at Din Tai Fung or the MK hot pot on Level 7. Or if you want something special, go outside the Mall and you will see many vendor that sale grill fish. The taste is amazing.
Nice shopping mall. Fancy mall with different floors representing another country. Bottom floor has a food court with different choices. Good stop if you're nearby.

Nail Wonderland at Central World Plaza, Bangkok. This shop is big and attractive. My friend and I went there for a mani/pedi. The manicurists were quite rough when filing our toe nails. They filed along the flesh area as well as the nail. Before my friend could tell them to stop, they had cut and pulled some skin off the side of her big toe. The area got infected and my friend was in pain for many days. We didn't complain during our stay as my friend was too disheartened to visit the shop again. When she returned to Singapore, she visited the doctor and had to pay quite a large sum for her treatment.Please do not go to Nail Wonderland. But if you do, please voice out your discomfort immediately. Don't keep silent if you're in pain.
Shopping mall with lots of choices. Just another mall similar to Siam paragon. Have a variety of food choices and also shops. Naraya is located at this mall

Good for luxury travelers. We were told it's the most luxurious and beautiful mall in Bangkok for brand shoppers.Unfortunately we didn't have enough time to see all and just visited the first floor but it was enough for me to agree with them.in that little time my wife could buy some clothes from the big H&M shop there.

amazing wealth. Most Thai people are average working class and perhaps in poverty. Just flip the job ads in their newspapers and you see jobs going for 15,000B a month.Then when you arrive at this mall operated by the Central group, you see prices that does not agree with the average Thai people. Crazy.But there are filthy rich Thai people too. And these are the target audience. They will shop for a car on the 5th floor of the mall. Or even pay 3 to 4 times more for a luxurious movie screening.Yes the rich come out to play, despite the traffic jam that surrounds this mega mall.Tourists go for the average option at Chatuchak.Rich tourists come to Central for the big brand names.Your pleasure is dictated by how much you are worth.That is the tragedy that is life.
A nice shopping destination . A large section of shops, mostly brand name. It has a shops for all your needs. Also a cinema at the top

Happy shopping and eating. Enjoyed the shopping n window - shopping as well. Wide range of shops . There were many restaurants too to choose from. Had a very delicious Japanese lunch there. Reasonably priced.
Average shopping mall.. The mall is very big but design is quite old. There are hundreds of restaurants and cafe however goods inside are generally over priced.

Great & Convenient Mall. We visit this place almost every time we visited Bangkok.We usually stay in a hotel within Siam Square and the overhead foot bridge linking the street to BTS and all the Malls making it very easy to walk from our hotel.There are several favourites within the mall that we frequent.Besides shopping in stores such as ISETAN, ZEN and others. We also enjoy the food from our favourite dumpling restaurant Din Tai Fung.We have also never failed to stop to enjoy our favourite milk ice cream stall Umm! Milk...
Isetan & zen. Major shopping here are these two dept stores with many resturants, a cinema & other shops.Connecting bridge from platinum mall does not link to here directly.

Check out the Food Vendors Outside. We didn't go in the mall - we weren't in the mood to shop while in the crazy manic city of Bangkok. Although we may have stopped in the mall to escape the heat but luckily it wasn't too bad that day. We did go to the giant tent full of food vendors on the east side of Central World. We had pork belly and rice for dinner, and tried durian (interesting). It was really fun walking around and looking at all the fruit and meat vendors. Very cool! It was a great place to try different types of street food.

Great Shopping Mall . It's a great and big shopping mall in the city having almost all major International brands but very expensive.A lot of restaurants also expensive but restaurants out side the mall are comperitivly cheaper
Massive complex with everything. Movies, restaurants, shops it has it all. A great way to spend a few hours. Outside you will find Thai stores selling their food.
Expensive . Very expensive and higher prices than Australia, but the food market just outside is sensational and cheap.
Huge. A huge place with all branded goods and luxurious items from all over the world. A lot of restaurants too.

Choices Choices Choices!. This is definitely a worthwhile visit even if you're not looking for anything in particular. The mall is huge and offers a variety of shops from mid-prices to higher end shopping. What we loved here were the F&B outlets. Mr Jones' Orphanage is here, as well as some yummy Thai restaurants, dessert houses and Japanese restaurants. We basically spent a whole afternoon here just browsing and having coffee and meals.

Good place to people watch.. Its busy, but considering you're in a major city. It's to be expected. Definitely worth a visit. Be sure to check out the shop with figurines, especially if you have kids who like star wars and action movies.

A very huge place . Huge and with loads of things to do. Would be good if the closing time is execs till 11 pm which i know internationally is often 10 pm but here is busy bangkok!Also having the supermarket at the very top is not the best thing for the users. Specially that its not easy to find the lifts!
Visit 6 or 7 floor for food. There is a foodcourt and a lot of foodchains. Try fx Shubashi. Its a chain with sushi, tempura and hot pot

OTT expensive.. An air conditioned multi level super mall with prices to match. This is on a par with any giant mall in Europe and so are the prices. No point looking for a bargain here.Also, some of the staff reminded me of the snooty stereo types in the UK comedy " Absolutely Fabulous " sketch! It caters for high end customers and could be a shopping center like any other in a major city in the world.The usual big name brands are all there. I wasn't impressed and nothing there really that excited me or that you would buy to remind you of Thailand or Thai culture.Same old, same old but a different city.

Great High End Mall. Great high end mall, complete with international brands. Famous as a center for the sale of branded watches in Bangkok. Mall big, clean and neat. at the time of my visit there were held food bazaar, they provide a variety of food from local to international. The crowd was not only local but also foreign tourists who are interested in coming.
Excellt. Biggest shopping mall I have ever been to, they have everything and all organised on themed floors. From clothes and furniture to toys and a food court. Cinema on one of the floors too.

Huge mall with lots of international shops. It takes a lot to come to the mall as it is in the middle with lots of traffic and lots of walkways packed with people. And it takes forever to walk inside the mall. The mall looks relatively modern, well maintaned and they have international brands and shops and many things to eat or snack on. Plus a food court at the top. The mall is not exactly my cup of tea, but if your into shopping brands or eating international food then this is the place for you.

Very big . This was a great way to spend a few hours on a rainy or hot day. The stores are for a younger kind of customer but then most are. There are so many restaurants to pick from and all with good standards and clean looking. Would go back anytime.

A lot of shops. Very big with a lot of 'big brands'. The popular Naraya can be bought here at level 1 too. On the top level, there is a lot of restaurants. For this month that we came, there's a mini fair outside Central World that sells food and some leather goods, bag etc. worth a visit.

A great mall, perfect for a days shopping and eating. This mall has a host of reasonably priced shops and eateries which you can happily spend a day in.Very easy to get to by BTS at Chit Lom station (next to Erwan Shrine), it's not far from the nice hotels along Sukhumvit Road.There are 2 parts to the mall, a older part and more modern part which can be missed if you are not aware it's there.

Central. I'm at central right now, and I can tell you a few things:It was such a pain coming here, it took such a long time, It's really hard to find a parking place,It's awfully busy,But the shops, restaurants, everything is high quality, expensive, but high quality.I highly recommend Nara as a restaurant, but make reservations! And the ice cream at FreshFreeze is fabulous! That why we always come back here, it's a great place for shopping and great for parties!

Great World. I like it very much but as to come for some relaxing after after hot travel. Of course, it is not that you come to Thailand to stay in a mall like the one you have at home. But it is worthy to see, because you find everything and you see the smart Thai people and also people from around the globe, listening many languages, finding too many restaurants of many nations, even a praying room, technologies, movies and everything.

Huge mall. It is one of the largest shopping centers I ever visited. It is enjoyable place for the family where every one can finds his needs. It is considered as a luxury place compared to others which sell thai made goods only. Most of the international brands are available here. It has excellent location where you can reach other shopping malls like Siam Paragon, Platinum, MBK.

Spent so long here!! . My husband and I went here, he informed me 'it's one of the biggest malls in the world' I said surely not, but it went on forever! It was a lovely place to window shop and just have a relaxing walk around in an air conditioned place.
Another shopping mall . Just another mall with branded products. Great for hangout with friends. Came here to visit Madame Tussaud and walk-around.

Shoppers paradose. I personally am not into spending vast amounts of money shopping but it really is a shoppers paradise here. It's all brand names hete so get your plastic card nice and warmed up ready for some action.

ate at narra resto. it was good they have to train the staff more on how to talk to guest it has good food good ambiance clean impressive food choices very yummy food i would like to come back once more

Usual brands. Usual (bad) food . Mall. Designer brands (probably more expensive than in the west, but if you come to bangkok to buy an original Gucci or whatever I doubt you need to look at tripadvisor) . Class and status. Beautiful young people while everyone else outside looks miserable and worn out. Food court like all the others. Food generally bad. Can really see what money can mean in a city of extreme contradictions like bangkok.

Branded stuffs like normal shopping mall. Just another shopping mall and u can found the normal branded products here. If u looking for cheap stuffs, this is not a good place for u. U need to go to morning market or night market. This mall is connected to bts station siam / bts station chit lom.
Family trip. Another mall huge & big, original brand !They improve it quiet well and hotel inside.Always évents during week end Time, music, concerts...

Must visit place in bangkok. The good place for shopping with brand name products, the food court with many dishes and luxury restaurants also. The location is very convenient, near by Platinum and Big C.

Big and impressive. Going around Bangkok reminded me of Singapore with all the big malls located near each other, the only thing that is missing is an underground connection or a fully overground connection, as for the mall it's big and has all the shops you need and outside you can find the small temple shrine for ganesha that is quite impressive

Another mall in Bangkok. Bangkok has so many malls. It is a shopping heaven for my teenage daughter. This mall is no different than others, most of the brand name stores are here including forever 21, Zara, mango.Walking distance from here is Amarin Plaza, Grayson mall, platinum mall and pratunam market.

Anniversary . Love central world came here the first time we visited Bangkok as stopped at centara grand at central world what a fantastic hotel!!! Food court here is great and there was a food market on when we came so tried different foods etc the food court here is great had a whole steamed sea bass for less than £7 - great meal this is a must if you like a lively atmosphere but with shops you are familiar with - great day out

A great mall with every brand you need. This is your basic large format mall with all the major European and American brands with a smattering of home grown stores. There is a good variety of restaurants, an ice rink and a cinema. Its a perfect location for browsing on a wet afternoon. It has excellent public transport links

Not for a busy day. If you visit central world with children you need to do this a day when you don't have anything else planned, the mall is huge and to be honest you find the same merchandise at home in any large mall. Souvenirs should not be bought here since they have high fixed price they are better bought on the streets it weekend market. If you are looking for a bargain on a brand name item you will most likely find it back home in US or Europe for the same price. Or at the airport but they also start to charge same prices as stores at home.Personally I think it's worth a visit since the mall has a nice layout and a lot of shopping, the downside is that with children mine is 10 years old and like to buy everything and also gets tired after the first floor so it's very exhausting to visit here with children.
The biggest. This was the world trade centre - revamped. It has everything and more. I have been here 30 times and I still can't help getting lost. Worse the experience alone

A nice place to have lunch and shopping around . One of the most modern and largest shopping complex with in a walking distance from Suam Paragon Shopping complex and Central Chidlom Department store, on the corner of Rajprasong intersection opposite the famous Erawan Shrine. It is in between BTS Siam Paragon station and Chidlom station. You can find everything here from clothing to restaurant to movie, salon, furniture store, Audio&DVD, art work etc. Two shopping department; Zen on one side and Iseton on the opposite end of the mall. A good place to have lunch or dinner.A lot of restaurant to choose from, Chinese, Japanese, Thai, Korean, Vietnamese, American, International yo name a few.....don't get lost from it's size though.....remember where you park!

Still my go-to mall.... Despite the emergence of newer, sleeker and trendier malls - Central World will remain my favorite as it has a lot of better value propositions for me to experience. It has better dining establishments catering to different budgets and tastes, shopping options from luxe to bargains - and simply just the space to move around in is a treat in itself. I also like that its connected via walkway to its smaller, older sister Central Chidlom - another favorite of mine.

Gigantic mall. This is a gigantic mall that's extremely easy to get lost in. It has high class stores and low class stores, but mostly expensive stores. I highly recommend getting Google Maps before you enter, because otherwise you'll be stuck for hours trying to get out. It has a lot of things that you can't find anywhere else in Bangkok.

Huge and very well connected . Central world plaza is huge and one of the largest shopping plazas in the world .Everything is here from shopping to eating to spas to hotels. It's a lot of fun and very lively atmosphere here .It's very connected to the sky train and road .

The Biggest shopping central that I've been!. This shopping central is real Big, to finish walking arounf and shopping you need the whole 2days to go. So many choices of brand good name such as H&M, Zara and all fasmous cosmetic brand name. The top level is a food court with so many restaurants, cakes, juces.... Special, outsise of the center have a food market with tons of foods, so many type and cheap too. Love shopping here )
Nice restaurants. Central World is the place to be for both shopping and food. All the locals seem to love it too.There's a lot of choice in food but mostly Thai, Japanese and coffee/tea/cake places
Coffee. I come here to Have a coffee at starbuck. This place is good for hang out with friends and family. You can also watch movie or shopping. It's easy to find parking space here.
Great shopping. Central World Plaza is huge! Despite its vastness, I enjoy my every visit. Food, entertainment, shops all are amazing. Great piece of engineering.

Great Shopping. An amazing shopping centre with almost every brand that you can think of, very clean and you can enjoy spending a full day in the mall. The small golf car inside the mall for every floor to take people around is fantastic.

Enjoy your shopping!. It's a big shopping mall that you can find most of the brands, as it was summer sail most of the shops were up to 70% off!
There also were so many restaurants on upper floors. We bought everything we want in our 3 days stay in bangkok from central world and siam paragon and enjoyed a lot!

Always good. Great great shopping mall in Bangkok! Not the big expensive brands like in Paragon but a lot of nice shops.
A good mixture of different kind of restaurants in the mall which makes everybody happy!

Everything you need . It's a huge shopping mall with everything you need. One of the hottest place in Bangkok and it will always be. The durian fest is right there when I visit in Aug . It's fun I get to try the coconut ice cream which is awesome.
Cheers

Floors and floors of shops. This is a shopaholic's heaven, with several floors of shops, including the flagship Zen store.We love the restaurant levels from the 6th floor onwards, where you can find a wide range of cuisines ranging from Japanese to Thai, Western to Italian. There is also the Central Loft supermarket where you can get almost anything from around the world. We bought some bread, bacon and eggs there, as well as Thai local snacks like shrimp crackers with pork floss. There is also a tiny food court tucked away in the centre of the supermarket, mostly for staff and locals.There is a separate annex where you can find most things related to children, including Toys R Us, music schools and kids' clothing.

Huge choice, lots of good options . Loved the food halls and the market square. The shops are very British shops such as marks and spencer and top man but good general superstore with lots of electronics. Go early on weekends as it gets busy.

Very big and luxurious. Very big shopping mall with various brands and stores who sell luxurious products. Good to have a stroll around and have a bite in the food court, or take the kids to sea life center at the bottom floor.

Almost the world at your feet!. Originally Bangkok's World Trade Centre, this inner city shopping mall has been expanded to cater for almost all tastes of clothes, furniture, IT, health & beauty and food. Anchored by two department stores, Zen and Isetan and spread over six floors, it is a maze of shops, restaurants and showrooms, topped off by cinema complex.

Decent variety of shops and restaurants. If MBK is at the lower end of the scale and Siam Paragon is high-end then Central World is similar to the latter with less designer brands and a decent variety of shops and restaurants. There's usually something going on outside at the weekends (markets, festivals, etc.) and occasionally there are events happening inside. I've seen Bangkok Motorbike Festival, Manga Festival and Miss International Queen to name a few.

Huge and Impressive!. It was my first time to visit Bangkok and I would say Central World is one of the best malls they have. It's huge and the interior is quite impressive. You get to see a lot of shops. What I love about it is the long array of food shops inside. You won't be able to decide on which to choose and try as their are a lot of choices. We also did try to watch a movie and indeed they have one of the best cinemas. I believe they have 15 cinemas inside and the seat is spacious and very comfortable. Definitely I will visit Central World again when I get to travel back to Bangkok.

Massive and overwhelming . Central World is everything you'd expect of one of the largest shopping centers in the world. We visited three times and still did not see everything. Plenty of food to be found and shops of every kind. Whatever you need can be found there.

Big Mall. Situated at the adjacent corner facing the luxurious Gaysorn Plaza & next to Siam Paragon. It is really big & has a new wing rebuilt after an arson during demonstrations. It's an upmarket shopping mall with multiple local & foreign brand outlets including restaurants, an ice skating rink & a cineplex. It may take 5 hours or more just to finish looking at all the shops & joints.

Shopping at Central World mall. I won't say that Central World is cheaper then Siam Paragon. Instead I got clothes cheaper at H&M in Siam Paragon cheaper. We had lunch on our 5th day in Bangkok there, walk around but quickly realise that prices are quite high. So we left for Platinum Fashion Mall which is 7 mins walk on the skywalk to the 2nd level of the mall.

Exclusive with constant sales. One of the most impressive shopping centers I ever visited. Good mixture of super brands and more affordable stores. All have constant prmotions without turning the shops into a mess. Two top floors house numerous small restaurants and a cinema. Ground floor offers ice skating Quite an experience.

So much quieter than Siam. Has mostly, if not all the brands that Siam Center has yet much less people. Easy exit from BTS, and Siam is just a walk up the road of 5mins if you feel like getting amongst the chaos of Pokemon hunters at Siam.
Big shopping center . Big shopping center with a lot of stores, cafes and restaurant. Have seven floor but in the area have better shopping centers
cheap as market :p. Clothing in H&M,Zara,Uni Qlo,Mango,Giordano,Bata.. sale so much,what i say they cheap as marketcentral world take me many many hours to choose and fit
Best shopping . A great place for shopping and have a meal.Everything available for shopping and on top is a great food court for some good thai meals.Highly recommended to visit This place.

Seemingly endless mall built for a luxury clientele. ....that seems to have evaporated with the economic problems involving the yuan and the rouble.Good for bookshops but other than that a corporate, soulless universe of brands, crass marketing and consumerism that will disappear completely once the neoliberal, cheap energy bubble finally bursts. Good riddance.

They love their malls. Central is large and centers mainly for for mid to high end retail. After having said that if you manage to catch their sales you will end ip with good offers. Case in point was the Brooks running shoes - Transcend 3 and the Dyad 8, which I purchased for really good deals. The former retails for rm800 (usd150) everywhere else but i was lucky enough to get a 30% discount and the Dyad for only rm220. Their Zen dept store is also a good store with good offers. An event hall similarly has great bargains. But the food instore was just heavenly.
Great for brand names. This mall is huge and is great for brand names, and also eating, we had nice lunch and ice cream. But there are non many non-brand type bargain shops as we saw in other malls.

Long weekend trip . Lively, lovely , thriving, arty, centrally located, walking distance from our hotel , its a super place to shop, eat and soak in the local culture and when all that is done get to the cinema! Clothes, shoes, luggage , cars name it all on display and available for sale, stalls with local produce, clothes and artefacts , the entrance has various sculptures by modern artistes, and. "Durian" festival as well, pizza, icecream , desserts all made from the special fruit . A must visit when in bangkok !
Shopping Centre mecca. Another huge shopping Centre. Once inside you could be anywhere in the world Nothing stand out here if yo7 want bargains this is Not where to find them

This place was huge. I thought the malls in Japan and South Korea were cracked out, well this place is just about as cracked out. Not only is it massive but there just so many shops and restaurants. Perfect for s rainy day. When we went it was packed, i mean you could barely walk through the mall. Very clean so nice place to chill out. Something for everyone.

You can find everything here!. CentralWorld is gigantic, it's easy to shop & find things here, the food courts also offer different variety of foods, I tried a few restaurants and they were all good. CentralWorld is located between Chit Lom and Siam and is not far to Erawan Shrine, very easy to get there. Enjoy your holiday and shopping tours in BKK.
Amazing shopping!. So much range and brands from all over the world. Will definitely be back! Some very high class brands though too if that's your thing.
nice Central World Plaza. I went for shopping with my friends and it's a good place to hangout and see so many stores and brands, the vibe and feel of this mall is very nice.
A big and standard big mall. This is typical modern shopping mall with everything. If you don't like shopping mall, you may keep this.

Very big. Much bigger than I expected it to be. If you don't plan on spending the whole day there, plan ahead what you want to see/buy as you'll probably get lost if you don't. I found the prices (in all Bangkok malls) to be a bit more expensive than in Europe when it comes to things we have here (Topshop, Nike, Sephora...) so I ended up leaving with nothing because I knew I could buy these things at home for 10€ less.

Shoppers paradise. It's big shopping mall. Get ready to spend all of your money if you visit this place with your wife/girl friend. This shopping mall includes many local and intl. brands and too many resturants with all type of cuisins.

Modern and Air Conditioned!. Sometimes you need a break from the real bangkok and get back into the modern world for a bit. The place is huge and you could easily spend an entire day in there. You shouldn't... but you could!

Prepare to ge lost. This place is huge! It has pretty much everything you are looking for while in Bangkok and more. Easily accesible to and from all the other shopping spots around like Gaysorn and Siam Paragon, and is connected to Zen and Isetan.It has all major brands and a pretty good grocery store. More expensive than local shops like Big C but less crazy.Has all the local aroma brands and their spas-except for Panpuri with its spa located at Gaysorn.Has lots of restaurants and coffee/teahouses too. Only downside is that it's too big you might get lost.
Nice and big shopping mall. It's a shopping mall just nearby Chit Lom BTS station. So easy to get there. Central World is a very big shopping mall that have many restaurants and shops.

Vast Mall. A classy mall with a more upmarket feel to it than some of the others in the area. Makes a pleasant change, to get away from the market stalls and a bonus being able to try clothes on before buying.

Big Mall. There were lots of stores and food options to choose from. There were great sales when we went. It was easy to find since it was very close to the train station. Platinum Fashion Mall and Siam Paragon were just walking distance.

HUGE, much more livelier than Dubai malls. We live in the middles east so the array of life, variety of stores, restaurants and products for sale in this massive store was amazing. We loved the sense of aliveness of the place. We stopped in at the movies, where you can even pay for day beds to lounge on and watch the film, so as a family we curled up together on one massive daybed for 4 people and enjoyed a film with great sound and visuals. Had a wonderful Japanese bbq banquet and a great escape from the summer heat

Took my daughter to the little real world for kids. She spent the whole day from when it opened.Entertainment all day long.They will have the most fun they have had ever.Running around being little adults working learning to be police officers journalist etc The best thing I have done with my daughter

Shopping for brands. While platinum and mbk offer local products, central world has stores of most international brands. M&S, H&M, Pull & Bear, Victoria secret, et al. Shop till your feet and wallet permits :)

Get anything you want. Huge shopping mall includes local and international labels. Basically, can find whatever you need. High end products in ZEN to cheap options with reasonable quality in Big C ( cross the road). Apart from bags and fashion, linens, Thann products are much cheaper than. Hong Kong.
Great for shopping or eating. This mall is next to the bts line so eay to acces by public transportation. It offers a wide variety of high end brands and fashion designer stores.

Big and well stocked . One of the biggest mall in Thailand.
Shops are well stocked so is supermarket. Quite a lot of decent dining options are there too.
Cinema has latest movies and very comfortable chairs.

International trendy brand. This is a good place to shop with different brand or shop. Together with good hall.
Highly recommend for family shoppers

Mega huge mall. One of signature in Bangkok. To reach here the access is very easy. From Siam train station walking distance as well. Even raining day without umbrella it's possible to reach here. Products line up also full of variety. Restaurant also a lot of variety of food we can enjoy.I reached here around 3 pmBut when I notice it was already 6 pm. Probably when I visited here was mega sale period. So lucky to visit herein such a good timing. I cannot wait coming back again.

Central World has everything. Central World used to be called World Trade Centre but after 911 was promptly renamed.It is a goliath of a shopping centre with 7 floors of shops, it is the Harrods of Bangkok where you can buy just about anything.Prices are not as cheap as you would imagine but that reflects buying from a shopping complex.It is open from 10:00 to 22:00 and air conditioned throughout.There are cashpoints dotted around the malls so you never need to go far to get some money to spend!! Over the years it has become more upmarket with very few craft stalls there that was the case a few years ago.Don't forget, everything here is price marked so there's no bartering, but they do have some deals if you buy more than 1 item such as buy 4, pay for 3.I have been coming to Bangkok for 27 years and personally I feel that Central World has lost some of its charm and become just a huge shopping mall, but I still recommend it for a few hours entertainment if it's raining outside.

Decent Mall. A decent typical Asian mall. I do recommend to visit it, as some stores got good stuff. The area where the mall located gets very crowded, so if you're visiting during rush hour it may take a while to get there.

The open air market outside Central World. Malls are malls....what elevates this mall is the lovely open air market on it's side. It is filled with family owned stalls selling the most delicious street food and home made snacks and desserts that form a staple of Thai culture. The raw papaya and raw mango salad sold by a lady with large wooden pestle and mortars, the Phad Thai, the dried mango thinly sliced papads, the barbecued whole fish, coconut ice cream.....this place is a foodies delight! The only downside is that everything gets sold out by 8.30pm, and the stall owners close up shop around that time!

Take a compass to avoid getting lost. We spent many an hour shopping and having lunch here, in the temple of consumerism! There are stores and boutiques for all ages and tastes, albeit for those with well-lined pockets. Zen department store is great, and more upmarket than its opposite number Isetan. Our nineteen-year old daughter bought items from Topshop, Pull and Bear, Mac and Havaianas, whereas we bought garments and footwear from Zen and from Adolfo Dominguez, the Spanish fashion designer. A word of caution about getting over-excited about the Tax Free option for foreigners: you must declare the goods at airport customs before you check-in. If you don't do this, it's a waste of time trudging all the way to the Tax Free counter after passing security, as you will simply be turned away!!
Shopping. Famous for shopping eating entertainment. This place is so huge and I almost got lost in bundle of brand store.
Big shopping center. Most centrally located up-market shopping center in Bangkok.You find branded goods, restaurants, supermarket & cinemas here.Naraya is on the ground floor.

Amazing Big & Modern Mall. A big and modern shopping mall where you almost can find all the brands. It has also a lot of restaurants including my favorite one "Sizzler". This is one of the "must do" things in you happen to be in Bangkok. We have been visiting this mall almost on daily basis while being in Bangkok.
Great mall. You can find whatever you want. The best part of it is the 55th floor where you have the red sky bar.
Too big! . We are pretty keen shoppers but this mall was pretty big! Seemed to cover a lot and good selection but in hindsight we didn't buy much as nothing too amazing. Worth a look if in Bangkok
Ms. The mall is very very nice stunning views from outside and lotsa shops, traffic is a nightmare though getting from the airport. But overall Bangkok is 👌👌👌
Thani. Food is resonable price and tasty There are internatinal cuisine to choose, Thai , Indian and Western dishes such as Norwegian snow fish steak only 450.-฿ etc.

Wow! Beautiful Mall!. Central World is like a city within a city. It is one of the best malls I've ever seen. Everything that you could want is available including department stores, restaurants, an IMAX 4D theater, and even a post office. Escalators make it easy to go from one level to the next. All seven levels have marble tile. The air-conditioned mall makes you forget the heat and humidity outside. It is very spacious and enjoyable for shopping or just for relaxing. It is connected to the skywalk outdoors making it easy to reach other shopping malls and the BTS.

Amazing Thailand and lots of fun here. We really enjoyed our shopping and walking in the mall. We can buy everything here, and many shops inside the Central world. It has many kinds of shops for shoppers not only for Thais but tourists. We also enjoyed our food from many restaurant in the Central Plaza. Zen department was fund to shop in addition to many other shops!

So many shops!. visited here and we were so shocked by the amount of shops there was!, everything you could think of there was. with even english brands such as topshop, miss selfridge and m&s. took around 3 hours to get round and we never looked in half of the shops.loved how it was set out with all electronics on one floor, and then all food on another.

Massive mall. Absolutely massive, no other word for it. Everything you could ever think pf you will find it here. Furniture, shoes, jewelry, and all high quality stuff. Skating rink as well, it is all there.I enjoyed the market outside, the food on offer was incredible.This place deserves time to really enjoy. Wonderful, but remember it is just a shopping mall.
Big and nice!. Have good time here. This shopping center is big. Lot of stores and restaurant. Love to go shopping at ZEN departementstore.

Large shopping centre, but nothing out of the ordinary.. The square in front of Central World has BANGKOK in large characters, so make sure to get a picture there! The mall itself is beautiful and a nice place to have a look around, but don't spend to much time here as the stalls and food trucks outside are much more fun to visit. Not essentialy cheaper as in Europe too. We had an excellent Thai meal in one of the restaurants at the upper floor, Nara Thai Cuisine.
Great value merchandise. Our go to mall for shopping when in Bangkok. The prices are cheaper than in other malls and they maintain a high quality of products. VAT return forms available.
Huge. The shopping was good, food was good, the place was huge I'm still not sure I have seen everything although I visited it twice, in 2014 and this year in Feb.
Clean mall with shops - thats it. Not overly impressed with this mall plenty of shops , nothing amazing or worth going out of your way for. Its just another mall.

Eye Candy but that's all. I am from Melbourne, so this a good to go and see it if you are in Bangkok and in the area. The shopping centre looks amazing, quite glamours. However I wouldn't say it is a highlight of Bangkok. Terminal 21 and MBK has more to offer in terms of experience.

Excellent Shopping heaven. Excellent Shopping heaven. Shopaholic will loves this place a lot.
Food is good too. spend more time and walk around to see before commit to buy.
Great shopping!. A little bit of something for everyone... not like MBK Mall... no knock-off items here, but worth going just for the Food Court on the 7th floor!
Nothing here...... It is just about 10 mins walk away from siam paragon.. If you dont have much time do not stop by here. Nothing much inside to see. Just an average shopping mall.
Shop till you drop.. Fabulous shopping centre. Lots of teal quality shops and eating places. A stark contrast to the streets outside

Nice mall. This is the place to go to if you want to get some branded stuffs. It's huge, it's comfortable, it's modern and it's clean. It's so different from the shopping you get at the markets and along the streets. Granted, people do not usually go to Bangkok for these stuffs - or do they?The highlight for me this time round were the stalls set up outside selling all kinds of delicious street food! I wonder for how long will the stalls be there?
One of the best mall in Thailand !. Very good shopping mall with mix of many brands , It's big , New and clean , Many of restaurants and shops , I recommend to visit it.

Huge mall, international brands, fabulous food court. Huge mall, wonderful range of international shops- finally some European sized clothes :).Each floor has a theme, gadgets, clothes, home ware, children's etc. Who could forget the amazing food hall, fresh produce galore and loads of "fast food" outlets healthy and not so much-your choice. We didn't have time, yet we would have loved to go to the cinema that has 4d shows in thai and English showings! So many other malls in bangkok however for us we got everything we wanted here!

It's big. Okay, so it's another shopping mall, but this one is seriously big, I mean if you like a bit of shopping / window shopping you could probably spend all day here. It's also nice and close to the local transport system and can be accessed via a covered walkway.

Shop n drop. Excellent shopping experience awaits at Central, one of the largest malls of Thailand. It's a multi used one where there is a hotel and office connected to the mall. BRT train is the ideal way to reach if you want to escape the Bangkok traffic. Note the Skywalk at central there is a good 1000m walk.

Snow Tree Korean Dessert Cafe. Once of the nicest, lightest, fluffy snow flake desserts with flavorful real ice creams deep down beneath the snow flakes.Only thing is- for THB200 a bowl, it is a tad little expensive.I would probably just eat it once and that's it.
Not great, . I know it's cheap shopping, but I didn't enjoy this place. Top floor food also not great although good selection of foods .

Good place for shopping. Visited recently in July 2016 and this mall was actually a good experience for me to spend nearly half a day with shopping. Since its quite large it takes some time to walk about which matched the time i had. Also since the Siam series of malls is nearby, its easier to spend the whole day in the area. Had fund shopping for my kids who i left back home though not sure they would have enjoyed spending so much time walking about.
Amazing place, spent there 6 hours. Verity of stores, everything is big and clean, Food court is absolutely amazing! Many beautiful restaurants.You most go there :)

3rd Largest Mall in Asia. Huge and spacious mall... You won't feel claustrophobic even with large number of shoppers... All kinds of shops from kids play store to apparels.. Zen store has amazing variety of things for all ages. Sports store to coffee shops to Burger King for vegetarian tourists.. All brands of apparels and high quality stuff.. Shopping incomplete without visiting Central World. Walking distance from skytrain station and many other attractions nearby
Too big.. This is a big center, but full of great shops and many deals. So arm yourself with a fresh credit card

A Big, Very Modern Mall - Lots to see and Do. My daughter loved the array of very high end stores at the Central World Mall (easily accessible via BST and sky bridge).As with the other malls we visited, I have to admire their organization skills. Furniture all on one level, electronics on their own level, etc. Nice if you are focused on a particular item and not inconvenient if you just want to browse.Well air conditioned and plenty of food as well.

Such a huge Mall!!. Me and my friends we stayed at Baiyoke suite hotel and walked all the way from Pratunam market to this mall. You get everything in this mall.. literally everything. Must visit mall if you are in Bangkok.

Great shopping center. This mall has answer to any sort of needs : Famous clothes brands, Various electronic products, All kind restaurants, also a branch Robinson department store with good promotions, ... etc.
Also its location is perfect: just above a MRT metro station :)

Big department store at Bangkok capital city center.. Central Plaza has a lot of branch in Thailand, Central World is the one of most popular destinations at Bangkok capital city center between BTS Siam and BTS Chidlom.Central World was offering many exhibition events to serve everyone with Creative and Luxury looking, The subject of campaign will change in each months.In addition, Central World Next to Siam Paragon(Siam Oceanworld inside), Siam Center, Siam One, Siam Discovery(Madame Tussauds inside) at BTS Siam side and backside of Central World close to Platinum Plaza and Pratunum Market the greatest cloths wholesaler in Bangkok. BTS Childlom side close to Super Rich Money Exchange, BigC Hypermarket Rajadamri, Greyson Plaza, Inter continental hotel and etc.Overall everyone will meet their friends, shopping and eating around this place.
Nice shopping mall. The mall is quite big and has many good shops inside. Most shops are well known brands so if you're a shopaholic this is a good place to do shopping.

Huge mall with great dining options. This is a huge mall with countless dining options. My wife and I visit this mall largely to dine for its wide selection of cuisine. The retails shops are generally international or regional chain stores which you may likely find them in your country. On some occasions, there were fashion and food flea markets at a huge compound just right outside the entrance of the mall. It is also easily accessible as it is linked to a BTS.
Central Mall in Bkk. 1.In front of shopping mall have a flea market.2. The 6th floor has TK Park ,public library, and learning center .3.Many events occur here.4.Naraya Shop in 1st floor .
Huge . This shopping mall is big... very big. Not too crowded. Easy to park the car and easy to access with the BTS. Many choices of food also. I like to come here to chill.

Now, too crowded - and NO PARKING LOT.. Now, too crowded - and NO PARKING LOT.Yes, this place rules them all.You could find almost anything in this department store. But now there too too too much multicultural people.Good for store, but a bit annoying to some customers. esp. the parking spaces are less than it should.Please manage this problem.Best regards.

A shoppingmall even a dad falls on love with :). Its very big - one of the biggest. Half way thru the vacation, and the need for some hours by your self, a good cup of coffee and catching up on the news. This is a good place to be. The rest of the family wants to shop and you can be the shoppingbag central. What a great deal! At least 2 or 3 hours, maybe more? A great deal for everyone :D
Massive---get a map.. This place is huge and has some pretty good bargains. If you are looking to spend the afternoon out of the heat, this is the place to go. There is plenty to do for everyone.

Biggest Shopping Complex in BKK City Center. It was a gorgeous shopping experience in Bankok city and complex is full of every kind of shops including sports, footwear, clothing, jewellery and much more US branded and Thailnd branded shops at really cheap price.I bought lot of stuff untill my Credit Card is over limited and could found branded luxury item at cheap price and arranged VAT refund too.

Nice shopping in the middle of Bangkok. It's one of the shopping mall by central group and I'm not so sure the difference between this one and another central malls closed by, the Chidlom and the embassy. It's one of the mall and I don't see any difference to others. But good place to walk around and products are similar to other shopping malls.
My favourite mall. Very big, with sky bar on top of it. You can find real ice skating spot inside and really delicious food court. Ate there few times.

This is the biggest and most comprehensive shopping complex in BKK. If you want to go to one place and do everything, go to Central World. Traffic to get there is terrible, so I would recommend taking the sky train/ BTS and getting off at Siam or phloem Chit (I think), then walking. It's all connected through a sky walk and there are signs. The place is huge, so better pick up a map and map out where you need to go before you start your adventure.
Visit during sale season. Mall has alot of shops that has good items. We bought yonex badminton rackets half its price. Unfortunately we didn't had much time to explore...
So Big. I hear its sixth biggest shopping mall in the world and all eight floors are packed with shops and in 7th floor will find lots of restaurants.

More Shapping. Ok so we went to the Siam paragon first and then we found this one next door, another completely bananas, huge and brilliant shopping centre. I suppose the feature in this one is that it has an ice skating rink inside! RANDOM

Cheap and large shopping mall. You can find many cheap branches here with many supprising daily deals, Very very large to discover such as : HM, Zara, Berskha, Stradivarius,..and the location is easy to find, opposite Big C and beside Siam Paragon! I really love this shopping mall

One stop with so many things to do.... Central World Plaza is right in the center of Bangkok where there are two department stores in one building i.e. Zen and Isetan. Also along side by side in the same place there are many other free standing shops for branded goods as well the local goods. Plenty of restaurants from Thai to International food to choose from as well as coffee corner. Theatres and Supermarket are just up in the building and if your your kids are looking for an ice skating entertainment then please go down. Then there is always a pop up exhibitions or particular fair on the ground floor, whether inside the building or at the outer side of the building...there is always something going on...a place to enjoy!

Shopping Spree and Eating. This is a nice mall with many famous clothing franchise stores eg: H&M, Topshop etc, you can also get the well known Thailand local made handbags and accessories - "Naraya". It has Watsons where you can get some nice personal care items. Basically it has everything you need. The food court is spacious, clean and variety choices of food, price range between 50 to 200 baht. You can find McDonalds, KFC and many other fast food and restaurant here. You don't have to worry about eating problems. There are plenty of choices for food. Accessibility is easy. It is near to pratunam, silom. I took taxi and it wasn't expensive, the fare was less than 100 baht from silom. The mall has few taxi stop with Grab (app to hire meter taxi) service. You can approach the staff at the taxi stand there, they will hire meter taxi for you. After this you can visit Siam Paragon for luxury products, it is just 5 mins walking distance.

big big big shopping complex. It Is big but it is not crowed like MBK. Central is real center location. middle to upscale shopping complex. It is big big in itself and near to all other major shopping mails around Siam. You can spend all day here or one more day in this area if you are department store shopper. Because I am not such kind of shopper, I go here most for food and refreshment.

Shopping paradise. For typical mall shopping fanatics, if you can't find what you r looking for here, you might as well settle down for some Tom Yum. Massive and diverse, you will be able to find more than just your typical sanitized retail chain stores brands here. But wear comfortable shoes. It's gonna be a long walk.
Shopping!!! . This shopping mall is about 10minutes walking distance from Siam station..got so many brands that are sell over here..you can find so many things over here from head to toe..

A very nice mall for everything that you need!. This mall will make you difficult to choose where to eat... From Thai food to Mexican food, all is there. Two department store, Isetan and Zen, provide ample choice for fashion. The mall is connected to Paragon by the pedestrian bridge, so you can easily visit both malls in one go.

Love this shopping center . This shopping center is located between Chitlom and Siam Bts train station. There is a suspended walk from both. You can find anything your looking for, it's a very modern shopping center. Top restaurants, cafe's , cake shops, movie theater (in English), supermarket, food hall, Department store and many boutiques to choose from and etc. For very cheap eats try the food hall in the supermarket. Clean and very good local food. They will give you a card before you enter and you will use this instead of money, on the exit they will scan the card for the bill. And ladies the lingerie in the department store had a great range of local designers at a very cheap prices.
Free stroller rental! . Leave your ID at the information counter outside of H&M and you can rent strollers for free. Since we have 3 kids, this made our visit much more enjoyable!!

Just another shopping centre!. Seen one, seen them all. Very clean, lots of options, prices same as home. Food options on 7th floor amazing. One reason to head there for lunch or dinner be it expensive by Thai standards. Quality was high though.

High end shopping mall. This mall is pretty much similar to those shopping malls found in orchard road singapore. Many branded brands of goods can be found there. Several good cafes can be found in this mall. After a good shopping, can drop by these cafes for a good coffee and chill out.
Everything is here. Want shopping? Come here, it is very big shopping mall. You can find Thai brand and international brand which on sell. Restaurant are located on 3rd & 4th floor.

Clothes shopping spree. This center is a welcome relief from the hassle and bushel ,heat and smell of walking through the streets of Bangkok.Well air conditioned , clean , well presented stores with plenty of space to move about . I being a man usually do not feel comfortable in shopping centers . I felt at easy here and very comfortable . It is a modern building well lit and has modern toilets and plenty of quality modern Restaurants to eat in or simply have a coffee or cold drink . I am 51 and took my 20 year old daughter . We shopped for my wife and my daughter and 21 year old son . Plenty of quality shops and a big modern variety and best of all were the prices . This center is a stones throw from a lot of other Hugh department shopping centers . There is a train station close by . We managed to buy 2 complete new wardrobes for my wife and daughter and shirts and sporty type clothes for my son . All in about 4 hours . If you are in Bangkok I suggest you find a hotel central to this area . That way you can walk everywhere as the roads get very busy here . Trains also are the way to move around in Bangkok .Well worth a visit .
Shopping and eating . It's a great place for shopping many local brands with lovely designs and stuff also many restaurants plus cinema I highly recommend it one of the best malls in town
Nice huge mall !. Nice place...and also very big..we had few hours in the morning left and we could cover probably less then half the mall only...

Shopping mal for food, fashion, kids. Here to summarise our trip here:- central world plaza is big mal- you can find a lot of restaurants here- there are a lot of restaurant that serve local thai food- there is big supermarket with small food court inside (mostly they serve thai cuisine at good price)- wide range of shopping brand- there are shops selling computer equipment, gadget and camera, mobile accesories- you can find cinema, bank, telecommunication center- interactive exhibition for kids called teamLab

Impressive-must do for avid shoppers . Huge. Huge. Huge! Be prepared to go through security checks in way in. (metal detector and possible bag search) All to keep shoppers safe in today's world. Get a map of the Centre from information. Lots of stores. Too many to pick from. If you love shopping you would love this Centre. If you hate shopping I would give it a miss as you can walk around this complex all day. Some shops cheaper than Australia others not. Know your prices. Can always try and negotiate prices. Some shops were happy too. Others not. (Only try).
Nice mall with everything you need. This mall has lots of shops and there are two department stores (Isetan and Zen). There are also lots of restaurants and dessert cafe upstairs.
Plenty of shopping . Amazing Centre heaps and heaps of shops would take you days to do everything . Greta choice of food options too & movies as well
OK... In Central World Plaza you can find many department store inside, ZEN, iSETAN, and Central. Its was fun and enjoyable place for shopping.
Nice shopping mall. It was great shopping experience there. Location was hub of major shopping area with many shops,super markets and restaurants etc,.This area is must visit place for shoppers.

Nice mall. So far, in bangkok paragon mall is still the best mall here. It is clean , but again , only counted people can speak english. The worst thing here is if you wanna go home, just be careful with the taxi driver. Their id card which is shown is not the same as the one who is driving. We also have to bargain about the price wit the taxi driver . So just be careful

Huge!. More organized and less busy than Platinum mall. About 7-9 stories of shops and restaurants. Walkable from our hotel downtown which was nice. Taxi rides would have probably taken longer than walking because traffic is really bad.

The centre of the shopping world . A great place to shop for all brands, clothes and accessories .Restaurants are good ( not high end ) but have a mix of stuff .
Located centrally it does offer options .not my Preffered place to shop though 😊

A Big Shopping Mall With Isetan and Lots of Restaurants. We came to this Shopping Mall as we always see it when we were walking to the Big C. One of the trips to this shopping mall, we had a quick snack and another trip we had our dinner. As our children have food allergies, it was not an easy task as there are many restaurants that serve food with peanut (and milk), even for Ramen!For snacks, we bought sushi from Isetan Supermarket which is one of my children favourites.For dinner, we managed to find a Japanese Restaurant, Kobune, that do not have milk nor peanut in their food.The adults had ice-cream cone sold at a DQ Kiosk, sold at 10 Baht. A steal!
good mall. very like this mall specially groove centralworld, and there is cheap street food just in front of the mall entrance.

Go there to enjoy the aircon and to visit NaRaYa store. For the Singaporean readers, Central World is like Bangkok's Takashimaya. Mostly upscale international brands and the prices you see on Orchard Road or Takashimaya back in Singapore and giant tents outside for events and Bazaar like stores. There is one shop that is much more popular with female travellers and that is NaRaYa on the 1st floor. It's usually swamped with people while the other stores are mostly empty. Small purses and bags go for as low as 50BHT and go up to 500++BHT. If you want to buy gifts for your mother, wife or sister, but don't want to just get one of dubious quality off the street, you'll want to go to NaRaYa as its branded but still costs about the same ore even cheaper!

Big and confusing. . Super big and a lot of shopping. But it can be difficult to find the store in a the plan and assets.Because you looking in a assets and se a loot of store but you can't se the type because the store name is only to see when you passing it. There are no Signs get out from the store in the assets so you can get a over looking of the assets. But it's nice food market.
Food is great. . Great food and that was about it. It's got a lot of things to buy if your into shopping but i just love the food there. Great burgers and noodle soups.

Decent mall mid level mall. Isn't as high end as Siam paragon but some nice stores. I think this mall caters more to the average consumer so it is more appealing. Prices here are pretty much the same as in the states but just in Thai baht. No point in buying anything here then.
Good plaza . Lot of food and many things to shopping . Outside the mall there is a street market food , there is a lot cheapest food surely can enjoy
One of the best malls in Bangkok. Great mall, modern and clean. Both high end and low end shops, ZEN has a big Muji, big plus. Easy access from the train, Siam Paragon is next door.

Same old stuff . Just another mall. Lots of higher priced goods than other malls in international cities too be honest. The food court is good and only thing worth spending money on. Bangkok in general is going down value wise in shopping I feel. Even Singapore and Indonesia u get better priced then these famous malls here.

The Plaza was good. It's in the center of the city so it's pretty convenient for you to go shopping. There's variety of brands you can choose from clothing to accessories with different prices such as Zara, H&M, Rolex, Valentino,..There's a food court on the 6th (or 7th?) floor so you can stop by to eat many kinds of food. Thai foods, Vietnamese foods,.. And drinks. I recommend you to have a cup of jasmine tea or milk tea in the food court. It tasted really good.
Why bother. If you live in any developed country don't waste your time. It's full of stuff that you will find at home at your size.

All in one place. This shopping mall has luxury lanes as well as middle range such as Zara, Mango, Nike, etc. A very beautiful place to do also window shopping, there are restaurants and it is in the city center
Nice mall. I went there for shopping with family. There's many good brands. Also many international restaurants on the top most floor. Good place to go and chill out with family and friends.

I went to one or 2 stores... here but it made me seem like I was in a high priced mall in the states..the clothing cost so much..I mostly used this place to get on and off the BTS train..there seemed to be a lot of stores..if you have money to burn..I did not..as I am at the end of my month long trip to this side of the world

Lovely mall with variety of things .. We are a family of 4 and all of us loved Central for their own reasons. It has Zen and Isetan, two big anchor stores. H&M is also there with Zara and both stores had lovely sales on . Great bargain. Food court is on 5&7 floors and good options are available. Lots of free spaces so the crowded effect of mall is not there. Will definitely visit again when ever in Bangkok.
Big and bold. Very nice, clean shopping mall. A Lot af different shops. Big variety of shops and restaurants. I would say the best shopping center in Bangkok.

Shopping. Famous Naraya is there - a Favourite outlet for the ladies. Guys with spouse, be prepared to burn a hole in your wallets. Prices have increased though. The same item was 10-20 baht higher than it was 3 months ago. Just like paragon, mostly branded stuff and upmarket restaurants. Can drop by since it is along the way towards platinum mall.
Shopping Eating Conferencing. Great under-one-roof venue. Boutique shopping. Great cafes and eateries. Secure and well signposted. Conference facilities and venue huge, clean and great skyline views.

Not a place for ppl look for cheap goods. I heard that Central World is a must-visit place for Bangkok so I went there. But I was disappointed that it is full of foreign brands shops. E.g. H&M, Uniqlo, Forever 21 ... Which I can buy all these in Hong Kong, with similar price.So I think if you look for a shopping for local goods, please go to JJ Market or Platinum Fashion Mall nearby.

Good Mall. The central mall is quiet big and have much to offer.You have all the brands and a wide variety of food to choose.We ended up in the supermarket with the food court inside.This was a great experience to have a option to taste a lot of local food.They even sell beers and cock tail mix but they dont sell them until after 5:00 pm.We picked fresh cut fruits, muffin and bread which were really soft.

Typical modern shopping plaza offering a good variety of shops plus tge Zen department store.. This large modern shopping plaza is well maintained and well laid out and offers shoppers a wide choice of shops/ boutiques as well as the Zen department store. You can certainly shopin comfort in this complex.

Nice place to shop, the architecture is amazing. Cool place to shop. Architecture of the escalator is amazing. A bit reminiscent of the Guggenheim in NYC. Has some nice restaurants, a bit pricey. This mall is a bit more for upscale clientele.

Too much awesomeness!. Central World is in such an amazing close location (we stayed at Indra hotel) and it was a close walk away. Upon entering, we were amazed at the size! So many floors with endless shops!The best thing has to be the food selection - all the restaurants are of exceptional quality but the problem is choosing which one to eat at! Definitely visit here if u had half a day to a full day free in Bangkok to explore!

Wow!. I can't believe how huge this place is! We were here for an entire afternoon and evening and barely saw two floors. They have a decent sized Sephora which I was very excited about. We went to the movie theater, there is also Imax, and the seats are large and comfy and the theater itself is amazing. If you're looking to kill some time indoors check this place out!

High end mall . You will get lost in the huge mall with adequate parking and cine plex You can find branded high end stores food court coffee shops . Events are organized at the central lobby. Christmas and new year eve are a treAt to watch in this place

Favorite mall in Bangkok. It's definitely my son's and my favorite mall in Bangkok. There is always something in the mall that keeps him occupied while I do my shopping. Genius planet at the same floor as Toy r us has free children play area and small game arcade. With receipt of 500 baht, can register for a train ride on the floor. Plenty of dining choices on different floors and I like to go to Taling Pling. There is a corner near Isetan and Kinokuniya with quite a few jap restaurants too.Shopping wise, I have been to Naraya and jelly dream (selling Melissa shoes) just opposite. Also have Karmakamet and other aromatherapy shops which are quite scattered.Tourists can sign up for One Card that gives discount to the departmental stores and few shops. I managed to use it at Robinsons and Tops elsewhere to get the discount. Also tourist can collect a Naraya pouch with 3000 baht purchase at Central World, exclude dining, at the Level 1 customer service near Bangkok Bank counter.
