Nice mall. Central World Plaza has a great shop mix along with restaurants and cafes. Virtually all the usual brand of shopping can be found in this mall. Comfortable mall to shop in!

Many things to do. Has many shops including Isetan (multiple levels) and a Asian book store (that's it's name). it's easy to access by the BTS and there's also a ice rink but I don't recommend it as the ice is too dry and bumpy to skate on. At the highest level , there are so many restaurants to choose from including a supermarket and a cinema.

shopping malls. A huge shopping malls and comprises two department stores, Zen and Isetan. You can also find fine Japanese restaurants, Thai and Chinese restaurants as well as western fair and some fast food.

Huge and excellent food/restaurant levels. Absolutely huge mall. Zen department store at one end. Connects to the Centara Grand Hotel which is great if you're staying there.
The Food levels are excellent too. So much to choose from.

The best place for shopping in Bangkok! . Ahhh.. what do I say about these market. This market is so huge and you can find any stuff here as you desire. A posh place for shopping!! Its a shopping paradisa.

Everything here. Situated just by the Erawan Shrine is the Central World shopping complex. There is a huge array of shopping choices here with all the big retail names present. This is a very modern shopping mall and is a great place to watch the world go by in one of the restaurants. It is situated in the centre of the business district with many fine hotels surrounding it. The British and American embassies are also near and is easily accessible by the Skytrain.

Luxury. It's one of the biggest central of Bangkok. It's have many kind of goods from many famous labels. It has many restaurants also. It's suitable for shopping and relaxing together.You can get there by sky train.

Huge Mall! . Actually wasn't too impressed by the mall in terms of buying things. The mall itself is huge and stunning, but if you're looking for cheap things to buy this isn't the mall for you. Quite standard prices compared to most Western countries, and I left disappointed that there were no bargains.
Flagship luxury shopping. The stores here are the true flagship locations for the brands vs the Siam malls, but the number of stores is far higher at Siam. Beautiful location.

It's Central World!. It's my 3rd time to come here but I have never had enough time to go have a look all stores. If you get peckish, sample local delicacies in the food court or grab a quick snack at one of the multiple international fast food eateries. One of many big commercial centers in the capital, the plaza distinguishes itself with its range, design, and location, attracting scores of locals and tourists alike.
They have good concept. I like this mall. But their street food in front of the mall is awesome.You can enjoy the street food and then walking around the mall. Refreshing way for traveller.

My Shopping N Leisure Paradise. One of biggest shopping mall you can find in bangkok,full with branded boutique n dining resto, and many more...There are large exhibition ground that usually have event, and every end of december, central world exhibition ground will have 2-3 mini concert stage n drinking bar, enlighting for the coming of New Year.

Huge Mall. We spent almost a whole day here! This place is huge! They have a lot of options for stores as well as some great restaurants on the upper floors. It's a good way to spend a day if the weather gets too hot for you.
Huge shopping mall with good mix. Very nice and huge shopping mall with good mix of products, fashion both luxurious and average. Good spread of restaurants, very nice desert shops and stalls.
Escape rain or heat . They probably have a Shop that suits your needs. And it's a great place to escape rain or the Heat. Check out the sushi burrito thing at the food court. They were delicious.

Incredible food heaven at all levels. Central World is anot incredibly diverse shopping mall that incorotates a food heaven within a number of section of the mall.If you love shopping and/or food then you need to see this place, you will be gobsmacked at the amount of shops and restaurant's.We spent 2 days eating and eating at every single dim sum place we could find and it was truly an amazing experience seeing the cooks and chefs preparing everything in site especially the noodles.Everyday the centralee plaza sees numerous live events from singers to sponshore, showing a different aspect of Bangkok.There are restaurants andelivering cafes that cater for every palate and wallet, eating from 30 baht to more than 3000 baht as we saw in one fine dining restaurant.RecommendactionGo and visit and see for yourself and enjoy the uniqueness of the mall.

Huge centre to shop. We had a 12 hour stop over so caught the train into town to spend a few hours, this place is huge everything here that you could want, a bit overwhelming for me so couldn't tell you what the prices were like. There are actually 3 buildings here to go through lots of shopping of all sorts and lots of food to choose from. Also sea world madame tussaudes and a cinema huge!
Another shopping paradise. Another place for me not to missed out whenever I am in Bangkok. Lots of shops and cafe. Love this place if you are crazy for shopping like me.

Market was good. Tbh we didn't shop in the said shopping mall as we have low budget compared to the sellers. However they do sell good items and brand at cheaper prices i think. Best thing is that the plaza has everyday night market which was so cool.

Shopping and local food at their courtyard. Paid a visit to Central World. Huge shopping complex with a multitude of shops great and small. The court yard in front is patio to keep the retailers for clothes and shoes and local Thai food. There's a spectacular show of food and fruits and the desserts that only the Thais do in small sizes.Along the street are more stalls that only open in the evening, under a new construction walkway and there lies a group of Thai food restaurants all in their alfresco glory.Fabulous and delicious food that reasonably priced. Lots to do, eat and see here in Central World.
Huge mall. Huge mall with a nice supermarket on 7th floor where you can get groceries from all over the world Free wifi upon registering Many dining options to choose from

One of Many Malls in Bangkok. Central World is a pretty standard mall in Bangkok. It's fine if you are looking for the equivalent of Western stores but doesn't stand out as unique among the many malls in the city. But for basic needs or to wile away an afternoon, it's fine.

Shopping paradise. A railway themed shopping mallDifferent doors are arranged different ways very intelligent design you will be greeted by a huge escalator no safety rails so don't fool around it's quite high lol.Make sure you walk in and out all the side alleys there are some interesting small shops
Shopping. Incredibly big mall with insane number of shops catering to almost everything... complete with a wide culinary choice to tempt even the most fussy palate.

Central Food Hall (court). Chiy Lom BTS is the closest, leave via exit 6 and follow the skywalk, there is a dedicated entrance into Central World. On the 7th floor within Central World, hidden behind the food hall is Central Food Court. Prices range from 45 baht to130 baht. Very good food, well cooked, well presented and at a most reasonable price. There has to be something for everyone including vegetarian options. Great value, not as trendy as some other food courts as the seating is a bit 'works canteen' but the food is good and the value for money is spot on.

Large selection at Centara World. My husband and I stayed at the adjoining Centara Grand and found the shopping centre very convenient and interesting. There is everthing you would ever need .........global brands, Department store, boutiques,Pharmacies, jewelery,electronics, beauticians,hairdressers, restaurants ,cafes ,etc. Everything is fixed price and I couldnt find any bargains as everything was the same price or more expensive than back home in Sydney Australia. We enjoyed being connected to the Centre as it was lovely and cool inside when temperatures outside were too high.We also enjoyed walking through the centre at night after dinner.The centre is attached by walkways outside to the rail and other shops.

Clean & impressive retail. We stopped here to pick up a few accessories from Evita Peroni. Polite and attentive staff. Wished we had more time to shop and to check out the f & B there. We could see some nice cafes. We will definitely spend more time here when we go back in December
Visit . Basically there nothing to shop inside as most of the shop are selling branded at a higher price compare to sg or hk. Only the naraya can go as I feel it's worth while to go in and buy.

Mind blowing shopping experience!. I just could not believe this shopping centre, gob smacking, so many shops, so many floors and off shoots, so many places to eat and a cinema as well, very clean environment, lots of people but doesn't feel crowded, if you spend over 2000 bahts in any of the shops in the shopping centres and keep the paperwork and receipts you can claim 6% tax back at the airport when you return home, when we went to the bottom floor it had a stack of Ferrari cars on display, consumerism at its best or worst, glad I saw it but also glad we don't have one here!

Bangkok Stay!. The shopping centre was awesome, lots of designer boutiques,Lots of places to eat both local and western food. I certainly was grateful to find a good coffee shop!The Gourmet Market is also well worth a walk round.
shopping. shopping heaven for lady, many discount, night market just in front of the shopping mall. Many international brandedf

Big mall. Excellent place very clean loads food halls and plenty of variety of foods to eat. shopping wise big variety loads of stuff I thought at resonable prices . mall is air conditioned toilets very clean essential for travellers.
Nice mall.. Very nice mall with many shops and places to eat...and some good escalators to go and up and down...awesome place...
Expensive. This shopping mall is more expensive than the norwegian malls. The shops are okay, but there is more interesting and fun malls to see in Bangkok. Recommend Terminal 21 and Discovery.

Perfect place to start shopping.. A huge mall with lots of branded shops and local stores. They also have lots of restaurants and a good foodcourts. They even have a 4 star hotel that connects to the mall. Good location also, within the mall strip of Bangkok..

My favourite in Bangkok. In my opinion this I the biggest and best shopping centre In Bangkok, it has everything! So many choices for food and every clothing store you can think of. It's hard not to get lost here!

Great shopping and plenty of restaurants . I prefer Central World over Siam Paragon. Great dining options on the 5th floor, many different cuisines, and one of my favourites Din Tai Fung which has the best Xiaolongbao Dumplings in Bangkok, in my opinion. If you are after electronics, then I definitely think there are more stores catering to this in Central World. I'm any event Central World is not too far a walk from Siam Paragon, so what you cant find in one, you would most probably find in the other.Location is right on the BTS Skytain line, Chitlom Station, however it is very close to Siam Station too.
Amazing mall. This place is massive and has like 3 malls in it. Fantastic food court area too and pretty damn cheap. Avoid lunchtime rush though!

A lot of shops and restaurants . You will find everything you need to enjoy some shopping time. The mall is full of different shops, and the restaurant part offers a large variety of foods. You will definitely like something there. If you want to enjoy the night, a lot of bars with live music are available outside.

Just a shopping mall. You can expect what a shopping mall offers, from daily essentials to fashion needs and run of the mill dining offerings. I like the Zen dept store there (operated by central group so the tourist privilege card can be used too).

Good entertainment. We stayed at the hotel adjoining the mall so it was a regular visit to the mall i would say. Its a huge mall with seven floors having high end retails as well..the salon in it were veeyq reasonable...there were lots of sales going on at this time of the year, so for shopaholics it was heaven.Innumerable food shops offering all kind of food... plus the supermarket at seventh floor too was good with all kind of fruits n vegetables as well as bakery products.The mall has good bookshops as well with great deals.The ice rink n team labs island are a must go thing for kids.
A Decent Shopping Mall. A Good Variety of Food and Shops.Clean and Decent mall with varies brand.Big and Comfortable Walkway.

Too huge designer mall. Massive mall mainly for top designer stores. Compared to other malls in Bangkok this had no atmosphere as it's always empty. Unless you've got loads of money and want personal service you are better off with platform 21 or BMK.
Central World. A lot of branded stuff. Nothing much but it is very near Platinum Fashion mall so a nice air con place to rest after all the shopping.

Huge!. This store is HUGE! Please make sure you have plenty of time to go Around.
There is a lot of shops & all at very good prices.
I would recommend visiting.

The Most Iconic Shopping Mall after MBK. Central World Plaza is definitely one of the most iconic malls in Bangkok with its flagship department store Isetan and Zen plus the endless list of F&B shops in its vicinity. With the famous Place of Worship just outside the mall, it is also the centre for many festive and important festival celebrations.

Good mall. There is mainly two best mall this is one of them. First is Siam Paragon and other one is this.
It's have good options and nearby the Siam paragon. So you can also check out there.
It's have food court also available. And well maintained.
Thanks.

Nice shipping centre . This is the place that caters to all with branded shops to shops that sells item at an affordable price. It houses many restaurants and has a supermarket at the top level along with a cinema. You can find brands like Naraya, Superdry, Isetan, Zen and many more here. There is also several bridge that links Central World to Siam BTS which makes it convienent for tourist to come.
Big mall with lots to see. 5 mins walk from BTS ChitLom. A big mall with varieties to see. It has an ice skating rink at 2nd floor, movie cinema & supermarket at 7th floor.

Central World Plaza. We took a taxi from the hotel to this shopping mall one evening from our hotel and a tuk tuk on the return journey. There are plenty of both taxis and tuk tuk outside the mall on the main road that will take you where you want to go but do negotiate the price first.This mall is absolutely huge with numerous floors, however it is over whelming in size and dare I say it with too much choice! It was good to have a look around however it was so vast that in the end we got bored and returned to the hotel. Alot of the shops are highly priced and having been used to negotiating at the markets the experience here was completely the opposite.There are market traders located outside the mall, having spent a couple of hours walking around the different floor levels and shops, the market was a welcome sight and back to reasonable prices. Good experience however if you want souvenirs etc stick with the markets.
Big market. It was looking interesting building had a lot floor for local people ,Had sale a lot thing like clothes ,jewel ,nice building .

Shopping Galore. This is a huge mall with two department stores on opposite sides. The Zen on one end and Isetan Department Store on the other end. I liked Isetan which is a Thai branch of a Japanese Department store chain. If you are fond of cute stuff you have to visit their area which showcases food that are popular in Japan. The food designs were so cute that you would want to take photo first before eating. They also have sections for Japan themed restaurants. I was able to buy Sanrio products at discounted prices in Isetan. On the other end is Zen which sells clothes of higher end brands. In between the huge mall you can find various arrays of retail shops. You can also find Naraya Bags at the ground floor which is a big hit to the Chinese tourist. There were long lines in the counter that I decided not to push thru with my purchase. Finding food and restaurants for any race won't be a problem coz they are scattered all over different floors in the upper portion. If one is on the budget they have food court as well as supermarket with plenty of Thai delicacies. After roaming and shopping around Central World I also went to the front outside grounds where they were having two big tents on opposite sides selling foods and clothings as well. I am just not sure if they do this on regular basis but I just felt lucky during that weekend coz I was able to buy clothes at very reasonable price from local designers. And of course there is Big C just across Central World if you want more local stuff at supermarket prices. Happy shopping. . .
Overrated . I actually e did up going here before I went to siam paragon. I would have been bitterly disappointed if I went here afterwards

good for Bargain shopping. This is a huge mall good for wholesale shopping for unbranded garments, shoes ,hand bags, night clothes, lingerie etc There are no trial rooms so be clear about the sizes you pick and bargains are available. the re is a food court on the sixth level ? with different cuisines available. ( hard to find indian food)

Everything you want in one place. You can spending an all day long here at CTW due to a huge combination of 3 Department Store within one big mall. And anything you want such as clothes, food, accessories, book store and etc and suitable for all ages. The location is the best because it's in the center of everything such as Siam Paragon, Siam Square, Siam Center, Gaysorn Plaza, Amarin Plaza, The Plattinum Shoping Mall and Water Gate Market (wholesales shopping market).Across the street is the Erawan Shrine, in front of Grand Hyatte Erawan Hotel. And in front of CTW is the Trinity or Pra Trimurati (pray for love).Although, all the places I was mention is in the walking distance. I'd loved to suggest you to use the BTS instead of Taxi Meter or Tuk-Tuk service from there.

My favourite Bangkok city mall. This is my favourite Bangkok city mall. Has a lot of space available, a few classic stores and the perfect cinema up the top.A few speciality shops selling music equipment and other items throughout. Often surprising what can be found in there.

The biggest mall of Bangkok. this central world is the largest mall in Bangkok, its connected to another mall internally and one could easily pend the whole day there without stepping out. Some of theist luxury brands are in the mall along with many mid range brands. They have a huge supermarket as well as massive food court with all kinds of cuisine possible on offer.

Not for everyone. Although there are several things to enjoy and do here, it's definitely not for everyone especially those looking for cheap goods and affordable eats. But we did enjoy the food at a local Thai restaurant there.

Central World , centre of city. Central world plaza is really the centre of Bangkok. With Central hotel up and.big shopping mall under. Connected to BTS. Very convenient. However, taxi may be jammed when reaching this place. Traffic jam.is still the main issue in Bangkok.
Typical mall. Having been in many balls in SE Asia, Central World was unexceptional. I found it to be a fairly typical mall shopping experience.
Be Prepared to be Amazed .. Floors and floors of shopping ..Air conditioned and comfortable .Every stall is the dame as the other one ,however Same Same but different .
1 place shop. These are the must to go malls in bangkok... up to date with fashion hi end and moderate stores... just love the Thai clothing excellent quality

Good Mall. Not many tourists visit this mall as the Central World Mall is more popular with tourists.This place has less crowds and mostly frequented by locals. The mall has a decent selection of shops and whats great it has a Tops market at the basement.We stayed near bye so it was convenient for us.
Huge mall. Very big mall with lot of options to eat and shop. Located very close to good hotels from where you can easily walk through this mall.

Perfect for all your needs. Our last day in Bangkok was just for malling, this place definitely is my fave. Its a huge mall not just luxury brands but also those mid-range products. Its really clean. Lots of food selections as well.

For shopping. Good and enough but a bit expensive. Have food and electronic shops and matbe all of what you need you can find here but a bit expensive and comparison with your country pricess and then will buy

Very convenient. We wanted to watch a late night movie, so we bought our tickets at the SF cinema.It was quite late already, so most of the food outlets were closed. Fortunately, we went to the Groove at the front side and could find all the restaurants/outlets were still open.We enjoyed our late supper and was able to stroll leisurely to the cinema on the 7th floor to catch our movie.Very convenient place for both watching movie and dining.

They did a fantastic job putting this place back together . Five star shopping and something for everyone and food of all kinds depending on your mood! I've eaten here even twice in one day to calm my shopping inertia!

Huge shopping place. This mall is very big and it is connected to the BTS and skywalk . It's very accessible lots of shop and restaurants . Isetan is connected to this mall as well . You need a day to roam around this mall.
Perfect for shoppers looking for branded goods. Excellent shopping centre. Great range of shops, including all top brands.Various food options and worth a visit, especially if it's raining!

Food court. Visited here a few times as was located very close to our hotel. Contains many restaurants over the 6 floors and will cover every bodies tastes with all the usual Western brands and asian food restaurants. The shopping centre is very large and clean but any western brands are more expensive than found in the UK.

Wow. You could get lost in this place for days, just so many shops! You really need a couple of days to explore this place, it's pretty much the same as any other shopping centre just on larger scale!
Shopping Paradise. So much to see and shop! Clean malls and toilets! One of the few malls that Bangkok boasts of with a variety of choices!

Good! . I recommend this place to go shopping 😊😊.
You can get all brand products. Then they have free mobile charging stand. It is good for you ;)

Great shopping mall, but the food court is HORRIBLE. Great brands from basic h&m and zara to high end luxury brands and designers!
Would recommend.
A lot of stuff to do snd to buy here!
Dont eat in the food court though!

Massive!!. If you are a shopperholic then this place is for you. Possibly need a week to get around the whole place. Fortunately there are many info boards to read and find what you want. I purchased a pair of Clarke's shoes for work, the assistant gave me 10% discount straight away.
Happy shopping!. Its a big shopping mall with reasonable as well as high end brand shops. Too many shops to cover. A lot of good restaurants. Nicely done!

Loved the variety of handbag . Loved the brands such as st James, wide variety of shoes and handbags
Great place to look up for stone based jewellery
Offering huge discounts of 70-90% on high end brands like moschino , juicy contour at lower floor
Nice place to look up

Biggest shopping complex. It's so huge there are sea animals living inside. (Got sea world)
Best place to hangout eat lunch .. Avoid the afternoon sun.
It has many restaurants for us all to choose. From lower ground floor till the highest floor.
You may get lost so becareful !!
😘😝😝😎😎🤗🤗

A place I like to shop. Central World Plaza is a big shopping mall with plenty of shops, restaurants and cafes. The shops here are from the reasonable price range to the high end brands. Big C Supermarket is just opposite. This is the place I will go when I visit Bangkok.
To many shops. This was fun for the ladies but for any of you guys remember 100 000 shops take a long time. My hubby lasted an hour but most of that was coffee and biscuit

The Best in Bangkok. We always centre our shopping on central world as it is the biggest and in our view the best of the shopping centres in Bangkok with a large range of restaurants and cafes as well. We also stay at the centara grand which is attached to the shopping centre.

Best Shooping Centre in Bangkok. I like to shop in the Central shopping complexes throughout Thailand. This one is no different. A large shopping complex with a food Plaza and so many stores to choose from
Lunch. Look for the central world good hall. A clean and more variety of food to choose. They have fresh juices in affordable price. A middle class good court.

For your leisure. I will come over to Central World for the food fares that offers a lot of choices when it comes to local delights. The Naraya outlet is always packed with tourists; especially China & Taiwanese who sweep through the store like a whirlwind .You can also enjoy Starbucks and International cuisine here, and there's a bowling center at the basement too. Want to catch the latest blockbuster movies? You can go up to the 5th level for movie entertainment & arcade games. Zen department store and international brands can be found here too. There's even a VAT refund counter somewhere in the building, though I've never visited it.

Naraya flagship store is here . For tourists who goes crazy over Naraya, this is the place to come. Located at level 1 you can find a huge Naraya store with more designs you may not find in other outlets. There is a Isetan within this building. There are also many restaurants and cafes which you can take a rest before continuing with your shopping.
Big. Good variety and prices reasonable too. Quite a few shops. You van design your own T-shirt for 700 baht and visited north face and sports world.

Fabulous Exquisite Shopping Experience . Unlike Paragon, this place is uncluttered & every shop is well situated. Not as crowded.Restaurants opens the moment the shopping mall opens unlike the restaurants in Paragon, you did have to wait till 11:30am and they don't open all day dining.Love Central World.

World class shopping experience. All under roof world class shopping, includes all international brands. The cost is little on the higher side than MBK mall. Good entertainments for kids and good cinema halls. Book shop has good collection of books on all subject. Good access from metro sky train and bus.

Slightly expensive but great food. The stuff they sell here are the usual stuff you can find in your country. There are not much cheaper so dont bother. However, the food there is really good!! Make sure you try the bake tarts at the highest level!!

Center of the world. Extremely busy on weekends or holidays. Please beware. Otherwise great choices and variety of shops and restaurants and entertainment. More middle class that it's neighbour Paragon.

Easy to reach by BTS. Very wonderful shopping center & Modern shopping you could find the following brands zara , H&M and mother care ,levis,lee and major brand and International Food Court. & restaurants and cafesone of the best food nice food court and restaurants on 7th floor also SF World Cinema.Also Central World is a shopping plaza and complex in Bangkok, Thailand. It is the sixth largest shopping complex in the world. The complex, which includes a hotel and office tower, is owned by Central Pattana.How to Get There : SkyTrain to E1 Chit Lom Station (Sukhumvit Line). Take Exit 9. For Skybridge to Gaysorn Plaza and cross road to CentralWorld i personally recommended anyone to change his normal routine to visit this amazing shopping center.

BIG MALL. A huge couple of story mall having 100 s and 1000 s of shops & boutiques selling variety of ladies' ready made quality dresses. Nice place consisting of specialty shops, banks, food court, restaurant, supermarkets, department store and cinemas, as well. However, for Gents no enough of shops to select their requirements.
Central World Plaza. An amazing mall, very big and beautiful, with acceptable prices for everybody, and really good restaurants with amazing food and cheap.

Very convenient to shop and eat. There's a lot of boutiques, specialty shops, banks, food court, restaurant, supermaket, department store and cinema. Just a 10 minutes walk to Siam BTS station or a 7 minutes walk to Chit Lom station.

Central World On Saturday. On Saturday , me and my mom visited Central World to eat lunch and go shopping. We went to both parts of Central World. The main part which is the mall and Isetan where they sell a lot of Japanese things. It was a very good experience although I went to this mall a lot of times. The food there was very good , there were a variety of foods . So much that even I don't know what to eat. Central World also has a lot of shops too. Overall it was a good experience.
Cool. Cool shopping mall. On the expensive side for Bangkok. Lots of different shops and delicious food. Easy to get lost. Clean toilets.
很難買. Hard to believe they sell such a expensive clothes in Bangkok. I been there for 3 hrs buying nothing .
Lots of shops and restaurants . A massive shopping centre offering a n number of spas, restaurants, a great cinema and an extra dress choice of shops both local and international

Great shopping. Great shopping center, with plenty of stores such as H&M, Forever 21, Pull & Bear, ZEN and many make up / beauty stores. Really good food level, plenty of restaurants to choose from. Center was easily accessible from the skywalk.

Seems like a nice Mall. A big mall with many brands and stuff. I only shopped at Zen (departmental store)while I was there because I only had 2 hours but I found that there are many 'not bad' brands there (men's section) and the prices are quite fair (with much discounts).I walked around the mall a bit and would like to shop more if i had the time. Overall it seems like a nice place.
Shopping . Ginormous shopping centre, have platinum and palladium just up the toad too, some ok shops but some crappy places too, you could spend a day here it's so big
The biggest department store ever seen. It's the biggest department store ever seen!!It's really a world!central world has a lot of building of stores,we walk through three BTS station!
HUGE & broad selection. Huge (7 spacious floors) & varied selection (fashion, electronics, restaurants, even a movie theatre); good connection to BTS skytrain.

The Best central in Bangkok interesting places . Definitely a much -visit when in Bangkok The make has been creativity made for tourists it's a great place for tourists to visit and take pictures The mall give you a fell of what it's like to be in haven This is a main city of bangkok much visit new year is the make more beautiful

Everything you need. A fantastic place to visit even from a westerners voew point. If only our shopping centres were open till 10pm every night.
The street food market outside is amazing too.
Nothing special. Worth a visit if you are a fan of H&M, zara, mango.... Very huge. Food court inside the supermarket, the price quite ok. Not sure we will come back on next visit. Nothing special.

A shopping paradise. This is the place where I shop till I drop. Huge and comfortable shopping mall. Must wear comfortable shoes when you come here. It's link to Chitlom BTS via sky bridge. You can get basically every good brand from expensive to affordable things in Thailand. I personally like Zen a lot. Not only because they have good customer service especially the VAT refund, they also provide free drinks every hour to customer and there is a creative local corner where I get specially designed things from Thailand. Also love Isetan as their food hall serve authentic Japanese food. The Japanese desert is my favourite. The restaurants selections here are marvelous. If you are a tourist, try Nara Thai, as their curry crab and Tom yum Koong are heavenly!
Many shops. Good place for shopping and also for dinning. From electronics to cloths to brand shops. Many restaurants as well

It is amazingly big!. This is a huge mall by South East Asia standard. It has many floors of shopping, and it has many eateries that offer many cuisines from different countries. It is simply a haven for shoppers!
Big Malls. Luxury, Mid Range and local brands are here ! Tons of Foods (from resto, cafe, dessert and etc)..Get free WIFI if you are tourist ! love it !
Just a Mall. The Plaza is very nice and big and there are a lot of shops, but there is nothing special in my opinion. It is a typical modern mall in a big city.
Shoppers' paradise especially for Thai designers. The shopping centre is accessible and not overly huge. A good place to seek out Thai designers for clothes and accessories.
great!. Super big shopping mall. All brands there. Enjoy foods court at the top floor. The place must go if you are a shopping addict.

Huge Mall In the center of Bangkok. This is my favourite Mall in Bangkok along with Siam Paragon Mall.It's so huge that you will definitely get lost and also you require a break for exploring it fully.The Ground Floor is filled with all International Brands where very few people were there.There's a high end Cineplex on the top floor along with a huge food court where at least 20 restaurants were there.There's also a Ice skating rink in the center but could not try it for paucity of time.This Mall is not for budget shoppers.

Many choices of restaurant and shopping . The central word plaza was located between BTS Siam and BTS chilom. I have been many time to take a break for my lunch or afternoon tea. The varieties a selection of brands costume.
ice skating. there is a ice skating pist in the middle with acceptable price but with old skates but it is better than nothing, it's a good activity and you will probably have fun on the go :P

Big mall where you can barter. This mall was large and one you can barter at. I didn't enjoy the experience all that much bartering a lot higher then in the markets and same stuff. They did have jewels although not sure on quality and still high prices .. Not what I had thought. So many other great things to do in Bangkok so I think all in all I didn't enjoy any of the malls it feels like you should be experiencing other things. In saying this if you love malls and shopping check it out you might find a deal or two
Big mall. A great shopping mall. It's pretty big so make sure to know your directions. Good place to cool down under the hot Bangkok haha...

Enjoy your shopping. It is newly renovated. Nice and plenty of shops and brands. Spend a day here, enjoy many shops and foods. A bit inconvenient because you have to walk a long way from the BTS station.

11 stories with something for everyone!!. 11 stories high, with mix of small local specialty stores and big name international chain stores-think Starbucks, Kenneth Cole, H & M. Lots of local boutique type stores, along with a movie theater, game arcade, fitness center and a currency exchange.

One of my favourite malls!. This has to be one of my favourite malls because I can find almost everything I need in this mall. The shops worth mentioning is Naraya and After You cafe. The good thing is also that the big C supermarket is just opposite.

Big shopping centre with great shops. Central World Plaza shopping centre is very big and amazing complex. This centre has 7 floors containing many shops, restaurants, cinema and really everything you would ever need. This centre has all international shops and restaurants, for example H&M, Bershka, Stradivarius, Sephora, Mango, Zara, Starbucks, McDonald's and many many more. This shopping centre is really worth to visit and great attraction for rainy days. Remember, you need more than just couple of hours for visit this huge centre.

Levels and levels. Busy, large centre with all your usual international brands.
Prices are comparative to what you would pay back home so dont expect a bargain.

Good selection and pleasant.. A large shopping Mall with plenty of shops covering from fashion to local brands, electronics and plenty of restaurants and cafes.The mall offers mid range prices, and a good variety of shops including a quite large shop of Jim Thompson with excellent silk items which are all produced and designed in Thailand. They make excellent presents back home.The vast majority of shops offer VAT return so don't forget to ask for it. You will need your passport number and your arriving and departing flight details.If you want to also try the top fashion houses you could walk next door to Siam Paragon Mall which 5 minutes walk.
Good place to hang out during free time. If you have money to spend, it's good place to hang out. A lot of restaurant and the Plaza just located right in the city

Entertainment, Dining etc. Central of Bangkok; very lively and you can probably spend a whole day here because it has almost everything you need just in one spot. Eg Supermarket, Cinema, All kinds of stores, restaurants, jewellery stores.Quite up market without being too expensive.It's big, bright and clean.Next to the shopping mall there's a temple next to it, and the area is always busy. Some outdoor events sometimes host in the space right next to mall entrance, like Songkran festival there's a big party held.

Great mall for branded stuff. You will get all brands here. It's a huge mall with great stores. The food court has some good eating options. Check the shops you want to visit else you ll waste time hunting for stuff.
1 day is not enough. a LOT of good shopping and eating treats. Luxurious as you may say and something different from what we have in Kuala Lumpur.

big shopping center with activity for children. Beside the shops and the food hall and the restaurants there is a nice place on the 5th floor ( I think),the name is CLAY WORKS, 45 minutes of amusement for the children, at the end they receive the work they made , it cost some money, adults not allowed to be in this room with the children, you wait outside or walk and see the mall. All family enjoy it, outside the clay works room there are some other activities for children. It is open from 10:00 am. Enjoy.

Another shopping centre. A very large multi storied shopping centre with a vast array of shops on the upper floor there was a huge variety of eateries. It was lovely and cool a great place to spend a couple of hours out of the heat

Massive space - plenty for everyone. This place was massive. Its a day trip all by itself. Plenty to of places to shop, although price wise most things are the same if not dearer than back home in Aus

Huge, lots of food options. Central world Plaza is a huge shopping mall, it's a mixture of luxury and mid-range offerings. There are lots of food options, from elegant dining to a quick bite. It's big, it's clean.

Very cool place . This mall was a good place to pick up gadgets and Chinese knock offs. I found a few cool little items that I bought as gifts. Good for electricals and phone accessories. This place is huge but gets repetitive after a while.

Limited Period Night Market! . Went there during the day time and noticed the tents and posters on night market. Went back at night - - Not disappointed. There were a huge number of tents right outside the mall selling food (fried chicken, granola, baked pasta, burgers, cocktails, mango sticky rice, and so much more!). My friend and I were spoilt for choices. Other than food, there were apparel stores as well. The mall should look into having this event more frequently as it really liven up the spirits at night. As for the mall, well it's huge but the stores are pretty general.

Nice shops good eats. I find this shops more to my likings great mixture of good brands not so much upmarket Prada kinda brands with shops with no soul. Last 2 floors r food with bloody great selection.. had soba noodles with pork strips for about 100 baht..
Great Place to Shop and Spend a Hot day in the Air Conditioning. Super place to visit when you are too hot from walking and//or need something extra to take home from your trip.

THE place to shop. There are numerous shopping malls in Bangkok, but Central World Plaza seems to have just the right balance of brand named shops and multi-national mid-range type stores. There is also not TOO much emphasis on food outlets. The Groove is a pleasant place to eat and drink, but for some strange reason does not serve alcohol between 1400 and 1700, not good news for foreign tourists (particularly bored and tired Dads).

more than 400000 m2 great shopping - higher level - lots of new fantasy to see. going there is even, if you do not buy, a great experience, always new art to see, which tries to catch your mood - great shops - good restaurant and cinema place !

Not a mandatory visit!. The best of it is the food market that's located on the very entrance of the complex, which is very colorful and vibrant! The food is delicious and there's a huge range for you to choose from! Aside from that, it's just a huge shopping center with higher prices than the regular Thai shops...

Shop, eat and play....its got it all. From high end shopping to everyday brands, food courts to fancy dining and entertainment for kids and adults alike. Very large mall to escape the heat during the day. At night the top floors also house some great cocktail bars and music venues

Central World plaza is quite upmarket!. Visited Central World Plaza with my wife in July 2015 and was quite impressed with its size and variety of upmarket and popular brands to shop from. Be prepared to spend half a day to a full day due to its size, location and eateries.

Great place to shop, better place to eat. Plenty of good shops but the food establishments here and ten times better, tons of different types of food including a restaurant where you can cook your own food on the table!

big mall ... Siam. A huge mall with lots of shops and eateries. Nice eatery section area as an open air section surrounded by restaurants and some bars ... all high end. 'Wine I Love You' restaurant (you get decent hamburgers, fries, steaks maccaroni etc here.Few coffee shops in the mall for a sit down n rest over a cup of java. Big state of the art gym (I attended a few times) on the upper floors of the tower building which adjoins the main mall.Like many malls in BKK its more expensive than smaller out of the way shopping destinations but you get a huge range of choice and high end stuff here too. Joins to Japanese mall next door (can't remember the name). BTS very close.Next door there is a gorgeous green oasis of a Wat royal patronage by the Crown Princess).
shopping, shopping, shopping. Where to go when the wife wants to shop? answer: Anywhere that sells women's clothing. Great place to sit and have coffee while the wife is in her shopping mode.

Just another shopping center . This place wasn't far from our hotel so we de used to check it out. To be honest, it's just another shopping mall. There is a cool sign outside to take a photo with . Other than that I wouldn't recommend it unless you need to shop for something at a typical mall.

Like the title says Central World. One of the nicest big mall in Bangkok. Connects with BTS sky train. Not too far from MBK or Platinum Wholesale mall. Great shopping and food options. A great movie theater too. Also, huge parking spot for people likes to drive around. You can easily spend half to your day here if you have spare time to kill.

Expensive, but we like it. Polished and expensive shopping mall, but I like it. It is not too crowded, and you can roam around without thinking about protecting your pockets. You can find anything you need: from gourmet good, supermarket, hair salons… Will be back.

Humongous mall!. This is a massive mall and has all the expensive brands. Amazing for window shopping and also for actual shopping if you are so inclined. There is just so much to do inside that you could actually spend the whole day in here.

Huge, Clean Mall. Great place to escape to on a hot day in Bangkok. Myself and my sister made full use of the air-con here. The place was clean and the variety of shops was brilliant. Some great food places- the pizza restaurant on the top floor is reasonably priced and delicious. Also the milkshake cafe is brilliant. Delicious milkshakes with fresh, cold milk. The only problem we had was with the layout of the shops and trying to find our way around, as the mall is absolutely huge.

Good mall! . A good but very big mall: with lots of restaurants, high street brands and depatments stores, cinema and indoor kids playground. A bit complicated to find around in - well the map shows the area where you can find what you are looking for and not where the shop really is. But hey! The pleasure of shopping.
Huge. I can say the in London we have very big shopping centres but this one it's huge, 6 floors of huge fun, delicious food and big variety of clothing. Definitely a place to be back.
One of my favorites . Always has a good choice of products at the food court and shopping is very pleasant. Parking is good as well, traffic can be a problem.

diamonds are a girls best friend definitely. Diamonds in the central department store are a sight to see. I was 70 2 days after my return an my other half gave me the money to buy myself a ring. Boy this store really does come up trumps for choice . So many counters full of beautiful gifts. I knew exactly what style I wanted which made choice a lot easier. I bought mine from De preco. I always enjoy shopping in central and find that the prices are usually made for local people and not the foreigner. I was given a plastic card with all the rings details specified exactly. I had to have mine 3 sizes larger which cost me 10 pounds per size but as this was 18 carat white gold that was reasonable. I was also given a vat refund firm so that I could claim my tax back at the airport. The refund covered what I had spent getting resizing. My assistant at the shop was khun phu who really excelled herself. I had to tell her that I needed to go and check with my husband back in the u.k. and would be back. She did absolutely everything for me with a constant smile. Don't just take my word go and check out the counters and make someone happy.

WOW!! Great for shopping ☺️. I stayed in Bangkok for 7 days purely for shopping and I went to 9 different malls and this is hands down my favourite. 60% of my shopping for my 7 year old son and nephew and nieces from the age 4months to 12 years was done here and was worth the walking. Loved the kids section in Zen and the shoes are a bargain esp. for brand names such as Diesal. Sizzler steaks restaurant is a must visit for lunch. Price is more then MBK and platinum however the quality is much better.
Bangkok Shopping!!. A must-go place for shopping in Bangkok. It has movie theatre on the top floor and many good restaurants and food stalls.
big. we walk around here all days, its seems my wife very happy but me quite tired, its so big, anyway have many nice play to stop for food and drink

Nothing fanciful, give it a miss. It is considered the high end shopping district of Bangkok, but usually people come to bangkok for their cheap clothes near pratunam or other districts. So this is probably one area you would want to avoid, unless you are here for the cafes.

A superbly big shopping mall. I can only say I find only a few shops I'm truly interested in. I don't go bangkok to roam shopping centre. But it does have a few good restaurants and a couple of shops like Jim Thomson. There's always a tentage of stalls of Thai food in front of mall.

Fun!. Quite an amazing collection of stores under one roof! Super rich being around for exchange was a huge help though the girl attendant disappeared for a longer lunch break than displayed on the notice.

Designers mall. I live in London so when I went to Bangkok I wanted to spend my limited time there learning about the culture, visit the tourist attractions and learn about the local lifestyle, make the most out of my time there . Shopping for designers labels is something I can do at home.I did visit the center purely because i visited my other half's office there; it is a mall like any other western mall. Full of all the international brands. I did not look at anything so have not seen the prices but I think, having seen in the airport that a imported chocolate is £20, I would think everything there was very expensive even for us who live in UK.However if you are a keen shopper this would be something you will enjoy.The best thing about this place is the air con, so it may be a good place to have a break and cool down a bit in style,Big mall so time-wise it depends on your personal interest - one can spend a whole day there!

A mall.... Vast and sprawling shopping mall that looks like all the others. It has a confusing layout so you often think you've seen it all...but then there is another wing. No special shopping but is so big it feels less crowded than other similar malls.

I'm not a shopping fan, but this is amazing. One of the biggest shopping malls in Asia (the biggest). It is nearly impossible not to find what you are looking for. From Computers, phones, to clothes and food. Just everything is available.

Mall in the centre of BKK. There's a small place with the four head Buddha statues at front, and you can find hawker seller at night, alongside the mall. It was an okay mall, branded stuff but not as much as siam world. I can't review much, since I don't really like the place. but I can say you can still find shops and foodcourt at the top floor, it's not bad thou.
Top. Great place for shopping... A lot of brands available... A lot of good restaurants... Ice rink... Cinema...10 minutes walk from Paragon.
Location. Great location with food galore on the 6th floor. Spoilt for choice for the various cuisines.. Enjoyed this Mall.
Another Mall. Bangkok is littered with a number of large malls, Central World is not unlike many of the others. In my opinion there are far more interesting things to see and do in Bangkok.

Not my kind of shopping experience. It's a big mall full of shops that you can find in every other big mall on the planet. Not very interesting but probably convenient for many people and I guess teenagers and young families always need this sort of place.

One of the largest shopping plazas in the world. My wife and I were in BangkokFor a few days and we were taken to the Central World Plaza. The building itself is spectacular. The architecture is world class and the shops and services are high end. I was taken aback a bit as I listened to Celine Dion singing a Christmas song but we got used to it after a time. You could make a day of the plaza if you wanted. It would be a good way to spend a rainy day or get out of the heat. The shop keepers were attentive and most spoke reasonable English. There is a currency exchange on the main floor as well as banks and other services. We didn't spend much time there as it felt too much like home but if you like to shop and have money to spare it could make for a fun day.
Big and grand shopping centre. World-class shopping centre in Bangkok. Always full of people visiting. All kinds of merchandise available.
Worth a visit . Was just another massive mall. Definitely expect to get lost, there's plenty to see, lots of people, quite a cool lay out.

endless food choices. this place is heaven for foodies...food kingdom! Great place to be after walking around the huge mall. There is a plethora of choices from seafood to japanese to italian and french and to desserts. This is not for the weak tummy!
every thing under one roof.. very close to Chit lom sky station and near to Paragon center. Lots of options for shopping. Excellent facility.
Shopping. Was a great place to shop. Lots of stuff there and people there are really friendly and nice... going back to shop there again next year
Pricey. It's a nice place to get away form the sun, but definitely overpriced! I went in search of a particular product, and found it there, but it was very expensive compared to other places.

All items under one roof. This place is amazing and best place for a shopping lovers who are willing to pay extra money. Clothing items are very expensive than we expected and felt overpriced considering the other shopping malls. Good eating choices are there.. Next to this there's a Big C where you can go for grocery shopping.

big mall in distric area. good concept mall with many showroom and easy to reach.. connect thru to bts skytrain. so comfortable. many restaurant option to choose also big sport center here. u can search all u need here..

Great mall. ths is a massive mall you can find anything you want here
they have a level just all food a great place hang out
The No1 Shopping experience. Central World just at BKK's center has everything you can ever imagine. You can spend several full days their without getting bored.

Overpriced shopping mall. Was here today, getting out of the heat for a bit, having a KFC, probably most reasonably priced thing in this building.Its a large mall, selling everything from condos, cars, designer goods to groceries.Nice place to be, but everything is more expensive here, they must have high rents.Went into a Fred Perry shop, a shirt that would be about £60 in the UK was over 6000thb which is £120+ at todays exchange rates.Wouldnt recommend it unless you want to get out of the heat or show off how wealthy you are.I love buying things here and leaving a 2thb tip, makes me feel warm inside!
All shopping under one roof!. All the brands plus local shopping as well. Good eating choices. A whole day can easily be spent here. Wear good walking shoes!

Paradise for shopahalic. Central World is a place that I wanna go everytime when I visit Bangkok, and not to mention it's strong air-conditioning. It's really nice to shop here with all the boutique and local brands.

Central World - Thai New Year Sale. Plenty of shops were on sale during my stay due to Thai New Year. The shops are mid to high end brands. If you don't like MBK then this is the next place to check out unless you are looking for luxury then you should go to Siam Paragon.My and my friend ate, had coffee and snacks like daily here. There are a lot of restaurants to try out.

Modern mall with famous (western) stores. This mall is located between two BTS stations and very easy to reach. It has big chain stores such as H&M, Zara and Forever 21. There are many food stalls. When we visited, there was an ice skating rink inside the mall and a catwalk show was going on. You can easily spend an afternoon of shopping in this large mall. We had trouble finding the exit, it could use some better signage. However the information-desks were helpful. You can also register for 60 minutes free Wi-Fi at the information desks.
High Class Shopping. If you are looking for a bargain,then don't shop here..Beautifully decorated and modern shopping Center..

Fab Shopping!. Enjoyed this shopping mall. It's another huge mall in the heart of the city, but the good thing is that it has shops from the reasonable price range to the high end brands so that a great thing. Easy to reach with the Sky Train.
Got everything. Good shopping, can find anything here! Good tempature inside. Eat at one of the Japanese resaurants, they are good. :-)

Great shoooping. Large yet relaxed mall with a wide selection of shops and eateries and cafes. Excellent anchor shop chain with reasonably priced goods. Easy walking distance from intercontinental along overhead walkway.

awesome mall- good range of shops. This is another huge mall in the heart of the city, but the good thing is that it has shops from the reasonable price range to the high end brands so that a great thing. Their food court is awesome with lots of varieties and it houses a huge H&M which was the main reason that I wanted to visit.

Shopping paradise!. Literally everything you could think of under one roof! I've never so many fake designer gear being sold in what seem to be legitimate stores! There about 5 storeys and can take hours to see everything. Good experience

Amari shopping trip. We booked our stay with Amari Watergate hotel shopping package and received a 1000baht card to spend at Central, Central and the adjoining shopping centres have a wide selection of western and regional branded shops and has a very wide selection of dining outlets you are spoilt for choice. A shopaholic could stay all day here and not get bored and you certainly wouldn't starve, plus you can enjoy a movie afterwards .

A Mall that has everything you need. A mega mall with almost every brand available under its roof, central world plaza becomes a must go for shopping lovers.The mall is largely divided in to purpose build areas which makes shopping easy.It is also connected to the BTS with sky train.The only factor missing is local high street brands, which can be found across the road in Amarin Plaza.
One of the Best Shopping Mall in Bangkok.. If you are in Bangkok and get time to Visit this Mall then do not miss this...You will like it for sure...

The malls in Bangkok boggle the imagination. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I have visited Bangkok several, always staying near the MBK Center. We thought we had seen all of the major malls - MBK, Siam Center, Siam Paragon - when we visited the Erawan Shrine and came upon this. Wow! 7 stories of confusing layout that just goes on and on. My wife went back a second time without me - I was malled out by then - and she reported back with more stories of the sheer size of it.I thought we had some pretty big shopping malls in California, but nothing compares to this. It's very well done - modern, clean, not too upscale to intimidate the average person. I imagine there's something they don't have, but I don't know what it is!2 thumbs up if malls are your thing.
Something for everyone. . Great shopping Centre to have a relaxing wonder about. Time I was there they even had a ski rink inside. Also lots of eating places.

Great shopping and fantastic restaurants . If you visit Thailand then Central Plaza offers a fantastic array of restaurant choices with food types from around the world. My favourite are Fuji Japanese restaurant and Swansen ice cream parlour. Great clothes shops and just about every other shop including hair salons, dentists. Really highly recommend a visit

Favourite BKK Mall. Love this place. Been coming since it opened and will continue to do so. Great for kids as on one of the floors has a little play section. My daughter loved the electric animals which she could ride on. Great verity of shops and restaurants and a great cinema and supermarket. Love Central World.

Big but not great. Not a real bargain hunting place. The food court is good, but I have had enough of the "Bangkok Waft". Look the plaza is OK to pass sometime but I have been in Bangkok for 2 days and the overall feeling, experience and scent is by no means my scene. You won't escape the "Waft" no matter where you go.....enjoy.
shopping. this is the place that you must visit when you are in Bangkok, pratunam.they have all you want and foods.
very big mall. enjoy all king of food at buffet, very big mall very near to siam central & siam paragon. very close to metro.
big mall, has everything. Huge shopping mall, easy to get to and move around.Lot of Thai and international brands, good food court

Good Mall for Global Brands. Comprehensive shopping mall for all sorts of global brands. it is well organized with help around every other corner. You can also grab a good meal at an assortment of restaurants and fast food options. We loved Din Tai Fung!
Just amazing. Just an amazing place to see and so many good shops as well as the food as im rather fussy im so happy to say i found pizza
Good shopping mall. This shopping mall visit is must if you are in Bangkok. Must visit destination for shopping lovers. But i am not sure about genuine or duplicate products?

Very big mall. This mall is very big. It looks really nice. It is also pretty expensive. Even if you don't want to buy anything, as a tourist, you should check it out. You can also eat something at the foodcourt. It is not expensive to eat here.
Nice mall. Nice mall. It is about a 5-10 minute walk from Siam Square and the BTS SkyTrain.While here, I would highly recommend going to the RedSky Bar which is in the same complex.

Best Option for shopping. It is the best place for shopping in down town Bangkok, all kind of brand range, it's not just for shopping, it's a great place to looking, I always visit Central World plaza once when I visit Bangkok.
A maze of shops. A large array of shops, not the easiest to find your way around. Staff there to assist have limited English language skills.

An amazing mall!. Over the last few years this mall has just got bigger and better than ever! It's got designer shops alongside everyday stores and quirky shops. The food outlets are brilliant. There's every cuisine available at unbelievable prices. If you've got the stamina it's well worth a visit
shopping galore. Great shopping centre. Cant do Bangkok without stopping at Central World Plaza, Try out the ice skating.

A grand establishment with cooling air-conditioning. Central World Plaza was previously set ablaze by protesters but it has since been fully restored. This is a huge shopping mall with plenty of retail stores & restaurants. One would be spoilt for choices & for the unfocused, it would be hard to decide which restaurant to patronise. The outdoor compound in front of the mall is always full of marketing activities. With anchor tenants like Zen & Isetan taking separate ends of the building, this place is a must visit for travellers!

My first stop when i get to Bangkok. This one of Bangkok best shopping centres and its one place i would recommend to any shopper, great food and restaurant on the 7 floor and and some great on the lower level at great prices.

Amazing multi level shopping mall. This multi level shopping mall offers an impressive range of stores. Outside of the mall there are giant letters spelling out BANGKOK - a great photo opportunity not to be missed

Wow - great shopping in Pratuman in the heart of the city. hundreds of (luxury) Shops, expensive, lots of restaurants, Cinemas. With Siam Paragon and the nearby Emporium, the absolute luxury. You should have a Platinum Credit Card to shop there
Good mall. A good mall to visit. There are tons of shops. The prices are not that bad since the quality of clothing and shoes is good.
Excellent Shopping Mall. A place for everything, you can find good restaurants, thousand of shops, better spend a whole day here

Has all the big brands and names, and the prices are also equally expensive.. This shopping mall is the same as any other shopping mall in any country.
It has all the big brands and names, and the prices are also equally expensive.
shops galore. Ladies fear not there is enough shops in this one location to keep you happy all day, high brand names galore.

good shopping mall. its big , its clean , at least you can find the most brands you are looking for in there ,
there are fast food brands , there are good restaurants , chain restaurants
you will have a good memory from your shopping ...

Truly regret when I got nothing in Hong Kong. THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!
Well I didn't realize that until I found everything in Hong Kong was at least 20% more expensive than what I found at Central World Bangkok! I felt so sorry for myself...Should've acted when I got the chance...
Superdry is super cheap!

Huge, clean, better than any London, Paris, Milan malls. The size of the malls and the number are unbelievable. If you come to Bangkok you will find better place than the ones we have in Europe. Time for us to catch up. This one is impressive. Located in the business district you can find all the luxury products we have in Europe Chanel, Dior,... But also mark and spencer... Etc
Everything. Everything you could want. There are so many malls, this one is great proximity to many things. Good food court.

World in Central World. This is the one shopping mall you have to go to. It's immense. It have 100 or so restaurants, didn't try them all but what I saw and tasted had good quality. Of course it's all about luxury, all major brands are here.

First Class Cinema. We saw "The 5th Wave" at First Class Cinema. We enjoyed our visit at the cinema very much. The lounge with an excellent little buffet, drinks and coffee. The waiters who obviously enjoyed serving us were patient, kind, discrete and effective. The luxurious interior in the theatre had comfortable seats. We enjoyed every minute of beeing there. We will be back some other time.Highly recommended.Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.
great shopping place. Very much brands, but also very big, you need some time to see all. Very good choice of restaurants in the upper floors

A/c non Thai experience. We escaped the heat to find a meal here and we're disappointed. Yes it's massive, but overpriced and one of those 'you could be anywhere in the world' malls. We visited MBK mall the day before which was great. Much more authentic.

Lots to See. Great mall to get some shopping done! Some things are pretty cheap but other things you should keep looking. They have a good variety of stores - from Cheap to Expensive. Could use a whole day shopping here.
Big . This place is so huge.. we havent finished exploring it yet. In front of the mal theres a lot of street food. Must come here again.
Great shopping. Lots of levels of shops with everything from clothing to electrical to food.Has department stores in complex.
Good place for your shopping day. Good for either shopping, dining, watching movies and catch one of the festivals taking place there almost every week

Luxury Modern Shopping Mall. Central World Plaza is a typical modern shopping mall. It is very spacious and has almost everything you need. For the food, they have variety of Western and Asian (mostly Japanese) food. It is difficult to find Thai restaurant inside here though.

One of the biggest Malls in the world. There is no chance to explore this mall in 1 day. It's really a huge one with 8 floors. This is the place for sport's goods. All the major brand names like: Nike, Adidas, New Balance, etc. are located on the 3rd floor. Don't miss the French coffee shop of Paul when needing a break. The Starbucks at the ground floor is much nicer than the one of the 1st floor.

It's literally a very BIG Mall! . You can find anything here. Careful not to get lost :) They have a big cinema, big Toys R Us, Uniqlo and H&M store. Small ice rink though. It's in the same area as the Siam's Mall.

Very well maintained. This mall is good and very nicely maintained more over it is easily accesable by sky train ,but it houses all branded clothing and products ,u cant get cheap products here,if u want cheaper go for MBK mall.

Shopper's World. For old or new generation , this huge shopping world has everything to offer. Luxury items, affordable clothes, food stuff, super malls, boutique, fashion, everything is there. The shops are glittering, loud music, noise, all make central world lively. Both inside and outside spaces are used usefully to organize different shows, functions and festivities. It is entertaining to shop in such a lively place.
CENTRAL of BKK. Central has no bargain stalls, has a lot of restaurants, branded outlets, grocery and CINEMA. You should dedicate 2 days for CENTRAL and SIAM.

high end but nice mall. This Mall is a bit high end but a lot of shops, good for those who like to shopping specially branded one, lot of good restaurant on the 6th and 7th floor. And a supermarket on the 7th flr.You can find good food in this Mall. Zen is also nice, they have midnight sale when we visited
Nice Shopping mall. Well setup, a lot of things to look at + places to eat and drink.Great for all!!easy access as well.

How big can these shopping centres get?. It's enormous, a good tip is to go via the Sky Train and walk from the nearest station on the level below the track so that you are still one floor above the road and therefore further away from the Cities pollution. Just go and see it, forget shopping, just look and be amazed.
Very huge. Very huge place. Enjoyed going here. Had everything i need. Highly recommended. Shopped here alot till i dropped. Must go

Probably the best in Bangkok. Even if you're not a shopper, this place is worth visiting. The range of outlets extends well beyond the usual narrow range of brands, and the food court is highly recommended. Plus there are cinemas and other activities.If you ARE a shopper, you will find a lot to interest you.

Huge shopping mall. This is a huge shopping mall with many shops. Lots of variety here, from simple stuff to high-end goods. The place is so big that if you are not careful you might actually get lost. Definitely a place to indulge your shopping urge.

High end shopping center with a fantastic food and supermarket center.. Get our of the heat and into Central World Plaza. Huge place with many shops selling expensive stuff. Particular interest are the food hawkers in the front serving dinner. Next to it, across the Klong is the Platinum clothng center.

Good for a Rainy or Very Hot Day. We ducked inside the nicely air-conditioned mall one day when we needed a break from the heat. It was quite entertaining to take the escalator all the way to top, and peruse all the different restaurants and food shops and retail stores there. I'm not sure if it's really a taste of local culture, but still very interesting! Plus, there's a movie theater at the top of the mall, and the tickets are pretty cheap! Of course it's the first thing you think of doing when traveling to a new place, but the mall is quite a spectacle and pretty neat to explore if you have some extra time.
Huge. Everything you need, all rolled in to one mall. More straight forward to navigate compared to some of the other Bangkok malls which can save you a lot of time!
Amazing. Wear appropriate shoes to cover the whole mall amazing layout with shops from around the globe all under one roof.

Beware. I went to Nail Wonderland and although the price is reasonable the manager (maybe shop owner) was not friendly and I got cut during the manicure . I think you can give this place a miss.Next I wondered into Banglok Bazar, and I got ripped off (I found out after I did more research) the fabric that I bought was charged at 800 bht (after bargaining ) per meter. The fabric was actually meant for lining.After two bad experiences I think Travellers should stay in the main shopping mall - should have better control over quality and from dodgy store owners!
Shopping Galore. Very wide and diverse selection of shops.Good bookshop, food court and everything else including top brands.

Shopping Paradise Bangkok. There are increasing numbers of high end shopping malls, frankly out of reach for many. This is a great way to spend a day shopping and get all you want in one place - entertainment with cinema, great choice for food and drinks, and normally an event on the plaza at the w/end - look out for these. I think this is the best place for kids/teens to have a chance to buy something new too, clothes not easy to find in BKK believe it or not!

The addition of "Groove" makes this a great place.. The recent addition of the Groove incorporating restaurants and wine bars makes this a classic one stop shop precinct. The supermarket has an incredible range of Thai foot and products. I stocked up on the many sauces available as well as soaps and snacks. Wine Connections is in the Groove complex and has a wide range of wines as well as the Tapas Bar. I think they have a "free pour" once a month where for 500 baht it's free drinks and tapas from 7-9pm. A great evening.

An excellent mall in a convenient location. A huge mall with a variety of food and shops. It is more of an upscale mall - don't expect dirt cheap clothing like the nearby Platinum Mall. However, it is great for relaxation - there are huge spaces and a variety of premium food.

Nice to buy. If in Thailand the technology is cheaper than your country, you have to go to buy in here. Of course it is not a place to expend all day because Bangkok offers beautiful places to visit, but if the idea is buy cheap things and have some lunch it is a huge place to look at.
Nice shops.. This center is pretty big, full of nice shops and places to eat. You can have a quick meal and shop all day long!

HUGE shopping centre. If nothing else, this centre is worth a visit even if it is just to say you have been there.
Prices are not as cheap as some other centres but the quality of items is better than some other shopping outlets. WORTH A VISIT!!
luxurious and convenient. there are a lot of shops inside, which might be the hot spot for shopping maniac. Also, there are lots of restaurants in it, people can have a good meal after shopping

More upmarket Mall not for budget shopping- as compared to MBK, Platinum Fashion Mall. ..... This mall is more upmarket as compared to MBK, Platinum Fashion Mall. You know it once you stepped inside.As expected, this mall is more classy, much nicer & carry higher end & different range of products. Naturally prices reflects the higher class here.Probably one will be disappointed if looking for cheap stuff here. However you may be lucky to stumble upon some items at 'reasonable' offer prices.Definitely this mall is a good mall for relaxation , either just sitting on the benches for a break or have a snack/ coffee or lunch/dinner.Would not come here if time is limited & intention is budget shopping. Otherwise fine to pop by for a visit

Central World Plaza. This large indoor mall offers most name brands and hundreds of brands of shoes, clothing and accessories, There are numerous spots to stop and have an ice cream, a coffee, or a meal and even though it has lots of things to buy it always seems most people are only there to be relieved from the heat in a nice AC mall atmosphere and are not actually buying much at all.
Convenient . Non stop shopping and eating. If you enjoy this style trip, just go. Also a lot of malls and booths nearby. So can just stay this area all day.

Nice Shopping. Huge and grand. Many local and branded retail shops. If you are looking for prices like what you pay in Platinum Mall, then don't bother coming here. Although prices are high, expect better quality too.

Everything you need and more. The CentralWorld mall was right next to our hotel so we spent most of our evenings in Bangkok here for dinner. There are two floors for restaurants alone! This place has absolutely everything you could want from traditional Thai food, to Pizza chain restaurants, Japaneze, Italian and of course plenty of Ice cream stools which are great. The food is also very cheap but excellent quality.In terms of shops, there is everything you could imagine, but all at Western prices, so no bargians to be found. Definitely worth a visit, expect to get lost, it really is very big!

Good mall. An easy-to-reach large mall in Bangkok. Besides the usual stores, the mall contains a large movie theater and a ice skating rink. One can find quite a lot of restaurants and desert places as well.

The ex World trade center, Zen World. Now Centara World ex Central World offers a lot, a lot without being that well located often in the recent past poised with deadly demonstrations, accidents. NOT to miss Zen department store.Food courts, etc...etc...Very pleasant entertaining Mall.

Probably the best mall in the central district. The area has a lot of options but CentralWorld is probably the best all-round with good food, great bargains and lots of space. The Groove has some really good restaurants if you're here for a special occasion.

great western mall. you can find here all the western shops from brand name clothing to electronic.
there is also amazing cinema complex in the mall and great food court and restaurants,
nice place to take break from the heat grab a snack and buy nice things.

Shopping Paradise. Central World, it's name implies is truly Central in its location, right smack in the heart of this wonderful City, . . Central World has numerous shops, restaurants, supermarket, high end cinemas, exhibition and convention centre, and even a beautiful Hotel, the Centara, beside it. . making it absolutely convenient for Travellers to be able to have and find everything 'under one roof'. . . it is also beside the Chit Lom BTS, and close to other Hotels and more shopping malls close by. One of the restaurant with delicious cakes is called Coffee Bean'. . a must try for all visitors' to Central World. Wishing one and all' Happy Shopping'!!!
Central world plaza mall. A mall like many others but this is one of the best, it s quite luxurious and is big, many quality shops inside. Also, some restaurants and coffee shops.

Fabulous mall.. Very easy location and on the BTS route. This ultra moder mall has absolutely everything you could want, from the famous designer shops to the bigger chain shops. It has the Zen department store, a great cinema, and a huge array of restaurants and sweet dessert shops, including Mochi Mochi and Yenlyyours which saw me every day !!!
A great place. Enjoyed visiting this mall very much. A lot of shops. Takes a while to get around so do on a rainy day and enjoy it.
Another huge mall . Another huge mall in a district with alot of shopping. If you want to do higher end shopping then go here. Not for souvenirs

Favourite mall in Bangkok. This is my absolute favourite mall in Bangkok, because of the great choices of food. There is an entrance to the mall from the walkway when exiting the Chit Lom BTS skytrain. The mall was completely refurbished in early 2015. The Zen store on the left hand side is the pick, and I just shopped at the fourth floor for men's clothes, checkin luggage and shoes, and on the sixth floor for toys. The bargain bins are around the escalator areas on each floor. The Isetan mall is far more expensive, but has the high end brands.

Excellent Classy Mall. Nice upmarket mall featuring all the Brand name stores as well Unique Designer Labels and Independent Designer outlets. There is a nice atmosphere in the mall, and customers all seem to be well dressed or at least take pride in their dress sense. Spacious and well laid out, easy to get around and find stores. So all in all a nice experience.

Shopping and food celebration . Huge mole that has everything. From shops to food court to restaurants to kids entertaining places and to outside street food bazar. All in a beautiful surroundings, air condition (important in Bangkok) and super friendly sellers and staff. Allow at least one day and you wount see it all

An excellent place for shophalics with loads of cash or credit. It is a very huge shopping mall with lots of dining and shopping options. The restaurants on the top floor would make you forget that you are in Bangkok.
