If you are afraid of eating street food and thinking wholly and totally erroneously that those are not safe to eat, then this is the place to go to eat, but you have to PAY more.Obviously, the shopping would also be expensive. Brand name products are all to be found here.

One of the best grocery stores in Bangkok. I don't come here to see branded clothing, I'm here to visit it's Central World Food Hall that caters to people who enjoys cooking. Too bad I'm not living in Bangkok or else I would have gone bankrupt. The selection of food ingredients in here is such an eye opener.If you don't care what you cook, go to Big C. If you have taste and enjoys cooking excellent food with excellent ingredients, this is definitely one of the few choices to go to.
Huge. This is now apparently the 6th largest shopping mall in the world.It has an Ice Rink, high end cinema complex and Pub/wine bar area.And 7 stories of shops and restaurants.
Food court. It has a nice food court with many different dishes from thai and international cuisine. When i got there it was the vietnamise cuisine festival week.
Shopping out of the Heat.. Like most of the newer malls, plenty of choice for shopping or eating whilst staying out of the heat.

Huge!. Just a huge shopping centre but the biggest I have ever seen. Makes everything in England seem small.We just walked around the different city themed floors and got some dinner in a Thai restaurant which was so much cheaper than at the hotel. The top few floors are all food outlets so plenty of choice.

Branded shopping mall. This is a very huge shopping mall.It has all branded items.It has food court also.Though its not cheap yet one can find good stuff There are many coffee shops and its enjoyeable 2 shop here away from.the heat outside.I had great time with shopping stuff of my favourite brandsZen and Isetan.
Sports shoe shopping. Excellent service and assistance from the staff who even used their own discount card to save me some money when the shoes I needed turned out to be not on sale.

7 level of shopping mall. It is huge shopping mall, everything you need and wants are there. Every franchise food are there, shops has nice window display and neat. The way the shopping mall arrange the shops are great according to the types. But difficult to find toilets, like going around and around then you finally find it. Overall, it is big and lots of food to choose from. Love it.
New one. This is new shopping with modern style, very clean and big. because it is new so still quiet than others.

A good high end shopping center. This is not the place to buy souvenir, as most store are designer and boutique mostly expensive items and it is a good place to cool down on a very hot day and window shop.
Good Place to shop. Amazing place for good shopping as you have all International Famous Labels. Beautiful place to visit
Good place for shopping. Good place for shopping with three different levels of shops - luxury brands in the front, and street-type vendors at the back end. good food court
Lots of shopping and varieties of restaurants. There is an Isetan as well as small boutiques in Central World Plaza. Nice shopping with various type of cuisine food for choices
Average. Average shopping mall. There are so many in Bangkok. Sam Centre is much better. But then it's a good for an hour or two

Great massive shopping centre. This place is massive. There are lots of high end shops and there was also a a special even in the middle when i was there.
It is about 15 mins walk from the station and if you walk further north there is the IT centre.
So this place is great to walk through while shopping
Shopping Heaven. This is a must go to place in BK once you have seen the real sites in BK. Shop till you drop and there are always bargins to be had as there are normally sales and discounts on.

Great place for shopping and dining. Its location is between BTS Siam and Chitlom, so walking cannot be avoided. Many restaurants and dessert cafes are there for you to choose upon your preference.
Isetan supermarket renovation makes me feel like I was walking in Japan, the atmosphere, the setting, shops.
It also has good selection of vegetables there as well.
Top brands mall. This is an amazing mall with all the big brand shops and a very nice decor, lots of good cafes and restaurants too, but not much cheap choices for clothes.
Typical Western Shopping Mall. This shopping mall is the same as any other shopping mall in Western culture, the prices and brands are all the same.

Huge mall with everything you need. Shopping malls in Bangkok are gradually becoming a carbon copy of one another. Most of the creature comforts can be found in this sprawling mall. Near to the BTS station as well so its very accessible.
Big shopping centre. A big shopping complex with everything you want under one roof. Lots of shops, restaurants and even a cinema. You can spend a few hours here. BTS station is Chit Lom
Wirld class shopping. Very good selection of the stores and the food. You will enjoy all kind of coffee shops to the designer brands. Also service and gift selection. Very secure and clean toilets.
Get everything you need in one stop!. Amazing shopping mall with a lot of great resturants and many brands available here. I spent a wonderful shopping spree in this mall with my husband.

If you like shopping!. If shopping is THE thing for you, than this place is just right for you (as well as Paragon or Zen).
Shops and shops of the same brands you do find back home, only difference is that it is a great escape from the outside heat and noises!

Huge and popular shopping mall. This well known shopping mall is huge with 2 main anchor tenants namely Zen and Isetan. Both these 2 main anchor tenants occupied 6 to 7 stories. All international brands as well as local brands are available. Huge area occupying 2 to 3 floors of restaurants, deserts and cafes available. Upscale malls with lots of events from time to time staged inside the mall. Large opened-air outdoor area promotes all kinds of events from time to time. Partying atmosphere at this area is usually during festivals with alcoholic brands staging concerts with live bands next to each other!. There is a popular shrine with the locals located at the end corner of the outdoor area.

Great place if you like expensive shopping. We had a look in this shopping mall. It has all the usual names and brands and is not cheap. Much more fun is Platinum mall down the road, especially if you want the real Bangkok shopping experience at half the price.

My favorite mall in the world. Thailand has surprisingly awesome malls. This is the best mall I've ever been to. Not that I've been to so many malls, but I've been to ones in Miami, Dubai, and throughout India.I don't like shopping and I love going here, that's how good it is.On the top floor is the best super market I've ever seen. It has such a great variety of products, fresh produce, freshly prepared food, and a good food court.The mall also has an awesome movie theater on the same floor, as well as many really, really good restaurants.

Thailand 2016. This Mall is on the extra large size. Wow. Floors of wonderful shopping. Had a tough time locating men's shoes though. Didn't really find the prices inexpensive compared to some other places we visited but did get a great Thailand soccer jersey for $18. Outside there was a great festival with street food and boutique stalls. Music and people watching.
Good for department stores addicts. A super-sized mix of "Galeries Lafayette and Le Printemps", that's all and that's enough. Good to chill out and assume your purchasing fever.

Beautiful with good scent to allure. Huge shopping mall with full of expensive and nothing to buy in this mall. However, I do love walking around and I always smell a very great scent in this department store. Furthermore, if you walk outside on the East side of them, you will meet the Trimirt Shrine - Love Shrine of local. You can buy flower and candles to sacrifice to her then pray from your heart anything about your desire in maternity, love, devotion and heart.

Huge, hard to find what you want due to bad information. The place is big. I was trying to locate a specific shop, but the interactive information boards were out of order and each floor only had the names of the shops on that floor by the stairs. Finally the information desk gave a vague advice, floor xx, that side (with a wave of hand). Which we decided not to follow and exited the building.

Large Shopping Complex. Partial local and partial international luxury brand.Isetan departmental store, cinemas, food court, around 100 F&B outlet. 10 minutes walk from the nearest BTS.Good shopping paradise and great for food lovers. level 6 & 7 with international and local cuisine. Too many choice to choose from.A must visit if you are not budget travellers

AIRY LUXURY. Visiting Central World Plaza is nice, as unlike the other shopping malls, it is spacious and relatively devoid of the usual crowds. All big brands - Thai and Foreign - are present. On the contary, restaurants at " the groove" are to be avoided,as quality is questionable and service poor.

Beautiful expensive shopping.. A very large and modern mall. High end shopping. One floor dedicated to children. A train and various kids activities offered.Top floor includes high end grocery store with international items.
Best shopping in Bangkok. Probably the best shopping center. Its really big and has most of the shops you can think of. Zen mall is next door. Easy to navigate around
Not the best for shopping. There are better options for shopping with more viriety, but if you have spare time, why not have a look.

As shopping malls should be. Surrounded by other great malls in Bangkok, the Central world,stands out with two big and well stocked department stores, Zen and Isetan and a collection of good diverse stores from sports to uni qlo to Dutti ,toms etc.The Groove is a good collection of full service restaraunts in the mall that are reasonably priced and offer good diverse food.
Huge mall. You will find everything you want here. So many floors! People are friendly and prices are competitive.
Good Mall. Nice modern Mall, Features better Quality Products as the Malls in Pratunam.Good Food Hall with interesting Food Court.Several Restaurants.

Good quality, Best shop. This shopping mall has various product. It is good for fashion, electronic, furniture, phone stores, camera stores and etc. A lot can get it. There's only a LEGO store but I can't find as I wish.

Not my favorite but still good. Not my favorite one in the big mango however still good for shopping as well to have a meal.
Too big and too large for me, however always nice exhibition and event to admire...

Fabulous cosmopolitan shopping center. A beautiful modern shopping center. Great for everything you need. Stylish, jet setting, modern and brands galore. Most big cities have got a shopping mall like this. Its worth a visit, big bright and really great to walk around. Its priced about the same as most of the malls around the world. The food area is really good. we enjoyed traditional Thai food after looking around to find somewhere. Enjoyed it.

Luxurious. At siam Skytrain station this shopping mall has everything to please the fashion lovers. From hugo boss,armani, versace and other big fashion brands to Lamborghini, rolls royce and other high end vechicule dealerships you will find it all. They have an amazing wide variety of shops and automobile showrooms. A gigantic toystore and much more. The food court has allot of different tastes from european to asian you will find it all. The movie theater on the top level offers the latest movies in very well maintained theaters. There is a bowling ( we did not do it so no idea how it is ) and a big conference hall where during our stay there was an exposition about Japan. Masam tusseau and sea life center are other amazing things you could find there. This has everything to please young and old on a rainy day.
Huge variety . Is a huge mall with a huge variety for shopping lovers! It also have a lot of restaurants of different type of food, beverages stations, ice cream and coffee stations!

Meed to go for shopping. Really a big shoppingmall. Not with the cheapest stuff, but have a look. Maybe you are impressed. Easy to find. Take the MRT skytrain. Getoff at Chitlom. Do not forget to cross the street to have alook at Erawan shrine
great shopping. Very good place for shopping as all the brands is there You can reach it by sky trainLocated very near to all the big malls in Bangkok as SIAM mall

Shop your heart out! Amazing restaurants!. Zen on the 6th floor is a place you want to eat if you can spend some. The mall otherwise is a great place to cool off and shop the day away. There are numerous other malls within walking distance so this should definitely be the starting point if you plan a day devoted to shopping.

The great shopping mall. This mall located in the centre of Bangkok.Get varitry of clothes such as expensive brand as well as non brand clothes.Great pleaure to visit .Worth well to visit and shopping this Mall.
Deluxe shopping. Very luxurious shoppingmall. 7 storeys of high-end brands. Nice atmos, but a bit too much luxury for me. But nice restaurants and cafés such as Paul.
a stunning mall. A very beautiful mall, very big with a wide array of stores, we didnt complete the mall in one day. Food is good with many options

Clean Shopping Mall. There isn't much to say other than this is a nice clean shopping mall. It has some unusual shops along with the bigger chain ones. If you are close by and want to do some shopping then its good I wouldn't recommend a special trip.
Great way to spent the day indoor.. Great shopping experience. Good customer service. Shutlle bus are available. Near to BTS. Good location.

huge crazy central world plaza. central world sf cinema it's a huge and well equipped cinema. a great place t chill, and they keep up with the actually day of release i enjoyed deadpool and gods of egypt in d releasing days. And after enjoying d movies u have a huge selection of food! central world is definitely one of d biggest mall in bangkok worth checking it.if there's something u cannot find there, i guess u can't find it anywhere lol. but seriously u need a day t walk all that crazy mall but i'm sure it will b fun.
A huge shopping plaza. Lots of space, and lots of stores. Generally of the upper bracket variety. Home to a great big bookstore, a decent sports store, and Jim Thompson locations as well.

High end shopping experience. The exterior of the shopping mall was quite well maintained, they have different decorations depending on the occasion. Not too much to expect from the shopping, it is just like any other shopping mall around the world. I rate it to be "very good" cause it is quite well maintained.
Just another mall. Nice location but really nothing to go out of your way for. on the good side they have some good restaurants here
Nice mall. This mall houses a big number of branded shops. Price is high for branded items. It's good for shopping who love branded items.
Good shopping mall. Good for buy and suitable priceThe biggest place in Thailand . The price are more suitable for all social economic status of people.
Huge Mega Mall. Has pretty much everything you need, including and Ice Rink and kids play area tucked away.Great spot to escape the heat even if you are not shopping. Loads of places to eat.

Great mall in the city center. Bangkok has a lot of malls but this is by far a favorite of mine, not only for the proximity to my hotel, but it has all the restaurants, cafes and different types of stores one would need when visiting the city. It's connected to an above ground walkway that will take you to other shopping malls so you avoid the direct sun, crowds of people and pollution on the street below. The mall has a newer edition called "The Groove," with additional restaurant options. There's also a large plaza outside the mall, where at the time of writing this review they had an outdoor market.

For Serious Shoppers. If you really want to spend your money on beautiful, branded clothes etc this is the place to go. This shopping centre has many beautiful stores in which to buy whatever you want.

Biggg mall.. You can basicly find almost everything in this mall and in any other mall of this size.
Quite nice interior also,and you can walk around here for hours and hours.

good shopping. Easy to find from the sky train and by taxi,but better to take a taxi,as the roads around it can be very busy.This mall is quite new for Bangkok with a lot of high end shops.Not many bargains to be had,but great for brand names.Easy to find your way about and quite often they have special offers on the ground floor or shows of some sort

Great indoor shopping if raining or not!. A huge shopping center, catering to every ones needs. All the brand name shops, restaurants, coffee shops and relaxing areas to take a break. There are alot of floors to visit and I think you can get better bargain prices here than in Paragon. Its worth the visit and I always enjoy shopping here. A shopping needs money so take some with you. There are many small shops also out side, street level that have many bargains and BIG C shopping center is opposite that contains more shops and relaxing areas. So good hunting and many people will say its expensive and I agree, but look in the right places and you will find bargains, I always do, not as cheap as Chatuchak market, but after all you are gong to a 5 star mall, there is a difference for your wallet. Enjoy!

Nice fancy mall for big brand shopping. Its a nice fancy mall which has some medium to great decorations around chrismas time. Most of the stores are high end. We did not find any interesting (budget :)) shopping options here. But still enjoyed the amazing size and layout and window shopping.
Close to my hotel. Close to my hotelI like it because of the locationJust if my hotel ( intercontinental)Large huge oneFull of restaurants and cafesMany stores and services
Big shopping centre. Big shopping centre, not much really to offer, no bargains to be had. Manly brand names. Close to sky train

Central World is Bangkok's most luxurious department store. Central World has almost everything that costs good money but very little that is cheap. Everything is there for shopping, eating and just strolling around in an air-conditioned environment. Shops have a good mix of needs and wants and just looks. I think overall one of the best malls in the heart of Bangkok.

Just another mall!. It's like any other mall with all international brands ... U will anyway get them all in ur own city too so why travel to BKK for them!I wouldn't recommend this mall for shopping same brands that u will get on ur own country.
Huge. Make a lust before you go before you go way over designated luggage allowance although so cheep tis worth it.
This place huge.... Be prepared to walk & don't be surprised if you can't find your way back because it's not hard to get lost

Bangkok's most luxurious department store. Central World has almost everything that costs good money but very little that is cheap. It's definitely better than Siam Paragon if you are looking for the wow factor. Christmas is spectacular
The one stop place if you don't worry too much about money
I go there every day, I work in the adjacent office building :)
Nice mall. I guess it is just like a typical mall in Singapore. Nice, cool and huge. I think the price of the merchandise is almost similar in value like in Singapore.

Maybe the favorite mall of locals and foreigners alike. Shopping mall in prime location.What stands out is the smart mix and arrangement of themes of the shops on the various levels.Always some events going on. As an event location, there is not better in Bangkok.Shops have a good mix of needs and wants and just looks... Hi-So enough but also good for daily needs. That mix is successful.Food on Level 7 (&6) is constantly changing, adopting, only the strong and good one survive. Great branches are to be found there (Din Tai Feng etc).Tops Supermaket on Lvl 7 is run smoothly and rivals many high end Gourmet Markets. And they do deliver like every Tops (free from 1000 THB).Overall one of the best malls in the heart of Bangkok - not perfect but great.
nice!. forever 21 and H&M available! Huge outlets too! this was the best news ever for me!! many other shops too :)

Huge mall with lots of options . This is a huge mall located right in the city center and it near to Paragon, Gaysorn, Platinum and Pratunam.The mall is very spacious and has lots of shops and dining outlets. Due to its sheer size, the people are scattered all over, so the mall is not crowded and it is very relaxing to shop here.
There is very little you wont find here. Very smart and upmarket. Good food stores especially the Japanese food store. Japanese produce at Bangkok prices.Nice food court / restaurant selection too.
Central World Plaza, BKK. Yet another huge shopping plaza, housing shops and outlets selling everything possible. Well appointed and accessible, but not themed as the newer Terminal 21 in Sukhumvit.

Shop and Eat. For us this is the best place to shop in BKK. It has pretty much every retailer and even though many others do too, it just seems to be well laid out. Above all it has so many dinning options in so many places. Every kind of food you can imagine multiplied many times. The Wine Connection is one of our favourite places. The Paragon Supermarket on the top level is probably the best in BKK for Westerners. If you're looking for familiar products or Thai specialties you'll find them here.There is also a huge cinema complex on the top level. All English movies are screened with original sound track and Thai subtitles. If you go on Wednesday its movie day half price.
Just one more shopping centre. Huge shopping center but nothing special. You find all international brands and a lot Restaurants round about there.

Good Shopping/Eating. If I remember, there are 7 floors to Central World Plaza. I personally went here for the food as there are MANY choices offering any type of cuisine you want. While there, go check out the ice skating rink in the mall. Getting there - the best way is to take the BTS (Skytrain) to the Chit Lom stop. From there it's a five minute walk on the elevated walkway.

Its Big, bustling, trendy Mall. For shopping enthusiast , a must place, with lots of shop to love and indulge.though we were there for few banking work at top floor, but journey was sparkling, its well connected to MTS, and fun place for kids and youngsters.
Crazy Big!. Very Big place with everything you Can imagine. We had dinner ón 7th floor. Many places to choose from.
Excellent mall. One of best malls in BKK, must visit for shopping and food freak. one can enjoy ambience to its best.
Huge. Another mall not to be miss, very big mall with lotsa of shops. Areas A, B & C and may get lost. Many eateries there too.....
very busy and all the name labels. great food hall heaps of choices for food and if you want label names they have it here easy to get to with the skytrain

It's big, it's a shopping centre. That's it.. Great if you want to spend your whole day shopping brands that would be familiar to most.There isn't anything particularly interesting about the plaza, but if you're there to shop and spend up big, you're going to the right place.

shopping. We had been shopped at this shopping center several times all these years. It is located at a busy street with many shopping malls. Nothing special if compare with Terminal 21 and Platinum mall.

To Explore the Entire Space, Reserve Some Time. What an interesting array of international retailers. We got in some serious walking in our two hour visit. Looks like some wonderful restaurant choices . . . perhaps for our next trip.
Big. It's a big mall, you can find all sort of brands. You have diversity regarding the food. Can be confusing sometimes

It's a shopping centre. That's it.. It's a big, modern, spotlessly clean, soulless shopping centre.
Nothing more to me. The leader of the opposition loves is because it's a big shopping centre with big name retailers.
nice shopping center. a lot of good shops and great restaurants. It is worth to go to this place (in addition to the cheap and hectic MBK).

large store. Place is huge and clean. Some salesclerks do not speak English well so you have to do some sign language and avoid being lost in translation. Discover card is not consistently accepted so bring also VISA or mastercard. Unless you really like an item do not buy otherwise you would regret knowing that some items are cheaper at Amazon.com. It is walking distance from Grand Center Pointe hotel Ratchamandri.

Something for everyone at Central World Plaza. Although anchored by major department stores Zen and Isetan, Central World Plaza has numerous affordable boutiques and small shops offering a wide and interesting range of merchandise, as well as an impressive array of casual and fine dining venues for every taste bud.

Decent Japanese dept stores, good restaurants. This is now an older (and several times revived) shopping mall but it seems to be on newer legs. Decent Japanese department stores for general stuff (e.g., stationery) and some good restaurants if you are tired and want to eat, but does get crowded on the weekends with cell phone texters who don't watch where they are going.

An OK shopping mall. I'm not into shopping, so this place is never going to be more than ok for me, but my wife loved it. What I can say is that it is absolutely vast. There are two huge atriums, each surrounded by shops. There is an entire level devoted to food. and plenty of cafes and restaurants on the other levels as well. This is very much mid range - international brands and large stores aplenty.
A City Under Roof. There is nothing you can't find at Central World. Movies, many restaurants, high end shopping you name it and you will find it there. Be prepared to spend the entire day.

TK Park. There doesnt seem to be a separate listing for TK Park but our family loved it. On the 8th floor. 20 baht per person. Library plus multimedia. Play area for small kids. Great place to relax and pretty inexpensive. English book selection wasnt extensive, but enough for our kids to enjoy themselves.

Cool concept, nice mall!. The theme of this mall makes it fun to visit. Good restaurants and shops and *great* bathrooms. The movie theater is also nice. Right on the subway line too which is helpful.

The first modern mega department store in Bkk. Everything is there for shopping, eating and just strolling around in an airconditioned environment. While it was the first (under the name world trade center) it is now one of many large department store in Bangkok offering pretty much the same, so its more a matter of where you are located than which particular one you should go to.
Wonderful shopping. this is really a wonderful location for shoppers and an absolute must see on your trip to Bangkok. Do not miss it

Top class shopping mall in chitlom. I found this to be a fantastic experience for shopping and eating.I was excited to see a new cafe Paul.They have an upmarket cafe cum Boulangerie with the most delectable French items on the menu.The staff are very professional and friend.y especially the Manager who hails from Maurtius.we returned 3 times and highly recommend a visit to this establishment
Shops shops and more shops. Shoppers paradise, with lots nice designer shops and gift shops. Lots of nice places to eat and coffee shops. Even found a few great bargains in the sale!

It's a Shopping Mall. It's a huge everything under one roof shopping mall. Mid-to high end brands, nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. Plenty of dining options from the fast food to the quality dinner style. Movie theater on the top floor with a tea and honey toast cafe across from it, the perfect pre-movie snack. You can easily waste a full day here completing all your shopping chores with a couple Starbucks around to keep you energized.

Plenty of shops and a great range of food outlets. This is one of my favourite shopping malls in Bangkok. I've seen it evolve from a fairly basic mall, to one that houses an incredible range of cheap and mid-range restaurants, and a slew of cafes and dessert venues. You will never go hungry at Central World; in fact, I think that's why most people come here - for the food, not the shopping.There is also a cinema and and a gourmet supermarket on the 6th floor, so you can combine your shopping expedition with a movie and a meal. Movies are cheap here too; much cheaper than at home.There are Zen and Isetan dept stores, with a whole lane of Japanese restaurants near the Isetan store. There's a big Asia Books store, a B2S book and stationery store, and a selection of designer boutiques and other chain stores such as Dorothy Perkins, Wallis and Ecco. You can spend all day here, and finish off with a cocktail at Zense or next door at the Red Sky Bar at the Centara Grand Hotel.

A delight for Shoppers. If you love shopping this is where you should head. Its a maze of stores all beautifully done up and escalators to reach higher stores. Items on sale are of the upper end and nothing is cheap.
Plenty of shops. There were many shops but there is nothing unique about this mall. I would recommend going to market instead.

Best Mall In Thailand!!. Central World is a very great place to shop because there are many shops and also many chairs on the way so seniors or people who are too tired can sit and rest for a while, then continue walking. There are so many shops and some are hard to find like Din Tai Fung. Even though Central was once partly destroyed by terrorist, but it is all renovated so people still loves to go there. Central World is suitable for almost everyone. It is suitable for kids because the Toys R Us there is very large and near the Toys R Us, there is also a playground for children, it is large and free too! This place is suitable for everyone! Pregnant women can come here to buy new stuff for her children, seniors can come here and bring their grandsons and sit and wait for them to finish playing, couples can stay at cupcake shops to eat and buy things at stores for couples. Artists can buy stationery at many stationery stores. There are many things to do at Central World.

My favourite venue for shopping and dining. No matter how many times I have visited Bangkok, I would definitely go to this Mall for couple of hours. The Gourmet market is outstanding and it should be the best in Bangkok.
So many shops. Love it - but overwhelming - you could shop here all day and still not have seen everything. Not much is missing from high fashion to cheap and cheerful

Amazing shopping. If you love shopping i highly recommend central world in bangkok. The shopping centre has something for everyone the food is amazing. In other words you can easily spend half a day here without getting bored. Make sure you bring some money when you come here though. Some stuff is cheap but then again there is expensive stuff as well for the high rollers.
Nice shopping.. This mall have everything, nice shops, many restaurangs, exclusiva boutice, small shops and big shops. Eaven souveniers.

Central World, Rajdamri Road. It's just across the road from the Grand Hyatt Erawan. It's a very nice shopping mall, very Western with lots of food outlets as well. But why go to Bangkok and spend you time in a Western style shopping mall? It's a waste of your holiday time. If you want to go shopping, go to MBK. Not as 'refined' but it sells everything you want, has far more atmosphere and has very authentic Thai food outlets - where the Thais eat so it tells you it is 'not bad' food! MBK is good to get your phone repaired, get accessories and also CDs, watches, clothes and gifts.
Plenty of shops. There are many shops here which you would at least spend half a day of shopping. There are also many restaurants for your selection and price are not expensive.
Part of modern Bangkok. Nice go through one and other shopping center in the modern area of Bangkok. It´s a shopping as others in big cities, but nice to stroll for couple of hours.

Very nice but expensive.. This is a must go to if your in Bangkok. Shopping, Movie theater and restaurants. My company has an office in Bangkok and it is located at Central World. After a quick visit to the office I headed to shop, quickly learned no bargains here except the Movie theatre, yes! see a movie here and get premium seating OMG! It was the best $8.00 (person) spent! popcorn and drink and the seats... couches with blankets. Awesome! Restaurants all reasonable priced, well worth the money!

Hugh Shopping Center. It's a huge shopping center and you can certainly gets everything you need. Again, similar to all other large shopping center, most of the shops are international brands but they do offer good discount during sales season!

Huge Mall. This is a huge mall split into zones and it is easy to get lost in but there are some gems of shops here that have some great local flavour as well as some international standards. If you want to have retail therapy in air conditioned comfort you could do a lot worse than this. Close to other malls and you can use the sky walk from Siam BTS station to save tripping over the pavement.

Good for shopping . This is truly the best shopping in Bangkok. Especially section for asia designers is interesting. For short rather unique collection I would recommend Zen shop insight Central World.
My recent visit to Bangkoko. There was a variety of items to shop of good quality. Movement is easy with state of the art equipment.
huge + very good cinema. huge shopping mal, mainly very expenisve shops but great cinema on the top and nice selection of restautants

Highly Recommended on Naraya. Basically a branded outlet with most prestigious brands. The Naraya outlet is always packed and lot of choices. It's shopped till you dropped. I found the branded stuff is quite expensive compared to other countries in SEA.
Great classy shoppingmall. A lot of Brands and great restuarants you can spend hours and hours and not feel bored. The restrooms are also very hygienic.

If you are a hopper, I'm sure this is heaven. Let me start by saying I am not a dedicated shopper. I wanted to experience a Bangkok mega mall. This fit the bill. There are hundreds of shops and thousands of shoppers. I found it to be overwhelming, but I am sure that dedicated mall shoppers would disagree.

Dirty and Getting Tired. Recently visited Central World and was shocked by the deterioration of this place. The toilets are not clean and the place feels tired. Aside from that its a bit of a maze and is just ANOTHER Bangkok mall. Please! Stop building them!
Awesome mall. This mall is great and is centrally located. Great shops and food locations. It's middle scale shopping.

Great Shopping Centre. Absolutely enormous. Lots of upmarket stores (often several of the same brand scattered around - it's HUGE!). Vast variety of goods and prices are very reasonable. Cinemas, food outlets on upper floor and in a separate area. Amazing.
A nice mall . A nice place to hangout with family or friends. Another mall of Bangkok where you can hangout other than the regular malls.
Big mall. Nothing to say, just a big mall overall. A lot of things to see and to taste. There are three floors fulled of good restaurants with beautiful decor.
Great shopping, everything you need!. Wonderful shopping center, all you need and many fun stores we don´t have in Europe. Not too crowded, great dining area at level 6.

good but already coming into her ages. The mall is almost to big - if you want to get lost, go there!
Recommendation: avoid Central World and go direct to the close 'Paragon'

A modern shopping and business mall in the center of Bangkk. you can spend a whole day in this amazing modern mall. lots of designers shops and restaurants, very modern cinema center with the latest movies and an amazing food court. you will love it.
NICE BUT FEW INTERESTS. Please build more theme park mini so children can have a lots of things to play. And also open some Kpop shops, game shops and more restaurants. Thank you ^^

All in one!. I love this shopping mall. It provides you with whatever you wish for, ranging from all the high end brands e.g. Hermes, prada, d&g and a lot more. The mall itself is very spacious, easy to go to and staffs are friendly and helpful. Good services for disabled customers as well.

shops all around. This place is stuffed full of shops, if you are looking for a bargain look again. The prices are the same as in Europe. What is worth a browse is the food court on the top floor. My personal favourite is the dumpling shop, but there is a large selection of cuisines.

A place for some high end shopping!. You wont be really amazed by the prices (tend to be expensive, even for high end brands when compared to another shopping destinations), but you will find amazing that this enormous shopping mall is erected in the somewhat forgotten city of Bangkok. The infrastructure and the architecture is astonishing.
Great for Shopping and Restuarants. We Shopped and Had a great food at central world as it is very big lot of shopping options and food options
Lots of variety at upscale. Lots of store and places to eat. Slightly expensive for the casual shopper in Bangkok. great place to cool off between walking around locale.

The biggest shopping mall in Bangkok. Very big shopping mall and and includes all the famous internaltional brands and local brands. Also there are many good restaurants in the mall. In the weekend, there were always some big events or shows outside of the first floor. This area is the most crowded and always in the traffic jam. I would recommend to take the BTS other than the taxi or Tutu.
High end plaza. This doesn't have the same atmosphere or size as Siam Paragon or the bargains of the MBA, nevertheless a great place to shop.

very big. IT is a very big shopping mall! You can buy and eat a lot inside. It is very clean and neat. You need to let the staffs checking your bags before going in. ANyway, I don't mind about that at all. the food court offer food in reasonable price! You need to get a card first and pay when you are leaving only. Easy!

It's a world plaza. It's location made one of the best high class mall in Thailand, in every occasion they will something ( indoors or outdoors) to attract people ( especially tourists) to visit the plazas.
She shopped till I dropped. Three different malls joined together. From standard to high end. Food courts and restaurants. You can easily lose track of time.

one of the older shoppingcenters, but still ok.. Central world is not only the shopping centre, but also in front of the building there are a lot of activities. Just take the BTS to Chitlom station, get out and walk on the skywalk to central world. Walk along the buildings (go inside if you want). Walk to Phetchaburi road, go left along Pantip (big building with all kinds of ICT stuff) and if you see the BTS again, go left to go to Ratchathewi station. .
Great shopping mall. Excellant choices of both retails, food and beverage outlets within this mall.Can always rest and chilled out in plenty of coffee joints .

Too confusing. CWP is a large mall with a rather confusing layout. There are all the shops you need plus plenty, and I mean plenty, of places to eat. Easily reached from the BTS Skytrain at Chit Lom and linked to Siam Paragon by the newly opened 'Skywalk'.
Just another Shopping Center. It's setup nicely, but not really special. For me Terminal 21 or Paragon or even EM Quarter is nicer.

"Western" Central World. Extremely Westernized shopping center with hundreds of stores including many designer clothes stores and restaurants. There was a super cool Marvel/DC/Disney store which I enjoyed on one of the top levels. A few book and stationary stores caught my eye and they also had a cinema which we was an English with Thai subtitles movie (approx 10AUD per person). Prices at Central World are very mid to high range.
good place to shop. best place to shop and enjoy your time to spend tim in Bangkok.i bought so good stuff from this centre.

Great western mall. This is a beautiful mall - very western. All the big name brands - Uniqlo, Gap, Sephora, Kate Spade, h&m, etc. Clean, airy and huge, could be in any of the worlds large cities. The prices are similar to what I would expect from a mall in Melbourne, New York or London. This is not a place for cheap knock-offs. We were looking for a quiet haven to do some western shipping and found exactly that. Loved this place.

Another great mall. Very accessible by train and other public transport.
Great range of products from high end to lower end products. Either branded or non-branded products.
Great range of food available.
Another place to swipe your credit card and make the bank profit more!!!
Great Shopping Experience. Great shopping experience at Central- heaps variety of all international brands. Ambience was really nice.
One of the best shopping center in Bangkok. This shopping center is one of the best shopping place in Bangkok, it is simple decor but too luxury, and contain many important mark in the world.
All-in-one destination. Great place to shop, eat and drink under one roof. It has all the major brands of the world. In particular, I go to the Uniqlo store here - its huge and has lots of options

Everything you need. Shopping and food, everything you need for a day of shopping. Great location near sukumvit. A very nice and clean place with all the stores you need. My wife likes shopping and I not so much, but even I liked it here

Nice mall. My wife and I were here to have a quick bite at one of the restaurants here and decided to have a look around at the mall incase we want to shop. Bought some nice frozen yogurt at Pinkberry and then shopped around. It is not as high end as the close by Siam Paragon, but it is still quite high end. I think everything is slightly more expensive than usual, but it is still a good mall to find a bargain or two.

Great place to eat. Large mall covering 5 floors newly refurbished. People seem to be spending more in the many restaurants rather than in the shops except the large supermarket in the basement. All the usual brand-named outlets at prices which may be higher than in the tourist's own country but not as upmarket as Paragon. However somewhere to escape the heat for several hours and easily accessible by overhead walkway from Chidlom BTS.

Beautiful Shopping & Eating!. Lovely.Clean, Spectacular Shopping and Eating Center! A delight for the senses. An array of incredible reestaurants from luxurious to simple exotic flavors. Great Happy hours to enjoy after shopping. I love Central World!

A very big shopping centre with all brands available. A very big shopping mall, didn't manage to walk the whole shopping centre, just cover part of the floors. The location is easy to find, can either walk from Pratunam or from BTS Siam station. This shopping centre have lots of luxurious and branded stores, especially fashion. The outside of the mall will have tight security due to the bombing few years back, there are also various street food stalls near the entrance of the building. Highly recommended if you are buying branded stuff all in one place.

Good center. Central World Plaza has everything you need, and it is a very nice shopping center. The prizes are average, but if you are looking for cheap prizes you should visit another center or a market. But otherwise, this is a great place for shopping!
Shop till you drop!. Big, bigger, biggest! Gigantic mall to suit al your needs. I'm not really a shopper where on holidays, but this is probably the place to be when you are.

High Class Shopping Center. These are just like any other shopping mall in the world and this is may be one of the luxurious mall in the downtown area, it can be compared to Siam center mall. and most of that the food at the Oasis and the top floor is pretty full of high end food.

Sixth Biggest Shopping Mall in the World!!!. Near BTS Siam Sky walkway, the place is very huge, lots of stuff to shop, include Naraya Bags famous in Thailand. There have lots of near by big shopping complex, such as Big C, MBK, Pratunam Market, Platinium Fashion Mall and etc.

Lots of brands. Lots of brands to choose from. Naraya, Cath Kidson, Uniqlo, Skechers, Isetan and much more. If you looking for cheap bargins then you should go platinum mall or pratunum market. Here is more for popular brands. But it is quite big so you will need some time to walk the whole place. There is an ice rink in the plaza if you feel like ice skating.

shopping in Bangkok. Very nice shop, but very expensive , like all th e designers shops all over the world. Really not for the normal tourist who would like some really from the far east. These shops are all over the world , especially in the big citeis.So , for me , not interesting.
Cool oasis. Fantastic array of shops and eating establishments to while away some time from the hustle and bustle of BKK. Clean cool and convenient for the BTS.

Shopping feast. The mall is very big and host 2500 shops !The quality is very good though a bit more expensive than night markets.You need more than a day to explore the shop.Or at least know what you are looking for and find out were the shops are located as you might "burn" lots of valluable traveling time.Shop around and you will find a bargain or two.Beware it is very big and impossible to explore in a day ! But it is worth a visit.For ladies a"must visit."

It's 4 star for a reason. The place is like the super new Bangkok - away from the crap of Khao San road and into the luxury malls of Singapore and Hong Kong.Bangkok caters to all travellers and while you wont find a cheap deal here, you will find good quality stuff at still probably cheaper than back in the West.
Mall. Central world plaza is a great way to spend four - five hours. There are and many restaurants with different food around Thai
shopping and fun. everything under one roof. central world plaza have everything one wants from standard brands to top notch ones.amazing shopping and one could spend entire day in this mall.

Fantastic mall with loads going on. We visited the shopping mall on a rainy day in Bangkok and were really impressed by this huge shopping mall. There was a massive selection of places to eat, drink or just grab a snack/treat. This mall reminded me of those large malls in Dubai with all the European, US and local brands. I would recommend the department store Zen which was enormous and had a gorgeous kids clothing section.There was also a Japanese expo going on that day which was awesome to watch all the fancy dress characters.It is very easy to access this mall via sky train (BTS)
So big, feet will be sore!. This shopping mall is sooo big!! Wear comfy shoes!Go to the top floor for food!! Try the shaved ice, to die for!
Huge Makl. Central world plaza is located in Pratunam.It has all branded shops .There is food court also where one can get all different cuisines.

Huge mall with VAT service for tourist. Its another huge mall with key brands like Naraya,Folli folie and La Senza. But they have one service which is quite good.You can get your Vat refund processed on the 6th floor of Zen and proceed to the airport to get a custom stamp.They have a great restaurant where you can try the local food called Eat,eat all Thai.

Just any shoppingcenter/mall. Jus a any shoppingcenter/mall, littlebit tangled to move, because threre is many hallways. threre is many mark shops, adidas, nike, superdry, toys-a-rus etc...Wifi is too difficult using, blaah.... Mall is very big

A massive must visit mall in BKK. Everytime i visit Bkk i will drop by here for quality shopping and dining. The place is huge with numerous stores, most having discounts, and food places are awesome with neat and clean quality food.

Short stop. I didnt plan to explore this Mall during this visit, but when I was walking towards Pratunam, I was attracted to the few Muslims food seller at the Food Festival stalls held in front of the mall. Walked a few floors to view the on-going Sales. Glad that I found a big Cath Kingston store selling homeware products there.
Great Shopping. It's a mall- so it's basically the same thing that you would see in any other city. But, it's got a lot of great variety, good food, wifi, and its in a great location
Very Modernized. Only area where we can buy goood quality products with reasonable price. It is very clean and food in the shopping mall is wonderful. Very relaxing and very enjoyable
Huge mall with western shops. This is a huge mall aimed at tourists. There are various western stores and a movie theater with a great selection of Hollywood films.
Amazing!!!. This Centralworld shopping is best mall ever, we were there for 2 days nearly all day and had so great time.
Oh yeah air conditioning. Look its cool inside so you might as well spend half a day here. Its a chance to walk around and talk. Shopping is shopping but this is cold and relaxing.

Excellent shopping. Here you will find everything, from H&M to Ferrari... The food on the ground floor is great, either in the food court or one of the many fast food places or restaurants. There is a great supermarket, an aquarium and decorations outside. We love the children's section of the department store.

Fancy shipping mall. Here have everything. Easy to go by sky train or drive but crazy traffic. Have many great restaurants, top brands, SF cinema. Sometimes have beer gardens or activities in front too.

Super huge mall !!!. I've heard a lot about the mall before coming to Bangkok. They always say :"You should visit and you won't regret !". Well, yeah, They were right ! There are about 4 floors with full of average and hi-end brands, but the price is much lower than in my country (I'm from Vietnam). My fav stores are H&M and there is a nice store selling Thai cosmetic that i cannot remember the name of it, but the the decoration is really nice and the price is reasonable ! I will be back to this mall for my next coming trip.

An Average Mall with Franchised Stores. The mall is extremely large, and at times difficult to navigate unless you're near an info booth or map. I found it had the usual collection of franchised stores, without anything too unique in it. Great for those looking for normal mall-based shopping, and they offer a "tourist discount book" just by asking for one at an info desk.
Loved it!. Lovely Mall and plenty of things to do, even for non-shopaholics. Plenty of food options, groceries, movies, and so on and on. One could probably spend days here:-))

One of Bangkoks shopping meccas.. With lots of floor space and endless corridors, central world plaza is the place to go if you wish to shop till you drop.No cheap imitations here but bargains can be found for a smart shopper. Plenty of popular brands from around the globe, especially clothing.Sprinkled with the occasional eatery and coffee shop to rejuvenate its offers a good chance to exercise your credit card and purchase something nice.
Nice shiny shopping center. We really like this nice clean shopping center.My girlfriend like to shopping and she find so many things for herself.We highly recommend it.

Great mall in Bangkok. We shopped here for half of a day. Lots of brands, good prices, and the food court was fantastic. We prefer Central over the more expensive upscale alternative a few blocks away.
Comprehensive. We had a one and half hour visit and it was very good. The mall have a very good collection of brand and has also the local brand.

Direction signs can be a little bit more easy to find.. lost in the vast shopping mall is not funny. Try to find way out and had to ask around. But the way they charge customer in the supermarket and food court is kind of cool.

A bit of everything. This mall is huge. 2 anchor stores, one at each end, would be enough but there are about 7 more floors of all kinds of things. There's very high end and food courts. I have to say I enjoyed my couple of hours mooching around the mall. If you can't find what you're looking for you must be crazy!!!

My favourite shopping mall. Central World at heart of Bangkok, 5min walk from my hotel. Huge shopping mall with luxury goods and nice restaurants. We like the central food hall supermarket as a lot of Asia foods we can buy home. Also, outside the four faced Buddha the side street. Every weekend have a few stall selling the seafood, nice and cheap. We enjoy the mall and foods.

Impressively large!. If you want a very large mall and shopping experience, this is a good place to go. While the shops had a distinctly western feel, there were a few that were local. I found some neat Thai jewelry at a reasonable price and for good quality here, and was able to get comfortable outerwear for my trip.While you can find food, I recommend going outside and visiting the street vendors instead.

a typical mall with everything you could imagine. This is the Central across from the Big C, very close to the Erewan Shrine. Sometimes with so many centrals it can be confusing. This mall has everything from cell phones to department stores to even a somewhat high end grocer. It's definitely a one stop shop. Although you could find many of the goods cheaper elsewhere, for instance Big C sits across the street with better prices on most things you could want. The mall is well organized with a great map. They have every type of food you could dream of from Thai to Japanese, and even the Manhattan Fish Market. The world famous Vietnamese Dumpling restaurant called Din Tai Fung is also here with a window to watch the magic. There are also some upscale shops here as well.
pretty much anything you wanna buy. One of the most popular shopping malls in Bangkok located near Siam square. Whatever you want to buy is available here

Very good mall. We visited both the big malls in Bangkok (Central World and Siam Paragon) and found them both to be quite amazing (if slightly big). At Central World we really liked the Zen shop as there were lots of good promotions.

Nice shopping centre. . Not bad seemed to be some restoration going on the day of our visit. So some floors were closed. Plenty of shops selling jewellery, clothes and gifts.Thai massage parlors everywhere.. I recommend the one on the third floor 3 stalls to the left of escalators. Most stall were not open as we visited early in morning. Seems a great place for bulk buying items as you can really barter the prices down.

Good place for shoppers. This is a good shopping mall in Siam. It's easily accessible, and quite organised. However, there is only one total map on the ground floor, and on each floor, the information board only shows you what are there on the floor. There's one thing needs to be improved: more signs. It's a huge mall, so it needs more maps, more signs.

Good big mall. First we found this place to be go big, really 1 day was not enough to see everything. Most of what we saw was nice (but expensive) brand name stores and some really nice restaurants. Most stuff we bought was from Zen department store because they had good sale there.

Gem Scam. My family (including my father-in-law, mother-in-law, daughter of 4yrs and husband) and I were approached by a guy who claimed to be "chief security boss" at Central World, he told us it was a buddah's birthday that day and claimed that there will be rituals at the "lucky" temple. We were brought to the temple by a tuktuk driver who was claimed to be a "safe" tuktuk driver by the guy who spoke to us as he was supposedly "used" by the security officers located just outside Central World (which we realised one day after that the security officers there do not offer such services of introducing tuktuk drivers). We were driven to the temple, after a rather long route, about 15 mins, when it was supposedly pretty close to Central World when pointed out (I suspect the driver had purposely taken a much longer route so that the next person we were supposed to meet at the temple had sufficient time to go to the temple). I also realised a few times that the tuk tuk driver had made ridiculous U-turns when he could have just turned left or right just to drag more time. When we reached the temple, it looked abandoned instead of the bustling temple which we would have expected if it was really a special day. There was not a single soul, the temple looked run down, but we met this guy, quite well dressed, standing at the entrance of the temple. We asked him if this was the Lucky temple and if there was supposed to be a ritual for blessing. He said it was the temple, but the ritual had already been done at 6am in the morning. He then proceeded to tell us that he was the teacher of the temple, teaches buddist study and that he didn't work there. He guided us to go into the temple to pray, then we can take some holy water home in a bottle for blessing. He also told us we should stay in the temple for 5 minutes for good luck after praying. When we were done with praying, he pointed me out to follow him to the side of the buddah where there was a big pot of water, he gave me a mineral water bottle and told me to take some water home. I was surprised to see many mosquito lava in the water, and thought maybe it was common for thai temples, unlike the Singapore ones which will never allow breeding of mosquitos. The "teacher" then proceeded to talk to us, asking us where we are from, and that he has a lot of friends from Singapore. He slowly guided the topic into famous people like actors, policitians and the riches and told us that they all came to this temple to pray every year. They would also donate to the temple and that the temple looked so old because the buddah which was sitting in the temple refused to move even though there was a newer temple just beside the old temple we were in. He said the chef monk fell sick on the day the buddah was supposed to be moved, 3 times in a row, thus they decided to let the buddah stay in the old temple. Super convincing. He then said he wanted to have a look at my husband's hand, and after looking, he said his fingers had holes inbetween and that would lead to bad money luck. He told him he should wear blue sapphire and I should wear red ruby as red ruby is the heart of the buddah, to bring good luck for my family. He told us all the famous people would go to the Thai Export to buy these gems to bring them super good luck. He also added that we must get only the ones which have been blessed by 999 monks. The usual gems which haven't been blessed would not work. He said these 999 monks were returning the good deed to the public by chanting for these gems as the public had donated money to the monk hospital. The blessing would bring the person who wears the gem good luck and blessing. He also mentioned that my husband and i should wear the gems together to bring out the best. We then asked him where is the thai export, and he wrote on a piece of paper, and we asked him if he could guide the tuktuk driver to bring us there. He spoke to the tuktuk driver and showed him the piece of paper with only the name of the jeweller written on it (note that there was no address). The driver looked at it for a short while, nodded his head. Again, we were driven to the shop after a long drive of close to 20 minutes. I believe this amount of time was enough to gather the correct people to the jewel shop. At the jewel shop, when we entered, there was a lady who approached us and I asked specifically for the gems which were blessed by the 999 monks. The lady looked a little confused, then proceeded to guide us to a separate room. I asked again if the gems were blessed by 999 monks, and she said all their gems in the shop were blessed as the monks would bless their mine. Coincidently, there was a chinese lady with a baby in the shop, which we later realised didn't work there, but was just visiting as she stayed nearby. The thai lady got the chinese lady to speak to us and we could communicate better in mandarin. I asked her if there was really blessing for the gems and she claimed she went with them to the mines and the monks really did the blessing. She also added that the thais were very religious people and that they would not swap the stones (I asked her if we chose to custom make the rings, would they swap the stones). My parents were playing with the baby when I was speaking to the thai and chinese lady. After all the discussions and negotiations (I already negotiated close to a discount of 50000 baht), we were charged 108400 baht for 7 rings. Thank goodness we didn't have enough thai baht with us and our credit cards were not activated yet. We could only leave a deposit of 2000 baht. The owner was initially hesitant as he said to custom make, we needed to put at least 50% of the total amount. We insisted that we didn't have enough money on us and that 2000 baht was all we could afford. He agreed and we were supposed to pay the full amount when they brought the rings to our hotel the next day. We left and asked the tuktuk driver to bring us to the 4 face buddah. It suddenly occured to me to check if the whole thing was a scam when I was more clear headed, and true enough, I managed to find the name of the jeweler where we were at. Someone had been scammed there before. The name of the jeweler is called "Manee Diamond", the owner is called Mr Diamond. It was then we realised that the gem scam was common in thailand and that we could have possibly fallen into a scam. I then told my in laws that we should just leave the deposit and cancel the order to avoid and trouble. Afterall, we could have lost 106400 baht more, which is $4500 singapore dollars. So my husband called the jeweller and told him that our credit card couldn't be activated and cancelled the order. Thank goodness for all the reports online, otherwise we would have lost a big sum of money. I would like to share over here so that tourists visiting thailand would be more alert and aware of these scams. They make us of our beliefts and also our trust in fellowship. We believed that they would not dare to lie in front of the Buddah, and that they would not make us of religion, but we were absolutely wrong. They put our guards downs by bringing in people whom we are more comfortable around, like the Chinese lady and her 6 months old baby to play with our trust. When we had time to think carefully, everything just came together, all the long rides just gave them more time to prepare for the next stage. Now that you are reading this, you might think that we are stupid to have fallen into the scam, but in that moment, everything was so convincing. Hope that this will put the guards of tourists up and help to minimise or eliminate these scams altogether. All these people should really burn in hell.

Huge Shopping Centre. Accessible from Siam or Chitlom BTS Station, Central World Plaza is a mega shopping centre with many shops and food options. Also within walking distance from other shopping centres like Siam Paragon.

Huge shopping experience with stores from affordable to elite. Super way to see all th shopping Bangkok has in a proper multi level mall with air conditioning. Granted you may find bette bargains at the weekend outdoor market but you will not b disappointed th your visit to central world. Paragon has super pricy designer stores and central world has boutique, single owner and department store Zen - with lots of terrific selection. Plus quick good eats. Do yourself a favor as a tourist and visit central world. Take the sky train.
Wow, Huge shopping center.. Wow, Huge shopping center, expensive..., great to walk around, lots of people, clean, open, great food hall, great for a visit.

Handy shopping centre. Central World is located in Siam Square, was a very short walk from our hotel.Security is present, you get scanned before entering.This is a handy place to go to. There is a supermarket to pick up the basics. Good sportswear, and the odd nice shop selling pashminas etc. We did have a real problem buying a SIM card, the place we went to had no English speakers, and whatever it was that we bought didn't work.It is a shopping centre that is like all shopping centres, so there is no cultural experience. However, as noted, it is useful for the basics.

Upscale, incredible mall. This was the drop-off point for our cruise ship shuttle, so we visited Central World twice. Very upscale shops with unlimited choices. A huge, modern mall, as nice as you will find anywhere in the world.

Huge but a bit quite. Huge mall with a bit pricey price... I only went there to their front door food festival and their bathroom.. but their c&k have like 50% disc so..yeah i bought my shoes there haha! Overall i prefer nextdoor mall then this one..huge and clean tho..
Nice place to shop. I love H&M and Uniqlo here. Many choices. In the 4th floor, it has many coffee shops and dessert shops. Good place for both shopping and meeting friends

Good mall for averaged price goods.. This is the best mall for your everyday inexpensive purchases. Clean and most stores have at least one person that speaks english.If you are looking for designer clothing there are better places to go.
Huge. If you like shopping centre shopping then this place is better than some of the high end ones. You feel a bit more welcome here
Quite a confusing place to shop. Its not really the easiest shopping place to shop as the layout of the mall is rather confusing. I would rather shop in paragon actually.
High end retail mall with average prices.. Its a great big mall with lot of high end retail and excellent food choices though prices are at par with international location and is not cheap.

Nice High End Mall, Must try EAT THAI Foodcourt. Nice mall, must try the sub level food court!!! Eat Thai is a food court with many different stations with variations of food. Super clean and busy during lunch time
Wow!. Wow wow wow... this is shopping paradise!!!! If you like shopping you will love here, we were there for 10 hours and it was not enough time...

Big center :). love this big center. you have everything you need under the same roof.
we spend the whole day. plan to go back :)
Large modern welcoming shopping centre. Many shops and many restaurants of all kinds in one single comfortable and modern location close to the Chit Lom and Siam Skytrain stations.

Love this Mall. This is one of the Mall that i will always cone when ever i am in Bangkok. The Mall is huge and have lots of selection. It also have some of the brands that you could not find at home.

Winter Wonderland. This mall was probably the most lit during Christmas:) awesome place they had a huge Christmas tree and a winter wonderland theme park (with various cartoon characters and costumes).Shopping mall is vibrant at night lots of eateries within and outside the mall, can also do some shopping great sale unique merchandise awesome place to be.There lots of people so be careful not to get lost, its a walking distance from the train station.Awesome place to be:)
just another shopping centre. there were heaps of shopping centres very clean and plenty of shops to wander through. prices in these are similar to Australia.
Good shopping. Nice clean centre with toilets and aircon, good shops with lots of choices. Great for a rainy day or to get out of the sun.

Good discounts, worth a go!. This is a rather quiet mall compared to the busy streets of Bangkok. However, it does have quite some cafes and high-end brands to shop around for. I especially liked the departmental store ZEN here, which spans 6 floors! The discounts was rather good in the store, ranging from 10-25%. I got myself a Guess watch for 15% discount! I do not suggest going to the food court located at the highest floor as it may seem rather quiet and quiet creepy. However, CentralWorld do have an array of restaurants on their 6th level. There are Western, Chinese, Japanese and Thai food restaurants available through out the mall. If you would like to know more about it, do visit my bio, where I have provided a link to my blog.Overall a rather good place to spend a quiet afternoon and have a break from the heat on the streets of Bangkok.
worth for a walk. On my visit 31st December there are thai boxing happening in this avenue. the show was amazing. The crowd just amazing, full of people on the street

Best Mall in Bangkok. This is not only a place for shopping but also a place to have a drink, dinner or even to spend new year at its doors.Its location is considered as the Eastern Times Square during New Year's celebration, many activities during the day until the countdown with great fireworks.After the countdown you could go to Khaosan Road for night party.
Large. This is a big mall with all of your standard brands and a lot of food choices. The cinema is cheap and clean and the supermarket is my favourite in Bangkok
One of Iconic Shopping Mall in Bangkok. Located just in the central Bangkok and very near to Siam. Can be reached by BTS, buses or taxis. Simply can spend hours here.

Very very big upmarket shopping mall. Impressively big upmarket shopping mall. Lots of choice and air conditioned... Great free bag drop service. Cinema and food restaurants on top floor (7th floor I think!) Difficult to review more than this...

Big Shopping Department Store with Full of Happiness. Anything you want, you probably could find it here. Fashion, Brandname Products, Cinema, Japanese Shopping Mall, Department Store, Supermarket, etc. It is like one stop shopping.
One of the best shopping mall. This mall containing the best luxury store from around the globe and has many restaurants that you can't miss

Nice Shopping Mall and within walking distance to Siam Paragon via linkway on the 2nd floor. A sure-to-visit Mall for me. Love it as it has Isetan and Zen Department Stores with many boutiques (could claim VAT refund which is a bonus) and many eateries/ restaurants. A very modern Cinema as well (though the last time my companion and I were bitten by bugs so I didn't quite enjoy the movie). I can visit CentralWorld 2 days in a row and cant finish shopping here. Oh I also enjoyed the Bazaar (starts as early as 10am till late) outside CentraWorld, at the open Square, had my fill of coconut ice cream and mango glutinous sticky rice. But understand it's not a daily affair as one of the stallholders informed me they are there for another 5 days.it would be great if the free wifi for tourists could be extended to at least 2 hrs instead of 1hr as I realized that not many places in Bangkok, there is free wifi considering it's a tourist destination.

LOVE THIS PLACE!!! . Love all that CentralWorld has to offer!!
All the restaurants are amazing. The movie theater is very nice..super clean! And the beer gardens out front are a lot of fun! Live music every night!!

Malls Galore ;). Malls in Bangkok are one of the best.Central World is one whole stretch of different malls on this one big block in the heart of Bangkok.You start with Isetan and go through Central World till you reach Zen Mall. Don't get lost though..the stretch has several side wings to explore.You can go to the ground floor of Zen Mall and chill with the rows of bars and restaurants with acoustic bands nightly.

full option for shopping and dining. This shopping is full of world wide brand for you to explore and there are many type of food for you to choose for dining or dessert. In brief, this is the spot to stop and grab everything you want.

Rather vast but useful once you get used to it. I come here often with kids and by myself. It's somewhat vast and bewildering at first, but once you know where to go, I find it quite useful. If you want to go to a mall that is centrally-located and has the main chain stores, it's a good option. If you don't particularly like malls and chain stores, do avoid.Pros:- Centrally located; reasonably accessible by public transportation. Useful if you don't want to go all the way to Asoke, Phrom Phong, Thonglor and such.- Plenty of parking, which is a big advantage over Paragon.- Nice play area for kids.- Shops that I like: Central Food Hall (7F), Toys R Us and other kids' stores (5F), Uniqlo, H&M, Kinokuniya bookstore (6F Isetan), a small and relaxed ice-skating rink, and the Isetan supermarket (5F) is excellent for Japanese foods.- Very clean and modern.Cons: - It's a mall :p (but they're necessary and useful in Bangkok...)- Rajadamri Rd is always jammed, and it's a slight hike from the BTS station (Chitlom)Tips:- Go during mornings; it gets crowded (and parking gets full) once past noon.- For every B500 you spend in Central World, you get to ride an electric train with your kids (5F).

Good shopping and lots of food choices. Unfortunately due to my partner having a dodgy stomach from some island food, for our transit day in Bangkok we spent the time in the Central World mall. For the whole day we had a look around some shops and chose places to eat in the mall, enjoying the air conditioning. There are a lot of Japanese restaurants and also Chinese, Thai, Western on the 6th and 7th floors. We ate at two different Japanese noodle places and the one on the 7th floor called Waraku was really good and not expensive. The mall is clean, air conditioned, has a lot of different shops and restaurants and has good security as well. A good place to spend the day.

Full afternoon spent walking shopping & eating. This place is huge! there are many floors of different items to look at. There was little to no bartering but that is to be expected in a shopping centre.The food court was good and the use of a pre-paid card was a great way to go and try lots of little meals. You can also get refund on un-used Baht left on card. Be careful not all stores took the card some only cash.

Big shopping mall - lots to do. This is your standard large shopping mall but it has a lot to offer and is a change from being outside on the streets. There was many shops and a skating rink etc. we had lunch on the 7th floor. There were many restaurants to choose from and ours was good Thai food.
Way too expensive mall. The location mall was awesome. But the prices of the items were way too costly. Only the mall is for window shopping.

Mall with branded stuff. A shopping mall with branded stuff . we traveled in end of November all the Christmas decors were coming up look beautiful in the night.The mall is with branded stuff, best place for the people who needs to buy high-end stuff cloths, shoes, bags, perfumes etc
Great Shopping Mall and Fine Restaurants. You may find lot of luxury stuff here as well as fine dinning restaurants ! One of shopping mall (besides Paragon) I use to visit when in Bangkok.
very expensive. you can find everything here if you have the bucks.its super expensive and sometimes you wonder to whom this huge mall is selling after all.
Shop til you drop. If you don't find what your looking for then your a terrible shopper...beautiful mall with a ton of stores and great choices of food. Give yourself at lease 3-4 hrs

check out the food levels 7th and 8th floor. you can find anything here, from cheap goods to upmarket brands. i love the food levels 7th and 8th floor with an abundance of restaurants. In November and December there are 3-4 massive beergardens with live bands in front of the central world plaza. this is good fun. also it is just a short stroll from there to pratunaam market. love the location.
A shopping centre with fewer people. Central World is about a 10-minute walk from Siam Paragon. It is more laidback and less crowded so it is a nice place to spend your downtime.
Good local mall in a great location.... Plus the food scene on the 7th floor is spectacular. Something for everyone and any mood. You won't be sorry.

Never ending shopping. There are two shopping malls connected with a promenade link. So many floors, so many shops and it is quite a long distance, feels like a running a marathon in there! Plan ahead so you don't end up going back and forth many times. Overall, fun but tiring: it's just too big.
Nice. Its big, well organised many shops and restaurants, like many other nice malls in Bangkok ! you cannot cover it in one visit

My favourite shopping place!. I come to Bangkok at least 5 times a year, and residing 300 kilometres away from Central World. Everything is there, anything you need..its a nice place to hang around, watch a movie, dine, shop, meet friends..

Great Place to Binge Shop, Walk and Eat!. The mall has many offerings (high mid and low budget stores) and can easily overwhelm a novice shopper. I am admittedly a power shopper. Still, I got lost, I walked till my shins hurt. I ate in the food court to restore my energy. The mall has so much air conditioning pumping through it , I had to wear a sweater inside. I loved it. I shopped repeatedly. Yes, I probably have a shopping problem. I recognize the problem and that is the first step to change. lol.

Best shopping in the city!. A total must-visit for all the possible brands and an entire day spend. I could spend repeated number of days here. Great dining options, coffee spots and a vast variety of brands available. IF you have limited time, skip the rest and go here.
Vegetarian option available at the food court. There were vegetarian option at the food court. The food was amazing. The price was reasonable too. We ate here few times during our stay.

CentralWorld: All Round Fun. Central World mall in central Bangkok is not only a shopper's delight with dedicated levels/floors for different categories of items, food, drinks, but is also a great place to take out kids. If it's festival time like Christmas/New Year week better. The gourmet floor has mind-boggling variety and is a foodies delight. Easy to access, CW is one of the best that BKK has to offer--- and for people of all budget group.
Massive Mall. A very interesting mall with plenty of features to get your interest. However could be in any large city in the world as nothing particularly Thai about the place.

Amazing shopping mall!. It’s one of the huge shopping malls in Bangkok located in a convenient place. The nearest BTS Skytrain station is Siam with a covered link way bridge through which one can enter into it. All the popular brands are available here, although a bit expensive but witnessed a nice shopping experience. It has a lot of restaurants and cafes to eat and drink.
Duty free. Run by King power, easy to get to by the sky train, very good selection,attentive staff, clean and organized

CENTRE OF SHOPPING. Think of any international brand and you will find it in this mall.Level upon level of things to buy. A shopaholics dream.A bit pricey though but that's what you would expect from anywhere that sells genuine top brands.There are also tonnes of eateries to choose from and movie theaters.Take some comfortable walking shoes and a fat wallet : )Would also be nice to know exactly what you want to buy before hand as you are definitely going to be spoiled for choice.I would advice to spend at least 6 hours to a whole day here. Its overwhelmingly fantastic.

Awesome, fun spot to ‘ring’ in the New Years. A friend and I headed here to take part in the New Year’s countdown at the Central World Plaza.
