After passing through several security checks, the crowds moved really smoothly and a great and fun time seemed to be had by all enjoying the entertainment and activities on display for the evening then leading to the eventual countdown to the New Year. The music kept the crowd going and there was a Thai fighting ring and the crowd was able to climb into the ring for a short period to take photos and celebrate. Being in the ring was a lot of fun and we had a great perspective of the area. The crowd was well behaved and watching the fireworks with the others celebrating was pretty awesome! I would definitely like to do this again next year.
Nice mall in a good location. Nice upscale mall with high end and standard stores great eating options and good location right next to the intercontinental and siam paragon

Huge without harmony. There are shopping establishments that you would want to go back time and again because its fun to walk those corridors and window shop. Central World is not one that draw you back. Its a huge shopping mall, but somehow give you a feeling of disjointed and disconnected. You wander around the corridors but could not get a sense of what kind of shopping experience they want you to have. I usually avoid Central World while visiting Bangkok.

Amazing Shops and Food. Arrived and went to the beer gardens for a wee swally before going into Theo Meo at The Intercontinental Hotel where the choice of food was just superb. With it being the festive season the buzz was tremendous.
Mall experience.. The shopping experience in Bangkok is unparalleled, evident in Central world. Many shops with great offers and discounts.

Epic Outdoor display and al-fresco area in December. Highly recommend the visit Central World in December for their outdoor christmas display decor - this year they tied up with HK Disneyland so you its a literal Christmas fairytale landscape. There is also massive al-fresco areas hosted by Chang, Heineken and another beer brand i can't remember complete with segmented seating areas and live bands. The actual mall itself is good - same brands as the rest of the malls in bangkok.
Shopping trip. This was part of our daily routine of visiting malls and shoppng and window shopping. amazing shopping malls in Bangkok which includes Central world plaza.

Huge shopping mall with a good sized Ice skating rink within. Central World Plaza is a huge shopping mall with popular brands and some uniquely Thai/Asian brands to shop from. It has a lot of restaurants and cafes to eat and drink in as well as a large Ice skating rink to have fun in. Central World is also conveniently located next to Siam Paragon shopping mall and close to MBK shopping mall. The nearest BTS Skytrain station is Siam with a covered Linkway bridge that connects all the way from Siam BTS Skytrain station to the Central World Shopping mall proper. Just follow the signage.

Favourite Shopping Mall. I keep coming back and enjoy the open space at Central World - more preferable than Siam paragon, which is too noisy and crowded to due smaller walk spaces. it is definitely nothing for budget shoppers, but you can find good deals during the sales seasons. The restaurants mainly are spread out on the two top levels. From KFC to Zen Cuisine, cheap to expensive, coffee to dessert, there is everything.The only negative point is the lack of a photo shop (maybe I have not found it yet).Interesting for families might be the Ice Rink.

Shopping Shopping Shopping. Easily accessible by MRT (Chitloom Station or on walking distance from Siam Station) and one can find almost anything; lots of varieties and almost all Brands are present under one roof including electronics on the top floors and numerous food outlets too. Impressive ambiance and we found it better than Siam and MBK
Huge shopping centre. If you want chic upmarket gear it's the place to go. There's also bars and restaurants there too. We found a cool machine that breathelises you for alcohol.

New year's countdown . Great New Years celebration spot just outside central world. We came there at 10pm for the countdown and to watch fireworks display. There was thai fight happening before that and than Thai singers were performing for an hour until 20 min before the count down. It doesn't really matter where you stand, you will be able to see fireworks from any point of the place. No drinks are allowed beyond the security check points. I think you can get there 30 min before and you still will have a decent viewing spot. Fireworks were good, but nothing special.
Good Brands. Expensive.. Has a great food court with so many food options and lots of space. Nice place to hangout after a long street shopping!
High Quality Shopping Mall. You can go for shopping here to get a branded products only. We have visited on 01 January 2016. Excellent shopping experience, located ideally.
new. bit of a walk from train station but best to go early as it gets very busy early evening. loads of designer shops to browse

Not bad overall. Advantages: valet parking, vide variety of different shops, nice location (5 min. from Siam station (BTS))
Disadvantages: VERY crowded, not all shops accept credit cards, it's hard to move around and to find something you need

Nice place to shop. Nice place to shop for luxury items; a lot of good restaurants for fine- dining standards; i definitely not regret to visit this place again due to a lot of trending items available at this mall. Service level of some shops are out of expectation which most probably dress codes is one of the measure of staffs on how shall be addressed if the customers have not dress accordingly.

Something for everyone. Another good shopping centre for everyone. All tastes and options are available here. Helpful staff and easy to find plus transport.Tip - sunhat, sunscreen, allow at least 4 hours , be prepared to bargain best price

All about lifestyle. run out of ideas where to dine and shop? Just come here.easy to park, shop, eat, play, watch movies and have fun with family & friends.Every new year, it is their tradition to feature well-know family cartoon characters on an outdoor settings. This year, it is the time for a Happy Fairly Tale of Hong Kong Disneyland to celebrate their 10th anniversary.So enjoyable and so much fun running around taking pictures with the tallest Christmas tree in Southeast Asia, Disney Tsum Tsum characters, the Princess, Mickey & friends.Oh, really miss my children and do not want the festive season to end.

Nice dedication during Christmas & New Year. We went there on New Year Eve, they had street party, was full of people to welcome 2016. Nice Christmas Three, and other Christmas decorations. It was worth a visit to take pictures. I was very crowded on the bridge walking to and from Siam BTS, full of people, can't even move. We left before the countdown to avoid the heavy traffic after NYE.
Bangkok shopping. Bangkok is shopping paradise and Central world is center of shopping in bangkok.. good place to chill out and have fun
Wow. One word WOW! This is new Bangkok, great day for shopping luxury goods.Don't expect low priced stuff. This is upscale. The Food Republic requires you to use a card which is reimbursable.
Complete Mall, You can find everything here. You can reach this plaza by BTS and other public transit. This mall is in the heart of bangkok, the BTS transit station, so it will be crowded.

Awesome . It is very large if i might say coming from Southern African i had not seen something with that kind of a design before or of its size. Visited the movie houses 3 floors checked all of them and the service was great. It has a lot of shops that can satisfy tourists of different financial capabilities and well women there is victoria's secret which had 60% discount among other shops that ranged in the 30-40% bracket. They have an ice scatting ring good for the kids while you do shopping and a train for the kids as well that goes around the mall cant quite remember which floor was the small train but its there. U get to ride with your child if you please for they are big enough and very safe. They have expensive restauraunts at the top if you are into that and also four floors of night clubs if i remember correctly. Good tourist destination
You can find everything there. A real big shop center in center of city. A place you can find everything you need with great discounts!

A wonderful example of complete shopping at one venue. This shopping centre stacks up against the best on the world. Why? Because it offers a great balance between top of the range internationally recognised brands and superb eastern brands all under one roof plus you can finish all off with a great meal from a huge selection of outstanding food outlets. I am a shopping centre manager by profession and can recommend this mall to anyone visiting Bangkok.
Shopping world. It is bigger than many of the malls i have seen in Melbourne. It has almost all the big brands and the 3rd floor has a nice food court. if you are a shopaholic then this is heaven

Shopping under one roof. One of the popular big mall in Bangkok city centre after Paragon mall. All under one roof for tourist as well as family. Major branded brands is available. Some local brands such Jim Thompson, Thannah and so on. 6th & 7th floors housed few good food outlets too.

near to Erawan shrine, Siam Paragon and Pratunam. Zen and Isetan Department stores and other stores. As there are so many department stores in Bangkok, it wasn't an outstanding one for me. However, it is in town and easily accessible. There are several restaurants in level 3 and all different cuisines are available.

A relaxing shopping experience. The area was festooned with Xmas decorations and on Xmas Eve it was a joy to be part of the celebrations. A warm friendly area which although very crowded was safe for all ages. The myriad of shops and restaurants inside Central World was eyecatching to say the least

Limited shipping options - good one-off visit . Has most major international brands, prices are standard - not much cheaper than any other shopping mall in the world.Nice food court and atmosphere at Groove. Would recommend E.A.T. (Eat All Thai) there.

Family Adventure. The plaza has most of the high end stores, a supermarket selling a combination of international and local products, lots of restaurant choices. Attached to the plaza, Groove housed quite a few good restaurants in Thai, café, Japanese, North American, pub, etc. Very convenient location accessible from 2 skytrain stations.
Expensive for Bangkok. Huge mall but is expensive, and it is the same things you will find in other malls (all the international stores) I thing is better asiatique has a more local feeling

Huge amazing place with truly dazzling holiday lights. First, I hate shopping centers, but this place is huge and amazing. The lights and displays are boggling. Do be prepared for unfriendly and unhelpful security staff at entrances. Live music at central court many evenings.

Huge! But in the end, it's just a mall.. I was blown away by the size of this place, and it has pretty much every shop you could imagine, but like I say in my headline, it's just a mall. It was fun to walk around for an hour or so, but I prefer more "cultural" sites when I'm on vacation.

Nothing new. I had heard a lot about cheap Bangkok shopping. Central Plaza was a big disappointment. Nothing new for anyone who has shopped in the US and better places. Do not waste time going here. Even duty free shopping is mor eexciting and cheaper. The clothes too were one or two seasons old.
Excellent selection of shops. This is the place to go for shopping.it also offers great restaurants .cinema top floor .easily accessible by train.

Its a mall...what can you say?. Not that much into going to malls in general but Bangkok's malls are viewed as experiences in and of themselves....good shopping but would not come to Bangkok simply to go shopping....most everything in there is available anywhere else in the developed world...

Can spend days in this giant mall. The mall is so large that it can get overwhelming. We were here during the Christmas holidays and the place was crowded. We mainly ate at the restaurants, but did little shopping, opting for the street markets.
Amazing. All thing you need are there. Be sure. But you are in wrong place if you're a budget customer. Maybe you find better price some other places in Bangkok

I Get Lost Here Every Time. This is such a big mall that you really should have a map. I can never find one and inevitably I get lost. I find myself back at something I have walked past an hour earlier. There are so many shops with so many good things to buy. Nearly every name brand is available and there is a food store as well as a food court and probably a hundred restaurants and stalls. Something for everyone and plenty to see even if you are just window shopping.

My favorite Bangkok mall. This "ground zero" centrally-located, downtown Bangkok mall is usually not as crowded as Siam Paragon and offers more "user friendly" type stores that I'm interested in. It's huge, has a great supermarket, an ice skating rink, a huge movie theater, and numerous quality restaurants. If I need something, it's my go-to place that never lets me down. If you hate shopping, but need to, it's a dream.

a glance at the center of Bangkok. Central world located at rachprasong ( pronounced raprasong) is at the center of Bangkok's shopping craze.it's a beautiful mall to visit and spend the day with movie,theater,ice skating,cafeteria at affordable level, shops,jewelry clothing thai goods and many other attractions.I recommend this mall to tourists .
Ridiculously big. This mall is huge, you can get everything here, clothes, food, equipment.Walk and shop till you drop.
World No. 3 Shopping Mall. Known to the local more as Isetan, Central World Plaza is World's third largest shopping mall. There is a shrine (Erawan) outside of it, which is pretty famous as well.

Music night. We visited Central World plaza after visiting the Erawan shrine which is a walking distance. This is a large mall. We watched about 4 different bands playing music outside. The crowd was mainly locals who seem to have made this their place of interest for the weekend. There is a shrine at the end with Buddha and Lord Ganesha. It is easily accessible from the main road and the Skytrain.

It's a shopping centre. Just bigger.. Central World Plaza is literally a retail shopping mall on a huge scale. 7 floors of retail stores. Each floor has its own department. Prices are pretty much what you can get at home. Unless you really need a shopping fix you can leave this out of your sight seeing tour.It's a pain to get to as the traffic is awful and it really isn't worth the hassle.

Must go. One of the largest malls in the world, you get everything here. Best place to come with family and spend 1 day or 6-7 hours , shopping , eating ......The food shops on 7th floor are best , there are plenty more on the 6th floor as well. They have added a new extension GROOVE having bars, restaurants for fine dining till 11pm at night. Exotic Thai food available here, but price is expensive
Shop shop shop. youll need 2days here great electrical bargains and gadgets has everything and more so make sure you take plenty of money great

Shops and restaurants . Visited on the day we arrived in Bangkok and Enjoyed a nice meal here looking back it was more expensive than anywhere else but at the time still cheap compared to uk. The shopping center was nice and had a Christmas display outside. The shops were modern and a lot of the same names we were used to can get anything here.

The Largest indoor Flea Market! Fanstastic Bargains. Great shopping experience, if not a little overwhelming. There is so much to see! The prices are out of this world and quality is generally very good. Clothes, Bags & Cellphone accessories.

A very big shopping mall in the heart of Bangkok. There is everything for everyone. Shopping, dining and going for movies. Easily accessible. Highly recommended if you want to shop and dine. The surrounding roads are busy tough with frequent traffic jams
High end . A lot of branded stuffs here . We came here for the food and some further Naraya bags shopping. Else wise we prefer to go night market / jatjuchak market for the cheap bargain

Nice. This shopping center is really huge.and different design...There are lots of Luxury Brands and also lots of Local brands you have lots of choicr also for food there millions of choice especially i love upstairs local and world kitchen part. Decorations are amazing durin Christmas time.Also I love the escalators no need to walk it makes circle up.to high floor.
Huge Mall. It's a huge huge mall with big brands... Best part, it has food court, deserts and even supermarket... Quality stuff one can get!!!

Shoppers heaven. As a shopping centre this the biggest I have seen and been in it is over half a million square metres of retail space spread over seven floors of magnificently structured building with so much to see and do. A must see location for all.

Shopping in style. Great expensive shops similar to Sandton city in Johannesburg South Africa. So we we not too impressed particularly as the Japanese beed shop was double the price of South Africa as we were expecting the opposite. Worth a visit.
Good shopping place . This place has everything you need and lots of restaurants. Easily accessible by public transport. Can get very crowded at times.

Great Place for Shopping & Relax. You can find everything here (various dishes restaurants, famous brand or local shops, supermarket, cinema, department stores, etc). With good connection to other area and nearby shopping malls make this place very popular.

Up market shopping. This shopping center has everything you would like to have and is the perfect place to spend a rainy day in Bangkok. But it is high end high price shopping. If your after bargains this is not the place. It does have excellent restaurants and the air conditioning can be a blessing some days.

Vast selection of stores and restaurants. You can easily reach Central World with the BTS by getting off at Chit Lom station. There are many stores and famous western brands and the 6th and 7th floors are mainly dedicated to food. We couldn't find a master mall directory but on each floor there was a map indicating the stores on each floor. The floors are also organized by categories i.e. mens, childrens, electronics etc.If you don't live in Thailand, ask about the VAT refunds when you shop!
Great shopping. Huge mall, everything is sold here, very upscale and lovely. Many designer shops and good choice of places to eat.
Quality shopping. The mall was all decked out in Christmas decorations and stores had massive sales so prices were more affordable.Quality name brand shopping

Nice Plaza. This Plaza is very near to Tourists attractive area so everytime it is crowded.There are many floors with Men,Women Fashions,Sportwears,Sport goods,Food Court,Restuarants,Cinema Halls and even car showroom.Outside have two shrines similar to Erawan Shrine.At Evening time there are two Beer stations with entertainment.

Best shopping mall. I went to many times when I go to city. So many nice and casual shop,clothes, cosmetics, and shoes in this mall. Very convenient connect to BTS station. I like japanese food, many famous restaurants are there.

Bangkok's Major Centre for Shopping. Most shops here are Brand name shops, with prices to match. Remember Thailand import duty is around 50%, so unless a hefty discount or you live in an expensive city, it is probably cheaper at home.

Luxury shoppe-ing for all of your need.. You can find here almost everything, from low cost to high-end stufffs. One recommend place is the 7th floor supermarket and its surround area. You can shop, eat till drop.

Massive shopping complex. Pretty much anything can be bought here. Designer labels, perfumes, makeup, even expensive cars, etc. Noticeably absent is the fake t-shirts, pirate DVDs, etc. I guess this mall is part of the changing face of Bangkok as affluent Thais and farang tourists shop together as equals. In fact, I think soon the Thais shopping here will be considerably wealthier than the tourists. My suggestion is wear comfortable shoes and expect to spend considerable time looking at the shops. Also have breaks often and take time out to sample some of the delicious cuisine available or to enjoy a tea or coffee. A foot massage after a day in this mall can be a godsend.
great place to shop. a complex of many luxury shops in the middle of Bangkok. very easy to get to via the public transportation system

Nice mall worth a visit . This mall is decent size with good aray of shops and restaurants. Also has a nice set up for Christmas with lights and many x-mas trees. Easy to access from the skytrain. I would say it's worth a visit, they also have a skating rink here with reasonable prices.
Great shopping centre. The highlight for me is the Red Sky Bar on the 55th floor. The most amazing views of Bangkok, happy hour between 4 and 6 pm, 2 for one drinks.

Something for everyone!. Huge shopping complex, with pretty much everything you can think of included. Literally, hundreds of shops and outlets. If anything, Central World is too big and confusing to find your way around. But if you want everything in one place, this is as good as it gets. Prices are good, relative to Siam Paragon and other upscale malls. Loads of places to eat, including many, many Japanese restaurants with very good prices because there is so much competition. Can get a very nice Japanese lunch for only US$5 or so.
a large mall. very diverse but mainly brand names type of shopping mall, so if you are looking for traditional tupe of shops not in this mall

Excellent Mall. I love this place and visit often. They have a great movie theater that is not as packed with customers as the other ones in the area. I also enjoy the wide variety of restaurants and shops. You can spend hours and hours here without getting bored.
Fantastic shopping Centre. This is as good as it gets fabulous stress free shopping including a multitude of restaurants very chic modern and claen
Good shopping. Comparing to the other shopping malls, this one is a good one but expensive. they have provided a good space for the customers and its not crowded.
Excellent place to shop. Firstly it was beautifuly light up and with christmas decor . Inside you will find all the brands one needs.

Very BIG. The biggest Mall in Thailand, really big.
Hundreds of shops and restaurants.
Cinema also
And on top of the Mall , one hotel :
centara grand.
On the rooftop, sky red bar
You can have nice cocktails with 360° view of bangkok !!
Huge!!!!!. You need more than one day to shop. Stunning center easy accessible from BTS etc, Not to be missed and the food court is to die for. A feast for young and old
Consumerism at its best (or worst). If you are looking for a western feeling when shopping this is the place to be. Quite a few higher end product lines that are difficult to find elsewhere.
amazing place. I was amazed by the size of this place, the choices there and how clean the place was. Definitely the place to take the family

Shop, Eat and Click. This is a very good mall if you are looking out for branded shopping, has good food outlets too.
When we visited this mall there was good decorations done. Check pictures.
It is in the heart of the city.
Great Christmas Decorations. Wow!!!! would never imagine a Disney Christmas decoration right in front of Central World mall.... together with year end Beer Festival....

Our favourite mall. We come to this mall mainly for the great value-for-money restaurants. There are abundant choices and great shops to explore. Nothing much to do here except shop, eat and shop some more!
Central World. Fantastic centre to visit shopping here is really good ,,up market with great places to eat,,beautifully decorated and designed

Shop and Sightsee. Quite a marvel of architecture - one might say lots of wasted space but actually a beautiful sight to walk around in, shop, eat, people watch and just enjoy this marvel of design, from water fountains, to decor to Lamborghini displays, you will enjoy time in this location.

Lively place. This mall is very lively and crowded. Many restaurants on almost every floor. The atmosphere there is very good for Christmas. Lots of Christmas decor and outside the mall also many Roadside stalls. Another nice place to shop and dine.
👍👍👍place for shopping. A lot of happenings outside the mall especially after 6pm. Live bands at various drinking joints organised by local beer companies
Amazing mall. The who's who of the designer world is here. Came here and get lost in all you ever wanted and may not really get unless you sell a kidney. I enjoyed walking around here.

Lots of variety. Several visits here showed us that there was a great selection of shops and services. The layout was a bit confusing at first but after a couple of visits it was fairly easy to get around. The idea of whole sections of the mall being dedicated to the same thing was kind of interesting and made it easier to find what we were looking for on any given day.

Christmas gifts. This shopping mall had enough Christmas gifts to more than fullfill our needs. We had to go around for a while to look at all the possibilities and succeded in finding almost all our gifts here.Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.
Nice shopping mall. It is the place you can find anything in it. Now they are having a Christmas tree and something like a mini fun park in front of the mall. Here is already the center of Bangkok!

Mall worth to visit. The top floor of the mall is for restaurant which you can choose any kind of food, western, Thai, Japanese, Chinese and others. Why I should come back here is because they have big Naraya store here....

Shopping mall.... It's a huge shopping mall... what is there to see? Outside is actually a lot more interesting there are some bars including TWO Chiang Beer bars which were playing football (soccer) when I was there.

Very big mall. This mall is HUGE!, I think it would take a few days to go through every shop in this mall. it has everything you need and in the middle of the city. there are many malls close by, but this mall is very convenient because of all the restaurants and all the shops should be located here. many events & attractions will be hosted in front of the building throughout the year, don't miss the largest Christmas tree in Thailand, which will be erected in front of the building during Christmas every year.
Great mall!. I originally went inside to avoid the rain but ended up spending the whole day in this great mall! Absolutely recommended for all!
Enormously Big Shooping Mall. very huge and big shopping mall, consisting of around 10 floors and you can find whatever you need in general
Shopping Mall. Upscale Shopping Mall. Less crowded. Exclusive lines of products. Spacious . Mall has several restaurants and Movie hall too.

everything available. there is nothing you can't get here..except the luxury high-end brands...we love going to Din-tai-fung on the 7th floor and this time we tried The Mango Tree..the best mango sticky rive EVER!!!!!!Montra Spa on the 3rd level..the place to head for great deals on massages and excellent service
nice shopping!. good for shopping, i really like it. not expensive and this is a big mall. you can eat here many resto.

In my opinion it is one of the best, if not the best shopping mall in Bangkok.. You can literally buy anything here, the shops are expensive, but your not buying fake!! The staff can all speak English and are really helpful and even put you in a metercab so you won't have to pay anymore than you should be doing. I love this place, it's definitely my regular shopping mall now.

Not so busy. This big shopping complex is not so busy as the Siam center located next.But there a lot of shops and many offers.Its a little difficult to know where you are since the complex is spread in a strange way.
Wow. This place is massive!!!! Its not the biggest but a great place to kill time and eat. The food selection here is outstanding and it is easy to get there using the BTS.

Big... lots to see ...... lots and lots of people everywhere!!. A great people watching arena! Several times on our trip we visited and day or night it was jammed with people. People were in a buying frenzy! We watched in wonderment. As we were traveling on to other international destinations, we were basically checking out this place out. This was definitely a popular place for the locals to shop.

Looking the christmas decoration. We like to go to central world plaza for their christmas decoration. Especially the outside decoration is always awesome. Last year was the snoopy theme which I liked most this year Dec 2015 is the Disney Theme which is more colourful but not as nice as Snoopy.Currently they have inside some nice deco and a Star War's show.My wife loves to come here to go shopping in the H&M. In general this is a more expensive mall.

Awesome shopping centre..... An awesome shopping experience - the more you spend the better they treat you of course ;)High quality shopping - high prices too.This is not the budget shopping experience in Bangkok but it is the 'best' as far as quality brands and high quality merchandise.

Favorite shopping mall. So many stores to shop i found so many nice clothes at GAP and got 10% discount and then a 1000 baht voucher for spending more then 6500 bath and then taxfree.Although the voucher was only from 7-13 December or something.They have a large grocery store on the 7th floor i think where they sell all kinds of merchandises from around the world.Its on the same floor as all the restaurants.Of all the shopping malls this is the place where we shopped the most and had a positive dining experience on two occations.Also a good hair saloon on the 3 floor called cut and curl.
Luxurious. This is one stop for Luxury goods and do not miss Embassy diplomat screens for 1000 Thai bhat you have a unmatched movie experience

great place to shop and enjoy!. we went to buy and staid for the entertainment in the plaza! t is really a very complete place in which you can find all you need + a great time as we had there with music and lots of happypeople

My new favourite in Bangkok!. This place is AWESOME. Well laid out - recently refurbished so it is really new and modern - and maps are everywhere and easy to follow. Escalators are well placed. Connected to BTS and easily accessible by taxi.There are some pricy designer shops, but on the whole there are lots of shops geared to middle income folks so you can get value for your money. Upscale but not stratospheric.Good selection of eateries that are a great value - it is airy - lots of places to sit . ;o)ZEN department store is terrific. They had a massive sale when we were there and we got some terrific bargains. If you are a big person, you will not find any clothes that will fit you here - but that is pretty well true everywhere in Asia. The largest size that is typically stocked for women is a North American 12. Ditto with men's clothing. Hit the markets if you need larger sizes.
New and Modern Shopping Center. here you can find the best design for shopping, all major brands available but also local specialties and also good food.
big shoping mall. this is close to swiss otel and mrt but expensive and qulity cloths and other things . nice lights and decorations

Great Centre with many options.. As an escape from the Bangkok heat, the enormous Centre is ideal. But the variety of store, eating options, cinemas and the rest are why you can spend hours hear and come back the next day for more. Make sure you find the massive food court on the top floor (?), find out how the cashier system works and then go explore the multitude of tasty and very low cost food options available.

A shopping plaza worth the visit. Central World has many many many shops and outlets to spend your money at. Most places will offer a cheaper price but bartering is not encouraged. Always busy and lots of money exchange vendors so not a problem to change your foreign money for spending. Cash is best.

Great shopping mall. we stayed in the hotel above, so this was ideal for us, very big, huge choice of shops, too many for us to look round, but very clean, and the staff were most helpful, we asked a young security guard for directions and he took us there personally, hope to go back again one day

Excellent shopping and dining experience. This mall has almost anything for everyone, including tourists ,Lots of international and local branded outlets for all type of shoppers. If you are a food fanatics , you will be happy to know you can have a large selection of casual and special restaurants, cafes, dessert and ice creams shops.This mall also has a guarmet market as well.Good place to visit , not too crowded during week days. Easy accessed to public transport .
Nice Shopping Mall with lots of Kids Activities. It's a nice and big shooping mall. Lots of kids activities such as playground. There's also a big food court with lots of yummy food.
Central World Plaza. 7 floor to shopping ,many kind of food and international food like Thai restaurant, Japanese food, Korea style, American style, European style etc.

Central World Plaza in Bangkok. This is one of the many excellent shopping experiences in Bangkok, with every conceivable variety of goods for sale, and many at reasonable prices. Good retail therapy !
Great place for shopping. I love this mall as it has many branded outlets and you can shop till you drop. It also has many food outlets too.

Perhaps the best mall in Bangkok. A good balance of not only luxury shops, but brands that appeal to all. The complete variety of shops that you would need and expect with an excellent supermarket on the top, fantastic places to eat and a great cineplex, too. Easy to reach with public transport.

A western shopping mall. If you want to go shopping in the manner to which you woke be accustomed in the US or UK, then this is one of the places to go - although I prefe Siam Paragon next door. The prices are on a level with the U.K. And there is no bargaining. But they often have discounted areas in the lobbies. Yesterday, oddly but rather nicely, they were celebrating UN Human Rights Day and, in particular LGBT rights. You can find department stores like Isetan as well as international chains, such as H&M.

It is an excellent place to eat and shop. This is a big mall with a good mix of tenants, and many eateries and bid names stores. It is connected to the Chit Lom BTS so the convenience is there. There are a couple of good eateries and dessert stores such as Tonkatsu Wako and After You respectively, and there are currently live bands in the open area in the evenings. It is an excellent place to eat and shop.

Like Waitrose but in Thailand. Although this is very much a shopping emporium for high end fashion shops the food hall in the basement is like a cross between Waitrose and Marks and Spencer which was nice if you fancy a change from typical standard fare.
One of my Must Go place in BKK. This is a one of my must go places in BKK. It's spacious and has all the major international brands, including my favorite Melissa's

Amazing shopping experience. Be careful if travelling with children or a group,, huge shopping center, you might get lost in shopping,, a good tip,, leave your wallet at home,, amazing shops and experience, you won't be disapointed.
just another shopping center you can find in singapore. just another shopping center you can find in singapore, very spacious with no crowd thou =) there is a few central world in bkk

Great location and amazing variety. Central world plaza is one of the newest and biggest malls in Bangkok. It is located very close to the Pratunam area and is also near the Siam areas as well. It has shops of all the leading international brands for clothing, footwear, luggage, sports etc. The best part is the sheer variety of restaurants and the food court. Must visit.

Out shopping and had to visit. This is a high end shopping center, no real deals on most items.We grabbed an ice cream and realized later how over priced it was to shops on the street.If your into high fashion and like to pay a little extra for the air conditioning then this is the place
Good shopping experience. One of many shopping mega malls in Bangkok. Has high end and regular store which makes it more attractive. Easy to get to. Fun place for people watching as well.

Modern shopping mall . Huge cosmopolitan shopping mall with big pricey brand luxury goods. Central world is connected to three other megamalls. A good landmark for bus transport but not a must go to place. Very modern, clean and well air conditioned.
amazing shopping mall. we spent some hours there and its a great shopping mall with a good variety of shops and restaurants
you can spend a whole day here. its 2 department stores connected together, there's lots to shop and lots to eat, there's also a cinema at the top
Great modern shopping experience. We visited here when the Christmas decor was up and it looked magical.The shops were plentiful and the eating places were plentiful.Well worth a visit

Premium brands under one roof - heaven for my wife!. Great place to pop in between the breaks in rain fall. Whilst most shops were completely out of our league, all shops welcomed you in to have a look see and to dream!
Good. For shopping there are also many shops and restaurants. I like to come here and see the art exhibitions and see so many artists from all around the world showing their artworks.

yet another massive mall in Bkk near Erawan Shrine. Easily accessible from Chit Lom station. Sells mid-range to high range goods. huge cinema and lots of casual dining restaurants at the top floor. Shibuya Honey Toast @ After You Dessert Cafe level 7 is a must to try - expect to queue

Nice place to shop. This is really a nice place to shop and hang out. Central world has so many varieties of products you can get. Mainly branded things where you can't find elsewhere. Food shops and restaurants are in so many ranges of cheap to pricey. A must see place for tourists as this has activities in front . Currently awesome beer gardens in December. Enjoy.
great place for food and watches. Many great places for dining and watches on the 4 th floor . Many international brands that make the place brilliant. Don't miss the bar beer in season

Great for quality goods and to refresh . Central world Plaza is a great shopping mall with really nice shops mostly western style shops but also a few Asian style shops on the 6th 7th floor there is a huge amount of different style restaurants to be honest some good some bad some terrible, there is also a cinema complex on the 7th floor it's very reasonably priced I spend a lot of time in BKK and quite often go to the movies there also good to know Wednesday's is discount day, Central world is also very well air conditioned so sometimes it's nice just to take a walk through and cool off ❄️❄️❄️❄️❄️ if you want quality goods then central world is a great place to shop, however it's not cheap but branded goods normally aren't cheep you may find some good deals the prices are probably a little less than UK prices but not much.

Mall for branded shopping, H&M etc. nice place to visit.. I love the Christmas decoration ice skating .. Nice mall for branded shoppingIts awesome in terms of big brands.. crowd was good no cheap stuff

Just a huge Mall. As an explorer I dont quite get the idea so as to what should be so fascinating about milions luxury shops at one place. Yeah its clean. Yeah its huge... but what about some relaxed atmosphere?

Amazing - a Must Do if in the Area. Wow - amazing place, amazing shops, not difficult to find, so much variety, world renowned labels, very popular with people lined up waiting for the doors to open, allow yourself plenty of time to browse - amazing and it takes a while to take it all in.

Too Big to take in.. Great for urban hiking. Not great for value shopping whatsoever. Prices higher than US prices. Grocery store was nice... Food selection for fastish food is great tho. A must do regardless of income level. I bought nothing and enjoyed the mall.
huge mall with lots of expensive shops. huge mall with lots of expensive shops, easy access from BTS. bu not so creative mall just simple place.

fantastic place to visit with a variety of things to do. Brilliant place. Its got great shopping activities, Food courts which have amazing cuisines from all over the world. The outdoor tents serve great beers and live music ambience.
Great place to hang out and have fun.
Brands. Huge mall with good food choice but most of the shops just expensive brand, not much bargains here considering its thailand.
Its so big you would get lost so easily. One of my favourite spot when I was staying in BKK, particularly if you like to shop for scented stuff - my personal favoruite is Karmakamet!

Holy Land!. It is the best time to go to Central world plaza when you want to spend your money on fashion stuff, or eat some delicious food! If you are the one who really like to shop, then you should visit Central World PLaza :D If You Are the one who like to eat food, then you should check out most of the restaurant , especially Yayoi, the service is pretty good and the food is SUPER DELICIOUS, Although i really enjoy shopping, I have to point out that the place may be crowded, if you like to eat, drink coffee and relax then Central World Plaza is the right place where you need to be at! It is really recommended

Visit the Department Store within CW. I went to MBK, Siam and Central World. If you are looking at luxury brands, at similar prices than in Europe, go to Siam Paragon. Else, visit both Department Stores at Central World and Siam, may well worth items at very good prices. For eating I would go to Siam's ground floor, and have a mango dessert on the way at Mango Tango (they dont always have the Mango and Sticky rice though!). Decent mango and sticky rice at Siam too. You can have a full meal for 2 for BH 500
This place is massive!. Be sure to give yourself a day of exploring! Whether you are looking to buy something, or not. There is a lot to see!
It's great. All the best international brands as a great choice of restaurants, in the heart of BKK, easy to find.
Huge with nice brands. Huge mall with a lot of nice shops and restaurants. If you get tired of carrying the shopping bags it is easy to have them stored for you. Wish we had found this mall earlier.

Only good . Fashion wise there are two departmental stores Zen and Isetan, as well as a few luxury retail stores at the first floor. Visit Neraya, the local brand to buy some souvenirs, they are famous for their handcrafted pushes and bags. As for food, there's not much selection. Go somewhere else for food. Overall, this is an average mall and you can pop in for some break if you are outside walking. I prefer the Siam Paragon mall anytime.

What you would expect from a mall!!!!. Very large mall with all name brand stores, located over many floors it's not for the faint hearted, shopping is not cheap at this mall but wouldn't say over the top.
Great food hall with lots of options to choose from, worth a visit but wouldn't go out of my way to visit.

Huge!!! a must see!. This mall is enormous! You can find everything you can imagine in this mall...
Especially luxury brands.
It's really something... even if you don't want to buy anything, it's worth the stop to there even to see the place.

Nice place for some...... Nice place for some air-con breeze!Above average shopping mall with both Zen and Isetan departments stores can be found in there. Plenty of other different brands can be easily located as well, and with many other F&B outlets so making once spoil for choice.Overall, nice place to hang out to enjoy some peace time away from the bustling street.

Very expensive. Real designer shops with set prices and very expensive. Lots of restaurants and easy access from the skytrain. No middle priced shops - shops selling cheap junk on the streets and shopping centres high end international brands.

Whoa...this IS a Mall of Malls!. I am from Dallas TX, where we have soooo many malls, it isn't real. However, this mall puts them all to shame...and I mean it, just soooo much to see & do here, you can eat, watch movies, ice-skate, shop shop shop...eat, shop shop... and just get lost for a while, haha. Great for groups, and it is perfect AC temp any time day/night!!
Perfect shopping centre. You could be in London or NYC, and it will feel the same. Wonderful brands, great coffee and restaurant places.Must visit if in Bangkok
Good for shopping. Many Japanese food shops and market.Fun to have time there with reasonable price for shopping.Good location, Chit Lom BTS station.

Every Mall Brat's Paradise. I am a certified mall brat. Matter of fact, I spent 3 days in BKK exploring its various malls than its famous wats/temples.Just continue walking and you'll find something to buy! :)
Escape from the heat. Honestly, there's not much here that isn't available in practically every major shopping mall in every major city, but it's nice to walk around in after a hot day out.
Puts Bluewater in the shade. One of the main shopping malls in Bangkok - along with MBK and Siam Paragon. A great range of stores, designer and less expensive. Good food halls too and well laid out.

Grand huge luxury mall. Even a full day is less if one has to see this largest luxury mall of Bangkok & do justice to its shops & food. Connected to BTS stations by an elevated walkway, the shopping as well as the dining here is quite an experience in itself. The Zen megastore, the Japanese Isetan store on multiple floors, the magnificent cineplex & the ice skate rink are major attractions, as is the Groove with its cafes & restaurants. Most of the world's leading brands have their big stores here.
Stunning. After a wander around, and up, you can dine in the food hall on the top floor. 250 Bht is plenty for a large lunch
Lots to see and do!. Day = shopping and night = live music. Be sure to stop by the tourist info booth for free wi-fi. Right now you can see one of the four "Journey of 999 elephants" displays
Out of this world. Hundreds of quality shops, fantastic food court and restaurants. Well laid out, spotlessly clean and super value.
recommended. we paid entrance fee550 baht per person.thru travel agency at the lower ground grand diamond suites hotel. we enjoyed the place a lot. it's worth for the price.

Plenty to keep you entertained. I loved Central World Plaza, there was enough to keep me entertained for the day. Many travelers may turn their nose up at shopping at a large mall while visiting Bangkok but air conditioning can offer a welcome relief from the heat outside.
too big to spent a day. if you have more time, no place to go, love shopping. This is the answers. At CTW you can eat, movie, bowling, shopping.

Big mall, not a lot of clothes. Big mall, has many restaurants and a food court. Many movie theaters (they don't allow outside food and drinks unlike most Asian movie theaters :/ ), and shops. Not too many clothing stores like in Terminal 21.

place to shop if.... anyone who would have more THB to dispose of, this is the place to go to. as it is, central world is excellent. from the food court in the basement floor that is of Singapore-style to the shops to the theatres to the food court on the top floor (Salt & Pepper i love the most), everything suits a very discriminating and classy taste.
A boring mall. Just another typical designers mall similar to siam paragon so nothing much to seeJust stay for half an hour Platinum mall which is 5 min walk away is much more to shop

one stop shopping and food. Very big mall in the heart of bangkok town. You'll find almost everything relating to fashion and food here. Lots of branded shops to go to. So make sure your pockets are full. Lol....
Very popular mall. Very average, very popular mall. There do have a great food court, which is worth a visit. They often have interesting musicians or displays.

Great place for easting midday. This has a great deal of places to eat that are safe for foreigners that are shy of eating in local places. Most of the popular western and Asia names are represented. Shopping is also available of course but very expensive compared with local stuff so why would you bother unless named brands are your thing.

Huge mall , free wifi for tourists for one hour , i hoped for more ... Helpful nice people , there are wheelchairs . Nice place to do shopping ...and have a nice bite , ....watch a movie , ware comfortable shoes as the mall is huge with its seven floors

Excellent Shopping!!!!. This is the best mall in Bangkok...centrally located, houses many many brands such as Zara, Forever 21, Mango etc. I visit bangkok every year twice and this is the mall I target first for shopping.....One day is a must since there is so much to see. There are 2 big departmental stores - Zen and Isetan. Zen is the better store with a whole floor dedicated to shoes and handbags. if you use the sky walk, it is a 15 minute walk from Siam Paragon to Central Plaza....it is therefore possible to cover both malls without getting off from the sky walk. Central has some great discounts and caters to all price ranges.....It is a one stop shopping place for all ages. Lots of restaurants too.....a nice way to spend a day....
The biggest indoor market.. Whatever you want would be here 20 times over. Huge market you would need a couple of days to get through. Great shopping

It is Isetan Actually. The locals call it Isetan instead of the original name Central World Plaza. It is huge and in front of it lies the famous Erawan Shrine. Well, it is just another shopping mall in Bangkok like Siam Paragon, Siam Center etc.

Central World Plaza Beer Festival - Much To Noisy. Three groups of senior international visitors gathered in Bangkok on 14 November 2015 especially to enjoy the Central World Plaza Beer Festival.What a serious letdown! We met at the Chang Beer Festival section and with nine of us gathered around two tables we couldn't carry on a conversation with the person beside us, let alone across the table, because the music was deafeningly loud - over 90dBA. Positively painful to seniors ears. Conversation was absolutely impossible! After one drink we all left in disgust and went searching for a restaurant within the Central World Plaza complex. We found a selection of peaceful restaurants on the upper floors that afforded a conducive environment for an enjoyable meal and a drink or two ... in comfort.

Love this place! Amazing food options!. This is my 4th trip to Bangkok and I returned yet again to Central World. Back home in Houston, I studiously avoid malls (especially our Galleria mall) but for some reason, I really enjoy Central World. It is an easy going place with a huge variety of eating establishments to fit all budgets and has great A/C. There are a lot of shops but the prices equal or exceed those back home so I don't buy anything. Basically, Central World is a pleasant place to escape the Bangkok heat and have a great reasonably priced meal!
Great shopping; confusing mall. It is one of the BIG malls of Bangkok, always busy, with tons of shops (not cheap though). However the arrangement of the mall makes it difficult to navigate through.

Huge mall, avoid high heels if you really want a full visit!. Central World is a great mall as it houses so many brands for shopping and restaurants that you are bound to find what you are looking for. Like all giant mall it can be exhausting and time-consuming to reach your shop / restaurant, particularly if you are visiting for a one-stop purchase / meal. Reaching the top floor takes some walking so wear shopping-friendly shoes. I like the new Groove area, which has a lot of interesting cafes & places to eat.

Watched a movie. Watched a movie at the cinema which was an interestj g experience. Great atmosphere on cinema level. Good staff who were able to speak English and assist when required. Overall a pleasant experience with great volumes of coke and popcorn. Cinema aircon was on full blast so please remember to take a jacket so you can keep warm.

great brand of anything. you must pay and buy everything so expensive from your country and their not original brands but you see something with great material and some good paymentdon't forget over 2000 bat have 7% vat refund

Free wifi for tourist. Comfortable and luxury shopping mall. Most of the shop here sell high branded items. But still worth to visit.If you a tourist don't forget bring your passport and ask for free wifi and other tourist benefit at information centre.

A Great Place to Shop for Brand Names and Bargains. I enjoyed immensely my visit to the Central World Plaza. This place has a wonderful selection of stores and restaurants. If you are a bargain shopper - you will enjoy it. Some places are a bit pricy but the quality of their products are first class. The plaza is very clean and the people who work there aim to please.

Central World. Its right the edge of BTS Skytrain line and a 2 minutes walk from Siam BTS. Offers many varieties of stores and i had my fave movie spot here with huge theathers. The ambience was so stunning at evening time. Its located side by side with other shopping centres.

Great to visit and shop to get out from traffic and weather. Large Thai mall with all the expected international brands that typify urban malls nowadays. Make sure you understand it's layout, otherwise you may become a bit disoriented...it's big.

Great Place for Shopping. Were several times in that Shopping Mall and it became our favorit. It not only offers high class brands clothing but also other brands from around Asia or Europe. We especially loved the huge Sports shop which offers everything concerning Sports. The food court is truly amazing, they have great Restaurants and little food booths which offer all kinds of Ice Creams, Crepe, Waffles, Smoothies.....They also offer an Ice Rink in the middle of the Shopping Mall, very impressive!!

Huge shopping centre. High class vendors.. Central world has the title of being one of the largest shopping centres in the world (rank 6 as of writing) and it definitely shows. There were 3 live broadcasts when I visited and an open air (shopping centre) ice skating rink. The shopping was high quality and high priced. If you are looking for branded apparel then central world is a great place to be. As previously mentioned there are plenty of thing to do other than shop. There was a model contest on that I fawned over for about an hour before heading over to iceskating. The ice skating girl must have taken pitty on me for being so uncoordinated as she kept laughing and trying to help. She is a keeper.

Beautiful mall. The mall houses branded retails and restaurants. The restaurants ranges from local to western cuisines. The mall is really big so be careful not to lose one another if you're travelling in a group.
if you like shopping. if you like shopping then this is the best, many floors of shops and a food court if you need a coffee boost
All under one roof. Hotel, grocery store, food, shopping, cinemas. All under one roof. Many of the shops that aren't in Siam paragon are here .... Like Marks & Spencer
Shopping paradise. Shop, eat, watch movies, shop, eat, watch movies. So much choices. No need to get out of shopping complex.
Huge Huge Mall. Huge Huge Mall with lots of food options and acomprehensize supermarket at the top level of Central world plaza. You will find everything and anything here at this super huge mall!
Just another shopping centre. Nothing really worth writing home about. Plenty of shops and places to eat but nothing different to shopping centres back home especially if you live in a big city.

shopping at central world nov15. Shopped many times at Central World on trips to Bangkok and was impressed with this place.It is huge so get ready to do plenty of walking.
Has large stores and countless of small shops which can cater for all of ones needs.
It is close to two BTS stations.
It is a favourite for tourists as well as local shoppers.

High End shopping . This is so called a vocal point of shopping centre in Bangkok. Many events going on at this area. Lots of local and international brands and also foods. It is for convenience only to eat at this place.
Many tourist come here and also youngsters.

Expensive & branded items. If you want to buy expensive & branded items, come here. Many eatery places here where you can try & a cinema here too! Else you can give it a miss if you are looking for cheap items.

Anothere shopping mall in Bangkok. On of the Oldest shopping malls in Bangkok , but its has been renew and its has tow part one called central world , the othere called Zen . there are many shopping stores and restaurants . its Near to other shopping malls as Siam Paragon and Platenium Fashion mall.

Another Large Shopping Center. One of many impressive shopping centres in Bangkok. There is a Movie Theatre, Toys 'R Us and a small supermarket along with a number of technology shops and banks. Layout pretty interesting so make sure you remember where you came in. If you have 4+ people in your car there is dedicated parking right by the lifts for you as well (for car pooling).

Impressive Mall but No Special Store. This mall is very large and has tons of stuff. However, if you are from anywhere with a decent mall, you have access to almost all of this shopping anyway. It does really add alot extra. It's essentially like being any other mall.....just bigger.

Gigantic Mall. It really is a very huge mall. It comprises of 7 floors catering to all the major brands, A shoppers dream. It also has a big food court that has a variety of choices. It is located between 2 BTS train stations so you would have to walk a bit to get to the mall.

This place is huge!. The first time I went here i did get lost.There are so many different sections with different levels to confuse you.But Central World Plaza is a shopping mecca.There are also so many places to eat here.The BTS either Siam or Chitlom stops very close to the Plaza and the is a sky walk to walk along as well.A very enjoyable experience.

Didn't Even Scratch the Surface. This place is huge, and was a great place to wander in to get out of the stifling heat. We went from this huge mall to the huge outdoor Market and back. What a contrast with these polar opposites.

Big branded mall in pratunam. if you looking for branded stuff, just go to central world plaza (walking distance from platinum fashion mall). They have naraya, zara, H&M, forever 21, Zen dept store, isetan and etc and lots of varieties of food at 6th floor.

Bangkok transportation. The BTS is a good way to avaoid the chronic traffic infarct from Bangkok. We mostly buy the day pass for 140 baht. If you go to the taksin station you can buy boat ticket for the boats on the chao phrayo river.
Wonderful shopping complex. Central World Plaza is a wonderful shopping plaza. If you are into shopping you can lost for days in there
Very decent mall. Large mall with quite a few optionsStores are generally organized into themes. [Banks all together, opticians all on the same end]
Its HUge. its a huge mall for shopping i could not finish it one day, if you are in the shopping spree and looking for some brands this is the place to go in bkk.
Yet another shopping mall. Not that interesting- huge, confusing- in the midst of Siam, off the BTS- Western prices and western goods
Mega Mega Store. Zen inside Central World is amazing. There are a lot of nice restaurants and cafe there at the top level. You can find most major brands but Zen will cater to most shopping needs.

Big Mall with lots to do. This is a big mall which is link to Siam Paragon via the sky walk. The atmosphere here is very relaxed with a lot of varieties of shops from high end to mid end. There is an ice skating rink which is a bit wee yet good enough for one who wants to skate for fun.
Great stop to shop. If you go to the mall for some food, shopping, or to beat the heat... This is a nice one. Bangkok has some great malls to relax in between all the sight seeing.
Big so big. This is big shoppingcenter in Bangkok near the streetmarket, you can here buy all you want in any brand, not cheap but it have the brand quality

Great cinema complex and food court. Mid to high end shopping mall that is a very short walk directly above street level from Siam BTS station.Great cinema complex with a multitude of digital formats showing the latest blockbusters such as Spectre in English with Thai subtitles.Also specialises in showing World Cinema. There was a small Spanish film festival on in early November and a larger world film festival is on in the second half of November.Excellent bookstore with lots of English language books on Asian subjects as well as a bright and airy food court.If you are looking for a respite from places like MBK this it.
Everzthing and more. For us this is a shopping center where we can find and buy nearly everything we look for. And inside are also good restaurants.

Huge mall . If you love shopping at the higher end, then this is the place for you. You could easily spend a whole day here, including lunch at one of the many restaurants. They also quite often have something going on out the front, from food markets to concerts.

Shopping at Central World Plaza. We were also recommended to several shopping centers, and decided for Central World Plaza. We found very good selection of shops offering jewelries, clothes, food, movies.We did end up shopping and buying several more clothes and spent the afternoon there before heading back to the hotel.Overall, a very nice shopping complex. Recommended!

Worth spending a couple of hours and have lunch. This is a nice mall, mid high end. Several sporting stores. Get the discount card for foreigners at one of the both inside the mall. We got 10% off for a couple of items we bought. Several restaurant to choose from. The majority of visitors are local so the food price is very good good. It is very easy to get there, just follow Exit 6 from the BTS Siam station.
Large shopping complex. Lots of restaurants. Very spacey, modern and comfortable. Lots of shops for fashion, electronics, cameras etc.

Very Nice Mall. This is where you ill find the High Value Branded products where you cannot barter!; a good place to browse in the cool therefore if you are after branded products this is the place to go.

Still a great place to shop, eat, and relax. . I've seen this place in many incarnations over the last 20 years. Still a great place to eat, shop, and spend the day. Excellent choice of restaurants, great cinema with a variety of movies (even the odd indie film), and a wide variety of shops for tourists and locals.

mid-high mall. it's not as rowdy as platinum, it's also less crowded. situated between chid lom / phloen chit, central world makes a good stop over. had lunch and a hair cut (lv 3 cut & curl <- pretty good) walked the entire platinum/pratunam area and couldn't find a decent salon, so this one's pretty good :) couple of good thai restaurants at level 3 too :)

Good shopping. Central mall is located next to Siam Paragon. It's a huge multi-level shopping mall with good brands/shops and food options. Easily accessible by BTS so definitely drop in to at least marvel at the sheer size of it.

Time for shop till drop. Many int'l brands located in here, some that hard to find in other shopping arcades like in Siam Paragon & Emporium. Love to sip a cup of TWG tea at the lobby lounge of the tea's connoisseur place as well.
Huge mall with great food court. Worth visiting if you want to experience a massive mall - if not, you're probably just as well visiting any of the local markets for souvenirs
The best in BKK. Defenetly the best and most complete mall in BKK..easy access and it has all what you need and even more.

Absolute must visit! . Now this is one mall that offers something for everybody.. be it middle class or serious shoppers.. There's Calvin Klein & jaspal for some great stuff and Naraya on the ground floor (must visit) for great bags, wallets and utility cases.. There's another store for bags called 'bags for all occasions' or something like that.. Even that's worth checking out.. All in all a must visit in Bangkok!

Central World Bangkol is a fun Place to go for everybody.. This was a fun place to zoom around after a long day walking around Bangkok. Great shopping mall and many restaurants to chose from. We had a lot of fun at this mall.

Shopping Area and Dining Area in BKK. large department store in BKK, convenience because of connected to BTS station. Inside you can shopping or dinning. There are International Food; Chinese, Thai, Japan also many of dessert shop.
place to visit. nice shopping center, but one day is not enough to properly go through all the stores. it was easy to navigate from section to section on different levels in this center
Good shopping and decent dining. Huge centre with almost everything you might need or want. Good selection of F&B outlets. Too bad there's no al fresco outlets to chill out and have a puff....

Nice Mall and VERY BIG. BIG MALL and you can't visit all the stores unless you have the whole week in bangkok. If you have time then you can get around to see other interesting stores. We were only here for 2 Days then we went to Phuket. But all in all Bangkok is a very nice town and lots of things to see. I would recommend that you only do 2 - 3 days here and continue the journey as there are other nice places to see in other towns

What a wonderful World. This shopping paradise is linked from Siam Paragon via the overhead pedestrain walkway which is directly under the rail track. How convenient!Here, you have Isetan and Zen stores. There is also a skating rink.
Nice big mall. Nice big mall but prices went up the last three years so usually didn't find any special deals.Don't forget to take turist discount card at the information dest on first floor.

Great Movie Theatre and shopping. This is so easy to maneuver, everything is easy to see. The movie theatre is so much fun. The bakery and food on the top floor, include cold pressed juice and many treats.

Huge Shopping Mall with good brand names. This is a 7 storey shopping mall in the heart of Bangkok's shopping district. It has big names like Prada, Chanel, Louis Vuitton, and many more. There's good restaurants on the top floor and an ice-skating rink on the ground level. The Zen department store takes up 7 floors.
Large and spacious. I would say the best mall we visited, reasonably priced shops and better prices than some of the other malls we visited. Food court had a variety of authentic dishes to taste.
Its huge!. A very, very big mall! It has everything from clothes to a movie theater. The prices is okey and there is a lot to chose from, only 7 stories of stores ;)

A huge american styled mall. Very high end products with prices to match. But it was a good to see the cheap shopping in comparison to the expensive. A great place to cool down especially when you are walking around in the heat.

Huge mall. What a massive shopping mall, full of high end designer shops. We spent a morning here and didn't really see a third of the shops. Lovely to browse, but not sure that the prices are any cheaper than in England.
Best an biggest. This mall got it all and it's huge! From bts either side you need to take a walk on the Skywalk to get there, it's hot but great to see more of bkk.

The highlight of every trip I take to Bangkok. When it rains in Bangkok, or when you've had enough of the heat, Central World is THE place to be. There are a zillion food options, ranging from fine Japanese dining to street vendors immediately outside the mall to a bevy of ice cream shops within the mall (shoutout to Dairy Queen's Nutella & banana Blizzard in a waffle cone). I don't think anyone actually buys anything from here; they just walk around, hang with friends, and go the AIS store to check one's mobile phone data plans.

Nice with great access from the BTS. Very nice but typical plaza with lots of stores selling ridiculously expensive brand name merchandise which no one buys. The centre is a hangout for teenagers. The food court is decent.

Very Expensive. A beautiful, stress free shopping centre for brand name equipment and clothing. BUT....You might as well have purchased it in Sydney, Australia or New York or where ever you most expensive shops are in your home country. True brand names ??????????????????????? not much to say on that but some very good gear. If you smoke Cigars this is one of the only places in Thailand you will find a decent Cigar, so buy them here before you adventure anywhere else in Thailand as once you leave that's it...A relative of mine purchased original Nike Air shoes ( very nice ) but latter found them cheaper in Australia.. Told her so. Sorry Carly. All in all, each to there own......

Gigantic Mall. It's located near the Chit Lom BTS station. A very huge mall that you will not miss. A lot of small shops inside selling music cds, some computer accessories, phone and accessories, ladies and gentlemen wares etc..etc.. of course there are a variety of restaurants too. It could take you the whole day just in Central World Plaza.

Great location and huge mall. It is located next to siam bts station.Compared with siam paragon, I like paragon more.However, it provides you other choices of shopping products.Big c, siam paragon and central world are just next to each other. For big fans of shopping, you may need more than a day in there.
Shop til you drop!. Very big shopping mall, of course you could find everything here!But because it is very big, sometimes too big it is quite hard to find the particular shop you are looking for.
Nice shoping place. Nice shopping mal. Near to food center around. It's a big shopping mall. Great to visit with family.

Umm, yep, another big Bangkok shopping Mall. Maybe I'm jaded by the abundance of shopping malls in Bangkok or because I'm a guy :)Central World Plaza is BIG. Like most Centrals, it has a good layout unlike Terminal 21If you've got a wife or girlfriend and you're ok with shopping and browsing, you'll have a great time as there's bucket loads of shops of every variety.I enjoyed my time here but it is just a shopping mall. Have fun
good mall. this mall is very nice, very big and you can found many international brand, is very easy to arrive there by btw

You will definitely get lost in this mall!!!. This mall has to be the largest in Bangkok. The layout is poorly planned as it is not easily navigated. As a result, I stay away from this mall. However, it does have good sporting goods, and a five star cinema on the top floor. If you want a better shopping experience in my humble opinion, I would suggest nearby Siam Paragon, or MBK. My favorite mall in Bangkok is Terminal 21 located at the Asoke BTS station.

Couldn't see it all in one day!. This mall is so huge! I come from a big city so the many shops there I can shop at in the states but still the place is huge, the top floor has an awesome food court, must see.

THE shopping mall in Bangkok. We went to Central on our last day and wished we had come here earlier. It has all the high street brands you can think of - more than that the range of the shops here like H&M, Uniqlo, etc was more than any of their other stores we had visited in Bangkok. The food court on the top floor is also great with huge variety. If you don't have a lot of days in Bangkok you can start and finish your shopping in this mall.

No longer the best in bkk.. BIG spaces all round... a bit tire to walk around, after the reno it get bigger but not necessary better, seen to have problem attracting good tenants.. Anchor tenant Isetan has seen better days! Overall still an iconic place worth visiting, brands have bigger shop space for more complete display.. a good thing for shopper. not very crowded now... lost big chunk of the crowd to Siam Paragon which is currently THE place to be!!
Fun Shopping. It is a great place to shop, many stores with great offers, lovely environment and amazing deals are available.
Biggest of them all!. So many malls in BKK but this is the biggest of them all I believe. Has everything, most brands, you can loose yourself for a whole day!
Great Shopping. Good shopping at this centre with Zen department store being the major store. Quality items priced accordingly.

Great shopping.. Just opposite Big C supercenter. Had a concert when i visited which was very nice. The shops there are expensive but you are almost guaranteed original products instead of fakes which can be easily found in the pratunam market. The cinema is also very nice. Food was also great. We had dessert at the Haagen Dazs and it was absolutely delicious.There is also a toy r us inside :)
Best place for shopping in bangkok. If you love shopping, buy clothes , bags & shoes ... This place is yours , Must visit shopping complex in bangkok

One of the nicer shopping malls. Huge shopping mall in the center of Bangkok. Usually not so crowded like the Siam Paragon. Nice variety of shops, restaurants and cinemas. Uniqlo and Zen are among the anchor stores.
Best venue for upmarket shopping. Variety and class of stores beats Siam Centre and MBK any day; great atmosphere and very friendly and helpful sales assistants all round

Huge Classy Expensive. Huge and Neat. Few outlets had big Sales although nothing attracted me to buy. It has branded outlets, expensive stuff. Didn't spend much time since I was made aware lot of cheap and good quality stuff is available elsewhere. But the Mall is good for Window shopping and to spend few hours if big malls are new things to you. Else its just another Big Mall.

Great Place to eat. I'm not much of a shopper but i found Central World Plaza had a great selection of medium to high end places to eat. A number of Tripadvisors top 2014 restaurants are located on the 4th floor. CWP is easy to get to via the BTS sky train. Exit Chit Lom station.
Everything you need. If you are looking for genuine products then you will find anything and everything in this huge mall

A very big and comprehensive mall. This is a humungous mall housing many local and International brands and different kinds of items. I am always able to buy clothes, household appliances, books, Japanese grocery and many other items during the same visit, which makes it very convenient.After shopping, you can have a nice meal here as there are a large selection of dining outlets serving different kinds of cuisine. The recent addition of the Groove section, which consists of hip restaurants and drinking joints, made this place even more lively.The downside is that the mall is very huge, so it takes a lot walking to find the different shops. Furthermore, as many people drive here, it is quite difficult to find a parking lot, even though they have a huge parking lot.

Relaxing time for ladyes.. Of caurse that is not the museum to tell long story... But very nice place to visit especially for ladyes. Big, clean< a lot of goods to buy or to see. I like shoping in Asia because You find a lot of staff from Europe and US at the same time. And many pleasent places to have coffee or some snacks.

Big Mall! Very big mall.. Central World could be anywhere in the world. It is a big mall in downtown, with all the stores you would know from anywhere else in the world. Just more of them than you would find in most locations. They burned it down in the riots of 2010, but it has since been redone, bigger and better than ever. Bring your credit card.
Another huge mall in bangkok.. Great choices in clothing, both known brands and cheaper selections. Also offers a wide variety of resturants.
Best Area shopping center in bangkok. This is second best shopping center in Bangkok where you can find all the international brands and even local one but the promotion are not so much available
Very good sized mall. Fantastic variety of shops ranging from designer stores to mid range stores. The upper floors offer a collection restaurants.

Huge shopping mall but not cheaper than UK. This is a HUGE shopping mall, it's the biggest in Thailand. If you are a shopaholic you should go here.. But it wasn't any cheaper than it would be at home (England). Not really sure how it works or whether it was because of the exchange rate.. Both of us came out empty handed!
Nice Mall. Good to shopping who love shopping. All shop have reasonable price and quality also nice. You can choice whatever you like.
mall with lots of variety. They even have a cinema there and many shops!! Lots of food there!! This is a must-go spot for tourists!!
Normal European Shopping Mall. Easy to get to from any where in Bangkok. It's is stunning to see for the first time but after that it's a 'been there done it' thing.

Many food options. A huge modern mall which contains many up market shops and department stores. It is not cheap but there are a large variety of stores. The best thing for us here though is the many options for eating on the two top floors with reasonably priced to your more expensive options. At the ground floor level at the back of the mall is a decent size area with a number of nice bars which are not that easy to find in Pratunum .

Huge Shopping Mall. it is excellent for shopping mall . this is the centred city mall.You can spend a day to walk through the entire mall. Foods drinks and all necessaries.there were many hotels close to this mall.

Massive Mall. Have been here before in 2010 and 2012 and it was pretty spectacular then, certainly in 2012 as the ice skating rink was put in before then. There seems to have been a massive extension and they are refurbishing the older part though it easy to get confused as one shopping complex seems to merge Ito another around Siam/Chit Lom BTS stations.. I went looking for one particular item and eventually found it at a reasonable price but overall it is a very expensive complex. You need a map but you will still likely get lost as it is not set out in a conventional pattern and it is a huge floor space spread out over multiple floors.
visiting the Central world Plaza. excellent for shopping even though a bit expensive has lots of shopping and eating places no train available has to use a cab

Good array of branded stuff. If you're looking to buy some tier-1 branded stuff, the cluster of malls around the Siam Central BTS is the place to go. Central World houses brands which are mid-range and not too premium or exclusive. You will find great deals on cosmetics, perfumes and garments. There's a VAT for Tourist claim counter on 6th Floor that's generally very busy. You will also find various tourist discounts against a paper-based tourist card (made free on request).

Huge Connected Shopping Mall. This is the centred city mall. You can spend a day to walk through the entire mall. Foods drinks and all necessities can be found here. The flyover connected this mall to all other major shopping centres and hotels.

giant shopping mall. Pretty big shopping mall in very centre of city. There is a hotel inside and open food street very close. So many stores.
