You can find cheap hi-tech items in some stores.Go activities sometimes. Upper floors have so many stores that has different cousine. You can find any cousine in mall
Too god to be true!. This place is marvalues! Amazing and super cheap restaurants. all the shops you can imagine are at the central world. I wish i could live there hahaha....
Shopping experience in Thailand. walking distance from the BTS station, the central world comprise of all the brand under one hood. Always check for discounts at ZEN.
One of the best. Must see if you come to Bangkok before you go out to see the country of Thailand and other places in asia

A Fantastic day out shopping in a great centre in Bangkok in Thailand. One of the most busy shopping centres I have ever been to in my entire life seven floors of shopping , restaurants children activities ice-skating, bowling and the movies etc. love the food court so much delicious items to choose from with great prices we all had a very enjoyable day in Bangkok and spend quite a lot of money at the same time.
Nice Shopping Centre. Central has good shopping mall across Thailand. This is one of the best mall and definitely better than Emporium. The mix and pricing are good .
Big shopping mall. Nothing unique or special. This is a big shopping mall. Lots of restaurants and stores and a movie theater.
Varieties of shops and restaurants. Have lots of shops and restaurants. Recommended restaurant is Lam Charoen Seafood. Cinema is on the top floor of the mall.
Huge complete mall. Gigantic malls with all the stores you could possibly need. Standouts are the Japanese store Isetan and the food court. Quite downscale compared to Siam Paragon though

Big and convenient shopping mall in the central of Bangkok. It's big and so convenient especially if you are Japanese or would like to buy some stuff from Japan. There's another shop next to Central World Plaza called Isetan.Due to its size, there are not so crowded inside. There are so many interesting restaurant where you can taste some nice food on the 6th and 7th Floor.This shopping mall is up to the international standard of the shopping mall. You can find the thing you want to buy so easy. In front of Central World, they usually have a concert; sometimes free sometimes not. It's one of an enormous place for count down to new year period and of course Oktoberfest.
All the brands. We found all the major brands and more here. Not really somewhere to find big discounts but an amazing shopping experience anyway.

Have all you want. If you only want to visit one shopping mall in Bangkok, this is probably the one you should go.You will be able to find whatever you want in a shopping mall, of course, the price of products will be higher compare to night market, but air conditioning is very important here in Bangkok. But one bad thing is that I revisited like 2 years from my first visit, things didn't really change much, the mall should find some new shops in order to keep the momentum of the attraction.
Huge mall. Spent a day here. This mall is huge. Great choices of both stores and dining.The mall is located beside the other huge malls in the Siam area.

The biggest shopping mall I have ever seen. I have been to Thailand many times and when I was younger I was always impressed by how large all the shopping malls were. As a grown up today, I was completely amazed by how big Central World Plaza were. We walked around for hours and visited store after store. For someone with a somewhat strained budget, I would recommend this mall before all the other high end shopping malls. For a casual strole during the day, this mall is great to visit!

business trip to Bangkok. Central World Plaza is easily accessible by BTS and shopping and restaurants are aplenty. Good place to unwind after a busy day and the Plaza is also in close proximity to Platinum fashion mall and Paragon shopping mall.

A 5 star shopping. In the centre of Bangkok city, Rachadamri Str. this is one of high class malls concentrated in this street. You will find here world's top fashion and goods. Not for low or medium class shoppers but worth visiting

Wonder world. Central World Plaza is shopper's paradise. We love going there because of its space, dazzling outlook, beautiful shops and availability of good. Though the prices are a bit higher than other shopping malls, but everything has a price for it. The decor, the convenient steps to shop around are quite handy. Customer services are there. Most of the staff now speak English. So, it is fun. They change the Decors too every now and then. There are plenty of good restaurants, movie theaters and innumerable shops.

VERY upscale mall with amazing food on lower level. The mall is mostly full of luxury brands I am not in the market for, but if you go down to the lower level you will find yourself in the most remarkable food court you've ever seen. It goes on and on and on with Thai and other Asian specialties as well as excellent Western foods and, of course, a Starbucks.
Another shopping and business place in Bangkok. One should visit here for good shopping and also try platinum fashion mall and adjoining area with cheaper prices and good quality shopping.

big moll ,with many famuse departmet stores,sentraly located.. in the front the worship for Ganessa -the ellefent god.in the billdinings many shick department stors.floor 4 and 5 -food ,the 6 is cinemas.Central and Zen connected.
sky train chitlom,and all buses to Pratunam.
Just like any other shopping mall. It is just like any other shopping mall...Visit this mall if you are interested in shopping...easily accesable from near by BTS station
Massive -- use maps!. huge. Look up the stores online first, and then consider where to go. Can easily get lost! But has almost all the shops you would need under one roof.

We need malls like this in the US. Crazy huge mall slash city. Great food options and all sorts of fancy shopping. When we visited it was 2 weeks after the Erawan shrine bombing which is exactly outside the corner of this mall. It was all cleaned up and security was making a show. There are better malls in Bangkok believe it or not, but you can walk to them from here.

Huge, price-wise similar to europe. Central world is one of the huge shopping centres in Bangkok. Here you can find a lot of international brands, but price-wise not really cheaper than back home.This centre is clean and you won't get as easily lost as in the MBK. You can find most shops quite easily and if not - there's always someone you can ask.When it's raining, it's perfect to roam through the shopping centres!
All in one clean and nice place. Central World is a huge mall with 7 floors, you can do shopping, and have the best food in town. It's also well connected with shy train.l
Shopping . Have big ice skate and have many restaurant.can come by bts siam.not far from siam paragon and pantip plaza and pratunam.
Fashion Paradise for Shoppaholic. A fanciest paradise for shoppers.You can buy the latest fashion trends, makeup and everything you want you can get there.
It's huge!. A huge shopping center. Many different shops, a big food court and a cinema.If you tiered from the bargaining on the markets it's a nice place for a different Bangkok.

Lovely shopping Centre. A lovely mall to shop and pass time. The stores are so much nicer than the market but substantially more expensive. The staff were very friendly, unlike the markets. All the brands you can think of under one really high roof, 6 or 7 floors of shopping. Free wifi for about an hour. Worth a visit. Keep your passport handy for wifi and vat reclaim docs.
This is huge!. Fantastic!! I love this shopping complex. One of the Central group chains. Shopping, dine, or movie, the place has them all.
Shopping. I loved this place. I like to go buy my Benjaron vases there. They have lots of traditional Thai decorations there if you want to shop something for your home.
Central world . I love central world! Everything here is very good and everything are brands and expensive😃👍. When people go there, people want to bought something on here.

Great shopping and entertainment space.. Posh and elegant the Central Plaza is a city within the space.consisting of shopping centres, food courts cinemas and entertainments. Most of the top brands are seen here and ample choice for shoppers..
Ice Skating in Asia?!. Beautiful modern mall with a ton of stuff going on. We had terrible weather in Bangkok and walking around Central World was a great thing to do. We even went ice skating!

Huge shopping centre with 7 levels of shopping. This shopping centre is in the centre of bangkok which is so big that it has two anchor tenants, Isetan of Japan and Zen of thailand. Level 6 and 7 have many types of restuarants to accomodate different budgets and tastes. I took us 1/4 of a day to cover all the 7 levels as it was so huge.

Great shopping in Bangkok. This huge shopping centre has everything in it! I took quite a few trips to these shops to see movies, to have meals, to look at all the international brands. One day I even participated in a racing video game competition for free, I could imagine there would be activities like this in these shops all the time. This was an amazing centre and I'll definitely be going back.

Fabulously clean, large & easily located mall. Easy to get to on BTS! Sooo many brand name shops available!! Had expected (assumed ) I'd not find anything to fit this caucasian butt - but I was wrong! Both H&M and Zen had clothing options that fit me (in Zen it was Juicy Couture) - so that was a trifle exciting!! Will go back, but with more petty cash as the shops really are mostly high end!

over sized,.... this is a huge place with not that much of an order,... I am not an avid shopper and this was not fun for me,... didn't see any area designed for resting,... the upper floor had an amazing variety of food,... it was mid range to pricier shops,... could be really fun for people who like to lose a day completely in a mall,...

Great Shopping. This is a huge shopping mall conveniently connected to surrounding hotels and mall via covered walk ways. May get a little confusing because of its size. And fairly easy to lose your friends amidst the shopping. This place is a little more upscale than MBK and definitely pricier than the night markets but offers the convenience of an air conditioned mall.This place is a must visit area in Bangkok.
There is nothing called too much shopping!!. This mall is huge, lot of stores, lot of variety, little too easy to get lost though lol. Having said that, its pretty lively.

A bit easier to your eyes than the MBK. This is one of the oldest shopping malls which has been renovated recently. You would find this more pleasant and a bit classier than the MBK. It has many good restaurants, a big supermarket and a cinema so you can spend all day there if you wish. It's better to get off at Siam station and use sky walk which connect directly to the Central World Plaza.

My favorite Bangkok mall so far!. I've visited a few malls in Bangkok since moving here in August. I liked this one the best. For me, it was the affordability of the products. Plus, they have an H&M and a Forever 21 like in the US. I was looking for some bedding and had visited Emporium Mall but the prices were really high there. I went to the Zen department store and found what I needed at a good price. This mall has tons of food options! There is a Toys-R-Us there that is pretty big in size.

Nice and Big. Nice, plush mall. Lots of merchandise to peruse through. The movie theaters are nice. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from. They range from fast food and cafes to higher end Japanese restaurants.

Big mall with great food court!. Among the malls I've been to in Bangkok, this is my favorite! It has favorites brands and stores in one mall. I love their food choices at the food court on the top floor. Not crowded! Plus, they have Sephora!

Loved the Central World. Centrally located - so Central World. And indeed it's a world of shopping waiting for you. Whatever you want, be it the stylish and designer clothing, then accessories to your watches, to your shoes and everything. It does not end here. Gives you all the choices that you can think of from the world of cuisine.
Must visit for shopping lovers.. Its a largest mall selling branded and unbranded goods. Centrally located having very large convention centre and also a 5 Star hotel.

Amazing Place. We walked around the pattaya beach and spent our day in Central World Plaza... Very big n wonderful; variety of brand n products... Restaurnats n game centres..awesome; we had a guide from thailand so he helped us to translate in many places. One of my friends took some photos also.

One stop shop!. I love Central World! It has everything you need; Uniqlo, Gap, Sports stores, shoe stores and a whole floor of electronics. You can find things that are high end and affordable. It is not quite Siam Paragon, but not MBK - it's just perfect!
Waste of time. Boring. This us Hugh end shopping and unless you want to spend big bucks, give the place a minus. Plenty of better shopping near by

A very large shopping complex. many stories of shopping on offer. Many of,the big name shops are on offer here, including also, cinemas, Toys R us and food outlets. Fully air conditioned and easy to wander around. Security and bag checks are at front gates and also on each entrance door.

AWESOME wORLD!. great place to eat,dine and shop
excellent cineplex with latest blockbusters are shown here
as the name goes central world, the world is here!

Ready your wallet. Central shopping centers are located throughout Thailand, but they go above and beyond in BKK. All of the major retailers are there. High end abounds and also has Starbucks and a few of the other coffee/restaurant chains. It is easy to spend a few hours at Central World.

Big, and I mean BIG. You'll find almost anything in Central World Plaza shopping mall. We spent half a day here shopping for clothes and some electronics. Nothing special apart from being big and being located perfectly in Bangkok.
The best shopping mall in Asia. Every time when I go to Bangkok, I will go shopping there, it's big, clean, and comfortable to shop there. And many international brands and local brands there.
Shopping at heart. Biggest shopping more at the heart of Bangkok. You can spend half day here if you can find nothing else to do. Keep walking

One of the newer shopping Malls with High Class shops. CentralWorld is a shopping plaza and complex in Bangkok, and one of the largest shopping complex in the world. The complex, includes a hotel and office tower.It is larger then then the nearby rival Siam Paragon in terms of size.On 19 May 2010, CentralWorld was one of the many properties set on fire when the Red Shirts anti-government protesters were forcibly removed after months of demonstrations which included complete blockage of the Rachaprasong shopping district. The parts of the complex most affected were the Zen department store and its adjacent annex. With the recent bom explosion, security measures are high, but do not interfere with the visit..

Another mall. Shop till u drop.....A really nice mall to shop at. But,let's face it Most the malls are wonderful as well as the shopping.Be careful u will need a extra bag when u go home and, that will cost you dearly.
Awesome mall. awesome mall with many brands and excellent food court. Has all the top brands and there were many sales when I visited.

Around trip in Central World Plaza, #Bangkok. Very nice to look around. But you must have a big full wallet. Some articles to expensive. We show some customers Bangkok, and a part was this shopping center.Is great to sit on the ground floor in one of the restaurants.The most people don't know that Google also sit in the Central World Tower.

Nice way to travel a few blocks in Bangkok. Loved the airiness cleanliness and high end shops. Didn't see many people purchasing items. We had afternoon tea at Harrods and were horrified at what we were charged. It was explained that in addition to service charge and VAT they had to charge similar prices to Harrods in England. Nice tearooms and outlook, view etc.

The best mall ever. This is my most recommence mall in Bangkok. This place isn't too crowded and have more than hundred shops there. The only thing that make this place not so perfect is transportation. Even though you can take BTS but you still have to walk about 400 maters.

Huge mall with tons of great shopping and good food!. This is a huge mall that you can explore for 2 days or more. There are two departmental stores, Isetan and Zen for general shopping, and a really good dining area. I highly recommend Taling Pling restaurant (traditional thai food), The Pizza Company, and Chabuton ramen (Japanese). There is a nice movie theatre and huge supermarket available too. I visit this place every time I visit Bangkok!
Big Mall!!!. Big Mall in BKK with lot of amenities, shops. Need nearly 1 day to completely visit all the shops!!!
Much the same as any other shopping center.. So many shops - but much like any shopping center in the world. Clean and easily accessed. I preferred the markets!
Best mall. This mall is the ultimate shopping experience. Every shop you can imagine and more. And great choice of food including tasty cheap food court.
Disappointing. Was a little disappointed with this shopping centre. Seems to have no atmosphere. Zen shopping centre next door much better.
Excellent Shopping Centre. Massive Shopping centre, all kinds of shops, cheap and expensive ones. If you can't find what you want in this shopping centre.
shopping at its best. there is loads shops food places and is great little visit for shoping, toilets easy access and help avialable all times, recommend visit especialy you like shopping

Big Naraya shop here!!. For those Naraya fans, Central World has one of the biggest Naraya outlet here. There are many other shops from various imported brands. It's worth the visit if it's your first time to bangkok.
Complete and in central area. In central world plaza you can find hundreds of shops from all over the world and restaurants. Should go!

Huge mall. All the name brands.. Great place if you want to spend a lot of money.. This immense mall is almost tiring for being so large and confusing, but it contains all of the name brands that you could possibly imagine. Most interesting is the top floor restaurant and food area, with lots of selection and a wide variety of eats. There's also a great bookstore and one of the several outlets of the Japanese burger chain MOS Burger. The place is great for the air conditioning if nothing else.

Bring a compass and a water flask.... The shopping centres in Thailand can numb the brain. The Mall, Future Park, Paragon, MBK to name a few but this place is scary. It is huge and is a flow on from the Old Grandma Central Chitlom to Central Embassy and Central World. There are an amazing variety of shops and eateries. You really need to spend hours in the place to cover every store in the complex. As far as eateries, they can be as simple as a doughnut stand to an upmarket "Please Jeeves" Japanese restaurant. These centres no longer the cheapy cheapy deals of Old Bangkok but you. An still get bargains with in-house brands at Zen for example offering 10-20-30 plus per cent off. So shop around but be prepared to be lost.

Grand Shopping in Bangkok. It's best place to shopping in Bangkok. It's a amazing mall called as central world. I think it's biggest mall in Bangkok compare to other. Must visit to mall for fancy item shopping.

The Centre of the Bangkok Shopping World!. The most amazing Shopping mall in Bangkok! The numerous designer labels offer a host of varying options to indulge in...A must visit mall, even if all that you fancy is a bit of window shopping.

Best shopping center in bkk. Lost of restaurants, lots of shop. Can walk from bts sky train. Center of bankok. Popular for local and tourist. You can come for lunch, dinner, shopping or buy some souvenir. Have big supermarket. I recommend.
hot day. after some days around the city on a hotty day we decided to got some shopping....good place to past yor time in a big mall. a lot of luxury stores with excelent stuff.. i like this place

Mid range price shopping center in Bangkok. Central World Plaza is one of the biggest shopping center in Bangkok which offers a wide range of goods, mostly clothing and accessories. The price is usually mid range.
Amazing Mall and plenty of Restaurants to choose from!!!. Beautiful shopping mall with 7 floors of restaurants. Perfect for a rainy day. an afternoon of shopping and dinner.Very very nice.

Big mall near the city center. In terms of how big a mall is, I'd say this is the biggest mall (of the ones I've been to anyway). They have a whole range of stores as well as a department store, 6 floors of good stuff. A really good place to go to. This is easily accessible by the train system.Don't forget to get a tourist wifi code at the information center. They'll also give you a discount card that you can use in their Zen department store and some other stores. You can get a VAT refund for some of the items that you buy.

Terrific shopping mall in a great location. Central World Plaza is a huge shopping mall. I like it as it has my favorite shops - Uniqlo and Ecco Shoes. If you only have a half-day in Bangkok, spend in in Central World.

Huge!. Huge Mall - top floor is not really what we as tourists would go for but alot of normal uk stores and then a mix of thai stores and wee stalls in the middle for cheap bargains. Mega air conned too which is a blessing

Huge Mall, no real deals.... Huge, really huge. Lots to look at though pricing was not what I had hoped. I didn't buy much of anything but I did eat quite a bit at the two floors of food. Don't go if you are just looking for a bargain- go if you want to feel what the mall feels like in Bangkok, Thailand- go for Mall food and ambiance.
August 2015. This is a great modern shopping complex right near the BTS. The shops are modern & the range of on offer is huge. If you go, don't miss having a cuppa & scones from Twinings Tea House.
BIG. A lot of shops. Here you can get everything, and at a more responsable price than many of the near by centers. Also a cinema.

Good shopping mall. I already visited this mall over 4 times, when I 'm stay in Bangkok,I also like stay there. It have many shops and restaurants, and I can 拜象神。It 's comfortable and nice place for me stay there.

Food, shopping and fun at its best. I visit Central World Plaza on a weekly basis and enjoy the food and fun. The upscale market is especially nice with all the delights of asia and europe. The bakeries are fantastic. I usually have dinner at one of the many Japanese or Chinese restaurants, but Thai and western food is readily available. The food court is very upscale with a price to match, so I skip it. They have one of the best movie theaters with all the latest movies. BTS access is easy from the skywalk.
friendly place. good location and variety goods for tourists. easy to locate and friendly shopping expeirence. stop over everytime when i visited bangkon.
Shop Shop Shop. International High Street brands represented in this huge and beautiful mall, nearby Siam Paragon and a few others.
Good. The shopping is quite good and offers a lot of variety. There are some good restaurants also. Easy connectivity is a bonus.
Shopping heaven. Very nice place to do shopping. Its huge with lots famous brands. Easy access. Great way to spend at least 3-4 hours

Central World/Zen/Isetan. This used to be a row of 3 storey shop houses about 25 years ago, when they were demolished, World Trade Centre was the biggest shopping mall in central Bangkok. Still widely known as "World Trade", you hear the public bus announce this as they negotiate the traffic to try and stop somewhere near the bus stop.They changed the name to Central World after The Paragon started to steal all the customers, and they embarked on refurbishment and expansion.The main improvement was the removal of the dark floor tiles, replacing them with white which gave the whole place a lift. Previously it was dark and forbidding inside, now it’s light and airy.Almost double the original size, it is easier to negotiate than The Paragon, but has everything you could ever need. Zen is the upmarket brand of Central Department Stores, and has many sale bargains. Isetan, although staffed by Thais, has the air of a Japanese department store about it and has many unique Japanese product lines.Some thought has gone into the layout of Central World, with similar retailers on specific floors, the higher floors are mainly food retailers, restaurants, fast food, buffets etc.Plenty of lifts and escalators and fairly easy to navigate, which is something you can’t say about The Paragon.Groove is a new addition, behind Zen, it is a complex of bars and restaurants where you can find fine food and imported beers – not cheap, but a good people watching place. My favourite is Hyde & Seek, very good food with international wines and beers.Also part of the complex is the Centara Hotel, a very good evening and lunchtime buffet here, varying themes. One night is Argentinian Steak night with free flow wine and beer. The silly people were doing Buy One, Get One Free, so a group of us ended up only paying 50% of the proper bill and completely elephant’s trunk, to this day, not one of us knows what mode of transport we used to get back, and what route we took, in fact no one even remembers leaving the building!It is a great place for brand name shopping, no bargaining though. I would rate it higher than The Paragon as it is a much less stressful experience.Get off the Skytrain at Chidlom or Siam, connect by walking along the Skywalk, it is well signposted.

Central World Plaza is Huge - many restaurants including International Buffet on 6th floor. Was in downtown Bangkok looking at the bomb site near Central World Plaza when I needed dinner and a friend from BKK recommended International Buffet which was great. Wide variety of foods that were well made and fresh - salads, soups, rice dishes, fish dishes, seafood dishes, pizza, fried foods, Sushi, a cook to order grill, and great dessert ice creams and cakes. Very good price given the high end location. I recommend CWP's International Buffet.

Large Shopping Mall. This is at the Ratchaprasong Intersection where there were protests and bombs and all kinds of drama so security is usually tight. The mall is very large with a variety of shopping options. Most of the things here are not cheap, including the food, and look like they are geared towards a certain kind of tourist, not the same ones as MBK but more upscale.
Good For Western Style Clothing. This is my best option for buying western style (and sized) clothing. Dorothy Perkins is my favorite shop.

Upscale plaza. This is a huge mall for upscale shopping. The foods are great and not to expensive though. You can find many international brands in this plaza and it's situated near the Siam BTS so it's very convenient. The mall is also near to other malls like Siam paragon and Siam center, and also huge supermarket, the Big C.

Upmarket shopping complex. This complex is truly amazing. Very clean and tidy shopping complex. This is a place where you need to take your time as there are so many levels to wander, look and hopefully buy. Many food areas to sit and relax and have a drink, something to eat, recharge the battery to get up and continue walking the levels. Our very first visit was a little overwhelming but now with our visits we very much look forward to wandering in. Usually the temperature in Bangkok is very humid and to enter Central World Plaza, with the refreshing coolness from the airconditioner is such a relief to get away from the humidity. You can spend many hours just browsing as there is such an array of shops/products.
Huge Shopping Mall. Something for everyone at Central World, lots of international brand shops as well as high end locally made products, and includes Isetan a Japanese department store.
Central World. We had an awesome day of shopping here.Great restaurants and lots of kiddies entertainment, including an ice skating rink!
Great food.. Huge shopping centre, some very good restaurants on the 4th floor. Good place for bits and pieces if you are wary of markets.

Hiso. This is a one-stop shopping centre if you're looking for international brands and services. With many floors of shops, your shopping dollar is sure to be well spent, if you like buying things. Lots of food options from the all-in-one food court to restaurants and fancy dining. Have a meal or have a tea-break at one of the many cafes. If shopping inside the mall is tight on the budget, then explore the perimeter outdoors offering cheap street eats and buys. There's also an adjoining hotel that provides 5-star stay and beautiful views of central Bangkok. Just be weary of traffic jams if you're planning a trip out of the city. Take the BTS instead.

It's a shopping mall. Sure, it's big and shiny, but it's just a shopping mall. There is little here that is unique. By that I mean, it's all well known stores that can be found in a number of countries around the world. You will not find anything at cheaper prices.I read a lot of reviews that fawn over the food selection. I guess if you're look for chain restaurants that can be found anywhere in the world, have at it. If you're looking for better food, you have the whole of Bangkok to choose from. If you're looking for shopping, there are a host of markets in Bangkok that far better than anything you will find at Central World Plaza. I do suppose that if you're living in Bangkok, this is an alright place to come, but if you're visiting don't waste your time seeing what is familiar.

Great place to escape the heat and humidity.. To be honest we found it to be like almost every other shopping mall in SE Asia. Great place to escape the heat and humidity for a bite to eat and drink.Conveniently located near the other malls. MBK top floor food court for cheap food and drink.

Wow! this shopping mall is fantastic!. I'll be honest, I've NEVER been a fan of shopping malls. But this place blew my mind. Great brands, clean, awesome foodstores, and simply a great place to shop. A concierge service. I just wish I'd had a longer time in Bangkok to enjoy this place more. Highly recommend this, if you're into High End shopping and shopping in general. There was an excellent bookshop for thai, english and other languages, and the japanese supermarket was awesome...... If I was living in Bangkok, I'd hang out here regularly.

Huge great shopping mall. You're likely to find here nearly every brand you'd likeIt is very easy to get around here and the place is so spacious you never feel it's overcrowded though many people are walking aroundThough in the mall there are plenty of food options, I found the street food just outside the mall has way better food to offer. I took this weird coconut puffs, pancakes alike, salty-sweet. Amazing!Though the prices are fair, you can find some good bargains if you stumble upon an occasional promotion. It is a very nice get-away at mid-hot-dayIf you were to pick a single shopping mall while you're in Bangkok, for trendy brands, this is the place. Find it to be way better then the siam paragon one.Nothing special worth mentioning - it's a shopping mall. A great one. Period.

Central World Plaza. BIG SHOPPING MALL, I lost every time that I go ... and I went to Central World Plaza more than 10 times.You can eat as you want.You can shop as you want ... take care your credit card.You can walk and relax yourself in several libraries or particular shops.

Nice mall. I grew up with this mall. I've been here for over 100 times. There are various nice restaurants and shops. The movie theaters are upstairs. The ice skating rink is downstairs. Basically, you can do a lot of activities in this mall.
SHOP, EAT, SHOP! . A very huge mall with loads of food places and restaurants. You will be spoiled with choices. Good place for shopping as well.

Nice shopping center wtih a lot of food. A big shopping center in Town. Can take skytrain to 'Chidlom' station and walk about 10 min. Recommend to try on 4th floor the food , a lot of food to select on 3rd-4th floor and also cinema. you can spend at least half day here. open : 10.00-21.00 hrs.
An interesting place.. This place is huge and has the biggest shopping brands, multiplex and a wide range of multi cuisine restaurants. Its centrally located and very easily accessible.

One of the best Shopping Malls in Bangkok. It's like heaven on earth for me. Any brands you can think of is here - Zara, H&M, Mango, Superdry and many many more! We literally spent hours in exploring most of the shops and ended up going home with bags of shopping at a good price.Location- easy to find, get on BTS and exit at Siam and follow the sign :)

enjoyed our visit, really nice place for shopping. interesting place for shopping, it is like shops in shop. every floor has a different theme. besides the usual clothes & shoes, there are also several shops selling good quality souvenirs. nice food court as well!
Bargins galore. Great place to go shopping. You get some great bargins here. There is lots to do and the food is very good here too.

Confusing layout... Too big. It's one of the biggest shopping malls in Bangkok. Actually, it is the biggest. It is ridiculously big and complicated to get around. Go during weekdays if you can, as during weekends it is packed with locals and tourists. Moreover, during weekends it is sooooo noisy as Thai people love to do promotions and entertainment activities for the visitors/shoppers and the music they play is extremely loud that you can hardly hear the person walking next to you. All mass brands are there. The kids section can be improved, only one international brand store (mothercare), the rest are locals, and offer just clothing. The restaurant section is great if you like eating in the malls. It is on the last floor, has all the cuisines you would imagine. It has also a great supermarket on the top floor, but obviously much more expensive than small supermarkets on the street like viva market for example.

amazing visit to mall. one of the new plaza shopping mall. very exclusive shops but not a ripoff. some very good stuff to be had here. there is a "EATTHAI "festival in the basement that has food from all over Thailand. to try and buy. an experience not to be missed.
Very Nice shopping Mall. This is a very nice shopping mall, which also has a movie theatre, and many restaurants. The skytrain stops here.
Shopping Galore. Its a great place to shop, you can find anything in tis place and its Huge!! We spent a full day and felt like we needed more time.

Dreadful Floorplan but some great shops. This shopping Centre is very large and has some great stores but be prepared to look for them, the layout is just dreadful. The supermarket on the top floor, although pricy has a good range of products and at the back there is a good food court.
Best Shopping in Bangkok. Best place to shop in Bangkok.All my favourite brands in one place Zara,Mango,Forever21,stradivarius etc. Has alot of thai local brands which are equally good.
One stop shopping. you can finde evyerthing you need in here.the DIN THAI FUNG restaurant is always full house but they offer the best dim sum. you will know it's all worth the waiting.
CentralWorld shopping mecca. EXcellent modern shopping mall with lots of shopping and foods. The only problem is that nothing comes cheap ...
Great place to shop. Great place to shop to many floors to pick from a little bit expensive but it is good quality plenty of choices in cloths

Most impressive, spacious and well planned.. Most impressive like most of the plazas and major shopping centres around. Floors after floors of luxurious shopping in a perfect settings. One literally can 'shop till you drop' in Bangkok. On the other side of it, it is also a heaven for people to chill out, dine, relax and meet up as it was designed for.

Shopping center !. It's a good place for shopping in Bangkok. If u're not a millionaire to buy famous and luxury brands in the world such as Chanel, Gucci, Louis Vuitton...U can buy some good brands like Zara, Mango...and everything u want. Outside the center u can buy some special things made in Thailand and it's very cheap. Also the street food, it's delicious. U can take taxi or tuk tuk from your hotel to reach here.

A Synergy of Global Creativity. It's a modern, commercial world of top brands representing the best creative merchandise under one roof. You need lots of money; or several credit cards to purchase some small commodities for they come with huge price tags. Always ask for the VAT REFUND FORM for TOURISTS so when you get out of the wonderland and ready to go back to home country, you can still have some funds for breakfast/ snacks despite an empty check book.Passports are needed. Even without buying much, it's worth looking around and experiencing the wonders of exultant energy of creating goods for practical use or, at the other end, an outright display of wealth for the rich. One is, for a brief moment, transported in a magical moment to places like New York, Milan Or Paris

Good but too big!. Centralworld had everything you might want food (restaurants - I love the Zen Cuccina there -, snacks - Mr. Jones's orphanage will please people with a sweet tooth -, smoothies - one awesome stall very close from the Zen and Starbucks but I can't remember the name...), international and local dress / accessories shops (biggest h&m I've seen in Bangkok so far...), IT shops (I bought 2 phones and a camera here), office furniture, beauty, hairdressers (I liked cut and curl.. The shampoo session was the best head massage ever!)...And there are always plenty of events there: photo exhibitions, Ganesha festival, Christmas decorations, mass blood donation events, small concerts...The only issue is that it is actually too big and if you're like me you'll often get lost inside it. There are maps and helpdesk to help you cope with this difficulty.

shop until you drop. this is a very big and amazing shopping complex which has everything you would ever want easy to find and spotlessly clean but very busy, you will not find it cheap i found it to be almost the same as home.
TOO HUGE. Extremely huge mall but fulfills all the shopping needs. The food court is good too. Probably won't be able to visit all floors.
Not the cheapest place to shop. International brands are often more expensive in Thailand than in the UK. Very confusing layout but nice and cold!
Shopping Spree. In my opinion one of the best malls in Bangkok. Also has a hotel named Centara Central World with a good sky bar with a great view.

Shopping paradise. A shopping paradise
As a family ,we are shopaholics
And this center was just one of the beautiful malls we shopped at
One of three great places to shop in Bangkok. This is one of Bangkoks top shopping places, all the large stores and up market one are here, you can also indulge in Thai food in the food court.
One of the best shopping malls in CBD Bangkok. Still my favorite mall with all the shops and cheap and quick eats at the food court! They also have world-class movie theaters!
all under one roof. wow,all your shopping needs under one roof.Very close to bts and daily specials at the shops.Plus excellent GUEST service from all the attendants.
Has everything you need in one stop!. Great kids area on the 5th floor (I think). Have a few arcade type games and then a huge play structure that had my boys begging to go back every day!

Great for a rainy day! . My boyfriend & I visited here when it was raining & really enjoyed it. It really has everything you could need all under one roof and we picked up some great bargains! The food court was also great and had lots of different variety!

Get a map if you can!. In one word - colossal. Having never previously visited such a large shopping centre, I was astounded by the scale of this one! A map is definitely required to find your way around!
Good place for Shopping. This is modern shopping mall in Bangkok. There are lots of quality goods to buy. The mall is very clean.

Shopping One Stop. If you can not find the item you are looking for at this shopping center then it may just not be availale anywhere. It is spread over 6 floors and each floor is a specific items be it cameras,electronics,clothing in most businesses. It is a must see and shopping delight and very easiliy reached from BTS a fast and efficent elevated transit system.
Good for all. Very nice shopping mall. You can find many shops with international brands and Thai brand. The prices are reasonable in general.

Great place to dine, lots of choices.. you can spend a whole day here, shopping, dinning, relaxing...anytime. full of choices of levels 6 and 7..simply a food paradise for you... Thai, Jap, Korean, western, Chinese, desserts... etc.

the place to shop for good quality. has the wow factor I used to live in bangkok and this is the place to shop has everything but the quality is good not the cheeper stuff you find on the streets . has great restuarants and by all standards is huge.not you typical shopping centre .it also has one of the best Dim Sum restaurants on the movie theater floor with reviews from all over the world.

Massive Shopping. It is a huge mall, with almost every kind of store. I'm not into shopping, but I was curious, so I went.There is also a large number of places to eat, as well as a cinema.It is easy to get to, centrally located, and, I think, impossible to cover in just one visit.

Great Weekend Hangout. Lovely place to hang around in the weekend. You can find basically all that you're looking for - from bookshops to a public library to a wonderful mix of Asia, European, and American restaurants and diners. SF Cinema city is also here on the 6th Floor. There's a dedicated area for kids to run around and enjoy some clay-works or other handicrafts. If you're looking for toys, there's also a Toys for Us store on the 5th floor. This place includes a Zen Department Store as well as an Isetan department store. If you fancy Japanese food and snacks, you should check out the fourth and fifth floors in Isetan.

Large mall - great cinema . We came to central mall to go to the cinema. We have been travelling a while so thought it would be a treat for the children to see a movie.Fantastic - huge cinema and comfortable seats - a real treat after backpacking through through more basic towns!Loads of shops of course as well!

Favorite shopping and dinning place for young people !. Very good place for shopping and dining as it is located right in downtown area with direct sky-train access. Busy place especially for young people who are walking around for gathering and dining. A bit too crowded for older groups or people who prefer more quiet places to walk around. Too many group tours !!

Good place for shopaholics that likes authentic things.. This shopping mall is really huge and it has everything that you need. From international brands to local brands, you can find items at wide range of prices as well.

Bangkoks 2nd Most Premier, But Perhaps Best Mall. Central World houses some of the Worlds most exclusive designer brands and retain names. But perhaps not as intimidating as Siam Paragon as it has a mix of mid to high priced shopping. Equivalent to Mall Of Emirates in Dubai or Midvalley Megamall in KL. Great for shopping, hanging out, dining. Located in a convenient location and close to the bargain wholesale market and another premium malls. Like its name it is in a central place.Should be one of the first places to visit in BK.

Good if you are looking for shopping in a trendy place with International brands. Central World Plaza, is a good place for shopping if you are looking for well-known brands.The shopping mall is big enough for you to get lost inside… Notice at the ground floor there is an aquarium and outstanding food court with all the International and Local food you could dream about. Regarding the aquarium, please notice the dual price cheaper for Thais and more expensive for foreigners… This is one of the reason why I suggest not to visit it.At the last floor there is a cinema where you can also see some movies in 4D. This shopping mall is quite crowded the weekend (probably too much crowded)… it is not my favorite Bangkok shopping mall, however anybody who come to visit Bangkok must go to have a walk there!
Cool mall. One of the big and trendy mall in CBD. This is cool place to hang out. Lot of shops and food, trendy and the roof top restaurants are great to view Bangkok at night time.
Average typical shopping mall. Average typical shopping mall. Signages not very good. Took a long time to find my gym when I was there. Ladies who love Naraya can find a store here at level 1.

Mall rats can play. The central world is centrally located and offers a great shopping experience. The easy accessibility from the BTS Station and SIAM centre close by it also attracts a huge footfall. The mall hosts most big brands and eateries and also the SF Cinema world which ensures as a mall rat you cant get bored. The food court on the top floor is fantastic. There is a M&S Food court which has the most amazing counters where one can place an order and sit down and have a relaxed meal/ snack. Out of the counters, the one that offers tom yum soup along with omlette and rice was my favourite and also the counter that would offer mango with sticky rice.

Shopping unhinged. This is another mega mall that takes shopping and the experience to that whole other level, shopping is themed and it like it takes you on an adventure, great fun and a little more expensive than the Paragon, which is a surprise in is self. Fantastic cinema complex.
NIce but Expensive. Place is nice but has some very expensive stores. Nice to get out of the heat, but not a place a budget traveller should go.
If you are not on a budget. If you like shopping so this place will be like heaven for you....lots of shops and restaurants around but do not expect that is is cheap there;)

Shopping isn't what it used to be. Once a great place to shop (it is still great for clothing), we found this trip to be a little dissappointing on the shopping front. Really miss the bartering which just seems to be going by the by. Set prices everywhere and all the same (watches, DVD etc) and absolutely no interest from shop owners in negotiating a price. Yet another wonderful tradition has gone from Thailand.
Shopping & Food. Central World have a wide range of brands from local designers to international brands. Apart from that, you wont be hungry as there are tons of F&B outlets waiting for you to try!

Good if you have the money. Good mall, like a Westfield in Australia .. Up market clothes and shopping.. Not cheap but good venue. Personally I came to Bangkok to shop cheap so wasn't my thing but very nice and would be a must if your cashed up

Cool Shopping Place... Amazed by the mall and the shopping area.. lots of shops - a one stop are for all shopping... Little bargain but the the price is very reasonable... a very good place to hang around...
Shopping and dining at Central World. It is the largest shopping complex in downtown Bangkok with hotel, apartments, movie theaters, 2 department stores (Isetan and Zen) and a lot more.

Shoppers paradise. An opulent shopping experience which appears almost infinite. there is something for everyone from the oldest to youngest including technology, banks, beauty, ice skating, grocery stores, decor, books, and food from every nook of the globe. If you are finding the humidity and bustle of Bangkok too much just step in here and it will be a complete change of pace to the the street level food carts, exhaust fumes and heat. I had lunch at a restaurant which I wouldn't have been able to afford at home in Australia which was delightful. Tried on some designer outfits in the lovely ladies stores and browsed at books for quite a time. It's easy to get to on the BTS station Mo Chit from memory..... you could spend a week in here if you wanted to but get outside to experience the Real Bangkok!!!

Its a Shopping Mall. Its a shopping mall, its big there are lots of shops, you can get in out of the heat. At the end of the day thats all it is - a shopping mall. There are no maps of the floors near the escalators just a list of the shops to be found on each floor and it didn't help that customer service had run out of maps to give away. Due to the size of the place if you didn't know exactly where the shop was you wanted you were lost - I am not one for aimlessly wandering around a mall to see what I might see. I do not think shopping in Thailand is cheap but you can not beat the variety available.
central world. there are still empty shops not open and the supermarket so small and you can not find every things in it and it location is far away

With Everything You Need. An excellent shopping mall that has a wide range of products and services. From the high end to the affordable. Numerous eating places to choose from as well. You just have to go walk around the big shopping mall to see for yourself.

Everything and Anything. It's a one stop hub. Watch out for special evening events from outdoor gigs to mini stalls selling knicks and knacks... Walk behind and you will get to Pratunam for a real bargain.

ZEN not zen and not reliable.... My advice if you want to be sure of a respectful delivery is not to buy a mattress at Zen shopping mall, you will wait and they will change the time and also try to propose another day whatever you have waited the whole morning and the afternoon with no result.There are other shopping mall you can easily find for a better service.
Best shopping mall in Bang Kok. I was just amazed with this shopping mall. It had all the brands that I loved and food court and restaurants in the mall was really great!

huge, divers, nice. This is a huge shopping mall, top two floors containing lots of restaurants. There is also lots of other stuff going on. When we visited a princess was there, a boy band outside and some live music by another band. Shopping is varied, clothes, electronics, food, watches, etc. Also access is pretty good, don't try to get there by car during peak hours. If you do get stuck anywhere near, just get out and walk a couple of minutes over the skywalk, but otherwise just use the skytrain or metro.

Shopping mall. The size of this place is huge. It's got about 10 floors.Lots of Western shops that I'm familiar with. Zara, Mango, Adidas, Crocs, to mention a few. Zen was a big department store. Lots of choice. High end, Chanel, Louis Vuitton...Lots of food and restaurant choices too.
Glamorous plaza with great diversity of shops.. Glamorous plaza with great diversity of shops. Spend an afternoon window shopping there. Hot spot for Hong Kong travellers.
Shopper's Paradise. Huge mall in downtown Bangkok. Huge is an under statement actually. High end shopping. Located in the most luxurious part of Bangkok.... A must visit!!
Good Mall. Not a real tourist place but more of your typical shopping mall. Was good and clean with lots of options. Would definitely shop here if I was an expat.
Shoppers Paradise. Great place to shop which has some of the BIG brands and Sale almost all throughout the year! Explore ZEN inside the mall, you get very good stuff.
ok. not bad shopping and not as good as mbk . out on the streets near by you can find local street stalls with good bargains just barter

One of my favourite mall in Bangkok. Besides Siam Paragon, Central World is one of my favourite mall in Bangkok! It is about 5 mins walk from Chit Lom BTS station or 10-15 mins walk from Siam BTS station through the overhead connecting bridge from Siam Paragon.Central World have loads of shops, restaurants and a big supermarket to get all of your local Thai tidbits, cookies, biscuits (pork floss, coconut, mangoes), etc. Laem Cha-Roen Seafood is highly recommended!If you think this review is useful, please click on the helpful button. Thank you :)
One of the biggest malls. Nice place. Nice shopping. Plenty of brands. Plenty of food. Big space. Do check out the free concerts that happen often outside. Nice evening

Between AVERAGE and VERY GOOD (Pls reveiw the rating perhaps adding GOOD). Central World Plaza at Chitlom is now a normal mall in Bangkok. The advantage is that prices are slightly better for some shopping (sport equipments and wearings) and at the food court.

Mid-high end mall. Central World is a short 5min walk from Amari. Big name shops (Zara/Mango etc) as well as Isetan & Zen departmental stores are all found under the same roof. Wide selection of F&B outlets as well. It is a decent mall but lacks a distinct identity compared to Terminal 21 or Siam Paragon.
The nicest mall I visited in bangkok . The mall is huge and has everything you need we spent the day there with the kids had lunch and dessert they also have a nice kids play area for little children

Great variety!. Hands down -- this is one of my favorite places to shop (and eat!) in Bangkok! We've been in Bangkok for about a month, and have been to Central World at least 3 times so far!! It reminds us of home!Love the top floor restaurants, particularly Yura An Cafe for Japanese food. Enjoyed "Mission Impossible" here recently at the theaters as well. Popcorn and soda -- good for the soul.It's easy to find your way here via the BTS -- either Siam or Chit Lom stations will get you there. (There is an expansive walkway to the mall from either station!)

Shopping extravaganza. Central world is humongous. You can easily get lost and spend the day there. Easy to get to via the BTS. It has been rebuilt since the terrorist attack pre Army takeover of Government. Shop in comfort and style but don't expect my bargains. It's there for the tourist dollar

Not cheap. This is a clean spacious modern shopping mall. Selling higher end fashion / branded goods it is not a place to shop for cheap bargains. However there is a good range of shops and some excellent food to be had. I particularly liked the small tented area outside at the front with stalls selling a wide range of foods including local fruits and street foods to take away.Also at the front was a dance display and inside a fashion event was in progress with a Thai celebrity attracting much attention.

Lord Ganesha enclosure near the gate.. It is a spacious mall with all the famous brand shops. Very clean and very well lighted. Staff is experienced and have knowledge of the brands and also the available promotions. The Lord Ganesha enclosure outside the mall near one of the entrance gates has lots of importance in my life. I come there to pray and when it is granted I visit to thank. I have lot of faith in it. It has been my fourth visit to Bangkok because of that.Thanks Lord Ganesha Dolly
for High end shoppers. One of the High level shopping mall. Siam station is the nearest BTS station. There is a expansive departmental stores in the 7th floor selling food products.

Humungous department store. Floors upon floors of stores selling anything you can think of. I'd recommend going to Central World Plaza to do your clothes shopping as you'll get clothes at the price that the locals get them (because this is where they shop). I would recommend avoiding any Central after 3pm as it's flooded with school kids.

Shopping in Cntral world plaza. There are many good shopping malls in Bangkok. Central World is one of them and more than worthwhile a visit. You can find anything here including many restaurants, massage salons and hairdressers just to mention a few. The mall is huge and you can easily spend the whole day here.

My fav place in bangkok. My favourite place in Bangkok. It is clean and has air con.So much variety and so many different shops on different levels with so many different places to eat. Also always events going on at different places and levels around the centre.

Great place to play, eat and shop. We went here for a number of things shopping, eating great restaurants, but really to cap it all off was the cinemas. Our boys wanted to watch Jurassic world( just came out) so off we went The movies are soooo much cheaper here than in Australia. For the cost of my two sons ticket price in Perth, we got two adults and two kids. The seats recline and are very comfortable. Will definitely go here again.

Great place but not very cheap. This place shows the modern side of Bangkok and I recommend visiting, but shops in there are not very cheap (obviously because brand names) comparing to other shopping malls. It has a nice cinema and a variety of restaurants and coffee shops in its massive food court. One last note, toilets are super clean.

Not for bargain hunters. A good but predictable selection of fashion. Not cheap. Feels rather like a ghost-town compared to some of the less "haute" malls. Lovely smorgasbord of Thai cuisine at the upper levels to make up for the shopping deficit.

Nice shopping destination for family. This one is best in the Bangkok in terms of accessibility and infrastructure for kids.but foodcourt was not good for me I had a family pack for 2 from mc Donald's but except the burger everything was tasteless the coke was with no soda just like drinking iced sweet brown colour water.the fried chicken felt like it was arl eat a coupe of days old

Great mall! . It's a great mall! Close to Siam Paragon and Platinum Mall, therefore if you stop in this area you can hop in to another malls easily.central World is one of the biggest mall in BKK, clean, well maintained, you will get everything you need.

Thai inspired MOS Burger flavours, Croissant Taiyaki and imported Ritter Sport flavours not sold back at home. Positive observations & experience:1) Finding the way to the mall is a no-brainer as one just walks up a bridge after passing by Platinum City Mall. 2) Got my dose of Green Curry Chicken Burger at MOS Burger. Taste of green curry sauce paired very well with the deep fried chicken patty yums!3) During the long weekend holiday, Boots Pharmacy had this "Buy 2 get 1 free" promotion. I was stunned by the variety of the product ranges and actually walked out without getting anything.4) Another long weekend promotion at the Central Food Hall on the 7th floor. There were a few flavours of Ritter Sport chocolates which were not seen before in my country. Bought a few bars which were on discount. Sweet!Cons: The mall is huge with the addition of Zen as well. Not an ideal place for a person who lacks a good sense of direction.Areas to improve: 1) More telco competitors for prepaid sim cards. DTac doesn't seem worth it as one needs to purchase two packages for a normal sim card and internet. I got a TruMove simcard at one of the kiosks at 6th Floor of Platinum Fashion Mall.2) Concierge needs to look more approachable - The one I chose to speak to had this "you-owe-me-tons-of-money" look on her face.

One of the biggest. One of the biggest if not the biggest shopping meccas in Asia. If you can't find it under this roof then it probably does not exist or its not worth buying. Convenient for all day open from 10am
Great and quiet mall. Visited this mall during my stay in Bangkok. There's a lot of good eateries on the 6th and 7th floor! Great restaurants and the mall is pretty quiet; not many people.

Nice mall. A great way to get out of the heat. We went the movies for 220 bhat each. On the top floor. Nicemovie seats!Interesting before the movie stars. We all had to stand and appreciate the King. In peace for a minute. Nice food court. We had pizza at Pizza Pizza.

Aug 2015 - Central World Mall. A mid-range shopping center. It is novel, clean and has a good A/C.It is huge (relatively to what we met till now in Thailand). It has 7 floors (last two are food courts)Recommend to take a tour map (and to make a tourist discount card) to make your visit more effective.My family and especially two daughters were very happy with the shopping experience and lunch/dinner there. We visited it twice.

All what you would expect from a fancy department store. I went to Central World on my first visit to Bangkok, I managed to snap up a few pretty good items for less than London price, but at the end of the day it's just another shiny department store. To grab a bargain I'd rather go to MKB. However Central World is great meeting spot, lot of locals hang out here, We came here on New Years Eve to watch the countdown from the bridge, that was spectacular.

Variety. Easy to walk here after a visit at erawan shrine and the big c. Theres plenty of shops for the whole family, we went to the top floor for desserts and lunch then head down to the lobby floor for naraya but its extremely crowded with tourists which you have to queue for a long time before you can pay.

Really classy. Really nice shops, about same prices back in Australia when it comes to fashion so bring some cash! Has a food part too. Doesn't have as many fashion stores as MBK. But better quality. You CAN try on clothes here unlike Platinum Fashion Mall (see my review on them too). They have fitting rooms etc just like shops in Australia. Walk about 20min left up the road (when you walk out the front) and then you can find Major Cineplex Ratchayothin. Which has an iMax too. So everything is close by.
Nice Mall.. Nice Mall with good brands not pocket friendly as MBK. One can visit this for fun and change. Well connected from BTS station and a walk over bridge takes you directly to the mall entry.

Modern spacious mall with world class shops and food. Central world plaza is easy accessible from the BTS Skytrain from Siam or Chit Lom stations. Look out for the directions and walk via the concourse to the mall. All the shops and food you need under one mall. The departmental store ZEN, very much like MBK, has a foodcourt with delicious local food.
Very large, has all the store you want in one place. This shopping center has it all, more or less. Personally I was a bit disappointed by the limited content of some of high profiled stores.

Excellent mall to spend some time away from the heat and to shop and eat. I went to this mall when I needed a break from all the heat. Went shopping, catched a movie (before the movie starts you have to stand up and pay respect to the king's anthem), and had some mexican food with a thai spin. You have to get off at Siam or Chit Lom station and follow directions.

One of the big shopping centres in Bangkok.. A very big shopping complex in the centre of Bangkok. If you need an hour or longer shopping you can chose Central world. Of course you can also go to Siam / Siam Paragorn or MBK.
Not as cheap as Mbk but nice all the same. More high end and maybe not as cheap as you would hope but still bargains to be found and a nice new clean shopping mall.

Very big and glamorous. Central world shopping mall is the very big mall. Once you get in, it's like losing in a maze. The shopping mall is full of thousand shops, stores and restaurants as well as entertainment centers. The nearest BTS skytrain stations are Chid Lom and Saim.

A Shopping Haven. Bangkok is food and shopping and Central World is one of its finest shopping malls.I love the atmosphere especially when you are outside the mall in the early evening resting after a day of walking.

Pricey. This is an absolutely huge shopping centre with department stores and all the international brands. However I found all the prices considerably more expensive than Australia and more again than the US. Markets in Thailand are far more interesting and authentic.
A best mall in Bangkok. This is a best mall with every thing you need. Located in the middle of the city. Large, Clean and Modern.Near Big C.

High End Mall. This is considered a high end shopping mall for the locals although there are even higher end ones in the area (example: Siam Paragon). I like heading over to this mall due to its comprehensive amenities such as a considerable number of restaurants ranging from low to high end, movie theatres, supermarket and great shopping.Firstly, the range of restaurants at the mall caters to all walks of life and budget. With the wide range of food available (Western, Jap, Chinese, Thai, etc), you’ll be spoilt for choice. There is also a food court at the higher levels which serves up local delights at quite affordable prices, although it is considered pricey for the locals.Secondly, there is a great movie theatre which is well furbished and comfortable if tourists would like go watch the latest shows. Theatre food such as popcorn, nachos, and drinks are warm as I do understand some theatres serves cold food. However, the issue with the theatre is that before a show is screened, they will play the national anthem where all the Thais will have to stand in attention prior. For Tourist, it may be uncomfortable but this is their way of life. It would be good to respect their culture by standing with them.Thirdly, they have a large supermarket above and if anyone needs to buy travel items, you can head there to take a look. Lastly, shopping is great but just to not that the mall caters mostly to the mid to high end of shoppers. For great deals, you can head to Naraya which is their local bag brand and it is really popular with Asian tourist as they are decently priced. I have friends or relatives whom will ask to help get Naraya items whenever I fly to Bangkok. They too have a large departmental store, Isetan, which sells a wide range of items. They too even sell Japanese food at the high levels.Just a note, the mall is really large and if you really want to take a walk around, it would take more than 3 hours of shopping to cover the whole area.

I have to laugh...... Central World is currently ranked #38 of 304 places to shop in Bangkok. Of those 37 places ranked above Central World, three (Chatuchak Weekend Market, Siam Paragon, and Terminal 21) are places to shop. The other 34 are tailor shops! And, of those I checked, how many reviews for tailor shops are from 1-post wonders? And what might that suggest?Perhaps TA should isolate tailor shops into a separate category, so that those places don't "muck up" the rankings for everything else.Of all the shopping centres in Bangkok, I suppose my favourite is MBK - as that place has the highest percentage of individually owned, or otherwise somewhat unique, vendors among shopping centres in Bangkok. My personal #2 would have been the "World Trade Centre" this place, before the rebranding - as that might have been #2 for originality. After the rebranding, Central World became rather less unique. But it still is probably my #2 preferred shopping centre after MBK. The others are mostly same-same, but same-same (in contrast to the popular saying "same-same but different"), if you get the drift of that wording.Central World is well-located. It has several shops which are not the same-same chains of most other shopping centres in Bangkok. It is, however, a shadow of its former self when it was Bangkok's WTC - even if it is now larger. Those that will remember the WTC may appreciate why someone might say that. Others would probably not understand.
High class shopping. For High class shopping this shopping temple is very good. You get all the brands of exclusive goods there.

An amazing high end shopping centre. Fantastic array of high end shops and department stores. Was lucky enough to see the orchid exhibition that was on when we visited. This was the most amazing display of orchids that we have ever seen. There were thousands of living orchids and literally tens of thousands of individual blooms made up into beautiful displays.
Less expansive than SIAM and intersting choices. Good mix of restaurants, interesting mix of stores offering more affordable and also some local choices

One of the best malls in the world. I find this mall is too often overlooked by Western tourists who just want to goto Siam Paragon. From the Siam station you can walk back towards Chitlom and there is a bridge that goes to this mall. Or you can just get off at Chitlom and it is about a 5 minute walk.It seems like this mall has almost 9 levels(it may be a bit more or less). You can find just about every brand name shop and every restaurant you can imagine. It has an excellent movie theater on the top and ice skating on the first floor.It is hard to explain this place visually unless you really go but it will almost take your breath away. It is huge and it seems as if you could walk around forever and not see every corner.If you a regular to Siam Paragon take a second to go over and check this place out. You wont be disappointed..
Massive shopping mall. What a place its huge , shops for everything ,big food court and many other things including ice skating ring I think place to go for everything you need

One stop shop. Huge variety of international brands, and a Zen department store which spans 7 floors and they have promotions on every floor. Almost will not run out of good deals to buy. Tourist can claim vat rebate on the 6th floor (kids department). Nice place to shop without the heat.
Shopping mall. A huge shopping mall with lots of shops and great shopping. There are a lot of restaurants here as well as a very good food court.

Huge Mall!!. This place is huge for sure... There are floors full of things to cater for a family including kids. Could spend a few hours there. It's always clean and so are the toilets.There is free wifi as well I think...

ANOTHER GOOD SHOPPING MALL IN BANGKOK. This is another very good modern shopping mall in Bangkok but it's not the best in Bangkok. It is very large and has a very good food court with numerous foods from around the world the Indian one I can personally recommend.

Must visit shopping centre !. Central World is a huge shopping mall in the center of Bangkok and it is the sixth largest shopping complex in the world. Central World comprises two department stores, Zen and Isetan, and the main shopping mall.And they are have the Thai street food in outside, which is good find for Thai food.Do not miss it, when you go to BKK
Enjoy shopping and eat food. I usually prefer this mall to eat and to shop the local products which they sell outside the mall but on mall premise. they have very good quality of products.

A good day out. Enjoyed our day shopping and eating here. So many sales on at the time we visited which was November . Maybe clearing old stock before Christmas?. Food varied every were very clean. Security around but unobtrusive . A very well appointed shopping complex and we'll worth a visit.

this is what you call a mall. This is all what a 5 star mall has to be,... great dining, shops, perks,..you can spend days in this mall,.... but note Thailand is more than just malls,...local markets give you much better value!

If you're into shopping or visiting for variety of food, you'd love this!. Lots have already been said - yes it absolutely massive, though I read about it I could not imagine a shopping centre this big.My favourite part is the food court / market on the 7th floor - there's cinemas on this level too but you have to check out this floor. SO MANY restaurants and at reasonable priced. If you prefer real cheap and yummy go to the market section on this floor and you'll see a food court there and there's so much to chose from - all authentic Thai food. They'll give you a coupon/card which you hang on to and hand over to the stall as you're ordering food and then you pay for it as you exit the area by giving the cashier the coupon. Nice and simple. I got greedy and ordered a barbeque pork with rice and crispy pork and both came to 160 baths which is like $6AUD - loved it. Then went over to the Thai desert and had the sticky rice with crushed ice and some sweet coconut sauce for 25bahts, once again was the most amazing yummy thing. While on this floor I also had a desert (different day) from an ice cream / mango place. Everything is mango flavour but there was this thing called mango treasure? Anyway, its mango sticky rice flavoured ice cream topped with real mango! OMG, it was a decent size serving and I had intended to have just a taste but couldn't stop eating it! For my own sake I'll stop going on about the food but yes, if you love food, especially if you're a fan of Thai food, you must go there and get up to level 7 :-). Also - on this floor, there's a restaurant at each corner of the building, just when I think, I've found all the restaurants, there were more as I kept walking.
Still as good as ever. It only gets better. Always able to get something in Zen.. And they are having the Thai food fest fair outside, which is good find for Thai food.
Central World Plaza. A great place to shop and lots of great restaurants! Major chain shops. Bring your passport for VAT refunds.

Mall trip. We visitet this mall on the 25th of July 2015. One thing i must say about this mall is who ever build this mall had thaught of it in detail. State of art restrooms ATMs every corner and the deseigne and the looks of this mall are phenominal. 3*** must visit.Very impessive.
must stop by. truly one stop shopping for all u need. Huge shopping mall with tons of restaurants featuring international cuisine. Can spend Two to Three days there.

A shopper paradise. . I was there during the shopping festival, there were so many bathing that my head spinner. I took a day or two just to check out the offer and then start buying. It just has so much to offerGo to Zen 7th floor and you can ask for fee Wifi if you need. If your a tourist bring your passport an d you will be entitled to 5% discount across most shops. My only regret is that they close at 8pm week day and 10pm weekend, I wish they were opened longer.

Just another mall by day. Live entertainment by night.. So for the most part, this is just another mall. Nothing of interest here. But in the evenings, the local Breweries, Chang and Singha, have pop up bars in the Courtyard with live music. Better yet if you're there in October, when there's plenty more beer and music.

Very huge mall. Many shops of all classes, caters for all in the family. Lots of cafes and restaurants. A very huge mall. Might need a whole day to cover all shops, if you are really an ardent shopper. There was a food bazaar outside the mall. Very interesting and popular.

Very Expensive - but a beautiful building to look around.. Just plenty of expensive shops in one place. Not that exceptional :P Its all your typical high end stores that you can find back home. Can easily get lost in the building.

Best Mall in Bangkok. Best place to shop in Bangkok in my opinion. It's combined with Isetan and Zen also, and just Central World alone has 6 floors of shopping. The top floor has a cinema and food court. Brands like Zara, H&M, Topshop, Forever 21, Mango, Gap, etc. They always have events in front of the mall too and is close to the BTS stations and other malls.

I like Central World Plaza for its food options. There are many restaurants here which will definitely cater to your liking. I did not do any shopping here but some parents may like to know that the Toys R Us at this mall is quite big by my standards, no comments on the pricing though, as I did not explore much here.
good shopping exp. it s big beautiful mall - attached with sky train and accessibility is great - wide range of counters in food court

Huge like...get lost huge. So we stumbled upon this mall in search of Sunrise Taco's which is apparently closed so kind of disappointed there but we were in this giant mall with so many good options! On the 7th floor there is a grocery store with a lot of western products and a food cafeteria with Thai food and other Asian cuisine. They give you a card where you scan your food then pay once you're done. Besides that this mall always has something going on and for those who love Krispy Kreme donuts there is on here! I cannot tell you the location though haha. The shopping is a bit on the pricey side but there is endless window shopping.

Why go Central World Plaza?. Many shops. Many branded shops. Good place for cheap shopping? Nope. And branded stuff are more expensive here than Singapore. So, why you want to be there? My old reason for being there was, the Japanese restaurants on the Isetan side (6th floor, I think. Maybe 5th). But when I last went there in April, they were gone. I hop they are back by now. The ramen there are good. And the Japanese food stalls.... I liked them. Shop they will be back too.

Bangkok's premier shopping center. All the luxury brands you desire are within footsteps of stepping into this great shopping mall: fashion apparels, foot ware, jewellery, watches and latest trends for teenagers and adults of all ages are available here!

Best mall layout . I love the malls in bangkok, this one was great too! I love the fact that the escalators line up so you don't have to walk an entire round just to get to the next escalator. The shops there are pretty much international brands that you could find anywhere so there is nothing special in terms of shopping. The only thing that stood out to me was the cinema and food fair on the top floor, and an amazing massage place called montara on the 3rd floor. It's a must try!

One stop shopping. A huge mall with i think everything there. I got all my shopping need in here like forever21, hnm, super sport, uniqlo and toy r us. There also food bazaar outside the mall which are a lot of street food there

one stop shopping centre in bangkok. spend at least 4 hour,so you can enjoy the whole mall.go to the information before shopping to get tourist discount,some shop will ask where you from to give you special discount.
Shopping Heaven. Do you like to shop this is shopping heaven you can find anything that you need and more besides .Everyone is catered for any age and air conditioned TRhis is heaven on earth

Shop till you drop!. Huge shopping center, one of many in Bangkok. There are all sorts of things to purchase here, so come prepared for lots of walking. Clothes, purses, jewelry, electronics, you can find it all here, and tons of food vendors on the street in front of this place. Pretty easy to get to by bus or transit system. At least it is air conditioned inside!

Best shopping mall in Bangkok. This place is full of things to do,places to eat and can shopping all kind of products. Its all in one shopping mall which is not too crowded like Siam Paragon. The place is fully organize so even it have a lot of stuffs but you will never get lost and will always find whats ever you looking for. Also have Theater and supermarket here too.

See above - regarding the travel date below it only allows you to go 2014 - It was actually March, 2010 when I visited. There is a lot of high end shops in this mall. It is good to look around and to visit - it also has Air Con and is an enjoyable experience - In the evening there is outside activities - I watched a boxing match the evening I was there

Do some shopping when it`s hot outside!. This shopping centre is just great. It has a lot of floors where literally everything can be bought. The only missing thing is that no Abercrombie or Hollister store is there.

Shoppers Paradise !!!. Travelers staying in Bangkok need nothing more than to taxi to the nearest BTS Sky train station and head to Central. All stations are announced in English as well.
