Thailand sets the service standards for the world. Every department no matter how small or specific to a type of apparel has two attendants to service you. You will never feel unattended to. They are clean, courteous kids (99%), eager to please and knowledable about their wares. A well air-conditioned environment with an abundance of International eateries. Pace yourselves as you can spend the entire day here and want for more. Easy location to get to multiple ways.

Enjoy the air con, but spend your money elsewhere!. While it's an impressive building, this is the type of shopping you can do at home, and not at all the traditional Thai experience. Go there for an escape from the heat, but as for shopping, you'd get a better price in your own country!

Better than Siam for me... Central world is 10 mins walk from Siam station. You don't need to get off from the BTS platform. There are a lot of guiding signs to lead the way towards Central world..
I personally prefer visiting Central World Plaza since I found better and bigger sale items. Food also available on the top floors..

Biggest mall in Thailand that doesnt disppoint. Great shopping mall housing just about every brands. Strategically located in Pratunam and walking distance to other major malls such as MBK and Siam. Lots of activities in the huge front entrance of the mall

Allow for hours of exploring..... Central World is huge.... huge and seemingly never-ending! The restaurants alone would keep one busy for months in an attempt to experience them all! This mall is more than simply a "clothing" mall, that is, they have most everything here. Very clean and organized, yet easy to get lost! Easy access from the BTS and the air conditioning here is just right. Go... and go again!

Always visiting this mall. The mall is so large with 2 department stores and many other stores located within the premises. The 2 department stores are Zen and Isetan. On level 7, there is a massive amount of restaurants. Many different types of cuisine located at the mall. Would definitely recommend a trip here.

Great mall. Loved the many restaurants and they had a number of Japanese restaurants to choose from too! Greyhound café for fantastic coconut sorbet and coffee, Central supermarket with a huge variety of local and imported foodstuff, Jim Thomson, and many more

Multiple malls in one. It has major global brands, local brands, mini shops of local designers, tailors with dubious and not so dubious taste, and shops that look like street market stalls selling luxury goods (?) at a fraction of the price.It can be a bit hard to fine truly nice things but there seem to be a few bargains.

First class movies. This place has the best place to view new movies, they are even some movies shown here before they are released in the USA.Buffet, drinks, popcorn, smallish theatre(around 50 chairs?) reclining chairs, blankets and never packed.I am talking about the "first class" admission tickets. The $ is comparable to a general admission ticket in the U.S.

One of many huge malls. The clever thing about the Bangkok BTS system is it stops at a lot of shopping centres and this is arguably the biggest, Located right in the middle of the city on the Sukhumvit road, you can easily spend all day here as there's so much choice available, Yes it can be pricey by Thai standards, but it's just fascinating to see the array and choice available and there's lots more cheaper centres not far away.

Typical international shopping mall. Prices high compared to Thai in general but there are some bargains if you really look. Huge variety however, and a great place if you want some respite from the heat.
Just another Mall. The central world loacted at : 4,4 / 1-2,4 / 4, Ratchadamri Road, Pathumwan,is the largest shopping destination in Bangkok.The location is central & easily accesible byr train.

My favorite mall in BKK!. This is my favourite place in BKK! Main reason because of its Central Food Hall and Supermarket which never fail me in whatever I need to grab. Also, the mall has 2 departmental stores (Zen & Isetan) which I fancy especially ZEN. The mall also has many other mid level brands and many others too. The mall is also full of food choices so one never fail to get to eat his/her choice. The mall is also linked to skytrain with shelter, so it is convenient walk.

Great shopping mall, but a bit pricey compared to platinum. Central World is very close to the Siam BTS station, and is a shopping mall with many brand name stores. The prices of clothing in central world were just about the same as in the U.S., so I would suggest looking elsewhere for clothes, such as platinum, before shopping at central world. There are also many restaurants inside, from U.S. food chains like McDonald's, Burger King, and Starbucks to traditional Thai food restaurants. Personally, I prefer the street-side restaurants for my meals but if you are looking to get out of the heat for a while, then you can definitely find something good to eat in the air conditioned Central World.
Here is everything. Whatever you are looking for you will find it in this gigantic shopping mall.Most belong to the more expensive segment.Japanese Zen department store is a gem.

SHOPPING HEAVEN. I love this place. Just spent all day here. & floors of specialty shops and 2 large department stores. My favourites Naraya and Jim Thompson to buy gifts. There is lots of yummy food on the 6th and 7th floor too, and movies..

All under one roof . Massive shopping mall, you can buy clothes, food or sit to eat and drink. Great place! We enjoyed escaping the busy streets and finding some peace here, ate in a few places. All very nice taste, quality and price!

Everything you could want in one place.... Went to find a Pandora charm and was pleasantly surprised of the plethora of shops. I couldn't think of a store that I couldn't find! Lots of entertainment going on too. There was a cooking show and then a popular movie had a fan event going on. Lots to do… great places to eat and hang out with business partners or friends.

Huge. This place is big and there are floors full of things to cater for a family, sports stalls are close together, ladies clothes in one section, kids clothes in another area.Could spend a few hours there. It's always clean and so are the toilets.There is free wifi but I think you have to go to information desk to get password .

Big. Each floor has it's own theme so explore according to your interests, though the best floor is the food court. Don't expect to find knockoffs or anything too weird here, it's all mainstream and high-end stores.

The best shopping plaza in Bangkok. Many selections of delicious food(since cheap eats till fine dining), good coffee, tea and bakeries. Very big supermarket inclusive of souvenirs and food court inside.Movie theater, big book stores, brand names products and banks are all here. Hotel centara grand is just next to the plaza. So convenience walking from sky train and lots of parkings here. if you are tourists, this place is a must visit!!
Great. A great place to shop and will remind you to fill up the vat refund if you're a tourist. There are Food stalls outside the mall ...

Everything you need!. It's a big shopping mall with 2 department stores, flagship stores, shops, beauty/hair salons, food court, restaurants etc. Everything you think of, you find it here, even jewelry and gold! All under one roof. The pros are that : it's easy access located among other shopping malls, hotels, movie theatres, it's air-conditioned so great for escaping from the hot sun and the prices are fixed not like buying at other malls (MBK, Platinum, etc.). The cons? Actually, it isn't really a con. But bear in mind that as it's upper market of branded goods, the prices are higher.

Huge!!!!. One word describes it and that is huge, its incredibly big and a great place.The grocery is a bit pricey. It is definitely one of the biggest mall in the world. Of course, here you will find a variety of well-known branded merchandise .There are plenty of restaurants to choose from at the top level. The SFX cinema is one of the most modern cinemas in Bangkok.

One of the biggest mall in the world. For lovers of shopping, certainly will not miss one of the biggest mall in the world. Of course, here you will find a variety of well-known branded merchandise and the place was also used them as one of the business centers in Bangkok.Come, do not you miss to visit this place when you are in Bangkok!

Must go mall :). Worth going! I love Central World Plaza!! So big with many levels..loads of restaurants in different styles of cuisines. I love B2S Bookstore! :D I love the Central Food Hall in the top floor, a huge supermarket with cooked food kiosks as well!! Also, love going to the department store ZEN!! Similar to Hong Kong's Lane Crawford! Worth going if you are fashion items fan ;)

Huge Mall!. If you are going to Bangkok for the first time and would want to go to the mall, I don't suggest that you go here. Yes it is big, cool, and hip but there's nothing that makes this mall so special, its just like your average mall. Instead of going here I suggest that you could just visit Terminal 21 or malls around Siam instead for shopping.
Great experience. A must visit shopping centre. A great place to shop and relax. All the high end designer brands available. Quality at reasonable price.

Younger persons mall. This is a nice mall, i don't like shopping but an enjoyable place to visit and have a drink in. I especially like the Twinnings place here, much pricier than UK, but a little treat on a hot day :-)

So big!. Always worth a visit. There's always something going on in this mall. The grocery is a bit pricey. Bought lots of shirts at H&M. Ate at Din Tai Fung. They can give you free wifi access if you show your passport at the concierge.
Shopping +++. Massive shopping centre. Get off sky train at Siam and walk across the bridge. Overwhelming size but fun and lots to see.

Nice and huge shopping mall. This shopping mall is really awesome. It is a nice getaway and a place to chill out from the hot weather in Bangkok especially after your long tiring shopping adventure in Platinum Fashion Mall. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from at the top level. The SFX cinema is one of the most modern cinemas in Bangkok. I recently caught Jurassic World there. Nice couple seats that costed me 700 bahts. I also saw a First Class cinema in SFX. It is probably belong to the top notch category of cinema entertainment that can also be found back home in Singapore. On the whole, this shopping mall is a great place that offers different type of shopping experience from the wholesale shopping that you can find in Platinum Fashion Mall or Pratunam Old Market
extensive shopping. Lots of brands and different price levels equals great choice.the It has various levels specializing in different things and floors with a variety of restaurants as well.
Good gataway. This mall is really good, counting with a lot of different price range for all pockets. Its nice to have a peaceful time away from all the pushy asian sellers.

Shopping Fun. This plaza is an amazing experience. The two department stores and the plethora of shops is a paradise in which to spend money. If you are bored with shopping you can take in a movie or enjoy a meal at one of the many restaurants.

Huge Mall. Its a huge mall full of branded shopping.
The food court is massive and full of options.
There are lots of street vendors outside if you want a local touch.

Favourite hangout shopping under one roof. Dont miss it of you have not been there👍👌
My favourite Nail Salon
Namu Korean Nail Salon.
Good skill , Good art work, Professional Clean & Hygenic.
Price above average but value for money
😆be sure to check it out

Huge with lots of variety. This is a massive mall, good variety of fashion and food stores. The food is great and varied, located mostly on the two uppermost floors, excellent and reasonably priced. We ate there many times. A really good mall, a mix of local and western stores. The supermarket on the top floor was great, it had everything, all the basics as well as gourmet foods and a good range of fresh fruit.
MALL. This is one of the big malls in Bangkok.Lots of good shopping and food outlets.Prices similar to other malls.Lots of shoppers.

Big mall. This mall is huge and very clean. They have alle the brands from cheap to semi expensive. It's to freakin big for me. But hey, I don't like shopping. For luxury go to Siam Paragon or Central Embassy.
love shopping. it was very good shopping with my wife and daughter , quite large and very reasonable price for branded clothes

I don't even like malls and this place is interesting. There is actually great food at Central World. Seriously. So for anyone who doesn't like malls and/or shopping, I am pretty sure you will be able to find something to do. Or at least to eat.

Everything is here. Mention anything you need and this mall will be your guide.
From many choices food from all over the country and many shops from all brands, no wonder this mall is the largest in thailand.
Central World Plaza. The one-stop-mall all great brands and goodies you want to buy in Bangkok. Easily connected by the BTS.

A HUGE Mall where you can find everything.. 7 floors. And each floor takes about at least half an hour to finish. IT IS HUGE. This one is for the shopping freaks. The departmental store in the seventh floor is big and it has everything you would need. Also, there is a cineplex with 15 screens. But, I am giving three stars because of one unfortunate incident happened to us. We have tried to get coffees from a instant coffee maker kiosk. And to our disappointment we have found few insects floating in it. So, I am rating average. I would suggest explore the local areas of Bangkok rather than wasting time in a mall.

A great and huge shopping mall. I go to this shopping mall 2-3 times a month. It's a huge mall. And it have everything you like to buy. There are also hundreds of restaurants, fast food places and coffee shops. One of the 3-4 best shopping malls that I have seen anywhere in the world.

Shopping in Bangkok.. This is actually central Bangkok for its shopping.The complex is large to say the least and has most shops you would want to get some shopping done.Outside the complex, it gets more interesting as they have fairs to showcase the different Thai food though it was a little expensive compared to your regular Thai fare.On the street it get even more interesting as the streets are lined with stalls selling food and shopping that is cheaper then what you can ever imagine it would cost to make it.Even the money changer "SuperRich" off the main strip on a side road gives the best rate you can get anywhere in Bangkok as my experience was. Note tho' only the main office gives the best rate as we found a SuperRich at one of the shopping malls but they didn't give that good a rate.You really need to spend time here even if shopping or eating or just being where the action is is not your thing.

Beautify shopping center with everything. This shopping center has everything you could want it and even if you can't afford it you'll still look, with many many floors to shop on and heaps of Resturant's there's some thing here for everyone It's merchandising is excellent and makes you want to look and shop and as per all the large Bangkok shopping centers are like this and all worth a look at if ur a shopper.

Lots of restaurant and Shopping area. I am regular customer of Central World for so long. I enjoy varieties of food here including the Theatres which I found here quite comfortable than others.Also it has so many shopping facilities with 2 department store, Isetan and Zen. I can find mostly of my needs here.
Central shopping. Good place for people who want to do some shopping in mall style. It also has nice toilets. Everything is clean and well taken care of.

Wow ! so many shops that will keep any person happy to shop. We have been there a few times evening to eat and daytime to shop.The entrance is security checked going through a security gate, so make sure you go through the right door, otherwise you will get stopped by security.All types of food on offer Japanese, Thai, Vietnam, Western and much more.Information for the ladies; the one thing that I like about Thailand the toilets are always very clean.

If you can't find it at this mall, Bangkok doesn;t have it.. Nice place to shop and eat. Plenty of good restaurant with a large variety of food. From Thai food to American to several types of Oriental. Also good coffee shops and ice cream parlors. The shopping is also fun and interesting. They also have entertainment to watch and listen. The only problem was finding your way out of the building, it's very large complex but the effort to check it out is worth it.

Shopper's Paradise. Great Shopping mall ! You get great discounts on brands and the mall is huge . Shop shop till you drop ! For all the Indians, don't miss the Lord Ganesh Idol at the front of the mall.

Still has the charm after all these years. Previously this is known as World Trade Center. Before Central took over, it is one of the best malls in Bangkok. Ever since Central took over and renamed it as Central World Plaza, it became better. Twice this mall has been damaged, After the repairs, t gets better.Even though it is like a maze inside, but you will never get boring spending time in there.2 anchor tenants, which is Zen of Central and Isetan of Japan. They have been in here ever since. Besides them, there are plenty of restaurants and branded shops. Even though you may not want to buy, but window shopping is not wasting time.Love this place always, especially with the skywalk to connect to other malls.
place for shopping!. clean area, lots of shopping, mostly expensive things but quite original and very good atmosphere!!!

Just like any other Mall anywhere . The mall has good collection of local and overseas brands. Most of the brands which are available in India are also here but the pricing is more. Some of the brands are and if there is some discount on garments then it makes sense to buy from here. Overall experience is above average.

not much of a shopper buttttt. it's overwhelming to see this much stuff for sale all in one place, it's shop till you drop and then some, no wonder people come from all over the world to shop here !!!I did do a little shopping and found that things are generally the same price in every shop for what it is your looking for, sooo don't be afraid to use your negotiating skills, you know the one you've been using on the street everywhere else !! anyway whole floors devoted to electronics, shoes you name it, caution don't lose tract of time cause this is not the reason you came here, or is it !!
Huge.....! . Make sure you have plenty of hours to be there... There are a lot of choices and at different prices... Take a look and keep notes on where to buy... No room for negotiations...

great place if you like food. I have been to this shopping center many time, and always enjoy the experience, lots to see and most of lots of different types of restaurants, especially the japanes section, also great to try the salads very fresh and when all the eating is completed I go to the cinema purchase the vip tickets and fall asleep great way to spend a day in bangkok
High end shopping central. This is the place you can find local and overseas branded goods. A place also for food and leisure Nearest BTS station is chit hom which is about 10 minutes walk

First Class Cinema at Central Chaengwattna is anything but. Had a bad experience at the First Class Cinema at Central Chaengwattna and when I asked for a manager they would only send an assistant. They had no interest in my question or complaint. Also, after you pay three times the price of a normal movie ticket they charge you extra for a coke zero (apparently only regular soft drinks are included in ticket price). The seats are nice, but that is it. The cinemas at other malls are much more worth it.

Typical big city mall. Shopping, shopping and much more shopping. There is a great variety of shops to choose from here and lots of delicious eateries to keep your energy levels going. It does house a great deal of upper end fashion though, and probably not suited to a traveller in a tight budget.

shopping and only shoooopping. Wow so big and so noisy! I used to live in china and these type of shopping is over for me :) It's a nice place for european to go see, however it's really the asian way to shop
Amazing shopping centre . Awesome shopping centre with everything in fashion covered. A great way to beat the heat and a heap of places to eat too. Shopping galore.

LARGE and POSH. I went there and expected the price of clothes to be much lower. It was a surprise for me, I thought it would be cheap because it is in Thailand. It is very large and the stores are expensive...

Not the best choice for food court. I went to the Central World Plaza food court for lunch on Saturday and was dissapointed by the food quality. We tried a variety of dish (thai cusine) from 4 different stalls and the quality is very so so. I thought I had high expectation, but I went to Siam Paragon on Sunday and their food quality is so much better. (I believe the price in Siam Pargaon's food court is higher than Central World Plaza's food court(
Like any other mall. But larger. Location - right next to Chit Lom BTS station. Multiple floors, connected to two other building. Enough food variety, and food court
Best mall in BKK. Our hotel was opposite CW and had a chance to explore. Great mall with large variety of restaurants and all the big local names. Easily can spend the day shopping there.

As shopping malls go, impressive. . Malls are not my thing. But for the architecture this one gets my attention. The central escalator area is shaped like a wide funnel so that you descend in a spiral from floor to floor, giving you a rather grand view of the ground floor which doubled up as a performance space the day we were there.

Shoppers Paradise. This is an up market shopping mall in the heart of Bangkok. There are at least 7 levels of shops both local and western franchises. There are also food outlets form a Food Court to restaurants.

Wow!. It just goes on and on and on and on and when you think you've coome to the end of it, another level opens, just like going through the maze of a video game. There is great movies complex at the top of the place, little away from fresh fruit stands at 9th or something floor!

Becareful freeline deceiver in front of central world. Im often visit central when come to bkkAnd im always looking old man stand up in front of central worlsHe likes talk with tourist to promote about secret wat and anythingSo guys dont believedIm ever hear from my friendsSome tourist follow him and then he take to go gem shop and souvenir shop and very expensive gem and souvenirAnd the gem shop dontbhsve certificare or illegal cause they are cooperation with many thai people to promote that shop with give some moneyAnd then he take to go secret temple and then u will need paid for blessing and talisman from the monkI think the mont is fake tooSo please dont easy believe and trust man give promise will take going good spot tourism and secret location tourism in bangkokBetter u ask to ur tour guide and policeman
Very good experience. Good muslim food at Mrs. Balbir's. Indian food. Good cinema. Toys r us for kids. Super heroes store, altho expensive but took great pix with life-size characters.

Shopping and food. Take some time off the citylife and go shop in this huge shoppingcenter. Also good food restaurants inside. As all shoppingcenters the prices are normal. Not especially cheap but you can find good offers.

Very Good!. It is one of the best Malls I have ever seen. It has such a nice variety of clothing brand stores with great stuffs inside it. The 'Zara' store is a really big one and had good variety. The Coffee Shops available inside are also pretty nice and good variety. Couples can come in and hangout for a little while. I really Enjoyed a lot in there as i am a bit of shopping freak. ;)

Get the free wifi!!. Central World Plaza is a modern and very flash shopping mall. Lots has been written elsewhere.We really like the Zen department store, but there are numerous "brand" shops, lots of eateries, and the food market on the top level is excellent.Two tips - see the concierge and get a wifi pass, and if you spend more than B2000 in any one shop don't forget to get a PP10 form and get your VAT refund.

Great place to shop!!!. Wow, what a cool mall! A great place to shop, but we discovered Bangkok has so many great shopping malls. This one was one of our favorites, great shops, many very high end, but some a little less expensive so that was nice. The selection of places to eat or just g have a cup of tea or coffee was excellent as well. Highly recommend, especially if you need a little change from visiting temples and museums.

SFW CINEMA. Nice big refreshment stand upstairs at cinema 7,8,9 full of popcorn and goodies. No one to serve you bar 3 typical lazy Thais playing on their phones at the ticket stand. Have noticed customer service in Thailand at commercial locations to be crap to say the least. First and last visit and will be passing this on to my 4000+ Facebook followers.

Huge Mall !. Good place to hang out with family and friends.....lots of restaurants and cinema....but shopping could be expensive as its all branded shops....would've been better if it was a stop for skytrain
You can buy as you want.. So many types of things for selection. I had been buying 2 pairs of shoes, two long trousers, a set of glassses and a traveller bag there last time.

Overrated. I had read it's one of the most impressive shopping malls in Asia and I had also read that Bangkok was all about the shopping. Well I'm not sure where those people are from but it failed to impress me. It's not as big as I had expected. It has most of the global chain stores e.g. Zara, MNG, Top Shop etc I was hoping for more unique stores with items I couldn't get back home. Prices are the same as back home. There was some entertainment going on - a beauty pageant and the Thai Food Festival was happening outside. I expected more architectural design or something that would make it memorable but there really wasn't much to grab my attention. I left empty handed and somewhat disappointed but luckily the food festival cheered me up afterwards :)

HUGE!! Packed with people though - watch your wallet here!!. Central World Plaza is a huge complex and great for finding just about anything you need. However, this place is packed full of people and is not easy to get around because it is so full. Especially on the weekends! A young boy tried to pick my pocket while I was here - I had my wallet in my front pocket which was zipped shut and had a Velcro flap over the zipper, but somehow he managed to get both the Velcro and zipper open. Luckily I noticed before he had time to get my wallet out. Be careful when you around a lot of people in crowded areas - which pretty much goes for anywhere in the world. Enjoy the plaza, but be aware!!

Restaurants, shopping, entertainment - all in one. This plaza's got almost everything you need. There's a cinema, shops, a large supermarket, and restaurants. This is the place to go if you like shopping, and have some great food afterwards.
Dissapointed.. Well i'd had to see the 3. biggest shoppingcenter in the world, but i was so dissapointed. It only has expensive shops and there is so many people, that i had to give up.

International shopping centre. Huge shopping complex full of known name brand shops i.e. Gap, Top Shop, H & M, Zara, UniQlo, Isetan, Sketches etc. A great place to spend a day, but I didn't find the prices to be any cheaper than at home. There are a few market stalls downstairs with cheaper items but generally you get what you pay for.A great place to spend a day in air conditioning when it is hot outside.

One of the BEST Shopping malls in Bangkok. Central World is one of the biggest shopping malls in Bangkok, it has everything you need in regards to shopping (local & international brands), food (all cuisines), entertainment (ice rink, cinema..) and much more! Many events take place in Central World, its always fun to visit. Make sure you visit during the Bangkok Motorbike Festival, you can find anything related to motorbikes and its accessories (make sure you prepare a budget just for that, the helmets are AWESOME!) Its a clean, safe and modern mall with beautifully designed architecture. You must stop by if you're in Bangkok.
Its a mall!. One of the many malls, certainly one of the better ones but it does not have its own skytrain stop so plan to get a bit sweaty getting there.

Huge, high class shopping mall gives Paragon competition. If you can't find it here, it's probably because you're lost. This place is immense, and offers for sale just about everything one could dream of and then some. I was looking for an outer shirt to replace one that was worn out, and a local friend recommended this mall, and a specific store. The recommended store had exactly what I was looking for -- in "S" size only. I've enjoyed a few too many scoops of coconut ice cream to ever fit into an "S" again, and asked if they had anything larger. "Not until next month". But luckily, another store in the same complex had the exact item I needed in "L", and it fit. The stores are an eclectic mix of haute name brands and budget stores (OK, maybe a fairly big budget), with very helpful staff, even in the cases where they don't have exactly what you were looking for. At the first shop, the clerk made a number of suggestions for alternatives as well as an idea of where else in the mall the item might be found. At the shop where I did end up buying the shirt, the sales clerk took the time to make sure I had the proper VAT refund paperwork in hand before I left the store.If I had not been on a tight schedule to get to a social function across town, I would have stayed longer to take in the fascinating retail architecture and perhaps have found some coconut ice cream to celebrate my purchase. :>)

It's just a mall. I guess if you live in a city that has modern malls you will think 'it's a mall - so what?' If you don't live in that sort of city then you'll probably be impressed with Central World. It has all the regular shops but no particular features or facilities to wow you
should be banned. what a shopping precinct, probably the biggest I have ever been in, hang on to you wallet, or better still don't take it

Lively Upmarket Plaza. The Central World Plaza offers almost everything that you need, especially in terms of shopping an entertainment. There are times when there are open markets on the external portion of the plaza - gives more life to the place!

Huge and modern shopping mall. Nice shopping mall in the center of the city. I love the ChikaLicious Dessert Bar.. Incredible ice cream and mocha. Pastry chef makes everything in front of you. DELICIOUS

Expensive toys. Great for women I guess... A pretty huge shopping mall. All I can say is the toys in the malls are expensive. Nose bleed after my sons picked remote control car + Pokemons. Found that it's above Sgp prices.
Huge. Its a never ending puzzle - it will ensure there is nothing left in your pocket!! A range of good value deal to top designer outlets.
Highend Shopping mall. We went there for Ice-skating as my daughter wanted to do. It was fun and not very expensive. Few expensive outlets but a lot of options. A must go...

My second best in Bangkok. Only 300 meters away from the Siam Pragon you find this huge shopping mall.
With lots of shops and restaurants it compliments its neighbors to form Bangkok's modern shopping district.
It is large, clean and busy.
Another shoppers paradise.

Love it. You could spend a day here as it cool after the heat of Bkk. and it has so many attractions.
Shoppers paradise, bring your credit card

Central World Plaza.. What do you need to buy or find at any time well into the evening? What if you didn't get to the bank in time? Here, not only will you be able to find almost any goods you want, but the banks will stay open far beyond the normal banking hours, and one can draw cash or pay for goods according to your own preferred method of payment. Food is in abundance with a good choice. Youngsters will be going around smartly dressed, often with the latest iPhone, even if back home the family are having to exist on $5 per day !

enjoyable. One of the best places I have probably ever seen in Sourh East Asia. I can spend the hole day there doing practically everything, from just walking around, shopping, eating, entertaining and even relaxing. Apart of its excellent location, in the middle of the downtown with connection of two main roads and a key train, make this place one of the most accessible so. Visit it specially in December, when the huge beer gardens are set up there. Enjoy.

Massive... With lots of varieties. Located in the centre of Bangkok... This huge place is always filled with activities... Shoppers and tourists... Lots of brands and restaurants to be found there... You'll get lost while shopping

Honeymoon Killer . Made a mistake bringing my new wife here. She spent an eternity walking around destroying my credit rating, feet and any desire for amorous honeymoon activities. Do yourselves a favour men, stay away! One star given for clean toilet facilities which I visited several times thanks to last night's Immodium challenging pad Thai.
Good for morning walk-- Nothing as tourist attraction.... Its good for morning walk.. big park.. well maintained.. though nothing to attract if you want a day picnic as a tourist.

Shopping!!!. One of my fav mall in Bangkok actually... Love that there are huge food choices! Ranges of western... Alot of Nice dessert!!! Excellent place to do your shopping with large numbers of varieties of goods, (Bags, Fashion, Jewellry, Body Care Products etc).
Out the mall theres places for u to chill too

One of the biggest mall in the area. This is one of the biggest mall in the Bangkok. Almost everything is sold in this mall. From electronic gadgets to cars, etc. We're able to buy some jewelries a bit cheaper.

Fun place. Where would you find the worlds most expensive cars on display in the vicinity of a Uniqlo store and a designer icecream shop. That the sort of place this is, great range of retail outlets some of which are a bit upmarket an excellent food hall and easy access from the sky rail

Excellent Place to Shop. Excellent place to do your shopping with large numbers of varieties of goods, (Bags, Fashion, Jewellry, Body Care Products etc). Numerous promotions/events at the podium both inside & outside Central World Plaza. Many restaurants to cater for diverse dinners.

Everything you need under one roof. I have been visiting this Mall many times, mainly to visit mobile phone offices ( to reload prepaid SIM card) .About AIS you have to know that you better charge small amounts , like 20 Baht per time to extend validity for 30 days each time instead of 50 ,same amount of days... True and Dtac are all represented on the third floor. There is also a free App available to find the shop you need to go. At some information stands, you will be given a free wifi code after identification. About restaurants, go higher. You'll find all kind of varieties of food; Japanese (Shabushi) and others sushi places, a SIZZLER with all you can eat salad buffet, Koreans , Vietnamese not to mention the common fast food chains. On 7th floor is a Tops Superstore and even a food court. On the direct link to Grand Centara at Central World Hotel you will pass a cinema multiplex with all facilities too. There is always something going on at Central World, in the ground floor circle, where escalators lead clockwise up, and down in. The other direction. To discover all shops, you'll need a couple of days there. Good luck in finding a new one!

Big and Beautiful. Nice aic-con mall. It has an excellent selection of brand name stores. The theaters upstairs are nice and well-kept. The restaurants are plentiful and many of them have delicious food.

Mega Shopping Centre. One of the top shopping centre around, outside the civic plaza. almost every weekend there is a event going on. There is a big supermarket at the top level of the building and lot of food outlet at the same level.

High end mall. This excellent mall offers an awsome selection of shops and restaurants, as well as skating on ice ring and sevral cinemas.However, it is very difficult to find you way around. Its location is very central
Make sure you have your cards and cash ready. besides the shopping, there are quite a fair bits of events from time to time. Lucky that we saw big bikes that Ride For Nepal. Our prayers to Nepal.
Fun place to shop.. A great place to step in from the steamy outdoors and do some shopping in air conditioned comfort. The mall is well organized with a great variety of shops.

It's a must for you if you like shopping also eating. This mall got choices of stores or restaurants for you, you can find almost any style of food that you want in the mall such as Japanese, Thai, American or Korean.I suggest you come here during week days even though it might still be crowded but it will be even more crowded if you come on weekends, there is also street malls that is just outside of the mall but unfortunately if you want to shop outside it will be more better to eat outside cause there are more food stalls than stores.
Powerful aircon. Great place to hide from the horrible heat in Bangkok. Products are mainly upmarket luxurious brands.

Not special. outside mall have event charity for nepal…inside mall is too crowd…tired while wanted to buy or choose any…but outside mall,which along road side,have many nice n delicious even worth for money to eat…

Lots of choices ... if mall shopping is your cup of tea!. This mall is spacious, has lots of the usual chain stores and such. You can easily spend a half day there, as a shopping enthusiast. I was staying at a hotel not far away and decided to try it out. Realized that I like outdoor markets in SE Asia much better for fun shopping outings ... oh well.

BEST EVER HAIRCUT. Central World Plaza is unfortunately not on a sky train station but is only 5-10 mins walk from Siam (Paragon center) or perhaps a little less from Chit Lom both ways are mostly assessable by an elevated walkway. the Plaza is perhaps a little downmarket from Paragon but is still a fantastic shopping center and i personally recommend a hairdressers Cut and Curl where for a similar price I pay at home for a basic cut I get a wash with fantastic head massage then cut and style.The center as well as having all the High Street brands has many individual shops and coffee shops cafe's and restaurants.

A great place to hangout. Central world plaza is a great place to hangout if you have several hours in your day to spend. The shopping and dining options are plenty so make sure you plan accordingly or you might end up spending more than you wanted to.

central world food hall. this is a good place to eat as there is a wide choice of foods from different cultures. On arrival you are give a card with value 1000TBH you can then choose food from any stall and pay on the way out …great idea

Nice ambience. I visit here because it is near the hotel. The center is large with many stores although food court is small and not much variety. The market offers a good selection of cheese and the bakery has a variety of delicious items. In the 'winter' months, there are beer gardens set up in the front court of the center. The beer gardens serve all kinds of beer and local dishes. They also have life bands. It is a fun place to visit, especially in the 'winter' filled with holidays spirits and year end sales. The center leads to other shopping centers via the sky walk to Gaysorn and Emerald Shopping Arcade on one end and to Siam Paragon, Siam Discovery, and MBK on the other end.Hope this helps those visiting this are for the first time. I visit at least 2 times a year.

HUGE upmarket shopping centre in Central Bangkok. One of the biggest and most impressive shopping centres in the world. More upmarket than any others we visited in Bangkok, literally hundreds of top name brands littered over their 7+ floors. Mixture of fine dining and standard restaurants in the food hall, covering cuisines from all over the world.A little tip, they have a cinema on the top floor that shows the latest English films, for 200 baht (£4). Our flight was at 6am so we didn't want to book a hotel, instead we went to Central World and watched the latest film they had showing, 12.30am, which kept us occupied until our 3am taxi to the airport. Fantastic, modern cinema with excellent service, they even let us charge our phones while we watched (we had the whole cinema to ourselves).

Shop, Shop, Shop. This place is huge an has everything from Prada and Dior to Uniquo and Gap, there is also every type of restaurant you can imagine and then theres a food court that sells every type of fast food

A Tired Shopping Mall. Central World used to be one if the best in BKK. However it has become tired and in need of an update like almost all of the Central offerings. Yes it is huge but it lacks anything special. No great prices like MBK. No Wow like Central Embassy or the new EM Quartier. No panache like Siam Paragon. Just big. IMHO other than Central Embassy, the Central Group has focused on expansion not refining and improving their existing product.

too much to see in one day. if you like shopping then this is the place for you literally thousands of stalls to see and would take more than a day to walk round..it is an amazing place to see and they sell anything and everything..load your wallets up and visit..you wont be disappointed...
Immense. Really, one of my favorite malls in the world - from great stores to a huge variety of eating places, to terrific theaters, right along the Skytrain. A great place on a hot Bangkok day.

Shopping Extreme. Central World is just full on shopping. Huge shopping complex with shops of every description. Easy to get lost as there is just so much. Easily spend a day there. Remember its a mall so prices a bit dearer than on the streets, and there is no haggling. :-)

Wow it's huge. My and my partner spent a great deal of time walking around today. Although we didn't buy anything it was worth a look, never been in a shopping centre so big and so many designer shops it was unreal , prices aren't really much different to the UK though.
Central World. Best mall to buy good branded stuff including automobiles. It is really a large mall in heart of the city and was walking distance from Amari watergates

Best in Bangkok. From shopping to cinema to even live concerts, this is the best of bangkok shopping, it has wide walking spaces and convenient stairs and enough toilets and restaurants that makes you like the place, huge place with many things to shop at very good prices. This is really the best of bangkok, also has one good rooftop bar in zen called heaven, and another on centara grand that is connected to the shopping centre which is called red sky, both great for sightseeing. This shopping centre even has an ice skate rink inside!!!

Huuuuuge. Not really sure how many days someone would need to visit all the shops in this mega mall, but it is really fascinating. Really huge and with all kinds of shops and restaurants. So if you have plenty of time and enjoy air conditioned space where you don't have to go out for days, this is your favorite mall!

Good traditional mall ..... With tourist prices. Done my fair share of mall visiting in many different countries. Decided to check out CentralWorld Plaza. The previous day I visited MBK, and wasn't overly impressed purely given the claustrophobic feelings I had there with so many vendors crammed into spaces.Nevertheless walking into CentralWorld was a joy. More like your traditional western malls with a wide mix of stores from sports to fashion to food etc. Some of the high end retailers and fashion brands were there also.The prices were fairly marked up, you won't really find any bargains there, but it was a wonderful mall that you could a good few hours looking around and then stop in for some late breakfast or lunch - again don't expect any bargain food prices either.Overall a nice mall. Just not a mall you would visit to find good prices. It's purely for the tourists and you won't find many locals shopping in there.

Awesomely huge mega-mall. I was surprised when I got there, waves of people in front me, you know, even for a Chinese/Shanghainese like me, I never expected to see something like this outside of my own city. And this place even exceeded my city. Huge mall, huge crowd, everything looks good in the mall and a lot of food and entertainment going on. It is definitely a world-level shopping mall.

Famous Brands from all over the world. Central World Plaza is a huge shopping mall near by Siam BTS. It's connected to the skytrain. It's shopping is to notch or so my girlfriend says. The plaza is massive. If you're hungry there are many restaurants to choose from. There is a great theatre inside too for an afternoon movie to escape the heat. Siam Paragon and Central World is usually packed with locals and tourists buying as much as they can fit to bring home.

One stop shopping in the middle of town. This is one of mall in Bangkok which I chose to go as the parking is not too difficult to find and there's valet service available. The mall located at the ratchaprasong junction, so you can even reach there by cab or bus which u can drop off in front of mall. If you choose sky train, you may need to take a bit walk from the sky walk. And you can walk either from Siam Station or Chidlom Station. From this mall, you can walk across the street to High end mall like Erawan Plaza and Gaysorn Plaza. Or you can walk by the corner to Platinum mall; the wholesales mall.Inside the mall it's include 2 malls (zen and Isetan) + 1 big plaza. Now they just expand new Zone called groove which have brand name stuffs including restaurant and bars open till late night.The mall also next to the hotel which it would give you another choice of dining experiences and chill out place on rooftop bar and enjoy the city view.Zen; is the middle class of brand and they sell varieties of products separate products by each floor. So you will easily find stuffs like cosmetic floor, male floors female floor etc.Isetan; is similar to Zen in way they categorize products by floor but the uniqueness is they served Japanese products as the main focus. There're selection of Japanese products and desserts on supermarket floor, Japanese food restaurants and Japanese book shop like kinokuniya etcThe plaza area just in the middle and there're varieties of branded stuffs, restaurants, grab and go food counter, they even separate floor for mobile and technology stuffs, varieties of bank services, sport and even furnitures. There's supermarket on the top and the theatre on the same floor. Groove area also serve something different and Give you more selection on shopping points and dinner options. I really love to go this mall as they always on sales. It's really motivating to go for shopping.

My favour it mall in Bangkok. This is my fav mall in Bangkok. I not exactly a shopper and if anything, I like shopping for sports goods, books or just simply eat . This mall has a floor catering to sports goods. It has pretty big book stores. And there are countless options for food and coffee. It's new and big . I live it here compared to the hustle and bustle of places such as platinum plaza. Not everyone will agree with me but I guess it's just a difference in preferences .

Just an average mall, but supersized. To me, Central World Plaza is just another upmarket mall loaded with plenty of international retail brands. When I plan a trip to bangkok for shopping, the last thing I want is to find what is already available back home. I'd want to do some serious shopping & haggling for discounts. All in all, it is still a good place for families with kids or anyone who just wants to get out from the scorching Bangkok heat.

My first visited mall in Bangkok. It was around 20 years ago, it was called World Trade Center At that time. Since the renovation everything had changed. The atmosphere, the shops quality. Although it isn't easy to find your way as this mall is gigantic! But you will never get bored. Interesting choices of really diverse shops. I loved the really high class jewelry shop called Orawan Collection. Nice quality and really friendly staff.

Out of the Heat and traffic pollutant emissions. To be honest Bangkok is not the ideal place to travel around in the day time due to the heat ect,but if your stay is a short one,try staying in The Plaza's near area's you visit good food and shopping to your needs and there is nothing to dislike as everything is cool

Escape from the heat. Huge and i mean HUGE shopping mall,between the Chit Lom and Siam BTS interchange.Also nice food court on top floor,pad thai's,noodles,stir fries,...for 50-60 baht,great selection of all asian cuisines.

Bit bland and without any character. To me this is just another shopping centre, one of many in Bangkok. Somewhere cool to go when it is way too hot to be outside. This place is easy to get to, it is between Siam and Chit Lom Skytrain statiions, it involves a short walk undercover from either station. It is a huge shopping centre with lots of shops and department stores. There is a Marks and Spencer and other British stores if that interests you.The supermarket ocated within the large department store was really good though. Good choice of movies at the cinemas too.

What more shopping. If you like millions of square feet of glitzy shopping this is the place for you. Floors and floors of air conditioned shopping from Louis Vutton to a place to buy your printer paper. The food court is really good.

best shopping mall in Bangkok. i been a lot of shopping malls in Bangkok. but CTW is best place. you can find eerything. many brand store. good foods. also 7th floor tops market have big food fair. tasty food for cheap price

Everything you need and more. Central World Plaza has a great food court at the top, wonderful shops with all the big names and more on all floors and right at the bottom is a bit of a 'bargain basement' with some good finds and a few more places to eat - I loved this place - it was attached to our hotel and proved handy a few times for us.
Big. I have a good impression on the mall as it is huge and provide a wide variety of shops. Got good food options, and being a spacious mall, it makes one wants to stay here longer.
Lovely!. Great place for shopping, lots of variety. Food court big and lots of variety, though the food runs out if you go close to closing time.A must visit place when you go to Bangkok.

Huge, modern shopping mall. Food aplenty, range from fast food and cafe to upscale fine dining. Most stores are in the mid range and affordable to general, sandwich between upscale Siam Paragon and warehouse price Platinum.

Modern Mall. The nearest Modern Mall to The Berkeley. Clean and Spacious. Layout is not friendly though. Two adjacent wings separated by a walkway which makes combing the entire mall rather challenging

Not much of mall fan, but very impressive. I am not normally one to hang out at malls, There are two big shopping malls. This one at SIAM station, the MBK at National Stadium. This one is more upscale, but not too fancy, has great food options and is very clean. If you don't like heights, you might not like this mall as much. (Not a fan of heights, personally)

contemporary but not opulent like Siam Paragon. I enjoyed walking through this mid to high end mall. Outside they have 2 golden statues on display with a place to burn incense and to leave offerings to ganesha and another diety. 7 japanese restaurants and a very good food court as well as a ice skating rink
Good shop/eat. Huge shopping mall. Lots ofchoice for dining, coffee options. Nice to be in cool air conditioned. Entertainment options.
very good option to paragon. recommend this one, its in many ways better than paragon. You will find everything you want to buy. But also fancy, you won't miss paragon.

Huge Mall, Lots to Do, Shelter from the Heat Outside. Central Mall is huge, lots of variety, though not particularly cheap. The food court serves average to nice food, though you'll have a better experience with the restaurants. Good for half a day of shopping.

Most happening place. Our visit was during the Songkran festival and Central World plaza was filled with people, mostly youngsters throwing water at each others (and passers by like us). The Mall has most of the top brands and other local brands. There are 2 floors of food court. It was packed during the holiday festival.

Enormous and modern mall with something for everyone. You can easily spend several hours at this mall! This is where I go to when I want to find gifts for my family and friends, everything in one place. The selections is huge and it's a perfect mix of local and international brands, tech and interior design, sports brands and high fashion. Here you'll find lots of different kinds of restaurants - international and local.
Shopping. Shopping here is amazing. I liked clothes particular fabrics made of linen.Shopping here is amazing. I liked clothes particular fabrics made of linen.

lovely. it is one of my favourite malls to visit, it's so huge that for a person to shop or look around every shop n each floor you would take around 3 hours but enjoyed the place. nice hangout as well. had gone in June, July 2013.

Truly Vast. As a Manila resident, I fancy myself a "veteran maller" if there is such a thing, but I have to admit I was a bit blown away by the sheer size of this mall, and the variety of the establishments I found therein, although it really eventually just boils down to the basics like clothes, accessories, gadgets, cosmetics, toys and food. I didn't have much money so I was pretty much restricted to window shopping, but the good news for anyone who may be interested was that there was a lot to see. I have no idea if their prices were competitive, unfortunately, though given that this was a high-end mall and not some air-conditioned flea market I'm guessing I wouldn't have been able to haggle my way through anything. Besides, one doesn't just go to malls for the things to buy but for the ambience, and in my opinion this place had it in spades.I wouldn't mind going back with a bit more money next time. ;)

Shopping for children clothes & Naraya bags.. After our prayer at Erawan Shrine,we proceed to Central Plaza.Our first stop is the Naraya flag ship store,where most of their goods design are available here.As the saying goes,is the huge crowd inside this store.Tourist are buying lots of bags and the cashiers are serving a long queue of customers non stop.We bought 4 bags of various design and proceed next to Isetan department store.My spouse managed to buy some good quality infant clothing on offer and Thai aromatic oil here.As it was 1pm and we proceed to Coca restaurant for our suki steamboat lunch.

A lot of excellent stuff. This place is in central Bangkok, easily accessible from BTS (sky train) and has lots to see and do. Excellent shopping including some traditional Thai goods, and many excellent and reasonably priced restaurants. While Paragon remains my favorite (close by) better deals and value can be had at Central World. It killed me when the Red Shirts burnt it down but now it is restored and better than ever. The Chang beer garden out front is fun at night and has good music.
Good shopping at Central World. Shopping in Thailand is no longer that cheap. However Central World has a large variety of shops for most pockets. Would recommend a trip here.

The Best mall in Bangkok and will always be :). Spacious but not crazy hectic like Paragon, Central World has always been my favorite for many reasons. The choices of dining is superb, from the restaurants on Level 7 to that foodcourt to Zense rooftop bar. Can I just say that the food court is amazing? A tad more expensive by Thai standard (but still nothing by usd standard) the quality there is outstanding. Every stall nails it with the seasoning and presentation. If you're after great street food right infront are those famous eateries with the salted hanging grilled fish. You can easily have the best Thai street food experience there with $15 and easily feed four.The shopping is also great as the walkways are so wide and spacious. The only Topman/Topshop in Bangkok is located here. I just find Central very peaceful to walk through shopping experience.

Always a vast and exciting experience awaits in Central World ..... This mall opens around 10am and shopping can never cease here since it is a huge place complete with Food Courts and SF Cinema on the top floor, with ISETAN and ZEN being the anchor tenant. There is also 1 SPA and Massage unit on the 2nd level Wing B12. Only problem here is the elevator takes too long and always packed!I had a great experience from the 11-13 Apr 15 since there is a photo exhibition on the ground floor. On the whole it was a great experience in Central World.
Not my kind of place.. Just high-end shopping mall, designer labels, brands and stuffs. Basically a kind of shopping mall you have in your town.

All the upmarket shopping you need. This mall is packed full of brand names, restaurants and movie cimema's. Its a great place to visit. Close to the BTS and surrounded by other shopping opportunites.

Nice food court and many interesting shops.. Not much for malls. But this one has a nice atmosphere and has some exelent food on top level with a wide range of local and international foods. There are also a wide range of funky (in a good way) shops. Has a cafe called "MR. Jones Orphanage" witch I found quite weird. But that goes with the mall...... Connects to SIam discovery and Siam Paragon malls as well.
Great cinema. A very large multiplex with an amazing range of cinema offerings. Friendly helpful staff- many not comfortable with English so practice your sign language!
Prepare for a long day. This place is huge, every branded and non branded shop imaginable. Very clean, good amenities, great store staff. The best shopping mall in Bangkok

Good restaurants and Dessert cafe.. Plenty of restaurants to choose from, ranging from Authentic Thai food,western to Japanese food and many Dessert cafe to choose from. 'After you' dessert cafe is a must-try.
Huge mall. Central World is a huge mall with every big brand shop... my girl likes Naraya the best... I like the food court!

Huge mall!. Huge modern mall with many shops and eateries of all types of food. You could probably spend many hours here. Also a nice place to bring young kids - there is a small free play area with a slide that will give parents of a busy toddler some relief. Make sure you pick up a tourist card from the information centre - you may be able to get discounts at some stores. Make sure you have a copy of your passport or a picture of it stored on your phone - it is required to obtain the tourist card.

Everything you need under one roof. Conveniently located, accessible by Skytrain. All the name brands you want and also other independently owned small retail stores. This place is huge, but less crowd than the other shopping mall near by. If you are looking for bargains, you are not getting it here. Better go to the Night Market or the weekend market. Its clean and organized well, but its huge that you can get lost here.
It is all there.. Especially loved the food court. Just wished that the rules of the land would be more intuitive for a first time visitor.

Another Mall. Bangkok seems to be a city of many malls. There seems to be more square footage of shopping mall space than parking lots, and certainly more than green space! Central makes nice malls, however and this one is no exception. Enjoy it when you are tired of enduring the heat.
awesome. good to go after exploring the city under the tropical climate. huge selection of items to shop and enjoy the city life & culinary

No more haggling shopping!. great place to get your shop on. Street markets line roads in front of shopping malls. McDonalds across from Armani, a mall for every budget. If you've been on the road for a while and need to pick up some harder to find items, or if you're in need of an entire update or souvenirs, this is the place to go! Fixed price also gives you a break from bartering all the time....

very nice shopping mall in bangkok thailand. visit their lacoste boutique you might get the chance to avail the same deal i got from them. spend minimum of 10thousand baht and you will get gift cert worth 3thousand baht from them.exchange your receipt to the reception desk of the mall for every 5thousand accummulated receipt you will get a free gift from them , spend 10 thousand you will get 2free gifts exclusive for tourist only

nice. the shopping experience are greatbut the air conditioning is not very strong enough under hot summerthe costumer service staff at information counter overall not so nice, not sure if too many tourist so makes them pissed offhope this would be improve in future

It just goes on, and on, and....... A very good variety of shops from budget to high end, with some quality restaurants & eateries on the upper floors.The centre is midway between 2 BTS stations (Chit Lom & Siam), where you can walk along the BTS walkway above ground level for easy shaded access to the centre.Not one to rush through, so enjoy the air conditioning !

Love shop there many things to buy !!. I love to shop there, many shop to shop around...Every day we will go there have a walk to see any special offer for the special occasion as close to the xmas season ... nice place to go..

More than just a shopping mall. I love Central World because it has a perfect assortment of boutiques, department stores, coffee shops and restaurants. They even have an ice skating rink (not sure if it's open in the summer though). The outdoor plaza on the side of the mall hosts major events for big holidays! The large glass walkway up on the second floor is a great way to watch what is going on without being in the middle of the crowd. This is a good spot to watch Songkran fun and stay dry too. Chinese New Year and other holidays also have major set ups here too. There are also 2 very beautiful popular shrines at the end of the plaza.

super big shopping mall. what ever you need you will be able to find it here, multi level shopping mall with clothing store, food court, lots of mall vendors. prices are reg. mall prices, but they have alot of shops that you don't see in other places.
Shop till you drop. 7 levels of shop shop shop, my favourite level was the very top, good for the shopaholic, very easy to get lost

Amazing Central World Plaza!. Central World Plaza is excellent! Because it is a big mall and I believe that everyone knew this mall. It has many restaurant, the place for shopping, and the place for read a books. You can enjoy shopping in every shops. And if you’re hungry, you can visit the restaurant. In Central, there is a lot of restaurant. For example, there is a Thai food, Japanese food, McDonald, Mr. Donut, and ice cream. You can get there by drive a car from your home to Central World Plaza. I go to this mall almost every week. Central World Plaza have everything that you want! Some day I stay at this mall for one day, because it have everything that I said. My mother and father also like to go too. My friends also like Central World Plaza. I like to go to eat Japanese, because it is very delicious. When I have free time, I will come to Central World Plaza and watch movie with my mother. That’s all about amazing Central World Plaza!

The Largest. This Central World Plaza is the biggest shopping mall in Thailand, and it's the sixth largest shopping complex in the world. You can spend a whole day, or even more time in this mall. This mall had everything you want, food, clothes, electricity things, bookstore... anything you want, it's just there and waiting for you to buy. And make sure you have enough money to buy things. The commodity in the mall are not so expensive, but there is too many stuff you would love to buy. The door was open at 10:30 Am. The transportation: BTS Skytrain – CentralWorld is located between Chit Lom and Siam Stations. An elevated walkway connects the two stations to facilitate foot traffic. CentralWorld can also be accessed from Gaysorn or BigC Ratchaprasong via pedestrian overpasses. And make sure the way you go is correct, cause there is more than 500 stores in the Central World Plaza.

AC in a big mall. Bangkok is so hot and humid, it was nice to find a cool spot for a few hours. This is the place to get away to. It has most everything you would want to find in a mall. There's places to eat and high end stores that cater to the foreign traveler.

Disappointing shopping centre....... After having visited several of the other large Bangkok shopping centres we found this one quite disappointing. Was not as clean or welcoming as other centres, and did not find the variety of stores as appealing, prices were overall higher than other centres for the same goods on offer. Access was easy, but wouldn't go back again.

For people with a younger outlook. Central world plaza appeals more to a younger crowd it's their mix of stores pitched to a yougercowd. Most of the big names here are in other malls and it's slight harder to get to location between two bts stations makes it not my first choice in mallsinbngkok. But it's big air conditioned and if you fit the demographic ok to wander around
Everything you need. You can spend a whole day or more in this place, plenty to see and do, great shopping and food court. Nice to escape the heat
Huge mall with everything good!!. This mall offer luxury brands to the affordable one. Personally loved the H&M and Uniqlo collection. The food is good too!!

Typical Mall. Typical mall atmosphere, nothing really special. Many stores, very crowded and over priced. Trying to cater to Thais that want to be looked at as HISO or just teenagers and college students hanging out doing nothing.

Big, Amazing mall, but expensive. It’s a mall, that is amazing, big, clean, safe place, you can buy many kind of thing in this mall, and you can eat many kind of food in this mall(for example: sushi, noodle...ETC),so I recommend this mall is good for shopping and for eating, but their is the problem is the thing are so expensive and overpriced, so think about you need to use money to buy something in here or eat something in here!
Walkathon of a Mall!. Huge huge place with such a vast variety of products right from luxury to affordable! Truly a one stop shop in Bangkok. Must Visit!

Huge mall with a lot of good food and good music stores. Bangkok is getting filled with huge modern malls and this one already has a history. A large part of it was burned down during the protests of 2010. But it was quickly rebuilt and you'd never know it now. It has stores of every kind and one thing I like is that it has quite a few high-quality music shops, especially guitar shops.

Another fabulous mall in Bangkok. We were just so impressed by the quality of the food court, restaurants and shops. Much nicer than anything I've been to in the US. Bangkok lives up to its reputation as a shopper's paradise.
Huge Mall with Everything Modern. Good shopping place just across Arnoma Grand, for dinner and all, an array of restaurants are available for your pick, Coca included!
Large Mall. With the hot weather at outside, I would prefer walking in the mall with acc :). This mall is huge, you can find a lot of brands and local stuffs here.

Another big shopping mall..... Its a shopping mall. Lots of nice shops including the high-end brands. A clean, safe place to shop, similar to Paragon etcYou can spend a day here if you are serious about shopping, You could be anywhere in the world, in any up-market shopping mall, shopping the same shops. Its a nice place to shop, but go for a wander along the streets too....just to remind you that you are in Bangkok.

Your typical high-end luxury mall. The mall itself is nice, clean and safe. It houses the typical brand name stores where you can most likely find in any developed country. It's a nice change of scenery if you've been strolling the local streets of Bangkok and provides a nice refuge from the scorching heat outdoors. I wouldn't quite recommend this place if you're looking for the local, authentic, traditional, Thai experience.

air conditioned class. Such a contrast to lots of poverty around in the city of Bangkok this is a beautiful place to spend a few hours, looking around top end stores. Air conditioned it gives you a break from the intense heat and is exquisite. Immaculately clean and well laid out a shoppers paradise !!

Drop and eat til you drop. 7 levels of shops and restaurants. Good quality restaurants including Thai and Japanese. There is a supermarket on the top floor but selling mainly imported items. The supermarket at Isetan is more interesting
Get a relief from the humidity and walk through the central world plaza. This is nothing but a high end shopping mall. Good for a break from the high humidity and to have food from the food court
Huge shopping mall. lots of brandnames and very near to our hotel and big C supermarket. You can shop at a reasonable prices
Great place to shop and eat. Lots of selection and discount. Ambiance was amazing also. We were there during a Thai food festival and Chinese festival, an unforgettable experience.
great shopping and lovely restaurant. excellent dim sum on the 5th floor and inexpensive ,bit strange when ordering and service but food was great

Good place to relax but not for cheap shopping. This place being huge , offers wide varieties of shopping & food. Don't expect prices to be cheap though. If you want cheap prices on clothes, bags, accessories - go shop at Platinum Fashion Mall, street markets, etc.However some things here may not be available in those cheaper places. This mall is more upmarket & naturally offer products in this category.If you just want a nice big aircon mall to relax, have a coffee or food or just browse around, this mall is a good place due to its size & wide range.

Clean and not congested. branded goods and expensive. Shopping mall is huge, connected to Isetan. Only bought Beauty cottage items. ( Beauty cottage sells skin products and only in Thailand. Their products are good esp facial foam. Not expensive )Top floors are all the restaurants. Many restaurants to choose from.

Multi floored Shopping Centre. Clean and well managed mulit floored shopping centre.Nothing different to any shopping centre but its in Thailand and has a different selection of clothing and food. There is a Gap Boots and Marks and Spencers . the prices are expensive
shopping. we thought tis was the best place to shop in bankok its got everthing you need and more its clean and the air con is very welcome. I love the auto no wipe toilets!

Large department store and near platinum fashion mall. At Central world has many restaurant and cafe, theater, Thai and international brand for shopping, and you can walk from Central world to platinum fashion mall also. I think it's good for find all in one here.

Large, spotlessly clean, little austere.. Typical big mall experience in the centre of Bangkok. Not cheap shopping (although some departments have 50% off sales) but rather impersonal - lacks coziness. Too many sales staff. They have nothing to do. They follow you around the department. You can't even look at a price tag without someone appearing at your side. I find that intimidating.
Huge department store. this place is really big. have a lot of shops mostly for teen and adult. Also have cinema and restaurants. example of the stores are coach, pandora, and naraya
My Shopping Spree Vacation in Bangkok. A nice place for you to get almost anything you want. Food choices aplenty. Location is easy to access.

Western Style with Thai Influence. Big and clean in the heart of Bangkok. Lots of shops and department stores to choose from. Adjacent to other big shopping centres that stretch all the way to MBK - a veritable shopping paradise. Food on the top floor is good and uses the prepaid coupon system.

A treasure island.. it is a treasure island where you can find every treasure imaginable.Please spend at least one day here.Come early as it closes at early evening.this place has just so many good things at such a cheap price,I bought a Samsung galaxy tab for about 3000 baht or like 90 dollars which costs about 350-400 usd usually.

Cooler than the street but bland and boring. I visited Central World whilst meandering in Bangkok. To be honest, I headed for the Air conditioning to get a break from the heat. Nice shops, posh shops but no character. Had an iced coffee and left....yawn!
Amazing. Clean and convenient. There's plenty of choices especially food, grocery and shopping. there's also a skating rink.
Bangkok Shopping. Big department store selling both local and international branded goods. Very well connected to the BTS (Siam station).
Great Theatre. The first class movie seating is awesome. I love the huge seats and the complete look and feel of the theatre.

First class Experience. This is now a first class shopping experience with a well balanced blend of international chains, and local offerings. The mass transit system runs right nearby.
Central is becoming one of the Asian powerhouses in retail.

SOS. My heel fell apart when I arrived in Bangkok. As a business traveler you just don't bring a closetful of shoes but that one pair! The hotel was close enough to a cobbler at Central World who was professional (ie not on the streets) and God-send! I visited Zen at Central World for a hairwash at the salon. The hairdresser was good and treated me to stories of the high life in Bangkok! The little things in life ....a good cobbler and a great hair wash...what more could a woman ask for on a business trip !?
Good shopping . Pretty big shopping mall where you can find almost everything. Prices are quite chipper comparing to Paragon mall, although all same trademarks are presented here.

Shoppers Paradise. Broken up into distinctive areas for every shoppers needs and desires, designed to accommodate for every shopping budget Central World Plaza offers a whole range of shopping experiences. Anchors like ZEN caters to a younger crowd, while the other franchises like the popular Japanese department store Isetan seem at home here.For the serious shopper Central Worlds stores offer brands that are mid to high end.If you desire high end fashion Central World has it and some of the more accessible brands that regular folk can afford. Its bigger than Siam Paragon, better in that it remains accessible for shoppers with different budgets. I tend to group this mega mall complex with Siam Paragon and Gaysorn. Whereas a step down in spending might see you shopping at Terminal 21 or perhaps MBK for thrifty savings.I like the choices on offer at Central World, though I prefer the bargain hunting at MBK. Each to their own I suppose.

The Ladies will love it.. Bangkok full of shopping mecca's like this. Alot of designer and brand name stuff, if you are a shopoholic then Bangkok will suit. Guys just find a relaxing bar or restaurant to wait in :)
Huge amazing place. I got lost and couldn't find my way out for about an hour lol. Awesome mall with something for everyone
Shoppin, shopping and shopping!. What to say except - shopping all day. If nothing at all to shop< at least visit once to see what it is all about.

has something for everyone. Loved that this place is huge, with a variety of shops to choose from - low end to high end. lots of restaurants and coffee shops to choose from. has a hotel connected to it (though I didn't stay there).

A massive space to purchase whatever you need... What's there not to like. A massive mall where you can purchase basically anything you want, need or desire; a selection of great restaurants and cafe's; and a large seating area outside to enjoy the hustle and bustle of life as it passes you on by.
Luxury. Very big shopping mall, you can find almost every luxurious brands...Inside good restaurants for lunch and dining....
here u find every thing to buy. if u are big zise go to Xl og import exportstore u dont need to go anyware elese for shoppingand eating. thay got everyting good resturants as well

Great shopping experiences. Easy access by skytrain Chidlom station, this shopping mall has all popular brands, nice decoration and well organized. From here, visitors can cross the street to visit Erawan Shrine or to Siam Paragon just a short walk. Such a great shopping experiences in Bangkok.
great shopping. Everything you find here is cheap and nasty. Be very selective, the quality is very bad and everything falls apart after a few weeks. You get what you pay for I suppose

Just another huge mall. We were there for lunch. A good number of restaurant on the 6th and 7th floor serving mid-range to expensive meals. Several designer brands on the ground floor. No crowd and pretty quiet when we were there.
Great Shopping experience. It was a great shopping mall with many shops selling international labels. The mall is comfortable with great amenities.

Expansive but expensive. We had laboured under the illusion that Bangkok was cheap , and whilst there are certainly lots of places to buy stuff which is inexpensive this shopping centre is not one of them. It is very clean, modern, houses an incredible range of fantastic brands and is very conveniently located we found the prices of everything on offer as, if not more expensive than London. A marks and Spencer's shirt that my husband took a shine to worked out to be almost £90. When we went back to the hotel and me checked their website it was £32.50. This was the same for pretty much all brands that the centre offers. If you are looking for good quality authentic products its a great place to come, but if you want to bag a bargain head to the markets.

Excellent shopping and food court. This mall is conveniently located by skytrain station and compares favorably to any large north american malls with huge selection of stores. The food court on the 7th floor is a must try as that's where the locals go to eat. Do explore the entire floor, as at the back there is a whole section where you get a ticket to go in, which is used as the bill as you pick up food from difference places and then pay at the end when you are done eating.
Never a dull moment :). This mall has so many things to offer from shops to restuarants,..theres something here for everyone :)...so come on over !!!

Good Mall to walk around. There used to have 2 beer gardens just outside the building. To me those are noise pollution where two live bands are singing at the top of their lungs.Now that they are gone, peace has returned.By the side of the building, there is a small bazaar.
