They sell general merchandise and also some very nice vehicles as the store front.It is a nice mall to shop though it is geared towards the mid tier Thais.

Huge shopping center. Convenient location, right off BTS. Has everything from fashion to movies to food. Feels very international and I don't think you need to go to Bangkok to find most of what is there.

Shopping Mall. If you are into shopping in the cool then visit Central World Plaza. It is just like the big American Malls but stocks items not necessarily found elsewhere. It is huge so allow yourself plenty of browsing time. the best bit is the food courts where the choice of dishes is amazing. And the smoothies are superb.

Very good !. The mall is pretty big with something for everybody. Each floor is dedicated to a commodity electronics, food , clothing et al. The 5 th floor has a very good food court with all the cuisines - Lao Thai Chinese . worth a trip. Cheers !

shopping centers comfortable and classy. This shopping center is located in downtown Bangkok. Fashion products that are classified as upper-middle class. I was fortunate because during a visit to the Central World Plaza, was ongoing activities Thai-Japan Anime and Music Festival. The food at the food hall is quite cheap and varied.

Mall with brand names. If you are a traveler visiting Thailand - this would appear to be another type or form of shopping mall. Central is a large company that has a number of destinations covered with their malls and offer a number of brand names and eateries that you would find back home in your mall. Here the malls range in types and size depending on the location.

Great Shopping!. If you are looking for beautiful and unique items from Thailand then Central World Plaza is the place to start. If you are simply looking for something practical too then you will find it here. And its a fun place to spend an afternoon. Lots of great food as well.

If youre from the states DONT BOTHER. Its a huge mall with All designer name brands with the same exact prices as in the us or any other big city. Head over to china town instead and bargain bargain bargain
Just a typical boring shopping mall. The mall is just one like in every big city but with a small different, the prices are compared to Germany much higher. Boring and disappointing.

Great for shopping.. But it's really huge!. Really comfortable to shop here... The Aircon is really cool here... Which is wonderful in a hot climate like Bangkok...
The place is really huge... So navigation could be an issue... Do check out the food court on the top level... A wide variety of local fare with decent pricing...

Pleasant surprise. Huge mall, connected to subway station. Similar to terminal 21 shops, not the "high" end shopping mall where you need a lot of $$$$$. Very clean, convenient place to shop. First time here, will come back again. After shopping, was looking for a nearby restaurant, shop guard/guide, personally showed us location, by escorting us outside of the building. Great service which was unanticipated.
Great Mall. Great mall, lots of shops. Not high class shopping, but also not market like. Just like a mall in the US. Neat place to walk around and get food.

Huge sprawling mall. This huge and sprawling mall is bound to draw your attention while passing by.I think it is the biggest mall on Bangkok in terms of number of shops or area.While going to the Pratunam area,the favourite shopping haven of Indians, we used to get down at Chit Lom BTS station and right in front of the exit of this station stands this giant of a building.There are also a good number of food stalls and other items outside the main building on the ground within its compound.It is having 7 or 8 floors with all types of shops including a typical big cinema multiplex,ice skating rink and a very big food mall.Big show rooms of signature brand of international products are also present.Prices seemed to be more or less same as in other malls and some bargaining is possible in smaller shops/stalls.It is so huge that even if you do window shopping,you won't be to complete seeing it in a day!However,it is a bit less classy than SIAM Paragon mall Pricewise and bargaining point of view, we found that Big C mall further down towards Pratunam is the best and cheapest in Bangkok.
Huge. Clean, air conditioned, huge shopping mall. Great selection of restaurants. Every retail brand imaginable is there. Spend the day.
Had lunch at the Wine I Love so great.. Good location at central world can sit outside and watch the world go by. The service excellent as usually for Thailand.

Varied. A large shopping mall located in the centre of Bangkok. There are seven floors and a cinema complex as well. A vast amount of both shops and stalls are located here. Transport links are good. Nearest Skytrain stop is Chit Lom and lots of buses serve the mall as well. There are also plenty of activities going on.

A shoppers paradise. This shopping centre is huge and has something for everyone! Prices are reasonable and centre is clean and safe with security on all the doors. Despite spending hours here, I'm sure I've only seen a small part of it! I need more shopping time!!!!
Well worth trying. This shopping center has lots of shops. Some sells luxury articles as well. There is many restaurants here, well worth trying.
Shopping galore. Great to visit with resturants as well as shops air conditionied as you would expect loads of shopping

Chaotic Chic. This is a must see. I have no idea how high the escalators go, the entire experience is just overwhelming. The best H & M I've ever seen. Great bargains on winter clothes there and same sizes as in the U.S.

One place rules them all.. One place rules them all.
Multiplex large scale mall which contains almost everything.
Variety of restaurants from normal franchises to elite world class restaurants.
Located in the centre of Bangkok make so comfortable to access.
High standard cinemas, which show exclusively some award-winning movies.
Good place for shopping and chill out! :)
Average big air con shopping center. Its fine too visit after a hot day walking around.There are manty restaurants and stores,nothing too out of the ordinary

Big and Busy!. As with most malls in Bangkok, it is beyond clean and organized, very helpful people and friendly atmosphere. But again like most malls, it has the same as all others. The only must see's that I can recommend are Siam Paragon/Siam Center complex, and for younger kids Terminal mall. Other than those they are all the same! Nice and well done, but the same!

Shopping Mania. This is one of the more popular shopping centre in Bangkok. It has the Four Faced Buddha outside that's popular with locals who would come here to pray for love. This is definitely one notch higher than Platinum Mall but a notch lower lower than Siam Paragon. No doubt if you are in Bangkok, this would be one of the Department Store that you won't miss.

Great shopping. Wonderful shopping experience and a short walk to the Siam Centre with the excellent Paragon shopping Mall with the food hall, which would take many visits to try them all. When I was visiting there wasn't motor Cycke show on. Very good

IF YOUR NOT ON SHOPPING SPREE, NO NEED TO GO. Very huge place, can easily get lost here. sure no bargaining here as everything is usual a fixed price, better off at smaller shops and stalls. do not go on weekends as way to busy,l during the week manageable. have everything here, if you are looking for everything to buy-lol

High end Cloth in Downtown district. Located closed to Prutunam Market connected to Siam BTS station area;these huge mall complex with 3 connected building; Isetan/Zen and Central group corporation.There are of course variety services to serve all customer needs.Cosmetic/Jewelry zone at ground floor; youth or High end luxury brand name clothes; Classy international restaurants; Cinema complex; Supermarket section ; Indoor Ice skating; Bookstore; Fitness ;electronics stuff; Also Accommodation Centara Grand building provided.

A Huge Mall.. Everything & anything is available, but as there are no fixed prices it can be difficult to bargain, as one is not sure whether we are being cheated or not.The place is so big be aware of the landmarks as you can get lost, also language being a problem stick to the group you are with or you can get lost.A lovely place to visit.
Day of shopping!. Every shop under the sun! Can get a bit crowded so go on a weekday not a weekend. Allow a whole day as so much to walk round.
A malls mall. . Like the old USA malls. A bit of everything that you can want. Nice area, air con and places to sit and talk about the diving of the week. Great people watching.

More Shopping. Shopping @ Central is always exciting,with a faboulos range of items to look @ & purchase.Bought presents for my grandchildren & some of my staff.Exciting,colourful & keenly priced.It is a great place to shop in Bangkok & we will return again on our next visit to Bangkok @ the end of 2015.Very easy to get to by Taxi or The BTS System - which stops virtually by the front door.Clean toilets & a cafe are excellent additions to spend more time shopping.

huge clean. this is a regular mall with all the brands ..but go to the food court and you can shop all sweets and local Thai food ingredients ..that's fun also there is a toys for us here which is good for kids shoppingwell located too...

OMG Shopping heaven. This is a huge complex with something for everyone UNLESS you are above size 16 woman and/or have wide feet! Plenty of clothes, cheap jewellery, electronics (including iphone6!), food areas, and a couple of big department type stores, dress fabric stores(silk, naturally! :@) ). A shoppers paradise! To do it justice you really should spend 4 hrs minimum here, including lunch ofcourse!

A big mall with lots to offer. Even though we are not big on shopping when we travel, we still managed to step into the air-conditioned, first-world class shopping mall. They have a lot of the same stores as what we have back home, but I am not sure of the prices.

Lots of high end stores. This place is very nice and has lots of high end stores if you are interested in that sort of thing. We went to the movie here and were treated to an ultra VIP experience well worth the price of admission.

Huge luxury mall near Chidlom BTS. Huge luxury mall near Chidlom BTS, where you can find almost every brand, including 2 department stores Isetan and Zen, restaurants, coffee shops, foodcourt and a nice skating rink.Also has music show in the evening to animate the area.

Trendy Mega Complex and more!. A huge mega shopping centre with two anchor tenants (Central/ZEN and Isetan). Toilets are extremely clean and the cleaning crew does an excellent job in polishing the floors sparkling clean every day! It is even a pleasure to see them at work and admire their attention to details!ZEN is trendy and filled with up to eight levels of shops catering to every needs.You could spend hours just hanging around this mega complex, including a massage at Montra (really based on luck, as some had so so experiences, but this time around, ours was excellent!).
Luxury mall. Very easy to find there because just by skytrain. All the shops are high class luxury style. Have lot's of restaurants with every food and all feels a lot space.

Large, upmarket and clean. We enjoyed this shopping centre. Next time we go there we will visit one of the many Japanese Restaurants. It has a nice skating rink and we saw a Chinese Band playing for the Chinese New Year which was great. I bought some of the latest novels in English from a bookshop.
Not to expensive but certainly not cheap. it is a Large Shopping options where all the well known Brands are represented .But as expensive as Europe .
Shopper's heaven. Very nice shopping plaza with lots of varieties.Not a place for bargain hunters but they have high to medium range brands outlets.
Big. Big store with a vast range of goods from expensive brand names to interesting bits and pieces. There is a good food area but on the whole I prefer MBK for prices and local items

Fantastic. Central World Plaza is a huge mall with a large variety of shops and a great food court as well as stand alone restaurants on the 7th floor. Mango Tree Bistro on the 7th floor has great food.

Makes Westfield look small. I am not a great one for malls but I loved Central World. So much choice. Easy to spend hours in there - mainly because it is so difficult to find the way out that you came in!!!

Large mall but prices higher than elsewhere. Floor after floor of everything you can imagine from a massive mall. Brand names, though prices not as good as other stores/malls. Overall preferred MBK as many more bargains to be had.

Amazed. I went there earlier this year. Amazed at how big it was and it was quite tiring eploring the whole place hahaha. But at nightime, the atmosphere outside was amazing, there was a mini market spreadout outside. indie singers. Some people dressed up in American Indian costume performing something. Rather than the expensive things inside the complex, the main highlight the outside scene bustling with life.

Huge Shopping Mall. BTS Sky train, stop more or less attached to the mall, huge choice of shops selling all sorts of goods, excellent choice of restaurants/cafes, very well laid out airy bright shopping mall

Huge gigantic shopping centre. This shopping centre is near Chitlom BTS Station. It's huge with lots of space to walk. Once you enter, you will go thru security check at all entrances. A lot of boutique shops like Guess, Coach, etc and it's up to 7 floors. Expensive place to shop if you are not into branded goods. Top floor a lot of restaurants. There's also cafe at each level. If you go by main entrance, on the left is Zen shopping centre and to the right end is Isetan.

I am not a shopper, but if I was.... Central World is a world class shopping experience. It is true, I rarely need to shop for anything but the bare necessities but, if I need a special gift, or want to find something new, this is where I head.Whenever I have friends in town, no matter what budget they may be on, I always send them here for the shopping, the experience and the food.A 'must see' when in Bangkok.
shopping shopping shopping. floor upon floor of shopping great sales and products. fixed prices. eateries to stop and relax. items from baby, kids mal, female clothing. stop right at bts

bangkok. huge. they have every brand andsometimesthank to the discount it could get very cheap. I went there in chinese new yr and the have the chinese fair that serve good and quite cheap food. also got a discount at pierre cardin.

Very Pleasant. Great shops and eating areas . For the travellers that are worried about eating from the street stalls in Bangkok ,Central World is a great option, a lot of food place to try and have a wonder through the mall at the same time . Air conditioned, clean and full beautiful designer shops

WOW!. As it was the festive season when we where their on the second visit to Bangkok Central world is a must.As we walked in to the central arena i said "wow just look at that" , the inner center of the plaza was adorned by the biggest Christmas tree i had ever seen indoors. But what was unique about this particular tree was it was upside down and littered with Snoopys of all different sizes and colors.Although we have been to Central world plaza before it never ceases to amaze me with the central decorations.It has a good food floor, but not like the other shopping malls ,Central world dose not have a food court, it has a floor with restaurants catering for all tastes and palettes.Central world plaza also boasts (if my mind serves me well) a 12 screen cinema ,from cheap seats,to first class seats ,3D and now a 4D screen too.On the whole a simply fantastic place to shop,eat and be entertained. Well worth a visit.
Give yourself some time!. This place is huge! 7-8 floors with pretty much everything you need. I love going to the mall to cool off from the heat!

One stop mall. I have been shopping in Berlin, London, New York, Tokyo, Osaka, Dubai, Sydney and so on (didn't buy much, just looking ;) but this shopping mall is by far my favourite. It really is a one stop mall (2 floors for clothes, 1 for electronics, 1 for food, 1 for furniture, a few SPAS and massage places and a cinema and ice rink). I prefer it to the Dubai mall. Its really clean, nicely decorated, hasnt got too expensive clothes (you can buy souvenirs and Thailand Tshirts at the MBK shopping mall in opposite, but its more like a massive market than a shopping mall) and the food at Central World is really amazing. They even have my favourite Burger place which you only see in Japan - MOS Burger...if u see it, you should give it a try :) anyway, I highly recommend this mall. Once you are in that area you can also go to Siam Paragon Mall, MBK and Siam Center..its all in opposite. But Central World Plaza was enough for me :) you just take the BTS Skytrain to Siam.

One of the biggest mall. The mall is not located directly with the skytrain but it's located in between 2 stations. There is a covered pedestrian bridge from both station for easy access to the mall. The mall is so huge that you may spend 1 whole day there. There's a lot of cafes and restaurant to try.

The shopping centre with almost everything.. This has always been another favourite SC of ours everytime we go to Bangkok. From a huge selection of brand name stores, to the easy accesability from the skytrain, to a SC where it is almost impecably clean, and a well air conditioned building, this SC is well worth a visit.
Big. This is very very big shopping mall. Can buy every clothes and accessories here. Also many foods available. But price is high more than other shop in Thailand.

Lots of choices. This shopping plaza and complex is the sixth largest shopping complex in the world. The complex, includes a hotel and office tower. It was pretty hot outside, so we decided to go the mall and walk around, wow, there were so many stores to choose from and we can cool off from the heat.

Unlimited Shopping Paradise. A great place for all day entertainment,shopping,food,travel and much more.One of the top 3 largest building in the world is quite impressive place and a must visit when in Bangkok.Trendy stores and thousands of choices to spoil you every floor

A must see. The central world area is a must see in Bangkok. This is the main shopping area with lots of action and beautiful stores and lights. It is close to night market, Siam paragon mall and much more. Great restaurants and has a western flare.

Awesome shopping. Great shopping area with many stores. Also very nice, newly constructed bar/restaurant area that is a must to spend an evening. It is called The Groove and usually has live entertainment.
Amazing shopping. Central World is my preference of the two main downtown malls (although I like Paragon too). The choice of shops here is amazing and the layout works well for me.

Shopping Experience. Very modern mall with loads of stores. I would not recommend any husband take their wives as you might not get out of there for weeks to come and money missing from your bank account.
Great mall. This mall is an example of the luxury life in Bangkok. It has great food and a lot of good shops. It is a good break from street markets and MBK.
Just another shopping mall. This mall is just like other asian malls, a lot of branded outlets, nothing special. However, it provides foodies a few nice restaurants to choose from.

Chill hang-out place. This is the place to go after visiting more interesting attractions within the city. Went here twice in my most recent visit in Bangkok, and enjoyed the food court more than anything else. Would like to try Emack and Bolo soon (w/ the stacking ice cream)!

A Bangkok Showpiece. This is an excellent shopping Mall with stores by many of the world's well-known brands. It is pretty modern and has an international appeal. Few capitals in Europe can boast of such shopping Malls. It also has many good restaurants and a very nice super market. But it has very little that is distinctly Thai about it. For that you have to go to open air markets or side stalls. Nevertheless it is worth a stroll for an hour or so as Malls like this one make Bangkok one of the great shopping centres of the world.
good centre. the wife loves it great variety of shops plenty of fashion outlets. and prices okay. good food outlets
No VAT Refund. It's huge and has all the stores that shoppers desire. Since they do not offer VAT refunds to tourists, it's better to spend your money at Siam Paragon where tax refunds are available.

I'm not a shopper but..... I don't really like shopping but if it has to be done then this is a good place to go. It's clean, light, airy, easily accessed from the BTS. You can buy everything there from low priced to expensive. The food selection is excellent. The bathrooms are clean. The only drawback for me is that it can get very noisy but the pros far outweigh the cons.

An amazing shopping center. One of the most amazing shopping centers with thousands of shops which cater for about everything you might want.Everywhere very clean and a lot of light with plenty of restaurants and cafes to stop eat relax and carry on shopping.The place is just vast and you must be carefull not to loose each other and the best advise is to stick together.

The Center of the shopping world. Shopping Malls are a major entertainment for Bangkokians. They get a cool respite from the unforgiving heat of the city and they get to experience shops, restaurants, cinemas, attractions, fairs and markets in a single place. Bangkok is definitely a shopping heaven.

All in one place. All in one place, shops, supermarket, boutiques, restaurants, cinema, ice skating. The only problem is there is no Skytrain station so you must to walk from Siam or other nearby station.
down town. Eesy by train, avoid street transport it's always take a lot of time for traffic. Nice mall, movies hall, good food center reasonably price. Good shopping district area.
A big shopping mall. I could have been in any country in the world. Generic big brand shops all under one roof. Lots of different goods but few bargins. Quite a good food hall though.
Great shopping. A pace to spend the day in air conditioned bliss while shopping too your hearts content. East access from the sky train

HORRIBLE Shopping experience!. Too big, too confusing all the same stores as everywhere else. Not worth the trouble of looking for what you need. And if just for window shopping, there are so many more nicer looking shopping centers, easier to get too and not nearly as confusing.

Lovely Food. Must try for Foodies.. There are plenty of options of cuisines to choose from.. so many tourists from different parts of the world makes this a good choice for variety of food that you can choose from in a budget.

It's all there. Shops of every kind, department stores, boutiques, restaurants, cafes, electronics, set up your telephone, Internet , cable TV accounts there. From very inexpensive to designer and top of the range. A lot of events take place on the esplanade in front of it, which can be incredibly noisy.

one stop mall. its so huge until you can get lost in here.
banks are open on sunday too (how convenient is that )!
do visit their top level for their restaurants as there are many choices for you starting from snacks until fine dining.

Just a usual Big mall. This mall is huge. It is directly connected through BTS skyway.
All the usual stores that you will find in any other malls are here as well.
Only thing new here was Ice Skating rink. If you know skating and want to beat the outside heat, you can try this.
Otherwise just the usual mall

Good shopping mall. The Central World Plaza is in between Siam BTS station and Chit Lom station, heart of Bangkok. You can buy anything there like main band name products and Thai tradition products. Many different kinds of restaurants and the foods in food court won't let you down.

Huge shopping mall. Great place to spend hot afternoons indoors strolling around among 1000s of stores and food joints. Extensive food selection and easy to empty your pockets here (by spending, not pick pocketing).

Central World Plaza is 6th largest shopping complex in the world. Central World is a shopping plaza and complex in Bangkok, Thailand. It is the sixth largest shopping complex in the world. The complex, which includes a hotel and office tower, is owned by Central Pattana.It has everything from brand name clothing boutiques, funky fashion, high-tech gadgets, bookshops and designer furniture to imported groceries, a lineup of banks, beauty salons, gourmet eateries and even an ice-skating rink. With so many tantalizing options to explore, you could easily spend half a day here without realizing it.U have bts skytrain stoppage and easy accessible .

Not sure what the fuss is about. Seems just like any other mall to me. Quite a number of stores yes, but just like any mall in Washington DC, Paris France, Moscow Russia or Tokyo Japan. I guess I was expecting something else.

Be sure to put a limit to your credit card.... All you can shop is how you can best discribe this experience. Clothes, food, accessories, movies, you dreamed it? You will find it. You might want to bring a map otherwise you might just get lost there. High risk of reducing your bank account level while raising your weight. But worth it.

More Asian Style food than you can shake a stick at.. Went her to the food market for 2 dinners. Massive shopping complex with food area at the top. If you don't like Asian food then you need to go someplace else as it is 99% Asian style. Had a Korean BBq and stir fry . Very good indeed.

big mall in big market. very big mall in the market area near from platinum market
just out side one can see lord ganesha's stutue
this mall is little expensive and it is opposite big c mall

Delicious food and shopping. I have to say things in Thai is kinda cheap, I had a delicious lunch in a Japanese restaurant for $15 per person !!! And there are so many shops which offers very good things
Shopping Mall. Could be anywhere in the world. Good air conditioning though !!! Handy for the Skytrain. Prices are considerably higher than across the road, where the Thai people shop.

Dont get lost. Easy to get there with BTS to Siam and then follow the marked way by foot - not more than 10 minutes. Central World Plaza is BIG so dont get lost - it is easy!! Here you can find more or less everything you need and not need.

Great shopping and eating experience. We live closeby, and this shopping mall is one of the best ways to spend the day. From a myriad of clothes and accessories stores, to cafes, restaurants, books and electronics stores, this place has it all. If that wasn't enough, they occasionally have shows and fairs taking place outside and the restaurants are open till 10 pm for a late dinner. I frequent it with my mini chi (who sits in the bag) and it's a great way to spend a day away from the heat
High end shopping only.. This shopping center is mostly for high end branded stores. There was hardly any shoppers there when we went. Recommended only for brand shoppers.
Shopping Heaven. All the shopping you will ever need both here and all the surrounding centres at Paragon etc. Terminal 21 is also worth a look if just to go up 4 floor escalator.

shopping. this is the place where yo can leave your wife alone every one confuse when they enter its really big and well organised shopping center inbangkokyou find latest fashion in this shopping centerits amazing

Good luck trying to find a taxi to take you out of there. Impossible to get a taxi in the evening to go back home. And the place is almost empty, except as for all other shopping malls in Thailand, the restaurant floors.
Humongous. Huge shopping mall with tons of shops. They say the 6th biggest shopping mall in the world. Fashion, jewelry, department stores you name it and thay have it. Big food court.

Good place to take a rest. Easy to buy everything.
Don't forget to buy gifts in NaRaYa. Must buy!
Close to BTS and Big C supermarket.

Well located. We were in the area and we decided to go to the food court at 7th floor. Trendy and like all other Mall, this one has everything to offer. A friend swore on the steak at THE GRILL and he is right on. It must had been the best priced rib eye ever. Baht 300 for 250 grams of Aussie meat. Right in front that time was a food festival where we picked up some stuff.
Huge mall. That's one big huge mall!!! They have everything here. All the designer! It's a very trendy mall, you can send a whole day in here.
Shopping. It's interesting to visit the big shooping areas but the prices are 20 - 30% more expensive as in Europe. It's more interesting to visit markets
great escape from the heat. There are loads of shops in this and it's retail heaven. There's food to be had but best of all in the hustle of this shopping street, it is a real respite.
Nice mall. This mall is rather large and easy to around. Lots of great shops and is worth allowing a full day here.

Thailand 2015. This place is huge and a maze of shops on 8 floors covering an area of over 3 square city blocks. an easily get lost in the way the floors are laid out in this mall. Also has an ice rink in the mall although the ice quality is pretty poor due to the heat of the building
Can't be beaten. For shopping in Bangkok it can't really be beaten, much bigger than any mall I've ever experienced..
Love it. For me one of the best shopping malls in bangkok, It as hard to get an overview, but really nice once you have an orientation. Good selection of mid-priced shops.

Great Mall. Not the easiest to find you way around, but I like the appearance of the place especially the huge window on the east side. I tend to use the Department Stores (Zen and Isetan) rather than the smaller places. Lots of places to eat, though mostly upscale and no Food Court which I could find.

Huge shopping mall. It is probably the biggest mall in Bangkok, located in the central shopping area with plenty other malls around it. Plenty brand shops, restaurants, cinemas, an ice-skating arena, supermarkets - all you expect to find in a mall. Much more glitzy than many of the other shopping complexes in Bangkok and with good quality stuff. Prices are fixed and you cannot bargain how you can in other places, even shopping malls, in ThailandIt is easily reachable with the BTS and there is a walkway from Siam and Chitlom stations.

Go there!. Well, if you like shopping, then this is the place to go. Huge mall, few floors, got tired from all the walking. The only drawback was that the information about the shops and where to locate them was hard to find. Other than that - all great!
World class shopping. Clean, beautiful mall, in the middle of the city. The sky train stops here so very convenient. Good range of shops, and good food hall.

Huge mall. Its a good mall as far as malls go , yes its huge but easy to navigate . All the usual suspects of brands are here just like at home with just a few local local shops. I am not a fan of malls because they are so same same and the only variety you find is in the restaurants , They do have good restaurants to choose from here up a few floors , so worth it to dine here.
Great shopping. This centre is huge and a great alternative to the outdoor markets. Clean and airy it has a great variety of designer shops as well as some good eating places. Easy to park as well.

Best not luxury shop in Bangkok. When you are have no much time for shopping I prefer multibrand shops, where you can find different clothing at one place like Isetan.Zen, Isetan and other shops like Mark&Spenser, Gap, H&M, Mango, Massimo Duti are here they are.Had nice shopping there with reasonable prices for given quality.
Top shopping complex. Shopping centre, where you will find everything - from shops (normal prices) till amusement things for adults and kids.

It's a mall, one of dozens in this area. Do not get excited. This is just a mall, like you have in your home country. It is located right in the middle of the shopping and retail area in Bangkok. No less than 9 malls within a mile of each other. Central World is huge, has many restaurants and a gourmet market on the top floor. What you find here is a better quality product if you want this. Most tourists like knock off junk found on the streets, or less quality goods at Big C, or MBK, but for those that want something better, you will find it here. All chain restaurants, coffee shops. Ice cream parlors, etc will be found here. If you are uncertain on what to eat. Go here. There are hundreds of restaurants featuring all different cuisine. Take BTS to Siam station or Chit Lom station and walk the overhead skywalk to Central World.

It has all you need or want. I have been to several shopping malls in Bangkok and they are all pretty similar but this one is nice because it is kept clean, has many good food options and of course plenty of shopping.I like that it is easy to get to on public transportation and because it is close to other malls you can easily find what you want at one of the three major malls all clustered together.

top 5 shopping centre in bangkok. CentralWorld is a shopping plaza and complex in Bangkok, Thailand. It is the sixth largest shopping complex in the world. The complex, which includes a hotel and office tower, is owned by Central Pattana.

Branded Items with Fixed deals Best for branded likers. Central world in bangkok and central festival in pattaya are the same groups both are same like branded showrooms not like siam paragaon's costly mania here but if you compare with MBK ,Indhra square type malls this Central world is upperside . Here you can get some Branded offers like 10%, 20% and some deals from the direct showrooms not to expect a low price . Other than this nothing here to mention any specific showrooms here some good branded jewels for kids is ok Thats all Nothing to mention . This mall also richer side , I got some kids ornaments (Not gold) try for the same Thank you

My fave mall. To me its Bangkok's finest mall! Yes it's big but still manageable. Well kept and lit. I love their continuous outdoor activities, something to look forward to always. They have big christmas trees and other decor for christmas, food fest in other months, bike show just ended, songkran fest with water supplied by them!! And inside you can almost find all brands with so much of food and dessert choice. If still bored then co go watch a movie or ice skate. I love the ambience of this mall. You can find brands like Zara, forever 21, Mango, H&M and even Victoria secrets here!!
Very model place. Nice place, very crownded and there are a lots of famous store: CK, LV, Channel .... and a lot of activitives for family and children.

Nice Mall. Close to Siam Paragon and MBK Shopping Centre this is a good mall for the average shopper but mostly fixed prices. There are tons of vendors selling clothing, electronics, souvenirs, leather goods and lot of food courts. There are a couple of big department stores as well. There is also a big supermarket and a few places to catch a taxi or a tuk-tuk. You can find almost anything here. You will need a few hours at this mall. Check it out and have fun!

Big, varieties of shops, mostly international brand. Been there twice during my visit to Bangkok, personally I found mostly shops are international brand, with some local brands inside the mall. I would be a great place if you love shopping some fashion items or brand which is expensive in your country, here offer better or sightly lower price. Else, if not, Chatucak weekend market may be better to shop for local goods.

The Buddhist way - Middle path. There are three kinds of malls in Bangkok. One, Platinum mall, MBK kind of malls, where you get local brands and discounts galore. Two, super luxury malls like Siam Paragon and Embassy central which have super luxury brands and you and I can just window shop there. And the third kind, where you get all decent brands at fixed prices and great ambiance.Central World plaza happens to be of the third kind. Delightful place. Great mid segment brands, almost fixed prices and assured quality. I personally would recommend this place highly if you are looking at a great shopping experience without either being worried about quality or putting your self nose deep in debt.
a very good shopping mall. A very good shopping mall but a little old. Find all the major shops and good restaurants. Have major chains like toys r us and Istean.

Good to shop~. If u rushing time for shopping, then mayb Central world is a good place for u to shorten then time and get many thing in a limited time. Like the most famous cotton bag, Thailand local branded, have a big shop at G floor. Easy to get there. The most famous supermarket, BIG C also located just in front of the Centra world. U can get the local food as souvenir from BIG C. there is a lot of choices.

Fantastic Celebrations for New Year 2015. Once again we headed to this big mall. the location is very easy to reach. Hundreds of shops and dozens of restaurants. This year I like the New Year Eve Celebrations. there were thousands of people who came here to celebrate the eve.

Nothing special in my view. basically its another big western style shopping centre.
If you've seen 1, you've seen them all.
It's in a great location, right in the heart of Bangkok city centre... but that sort of thing isn't why we travel to new country's.

Good Shopping. I really liked this mall. Having lived in Korea for four years where they consider a department store kind of a "mall", I really enjoyed it here. I've been to large malls in Manila where eventually it is just the same shop here and there but at Central World, this was not the case. Not one duplicate of a shop. There were two department stores that I wasn't able to visit but I still spent 6 hours there. There's an ice skating rink, different ice cream and dessert shops as well as a nicer eating area called Grove where there are different food and fusion food slightly more expensive than what is inside the main Central World. It was nice to see all the international brands and eateries so if you're looking for anything that is traditionally Thai, this is definitely not the place to go.

Very nice mall, but don't expect bargains.. Didn't spend too long here, but it's huge. There's even an ice skating rink !It's just a very nice shopping centre, with a great selection of stores, but things aren't really any cheaper than back in Blighty. You may find the odd item here and there that works out cheaper, but most of it is about the same, & some is more expensive.For very gucci gear go to the Siam centres, but (again) don't expect to save any pennies.MBK on the other hand is the common man's mall. A vast selection of shops, stalls, bargains & a fantastic food court.

Malls. Well... To us it was an average and empty mall. We just came from Manila where huge Malls are now like "streetcorner shops" and packed with people... We wonder where they get the money to buy all these consumers goods
Best place. This is the best place to shop in Bangkok can not complete in a single day.u will find all brands of the world here.just owsom
Incredible shopping mall. As shopping malls go there can't be many more impressive than this one. It is absolutely huge and set out in an interesting and beautiful way. Not many bargains though!

Central World Plaza in CBD. Central World Plaza is one of these shopping-malls where you have to go and shop and look around. Lots of restaurants at floor 6 and Cinema at floor 7. There is always something going on here.Last week it was crowded with Motorbike fans and next week it can be totally different. Take your time to visit
Shoopping. Make the time visit this shopping centre, it's huge ! So many different shops to see, an absolute must !
Massive. Worth the visit but a bit overwhelming from the sheer number of options available. I think that whatever it is you could want you would find it here

shop till you drop. I was shown this location by friends whom holiday in the area often. What a awe inspiring place to be. You can easily spend a day or two visiting shops. It has great atmosphere and very popular. There is just so much to choose from. If you go with several women, split up and meet later to reduce wasting time looking at things that are not of interest to you as there is so much to view and too little time when you are shopping with women.
The variety is amazing. This mall has it all...shops, restaurants, visual delights.A SkyTrain stop makes it most convenient to reach.

A city within a city!. A huge, major hub for shopping, dining and entertainment. You could shop till you drop, people watch, dine, walk around or park yourself at a cafe and watch the world go by. Check out The Groove section for some of the best restaurants in town.

Just wandering. This was on Day One, after feeling a bit templed out we just wanted a look at the retail therapy possibilites and some lunch.We heade up to the 6th Floor I think it was, where you paid 200 Baht and ate as much as you wanted. An amazing display of so much food. |Of course we deidnt have a clue what anything was so just pointed and crossed our fingers. That was part of the fun of it. I chose badly. It was delicious and I do like spicy food. But heaven knows what it actually was. Meat of some sort, but very bony and so hot. My lips were burning as was my mouth. My husband was laughing but I certainly knew all about it later.Not cheap for shopping MBK was better
MALL. This is another big mall in Bangkok.Like other malls here shops foodoutlets and helpful staff.You can go to shop here.
Elegant Shopping Center. Elegant, modern design and architecture. Connected to other malls and BTS terminal makes it more convenience.

Great Shopping. This is a beautiful mall. Many stores and restaurants and exceptionally clean. Near the skytrain. Staff at all the stores are very friendly, and majority of them speak english to assist you. Many sales!!! for you ladies.
Beautiful Mall. Beautiful Mall. They have almost everything too.Nice restaurants. Nice helpful staff. Lots to see and buy.

First world comforts. If you partake in materialism, consumerism, and hedonism, this place should satisfy all of the afore mentioned needs. I was taken here by a half German half Thai national that I met in the city. Tried the Korean restaurant on the top floor. Decent food. A bit pricey. The ice coffee from the stands on the side of the road on the outside of the mall is excellent. If you're lucky there might be a market (day and night) set up at the front of the mall selling a wide variety of street food and drinks that looks more hygienic and appetizing than your typical run of the mill street food carts. Food here is pretty tasty as well.
All that you need. One-stop shop! It's too big that you cannot do everything in a day. You must at least spend two days to navigate this place.
Shop 'til you drop. Very clean , bright open indoor mall. Easy access to all the other malls in the area. Mostly upmarket shops wih knowledgeable staff.
New Year's Eve. Thousands of people waiting for the countdown from many countries. You feel safe despite the crowds. Snoopy is the theme. What a sweet way to start the New Year!

The most amazing mall I've ever seen!. I come from New York City where we don't have Shopping Malls, but I travel often and see them in other cities. This one is quite amazing and has most everything. Bangkok has several extraordinary shopping malls. It's very impressive.

Good to go around. Lots of shopping options available . People can eat variety of foods . Road side shopping stall have less option but people can buy one. If you have lots of money than shopping can be of best quality.

Huge Shopping Complex. Hundreds of shops from many international brand are here. At 7th floor there is food court and supermarket, good to have some local delicacies. There is also cinema and bowling alley.

HUGE upscale shopping,. We visited this mall while finding the post office to mail a package. The mall is filled with upscale stores, beauty bars, high end local goods and beauty bars. Watch out, this a shoppers paradise Just wish we didnt have more time to shop!

huge mall with lot of options to buy stuff. We walked from the Siam station to the Prathunam market through this mall. This mall is huge and we can spend hours here. The shopping is very good quality but costly as per Bangkok standards. The food is not that tasty and is extremely expensive. Our recommendation come out of the mall towards Prathunam and eat there.

Anti-touristy. There was an event at the hall to promote tourism to Andaman islands. After long standing in the queue, we were declined because we were tourists. I think they should have informed us at the beginning. Quite inconsiderate!

How to enjoy the Central World Plaza?. The Central World Plaza maximized their complex by dividing every area into functional activities. By understanding the set-up, a visitor can either pick and choose the area they intend to visit on that specific day or browing each area with a knowledgable perspective. Start with the external outdoor area where from time-to-time certain theme-event is created to attract visitor to the complex. Check whether the theme is to your liking. Second on the floor of the atrium, there is always commercial event to launch or relaunch certain product and does have special promotion with price and give-away. Third the whole upper level dining and supermarket, choosing the restaurant or browsing the supermarket can be fun. Fourth the entertainment complex on the top for your movie etc. Five and most of all, the shops of most international brands with their up-to-date products and sales signs in order to separate you and your money. By understanding the complex well can help you to avoid the frustration in braving through the shopping complex in a busy day. Prepare to spend at least 3-4 hours if this is your first visit. Have fun!!!!!
So big.... That mall is so big we could't believe it! It was a great experience walking around, but in general is a very expensive place (in my opinion).
Great. Great if your not looking for a bargain and want to get some airconditioning.....not my type of thing but if your looking for some home comforts...place to go

Great Shopping. I cant finish the whole mall, it is so big that you can shop all your items here from luxury to mid scale, from daily household to gourmet, from local juice bar to fine wine shop.. you name it
Giant Shopping Mall.. Free parking (for 3 hours) in Bangkok's one of the busiest zone makes it one of the dearest shopping mall for me.
Shopping. My hotel was attached to the plaza and it is massive, selling amazing food, designer clothing and it even has a Burger King.

Alot of nothing. Lots of stalls and shops but nothing being sold that took my fancy, felt is was more for Locals and people of the city. Street Markets and Stalls MUCH BETTER! But it is a very clean place and everyone's polite.

Was old now new. This place got a facelift a few years ago. Before I went in once and it was dead and old, and I never went again. Unitl it got a major renovation and expansion. Now it's vibrant, new and buzzing. I often watch movies in the huge multiplex. And eat at one of the many restaurants on the 6th or 7th floors.

A great big shopping centre in Bangkok - not exactly a cultural icon!. It's a huge shopping mall, filled with quite expensive shops and with a very classy 5 star hotel attached. Personally I could get more excited in Cardiff

All in one shopping centre, everything you need under one roof. Dining, shopping and entertainment. Comfortable air con shopping mall, lots of choice, can easily spend a whole day and evening there, and still not see it all.

Great Place for shopping. Located between Central Mall (Chidlom) and Paragon Mall (Siam), Central World Plaza is by far the biggest Mall in Bangkok. It houses all the major and luxury brands. Highly recommended for those who should like to shop in one place. The food court serves quality food. There is a ice skating rink on the first floor, one can leave the children there to skate while one can go shopping. For those who do not know to skate, coaches are available.Generally there are stall on the ground floor, selling highly discounted branded clothes, shoes etc.. Always check out the ground floor, there might be good deals available.If you get bored of this mall, Paragon Mall is connected by skyway and is just a couple of minutes walk away. Or you could also take a five minute walk to Platinum Mall or the Pratunam Market.

As malls go, this is appalling. For all the hype it fails to deliver. The escaltors are weirdly laid out, the food court is underwhelming and expensive with small portions and the shops are somehow less than interesting. Maybe because the human flow is so poorly designed that collisions with your fellow shoopers common. I dunno, I'd rather eat dirt than return here. Sorry!

Shoppers paradise . Another great mall complex. 3 big malls a fused together and you don't have to take too many wrong turns to get lost in her glamour. Wifi connected , however must fill out a survey at the concierge to get the password. A must visit for anyone visiting BKK

It is Thailand's Largest Shopping Complex. Central World Plaza is located in the heart of Bankok's cosmopolitan Rajprasong area. It is Thailand's largest yet one stop shopping complex, Central World offers more than 500 leading brand boutiques, over 100 restaurants and coffe shops that cater international sumptuous cuisines and a 15-screen world class cinema.Right here inside Central World is ZEN, Thailand's cutting edge lifestyle trend megastore and a hub of alternative fashions from world class edgy brands like, Versas, Kenzo and more, plus famous local Thai designer brands. On top of these 7 levels of shopping paradise, ZEN is well known for its most spectacular rooftop dining and entertainment paradise with the most breathtaking 360 degree panorama views, under HEAVEN Bangkok's four unique concepts; ZENSE Gourmet Deck & Lounge Panorama, SHINTORI Japanese Art Cousine and HORIZON International Tapas Bar and Heaven-on-ZEN.

Huge shopping arcade with some of the world's best brands under one roof. Its spread in acres.Pay your homage to the idols of the Hindu Gods outside the mall and jet set on the never ending shopping experience.3-4 different malls are connected together and you wont notice when you left one and entered the other. Dont miss the impromptu shopping sales which happen openly.Be prepared to hustle and jostle amongst the people looking for a good bargain:)
Central World: an adventure in a mall. A very fashion and modern mall. The brands are not so expensive and there are a lot of variety. Definitely a good option for a visit.

Massive Shopping Center. It is one of Bangkok's best higher end shopping centers conveniently located at Ratchaprasorn area. Many brand-name shops are available here. What's more impressive for me is the collection of restaurants in the building. Many different cafes, fast food restaurants as well as some very high end diners are available here.

Top notch shopping. Went to this place a few times. This place is massive with many products to choose from (fashion, electronic gadgets, department stores and food). You won't feel crowded as the building is so spacious. Nice and clean place to visit. Highly recommended.

Huge mall with brands and lesser known outlets. Situated between the Siam and Chit Lom BTS stops, and reachable via walkway from either, Centralworld is a huge mall with many big brand shops but also lots of other less known outlets too.It also has two department stores, one at each end: Zen (a funkier version of Central) and Isetan (a Japanese store.There are seven levels with shops and eateries, as well as a Central Food Hall, Heaven on 7 dining, and a multi-screen cinema.You can easily spend many hours shopping or just browsing, or enjoy a film and dinner, all without having to leave the building.It is also just across the road from the Erawan shrine, which is always a popular tourist attraction.Definitely a mall to visit for lovers of shopping.

Massive Mall. Not frar away from Sam Paragon you find Central World. A massive mall with lot of shops restaurants, a cinema and lot more. Same stuff like in the other shopping malls. Cheaper than Siam Paragon. More "normal" but still often expensive if you not catch a discount
empty your wallets here. luxury shopping, designer brands, sports cars, world cuisine food court, super imax theatre. This plaza has got all the fancy joys of the world.

Massive mall!. We enjoyed this massive mall, words cannot describe the overwhelming size of this place!We also enjoyed New Years Eve celebration outside the center!Worth a trip if you are a shopper!NOTE this is not a bargain hunters paradise, decent prices nothing crazy though!

Brand Consious. If you looking for brand then after siam paragon you can visit this place.
Location is good if incase you dont get what you looking for then you can take a walk to siam paragon (15 mins walk) or patunam road for all shopping malls like platinum & indira market.

Shippers Paradise. I had been to Bangkok many times and always did my shopping at Siam Paragon or Siam City. This time we stayed at the Amari Watergate which was a short stroll from this mall.Well we were extremely please with the large choice of retail stores that are present here and absolutely loved it. So much so that we went again the next day as we had not covered all the different levels. We were also very lucky to be there at a time when all the stores had sales of up to 70%. Which only meant more shopping for usIf you love to ahop then you must put this place on your list of places to visit

New Year Eve Countdown 2015. We had travelled across Cambodia from Phnom Penh to Siam Reap and then ended in Bangkok. We were deciding where to do the countdown. The hotel we stayed had a dinner and celebrations package but we choose to do what the locals do on New Years Eve.We saw some celebrations outside central world. There were about 4 to 5 stages with music. The local beer company sponsored the event. We queue to buy coupons and get a seat inside. They charge us $3000 baht by looking at us. You must get tickets ahead . We were really lucky to be able to q and get in. It was very crowded but when time came for countdown ...the singers onstage were at a loss... they miss the que and continue singing... shame!The audience took it over and follow a clock nearby. It was perfect.As we could not understand a word the singers were singing, we just party on our own.It was indeed a fun way to usher in the new year.We certainly would like to go back. We may not have big bang here cos they are in Singapore at that moment but we also got a huge bang!Just get a proper dj that can do the count down on stage!The explosive fireworks display really rock the crowd!Only improvement is to have more toilets. There are just too many people who need to use the toilet. A policeman handed a bottle to a guy.... very funny.... he just could not do it in a bottle...So be come prepared and you have certainly have fun!

Shopping shopping shopping. If you love shopping for all the does over priced brand named items this is the place to come an spend your money in Bangkok, around 6 floors of shopping heaven. topped off with 2 floors of restaurants and food courts and a multi screen cinema and including an ice rink on the 5th floor.
Hectic. This place is huge, you get lost amongst all the stores and trying to find stuff, food even. It's awesome.

Best food court in town. This is one of the best food courts around. It's on the top (or almost) floor of Central World Plaza mega shopping complex. It's in the back of the grocery store and other small restaurant/ food kiosks. The variety of foods (no western) is excellent and quality always good. Prices are really good too. There is vegetarian booth too; I'm working my way down the list of about 20 different dishes just at that one booth. Save room for the Thai sweets there in the food court or the numerous ice cream, Japanese dessert stands outside of the grocery store. You'll be full, satisfied, and so happy when you've spent under USD 10 per person for so many different dishes, and even had a drink and dessert with all that. You can probably actually eat here for 3-4 dollars if you just want one or two dishes. We'd probably eat there every night if it weren't such a hassle taking a taxi from Central World (take the BTS).

Big and wonderful. Used to be called world trade centre.It's a big mall but not a mega mall You can still find your way around the place. Apart from the shops and departmental stores (isetan is here), there is a huge variety of eateries and restaurants on level 3 and level 7.

Another Mall in a Big City. As a westerner I found nothing of interest in this mall. It is big - glitzy - somewhat Western - just do not see the point. Perhaps a find for Chinese on a shopping trip? Skip it -Tom Cruise - cmon!
Nice and big mall.. Lot of F&B outlet and shopping.Walking distance from ChinLom BTS.There a Big C opp central world for your marketing need.Beside Patinum mall if you want to buy some cheap clothes.
Really great mall. Really big and a lot of different designer shops. Would recommend a 2 day trip to get through all the levels but definitely worth the visit.

HUGE shopping mall. A great mall with lotsa international brands, including 2 departmental stores, Isetan and Zen. You could get VAT refund by spending at least THB2,000 in the mall, but not sure if all stores does it. You can find brands like Superdry, Cath Kidston, Naraya, Nike, etc.

Lots of food, shopping and entertainment options. Giving it a 3-star as I think Terminal 21 at Sukhumvit is relatively better in terms of food and shopping. Food wise, Central World has loads of good options from Western to Asian fare, fast food to fine dinning. It also has the Central Food Hall which is a very good supermarket especially for gusts staying in Centara Grand. Also has a cinema and many facilities for kids.
Huge Shopping Centre. Well it's easy to get lost here especially if you get caught in the Zen multi-storey department store with hard to find directions to get out of it.

Huge Mall with Great Japanese Food. Compared to most Japanese restaurants back home, the ones here are generally run by Japanese chefs. I highly recommend the restaurants located in the top floor of Isetan and the Zen restaurant near Kinokuniya Bookstore. Naturally, some of their ramen broth is a bit spicy, most likely to cater to the locals' tastes.The mall has a wide variety of stores, and most of them carry international brands like Topshop, H&M, Cath Kidston etc. If you're thinking of getting books, apart from Kinokuniya, there's Asiabooks and B2S. Word of caution though - books in English is not cheap.During my stay in Bangkok, I made a pair of spectacles here as well. It was quite affordable due to the 30% discount on my frames. However, the prescription for the lenses is quite strong despite the optician responding to my complaints of dizziness during the lens fitting. So it is really advisable to just purchase the frames alone. Should you be interested in getting a pair there, they just need about one day to make a pair of eye glasses. Transition lens will take at least 3 days though. There were two key stores that my family and I had planned to visit from the start, which were Naraya and Boots. NaRaYa is a local bag brand that has a strong feminine touch to their designs. They also have special design for occasions like Christmas and Lunar New Year. Bags there are quite affordable. I bought a duffel bag and shoulder bag for 480 baht and 220 baht respectively. Boots is a pharmacy chain originating from the UK. They sell affordable and good shampoos and body soap. We bought 8 tubes of hair shampoos (Boots brand, of course) for 50 baht each. Hopefully this is enough to last the year, haha! As Christmas was around the corner, outside of the mall was this giant Christmas trees with a sea of Snoopys at the foot of the tree. Perfect photography opportunity if you ask me. There were 4 outdoor bars as well, belonging to 3 different beer brands - Chang, Singha and Heineken. Each bar had their own live band performing, so you can imagine how lively it was! I'm not sure if these outdoor bars are permanent as during my parent's previous visit in January, they remarked it was quite quiet. On a bright note, what will definitely be there are these small shrines located outside the mall, towards the direction of Platinum Mall. Everyday, you'll be able to witness the locals offering flowers and their prayers to the altars. One of the altars accepts only roses as offerings, while the other, a type of orange blossom. Sometimes, there are so much flowers that you can catch a whiff of fragrance in the air. There are stalls selling these flowers nearby. It is an interesting sight, especially at night, where you this contrast between the two adjacent activities - quiet, solemn prayers at the altars on one side and the intense, catchy music on the other.

Nice. I think I went to this place before, but just this time I spent more time with it, and really love what I experienced. It's a nice place for shopping, nearly everything is here. They also have this area on 7th floor where cinema located with restaurants and small "supermarket" to buy vegie, fruits, and the floor under that, 6th floor, having many nice dried fruits, and the sale staff was very very nice too.

Shopping at Central World. It is one of the largest malls in Thailand, the mall is in a good location and easy to access. The mall has over 500 stores and 100 restaurants and cafes inside. it is better to take a coffee break after shopping.

Not the most beautiful shopping mall in Bangkok but cool prices. I love to shop here. Its not as fancy as the other places but I saw in all my fav shops like Victorias Secret, Sephora .. many shoes so felt good in there  and in front of it .. the decoration this and every year for Christmas is just awesome. Nust see and great photo opportunities waiting out there

Huge mall. When arriving at the central mall by BTS, i was caught by the wonderful christ as decoration that was displayed with a snoopy theme. A lot of people really enjoyed and were taking photos. The part that was a bit confusing was when i had to go inside and take a lift to the floor that i wanted. I did. Ot realize that. If i had only walked a bit more in the corridor around the corner i would have reached the main floor where all The shops were. I guess if it is the first time it can be a little bit confusing. But once you are inside a lot of things to buy and see. There are quite a lot of restaurants and food outlets and Even a cinema in the top floor. I had a few hours in Bangkok so i enjoyed some cool time inside the mall in the hot afternoon. Although after walking around a lot one does start to get tired. It was a pity that the i e skating rink was not there as i would have loved to see it. But all on all, it was very interesting and a very good way to spend and hour or two in the afternoon in Bangkok.I would definitely recommend anyone to just go and have a look at the all and the display outside for this christmas.

Love to shop here. It was a little hard to find an enterance in at first with all the renovations being done when I was there but once inside I was trapped in a maze of shops! I shopped at my first H&M here and loved every moment of it. I had looked up what stores were being homed here before leaving for Thailand and good thing I did, the levels just went on forever that you could end up lost but it's a good thing to get lost in here because you can find random stalls/shops and find some great buys, I bought some amazing smelling room scents, lots of gifts for friends and found all but 1 of the stores I wanted to shop in. The food court here is amazing!! I had the freshest grilled salmon with garlic sauce here and had a delightful strawberry tea juice. The supermarket area was really good too. Stocked up on snacks, water and everything else throughout the weeks. Staff were all lovely and eager to help you however they could. The only things I wasn't too thrilled about was the toilets, I thought they could have been a bit cleaner but all the shopping and nice staff make up for it at least in my case.
excellent place to shop at. one of the finest malls in Bangkok to Shop at. Brands like H&M, Naraya are worth to put your money in... Also the toys R Us store for shopping toys for the kids..

Spent one entire day shopping here!. This place is huge and if you are a serious shopper this will take one entire day! Everything that you need is here and if all else fails Platinum Mall is just behind.
Pleasant and comfortable. Many good boutiques and shops. Zen is good for shopping.... nice clothes and upmarket. Staff are friendly.

Amazing mall. Went here yesterday afternoon to by a dress for last night, unfortunately only had a couple of hours to look around which was no way enough time! You could spend the day here. The shopping is amazing. The designer brands are legitimate, so of course be prepared to pay proper price for clothing! The only down side is that if you pay $500 NZ, for a dress you have no warrantee if the dress is faulty!The mall is stunningly set out, clean and shinny and very safe!Would have likes to have spent more time here

Beautiful Elegant shopping centre - so stunning!. This amazing establishment shopping centre is the 6th biggest in the world - and for a good reason! I have been there ten times and have become minimally "misplaced" each time! The interiors are impeccable and during festive periods the decorations outside are absolutely breathtaking! There is every shop brand imaginable and time easily becomes lost in this magnificent shopping-paradise! Must-visit destination!

Zen at Central World. Zen, one of my favourite and level lifestyle megastore, is being there. It is a nice place to shop as there are featuring many famous local and import goods. The first floor is entitled the beauty and cosmetic, you can also find the luxury accessories and bags that designed by the local designer.
Excellent mall. I like this mall because they have a children playground and we can borrow stroller too for my 2 years old daughter.

Just a massive Chadstone shopping centre!. Seeing that we were staying at the Centara Grand upstairs, We decided to spend a bit of time here.Its basically a massive Chadstone shopping centre (for those playing at home in Australia). Had everything like Chanel etc. but had a lot of cooler little stores.You can't barter here. This is rrp type of shopping. You pay the price on the tag.We didn't really enjoy the shopping experience. It was more the Food on Levels 6 and 7. You have a cinema (we saw the new Hunger games in a "couples" seat), And plentyyyy of places to eat. Have a good few dozen smaller stalls selling Crepes, Shakes, desserts etc. Food here is amazing. Endless choices! If shopping is your game, This is where you want to be!

Wonderful Central Mall. We were here 2 of the days on our recent trip to Thailand. It is a lovely place to be at with air-conditioner and lots of great shops. On the seventh floor is the Food Mall where you can shop for many items like local products and even imported food. The items at the food mall are pricey though. There are also many high end brands in this mall. There are also many restaurants to cater to different taste.I would recommend this place for any one interested in a shopping trip.

If shopping is your thing.... a good place to spend it, but you won't find much here that is unique to Thailand. That being said: it is massive, the variety of shops will leave you exhausted, and perhaps happy - if you are a shopaholic

Great shopping. This is one of the largest shopping malls in Bangkok. Also one of the best. I love it, and whatever you like to buy they have it here. Loads of good restaurants and coffee shops are there also. And most shops have VAT refund for tourists.

Interesting escape indoors from the heat.. This is another mega mall in Bangkok. There are more store than you could see in a year. Also, there is a great Cineplex on the top floor and a great food market. Lots of coffee shops and places to rest. Many, many dining options, including The Groove, multiple new R estaurants/bars on the main level and one floor below. And for a bit of exploring find the circuitous path through the Cineplex to the Grand ace tars Hotel and go to the 55th floor, I believe, and have dinner or drinks in the outside restaurant/bar. The night view is stunning! At Christmas the decorations are beautiful.

Nice shopping place . Not as high end as siam paragon but a good shopping place for clothes and food with the likes of international brands like mango zara to name a few . Featured some interesting brands worth taking a look . Good selection of cafes restaurants etc with indoor or alfresco seatings . Will be back for more food and shopping .^^
Nice mall. Central World Plaza is a huge shopping mall on Rajdamri Road. All you can wish for in retail is for sale here. There are shops, cafses, bars and restaurants here.

Jewelry scam. Beware of this scam if you are approached by the groundkeeper working the praying shrine in front of Central World, or in Bangkok. Luckily we didn't buy anything from the jewelry store, just wasted 1.5 hr. http://www.into-asia.com/bangkok/gemscam/

Fantastic shopping center for everyone. The Central World shopping center is located at the Ratchaprasong district in Sukhumvit street. It's a huge complex of shops, restaurants, and entertainment facilities. It's ideal for everyone. There is an amazing contemporary Japanese restaurant there must try. They have lots of activities and fun during Christmas time. I think it's the best or one of the best in Bangkok.
Loads of SHOPPING!. Great area to shop for last minute souvenirs or even yourself! I won't recommend coming here if on a budget though! Try MBK for the ones on a budget!

A great complex. Central World is in my opinion one of the better complexes in Bangkok. The range of goods is great. The grocery store is just fantastic. The food hall is just awesome. Loved it very much. Highly recommended

Best Mall in Bangkok. This is the best shopping mall for me in Bangkok, as compared to Terminal 21 and Siam Paragon. It caters to both first class and mid-class shoppers and the affordable food court on the 7th floor shouldn't be missed. Special mention to the best mango and sticky rice I had at Mrs. Amra on the same floor (it costs 140 baht, located nr. the supermarket). I would recommend this mall to everyone who has a limited time to shop in Bangkok.

6th largest mall in the world. Once you step inside, one can quickly realized why it is ranked the 6th largest mall in the world. Good point about this mall is that it has high end branded goods as well as mid range stores too. Lots of restaurants spread out too.

Lots of shops, and a post office.... Finally found a Post Office in here after failing in other Malls. The layout is reasonably easy to work out, there are a wide variety of shops, and a nice food court upstairs and more upmarket food and drinks area attached (Groove).

Great and cheap foodcourt on 7th floor. Very nice mall and great choices of brands. I like the foodcourt the most. You get a card when you enter the foodcourt. The stalls scan the card and add the stuff you buy. When you leave the foodcourt you pay what is on the card. Super.

Huge shopping mall! You really can find anything!. All types of stores, name the brand, it will be there! They have all kinds of food from crepes, to Japanese, Italian, Thai. Very nice place to visit, shop and eat.
World Class Shopping Mall. All WW brand names are here plus famous local brands. Big shopping mall with excellent facilities. Stay here and shop all you need from Thailand.

Big shopping mall. If you like branded items, here's the place you must visit. This big shopping mall located at sukhumvit area. I using BTS to get here, get down at national stadium or chit lom. Don't use taxi cause this is located on traffic jam area.

Lovely mall. spent a whole afternoon there. the next day when we went to the airport and realised our flight was delayed by 5 hrs, we went back to centralworld. huge mall, great bargains, got an area for kids to play. we did lots of shopping!!! very clean and organised mall.all the brands are there.the only drawback is the traffic in that area. it is quite painful!!

Love shopping. Wow what a huge shopping mall . I loved it !!!!!!!!!!! We shopped up a storm for our children and they loved the toys r us store . Seven levels ( I think ) shopped so much I forgot . Loved the gap kids store and picked up some bargains. I spent almost a hour in the b2b store and picked up ten books and love them all . Going back before we go home to phuket . Love. Love love
Great Bargains. Can get genuine branded items at bargain prices here. There is a halal eatery on 5th floor. The shopping mall is big and clean. Very organized.

Lovely place. Dont miss it or u might miss on some crazy sales. I went there n enjoyed everything. The foodcourt on the ground floor is huge. U have so manu things to eat. Oh u will love it but compared to MBK Platinum here it is more expensive but shopping is fun here. All the brands are here. Enjoy.
Best place for shopping . Great mall we have enjoyed a lot there you can get all brands there recommend place for tourists in Bangkok loved to go again
Recommended . Plan a day here at least. It is very big and soooo much to see and shop. And so easy to go there and to other places.

My fav. place to visit in Bangkok!. Absoultely my fav. place to visit in Bangkok. Awesome food court on the upper floor(either 6 or 7th I forgot...) along with all the other good restaurants. Great place to shop, especially the Boots store! Very close to Erawan Shrine as well!

Biggest mall I've ever seen. Central World Plaza is the 6th largest mall in the world. It was a little difficult to navigate around, and most of the finds weren't that much cheaper than buying it at home (sneakers for example) though they did have a better color variety than at home.If you are looking for higher end shopping this is the place for you. If you are looking for items or souvenirs that are more Thai stick with the markets.
High End retail Therapy. Has all the international brand names you can think of and a range of cafes/tea bars/ restaurants on the top floors.

High end shopping mall. A high end shopping mall. They have a top floor with good restaurants and a supermarket. Inside the supermarket, they have a food court. Prices are reasonable and quality is good. Place is clean and friendly service. Food are bought with a card where you will be given at the entrance. You will pay with cash when you exit.

mid-priced finds here!. It was a pleasurable malling experience and we found some good stuff at their department stores. Central World is walking distance from the bargain center Platinum Fashion Mall so you can just hop from one place to another while shopping.

Good shopping complex for Branded items. This was the first shopping complex we visited our tour. It has branded items. staff is not friendly. They are very rude like all Thai people. Not helpful at all and cannot speak English.

One of the best malls!!!!. I was here 5 years ago and it was nothing much. Did not visit in when I returned in 2012. I however visited the mall when I went to Bangkok in August 2014. WHAT A CHANGE!The 7th floor food outlets were amazing. Ended up eating at the Vietnamese Restaurant twice. (Extremely reasonable). The Cineplex is next to the Food restaurants. Amazing atmosphere throughout the whole mall. The vibe is better than Siam Paragon. Brilliant use of space in the mall. What more Isetan is next door and is connected to Central World. Shopping on the high side though.An entertaining kiddies play area which was exploited by me and my wife :-) Kept our two boys 3 1/2 and 1 1/2 entertained for quite a while.They also had a massive Toys R Us store on the 6th Floor.Ended up getting lost as well. Loved spending time there.

Shopping Paradise. Visited here twice and got lost both times as there is just so many shops.Quite a bit classier than MBK.Lots and Lots of food places but suggest you have comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking to do in this store.
Trimurti God of the most love. In front of central world there have the Great statue of Trimurti god there have the miracle that can find the Great real love ,the soul mate

Shopping heaven for shopaholics. Spoiled for choices here. Well known as the sixth biggest shopping mall in the world, there are plenty of famous brands offered. Standing beautifully in the center of Pratunam. Two Hindu shrines just outside of the mall made me feel touched and I can just stop by and pray every time I walked pass, either from the hotel to the mall or vice versa. Furthermore I don't find places like this in my country. Definitely had a great experience here.
The Place to keep cool in Bangkok. I loved this mall for many reasons but mainly great Airconditioning and great food choices. You wont be disappointed.

A smorgasbord of food and fashion. This is a massive shopping complex with 7 levels of pretty classy shopping. The top two levels are mostly food, with an amazing marketplace on the top floor. You take a little ticket and go inside, pick whatever food and drink you want and watch it made in front of you, then sit down to eat before showing your ticket and paying to exit. We were there around breakfast time, which was unfortunate because there's not a lot to choose from in terms of breakfast, but it would be well worth a visit around lunch or dinenr time.
shopping paradise. makes any shopping Mall in Berlin look tiny !A great mix of small boutiques to tiny stalls to luxurious brand shops and a huge variety of eateries ...

A whole day of shopping arcade. It is a family shopping arcade, where you can come along with your family with kids. There is a special playing area of kids at the 5th and 6th floor. A kids Toy shop is at 5th floor. Some of the very fine restaurants can be enjoyed on the 5th and 6th floor. Almost all fast food chains are available. The skating at the ground floor is my favorite among the amusements in Central World. you can hire strollers for your kids, have space to put up your luggage. have access to Taxi stands.

One of the super malls. With the rain tipping down outside, CWP was a great place to spend 59 minutes 59.9 seconds. No, really I jest, its worth a little more time as just having a pot of Twinings tea takes at least that, doesn't it Bertie? There's much that's worth avoiding here of course, but JT, Zen, Kum Poon & the cinemas on the top floor with the latest showings, all consume too much time. Oh yes, yes, I'd rather be exploring another temple, or some new jungly bit in Isaan or the far north, but really not on a grim day like this. So with a 60's watch in for repair down by the post office (for a bargain price), I headed for Zen, collected some new Santa's towels & Parker jotter 125 in fluorescent jade green.
