A 3D movie, (Guardians of the Universe) & then out into the dark again to a mega hotel nearby. Its one of the better super malls, although the others seem to have the really high end designer gear. Its worth a visit, whatever time it takes, but I am left wondering how many mega malls this city really needs & can support?

You didn't come to Thailand to see a mall, did you?. Hey, you. Yeah, you. The person reading this review? Keep reading.It's a mall. A giant, foreigner-friendly, first-world mall. It's got plenty of air-conditioning and kid-friendly restaurants. It has Thais around, but not much of what you might call Thai shopping. Now, the big question: why come to Thailand just to visit a mall? That's like paying big bucks to watch an IMAX 3D movie just to enjoy the concession-stand candies. It's a pleasant enough break from the heat, and is perhaps a reward for kids putting up with temples and palaces. Don't spend more than an hour here, though - Thailand has far more interesting places to see.

Great for shopping. When in Bangkok this is my favourite destination. It is a massive shopping centre from high end fashion to unique Thai fashion and products. There's also many cafes and restaurants. My only criticism is that it is not easy to navigate nor logical in terms of way finding as there are two main podiums of shopping.

International brands galore!. It's like being in an American or a Dubai mall. All big brands are there. And 15 cinemas which is great we shopped and our son watched a movie. Especially because it shows all English films. The place is huge and very glamorous.

Many Kinds of Restaurant. Go for the International Buffet.. Cheap and Nice. it cost less than 500B and you can eat for 1 and the half hour. This month is the sales Month so do hurry if you still not decide any date to Go.

SALE SALE SALE. contrary to common shoppers knowledge you could find good deals on good products for cheaper than street peddlers....if you are a sale hunter, also if lucky you could even get a refund on tax from many of the malls outlets. beautiful food places, very nice cinema theater, clean and pleasant.
Biggest mall in Pratumwan. Good Mall with lot of options for branded items. We have visited during the clearance sale and the discount was good.
Beat shopping Center. One of the best shopping centerer located in the heart of bangkok, Located near Siam Square, this Shopping centre gives and excellent shopping experience.

Great restaurants, theatre, and store selections. Central World consists of 8 floors stacked with designer to affordable clothing stores, multiple electronic stores, Toys-R-Us for the kids and an great selection of restaurants on the upper floors or at the adjacent complex, "The Groove". You will find the movie theatre on the 7th floor, which consists mostly of restaurants. If you have a car, there is lots of parking (free for first 8 hours). This is not the kind of place where you will leave empty-handed. And if you shop here, plan to eat here, the Dim-sum, Chinese, Thai, Japanese and Sushi restaurants are all excellent. Or you can settle for Sizzler.
THE MALL IS GREAT. as i roamed the mall to see for shopping you are assured that they sell branded items. the mall is nice and very clean. the comfort room smells fresh and clean.
Nice mall. This mall was really cool to walk around inside of. You could really spend a lot of time in here trying to see every store on every floor.

Rob & Licia. Wow, just go there to believe it, the atmosphere at night is mind blowing.Have a drink at the roof-top or a meal in one of the restaurants, they are an upmarket place so be aware of the prices.

Shoppers paradise. We spent 3 days in Bangkok and visited central world everyday. It is truly a shoppers paradise. It's huge! In one day we only managed to cover the 1st floor. On the 1st day there was a massive promotion happening in one area of the 1st floor and the royal family was in another area so the shopping centre was buzzing. If you get the tourist card you get one hours free wifi and many shops offer a 5% discount. There are many restaurants on the 6th and 7th floors that offer a good variety of foods. If you are looking to shop at places like H&M , Miss Selfridge, Pull & bear, Stradivarius, Zara , Top shop, Bershka and more then this is the place to go. Beware as your wallet when be empty when you leave and you may need to buy extra luggage to take home all the shopping!

Love it!. Love the place.. a bit confuse with the escalator location though... and also with the strategic location, the shops was quite limited.. is it because the high end brands already well-located in gaysorn and siam paragon which just across the street?my fave was the 6th and 7th floor.. food all over!

Super mall. Selection of brands is extensive. would love to see more local brands though. Tried a thai restaurant Taling Bling ( level3). It serves very good thai food at an affordable price.2 pax, 4 dishes plus dessert, 1100 baht

great shopping experience. if its designer shops you are looking for this is a great place to go , its full of them for clothes , shoes , bags and sports wear. Also there is Na Ra Ya , B2S Bookshop , Zen , Thai Souvenier shops , Isetan and much much more. if you need a drink there is Starbucks on several levals and the food court at the top is excellent , food and price wise. Once you are there you will stay for several hours. Well worth a visit ..

High-End Shopping Plaza. Central World Plaza seemed to be an high-end shopping plaza. It housed Isetan there and comprising about 5 storeys. Other than that, there were also other international brands resided in the plaza. Worth making a trip there, to stay away from the heat.

So massive. Went and had a quick shop here, I didn't realise how big this place was. I only had an hour to do some serious shopping before catching a sleeper train. It’s good for makeup and accessories but the clothes are a bit off as they are Asian sizes mostly. A lot of selections for food and drinks however.

Food court on the top has great street food at street food prices. What a treat it was to come upon the food court after wandering around this airy but gigantic mall. The set up is street food in a very cleaned up, mall-fied setting. I worried that the setting would cause the prices to double or triple. Not so, we got delicious, authentic street food at reasonable prices, and had a great seat with a view to eat it from.
Another impressive mall. Another shopping centre with everything from food, to shopping to cinemas. Found it a bit disorientating, so good idea to get a map. Clean and good quality shops

Beautiful clean mall. Another great mall we visited while on our recent visit to Bangkok,beautiful and clean inside with lots of shops,great cafes and restaurants.Great to wander around in the cool air conditioning,highly recommended if you are wanting to visit a nice mall.

Huge mall. No mall of this size where I come from. However if you are not in Bangkok for international brands then this place is not for you. There is a ice skating rink at the ground floor (or basement? Can't remember) for those are just here to accompany the shoppers.

Zen department store. Just love this place - The homewares department on the top floor has some of the most desirable home decor items you'd fancy - and from reasonable to crazy prices, so there's something to suit all budgets. Also my UK female friends seem to particularly rate the costume jewellery selection available in the store.

Average shopping centre but-------. At last found Marks and Spencer's.Been looking for a few months only small but cannot live withou M&S underwear.Small food section and they even have English tea! Bought 4 boxes.Otherwise same same shops. If you are looking for UK branches a lot are here.

huge mall just like the rest of them in Bangkok. Great mall for people interested in vehicles or real estate, there are always displays going on for different projects in the area. Also has the best currency exchange office located in the basement near the parking garage entrance.

Awesome Shopping Place. I love Central World Plaza because it's situated in heart of the city as well as the things you can buy are pretty great.It's probably the best place to buy sunglasses in the city because they offer competitive price and i sometimes i felt like it can even match the air port duty free.. Considering sunglasses are massive priced in Thailand. Other than that, it has fantastic food collection of shops and high end brands you can buy, just 10 minutes walk from this massive Central Embassy and about 8 minutes walk from Central Chitlom, opposite has Big C and next to Siam Paragon by SkyWalk, meaning you can reach without touching the ground to Siam Center, Siam Discovery, MBK and Tokyu.Moreover, on the other side, you can cross the small river to reach Pratunam, Platinum Mall and Pantip plaza, the big three Ps of shopping places.. that you may enjoy to shop. That's where reasonably priced items you can get.It's a shoppers' paradise and can spend an entire day of browsing around.

The Ultimate Shopping experience ! ! !. The Central World Plaza was just a 5 minutes walk from my hotel Amari Watergate in Bangkok. My wife and me went there for almost every single day of our 6 days stay. It is not just for shopping, you can just sit there in the evening and get to enjoy the vibrant atmosphere. Just loved the place.

One of the largest shopping malls in south east asia. If you are taking the sky-train, get off at the chidlom station and walk about a block and you will find the mall. It has multiple stories and is about 3 to 4 times bigger than some of the malls you may have in your city. Go to the top floor and you will find ethnic restaurants from all over the world( great reasonably priced food).They have fashion shows or some other event going on most of the time. There is a Japanese chain department store( Isethan) and the japanese clothier UNIQLO inside the complex. Across the street from the mall is the famous Erwan shrine ( Hindu shrine). You can take the skywalk from the mall ( 5 minutes walk) to get to get to Siam, which is the gathering place for the youngsters and tourists. They also have the Siam paragon shopping center, MBK shopping centre as well and the Siam centre with in the area. Check out the "Loft" store in the Siam centre ( top floor) for unique items.

Great shopping centre. We visited Central World Plaza simply just to explore it's offerings, and ended our visit there very happy! We had lunch at the Din Tai Fung there, the only one in Bangkok it seemed from the menu, and had a great lunch, as per usual as any Din Tai Fung location globally. We ordered two drinks - a lemon iced tea and watermelon shake - and the ice cubes we made with the ingredients of the drink! The iced tea had several round cubes of frozen lemon iced tea while the watermelon drink had frozen round chunks of watermelon. Made the drink more satisfying and non-diluted. We also saw a movie at the cineplex on the top floor - great value for money! Recommend.

How to Encourage Shoppers to Enjoy their Shopping?. When the Central took over the shopping complex, The place was totally wrongly designed and built. First the parking area was very confuse and most shoppers were lost either trying to find parking space or finding the exit. After the Central Group took over, the parking underground was redirected. Once the hotel was built, additional parking of 1000 cars was added. The new parking allows shopper to find plenty more parking space plus getting to the level of their choice. Overall the parking availability and friendly is the best among all shopping complex. Now for shopper that do not drive their car. The Central World divided the shops into different level by their merchandisers. Much thought had been putted into their design. Firstly the central core of the up and down was greatly expanded to give the free flow for the shoppers. Secondly, the escalators in moving up or down were synchronized for the convenience of the shoppers. Thirdly, the shops were position to attract the potential customer with minimum effort. All-in-all, the whole complex created an easy going and relax atmosphere for shoppers.

Nice Department Store. Today I have been there for meeting with my friend. So long time not visiting there. It's huge and lot of nice shops and Restaurants. So comfortable and relax, not busy and pax here.

Amazing Cinema!. what an amazing place to shop but best by far was the cineplex on the top floor. we paid 700baht each for a first class ticket which includes a buffet before hand, cocktails and beers unlimited and then another drink and popcorn once the film starts, you get a double reclining bed with blankets and access to the first class lounge. was the best cinema experience ever!! just go and try it

Love it. My favourite shopping centre in Bangkok! Great variety of shops and restaurants. Also, extremely clean!! Great location, can be accessed from the BTS station Siam, just a short walk away. Zen store is amazing and has anything and everything you need and want!!

Another Pavillion, KL. This place is one nice place. If you love branded stuffs like Louis Vuitton, then you will love this place because they have a boutique here! If you been to Pavillion, Kuala Lumpur, the branded shops here is similar to there!Make sure, you bring lots cash if you want to shop branded stuffs!!

cinema cinema cinema!. LOL! I can't stop recommending visitors to watch a movie in the happy theatre in SF Centralworld. Seriously! 500-600 baht for 2 with sofa seat, blanket, popcorns and drinks! that's a steal.Plenty of food.Do not miss Zen department store and the food hall on the 7th floor. If you have more time, explore the skydining too.

Good location and wide selection of shops. A great mall with plenty of choices for various brands and food. Good ambience too. Visited the mall yesterday and had brunch at one of the foodstalls on 7th floor. In the midst of enjoying ourselves, we noticed a huge rat running across the stall.

Enjoyable shopping.. Central World has a lot to offer. There are high end brands here ranging down to the brands we are familiar with in Aus. Plenty of food options, never crowded and always cool inside we found Central world a great place to shop and beat the heat.

Huge mall; good location; great food hall. This place is ridiculously large and a has good collection of brands for the shopping inclined. I wanted to pick up a couple of decent T-Shirts in Bangkok and I got a pleasant surprise to walk into Central World and find a H&M, Zara and a few other cool shops. I think it serves as a good middle-ground shopping experience in Bangkok. It's not barter-central like MBK, but at the same time not all out luxury shopping like you'll find in Siam Paragon. The food court is also excellent - and expect to pay street food prices in one of the better dining experiences you'll have in Bangkok.It's not crowded. It's got everything you need. Forget the rest, Central World is the best. A must-visit.

Good place for brands. Excellent place to shop for all brands. Zara, H&M, Aldo etc. No need to visit other malls, as far as I am concerned. Excellent local brands as well. Not high end luxury like Siam Paragon but not totally street shopping either. Good quality clothing and shoes.

Best mall I have ever been to! . One of the best malls I have ever been to in my life! It is so big you will get lost! Has many different stores and food shops! Definitely recommend going to this mall over any others in BKK.
Recommended!. Very big yet easy to find your way. Clean and not crowded. I liked it better than Siam Paragon. Prices are quite high.

À favorite place to shop. Check out the food hall and the shopsThis place is huge so give yourself plenty of time to explore and enjoy the experience Lots of bargains and plenty of brand names here too

expensive items but worth to buy. Located between Platinum and Siam Paragon, they have 2 big department stores. Branded item with regular price is here. the mall is so big, perhaps it takes quite long to explore the entire shop

A large shopping centre with an excellent food court. This large shopping centre has a couple of large department stores as 'anchor' tenants as well as a lot of shops and boutiques selling quality goods at reasonable prices.The food court on the top floor contains quite a large number of outlets offering food to cater for every taste in pleasant surroundings.

A-maze-ingly huge!. By far the largest mall in the country, it has gone through several refurbs since its opening and I believe the upgrading works are making it a lot better. Perhaps it's the voluminous interior, even when it's supposedly crowded, I didn't feel the congestion as I did in the other complexes. The spatial design though was a little confusing so it actually took a bit of time to get my bearings. That said, there're plenty to do and lots to see. If you're into doing some serious shopping, be prepared to spend at least half a day here. It's got plenty to cater to everyone. Though not very many choices for those with more expensive taste.There's no Skytrain stop here. Nearest one is Siam station which is about 10min walk away and can be reached via elevated (covered) pedestrian passageways.Chris Lee

Got its charm back.... Central World Plaza was burnt down in 2010 Red Shirt riots in Bangkok, it was completely damaged. But thanks to the hard working people of Bangkok, Central World is back on its charm. Its a beautiful Mall. The location is easily accessible. It's a very clean and ultra modern shopping mall. The best time visiting the mall is in the evening, though this is Mall is open in the morning too,but it looks more graceful in the evening.

one of my favorite places in bkk. One of my favorite shopping malls in bangkok. Connecting to BTS Chit Lom station, Central world locates right in the heart of bangkok. It is huge, bright, while well-organized. it is not as luxurious as Gaysorn opposite the street, nor that crowded as Siam Paragon. For girls who like shopping or window shopping, it is a paradise. From international fast fashion brand H&M, to local brand Naraya which is really popular among Asian girls, to designers' brands from worldwide, it almost has what you want. highly recommend the local aroma brand Harnn on the 1st floor, really good. Because of its cheap labor, Thailand is a good place to buy lingeries, bikinis, sports shoes and jeans. The restaurants are nice on the upper floors. And the seasonal decorations will always amaze you. Right now the Teddy Bear is having a road show on the 1st floor. it is really cute.

Fabulous Upper Class Mall. This mall is catering to the expat and the wealthier Thai person as well as the few tourists that pass through. All the shops here are on the sophisticated scale. I even heard an Australian man lecturing his wife about how the dress she was looking at cost $5000 once they did the currency conversion. That was quite humorous. Not all the clothes here are that expensive though. Each floor seems to have something different on it. From the clothes on the bottom levels, to the furniture level, to the education level to the cinema and supermarket on the 7th floor. There is everything for every kind of shopper. A part of the building extends off into an office block and there is a small group of upscale restaurants near here as well. The whole mall was spotless and easy to negotiate. There are lifts and elevators to get around on. Central World advertises itself as a global award winning mall and I can see why. It is freaking fantastic.
huge luxurious mall. thinking for shopping on sophisticate place. this mall was right place. its clean, nice, and lots branded item here. try to visit this place if you come to bangkok.

Huge mall. Central is a huge mall where wondering takes a lot of time. It's quite expensive but still not as expensive as the Siam Paragon. It was kind of high-end but not the highest-end.. Worth to visit never the less.

Massive shopping centre, every type of shop!. With 7 levels this shopping center is not for the non shopper. It has every shop possible, from technical accessories, guitar, dvd, audio, clothes, fashion, kids, more restaurants and fast food/ice cream/doughnuts etc as well as a cinema you wont be stuck for things to do. There's even a kids train on the 4th floor that takes you around the food courts. Boomerang is great for DVD, CD's (check region first). They also have major chains (avoid as they are cheaper in the UK, Top Shop and H&M was almost double the price). If you have hours to kill, money to spend and an appetite, this malls for you. Stunningly clean and better than anything in the UK.

Great place to spend the day. Was there to browse but ended up with serious shopping, dining, etc. Be prepared to spend an entire day in this large mall. Lots of shops, restaurants, even movies, etc. Enjoyed my trip.
Big Shopping Mall. Have many restaurants and fast food. Can watch movie and enjoy shopping at isetan supermarket. Mall for everyone to shop and is quite big

Shopping delight. Great palce to shop especially when the sales are on. Great variety of shops, high end to basic. Food court was great with good selections. Easy to get to by rail link and take the walk way to enter.

Great experience complete with Ice Rink. Well the Mall was well presented,great deco,clean service facilities and the highlight was am ice rink that matched central park,but indoors!goods again were very expensive,much dearer than the UK,no bargains here!

Good shopping Mall. Before you get into the main mall - take the opportunity to go the area on the opposite side of the road....lots of small food places,great for snacks or breakfast but interesting, plus there is a large Tesco (not that you necessarily want that but as a land mark). Then on the Central Plaza side of the road they also have a lovely little Mall before you enter the main store and go into the sub-way - where we had wonderful Iced Coffee, Cup Cakes and I visited the hairdresser there who was excellent a brilliant wash and blow dry on my long hair with a conditioner that lasted and smelt fab was 300 bht. anyway in the Mall which is huge with lots of floors you will find all the normal shops and outlets and lots of choices for eating...and I mean lots! all of course beautifully clean and air-conditioned

Things to do aside from shopping. CentralWorld is one of the unique malls in Bangkok because it actually has things to keep you occupied other than just shopping. Depending on when you visit, you might get to catch a "Tastes of Mexico" exhibition with tequila and tacos, a stage featuring K-Pop music, or an international bazaar put on by the wives of Bangkok's ambassadors. I've always found something going on to keep me entertained at CentralWorld.

Huge place and lot to choose from. You can easily spend whole day here. Lots of shops, restaurants, happenings outside etc. Not the cheapest in Bangkok, but clean and modern and tons of different stores

Great shopping. After a short trip to the Grand Place we went to Central World to do some shopping. It has the worlds 2nd largest H&M store, so this was perfect for my wife to do shopping.There are also a lot of food courts and restaurants, so you can have some easy dinner after you finished shopping.Kids enjoyed the Kids area with jumping zones.

Unfathomably Huge!. I cannot explain how huge this mall is. It can make Stratford's Westfield looks like a town precinct. I visited this mall regularly especially for restaurants. There are countless shops and you could get easily lost within its shiny labyrinth of commercial delights. Although it is one of the biggest malls in SE Asia, it does not have the charm of other malls such as Terminal 21 or Amarin Plaza. However, it is better than anything the UK have to offer in terms of shopping malls. They mainly have western shops, with the import tax being 50%, it may be worth reconsidering purchases at certain outlets. It is not really tourist geared as it is for Bangkok's wealthier population, but good fun to look through. If you like malls, and large ones at that, it's worth a visit.
Big and Expensive. Its one of the biggest malls of the Bangkok... it took me two days to completely explore it... Moreover you can get all brands under one roof...

Probably the biggest, probably the best. Probably Bangkok's biggest and best shopping mall. A few years ago they expanded, almost doubling the size of the mall.They have 2 supermarkets, Gourmet Food Hall (excellent and big) and Isetan, smaller but different and nice. They have a large B2S book store and 2 smaller book stores. The variety of stores and restaurants is really great. Sometimes I walk around for half an hour just trying to decide where to eat. They also have a cineplex and an ice skating rink.The one criticism I have is their taxi stand is not organised or regulated as some of the other malls. Taxi drivers demand exorbitant rates from foreigners in full view of mall security who let them do as they please.

It's a big mall. SO, this is essentially just a mall. An enormous mall. But still just a mall. Mostly locals visit this mall as it has essentials and is geared away from tourists. Interesting to see and if you need something, they likely have it. But I wouldn't go out of your way to stop by.

Shops shops and more shops. Central World is HUGE! Once you include Zen and Isetan it'll take up a whole day to go through everything. There's a food hall on the 7F which is well stocked and plenty of food joints to keep you full. Most major brands are present in Central World.

Big Mall Big Choices. This was, (not sure if it still is), said to be the biggest mall in all of Southeast Asia (and it really is a biggie). It's easily accessed by taking the Skytrain (BTS) and getting off at the Siam station. From there it's only a short walk into the complex. Once walking in, it's here one will realize they can buy virtually everything they may be looking for and the center has everything from jewelry, some small pharmacies, electronics to clothes, beauty and health, art and antiques, and of course, a great selection of food to choose whatever one may be craving for. If at all in question about what you would like to visit, just make a short walk to the concierge desk on the ground floor and they can tell you instantaneously where it is you may need to go. Also, if one would like to see just what stores exist in this shopping center ahead of one's trip, they may visit the official website at: http://www.centralworld.co.th/en/index.aspx Then, click on Directory to view the list of stores and eateries.

Good food and Shopping. The Central World department store has many different and good restaurants. it's a great place to do shopping for both locals and tourists. I actually like this place because it has varieties of products that are brand names as well as department stores.. ZEN and Isetan are each side of the building,
Clean and very very large but a little bland.... Very clean huge mall easily accessed by either skytrain or taki but nothing here you couldn't find in any other major world city...

Good shopping and nice selection of restaurants. Lots of dining choices, Thai, Chinese, Japanese, American, Steak houses, Hamburgers, desserts.
Big department stores and a variety of smaller boutique type shops. When we visited, they had a performance of Thai Dancers outside, inside they were having a photograph workshop. On previous occassions we have seen a car show with Mini Coopers, Mercedes and BMW

As Shopping Malls go, this is the best in Bangkok. Something for everyone. However, if you are looking for an imported sportscar then you will need to go to Paragon. Other than that, Central World has everything. Prices are the same as the UK for many items and can be more expensive for western branded goods. You can get bargains at end of season sales in various stores. Large choice compared to most western malls and better quality than MBK.We go here for eating, the cinema, Asia Books and SuperSports.Difficult to navigate but off the main thoroughfare there are some decent shops where bargains can be had at certain times. A lot depends on what is being discounted at that particular time.Dining options are plentiful. Mainly up on the 6th & 7th floors and are reasonably priced. You pay standard prices at chain outlets e.g. MK/Fuji, not the enhanced prices you find in Paragon. Cinema viewing options are many. I always recommend visiting friends to try the 1st Class package if available. Going to the cinema here is 10x better than in the West either on price or on service.At the back of CW is the Centara Grand Hotel. Try the Red Sky bar on the 55th floor. Amazing views and better value than other similar roof top bars in the city. Outside CW there are often interesting exhibitions on the concourse facing Ratchadamri Rd. At the moment, there is a large photo exhibition at the south end with the rest taken up with Xmas themes and beer bars ahead of the New Year.CW is always an interesting place to wander around at any time of the year.

The best mall in Bangkok. For my money, the Central World Plaza provides a much better retail experience than the bigger, more famous Siam Paragon mall next door. It is less congested and seems better organized. Wider, more open spaces also mean that you feel less cramped. Though it has no food court, there are plenty of great dining options throughout, but particularly on the 6th and 7th floors. If you want a good food court, try the Food Republic on the top floor of the Siam Centre mall nearby.

Shop and bop till you drop!. Central World Plaza is typical of most SEAsian shopping centre, it is busy; busy and busy. There are the usual familiar international and Asian brand names, boutiques, food courts, entertainment and close to other shopping centres. Central World Plaza provides insight into a modern and growing Thailand peoples - Young, smart and money to indulge. Interestingly outside the shopping centre are the peddlers of some of the most fascinating and kitsch goods - fun and quirky. It s worth the trip though traffic in that area is chaotic. The downside of the centre is that it is not easy to navigate....personally I think it is poorly designed as it does not naturally provide seamless shopping but hey it's okay if you are lost as it is what holidays are about....lost in a shopping centre lol.

Grand experience. If your looking for a large range of up class clothing, accessories and technology at prices similar to those you would find in your home country, this is place for you. We went during Christmas Eve and there was a large display of festivities outside the mall. It was a nice break from Khao San but it definitely hurt the wallet. We didn't go, but a Thai friend highly recommends the movie cinema on the top floor of Central world.

Average Mall. Very big and clean...some great designer stores...not as busy as many of the other malls...great cinema complex...I guess there is a place for everyone...I prefer the faster paced malls like MBK.

Great cinema. Like all shopping malls in Bangkok, this one is amazing. The cinema especially is fantastic value and very cheap compared to UK prices. Worth a visit for the high standard at a low price.

Great for shopping!. I felt very safe here compared to some reviews of the market streets around here. We arrived about 4pm and stayed until it closed at 8pm. There were some great shops there, very similar prices to the UK however the electronics were significantly cheaper. There was a lovely twinnings tea cafe which we had tea and scones in. Although it is very English we don't have those in the UK so it was lovely. The food court on the 7th floor has loads of choices to eat.
an ok mall. the mall layout was a bit too complicated and was difficult to shop. didnt feel that it was huge. it boasts a wide range of shops but was not cheap,

Good Shopping. A great place to shop but the mall is way too big. I wish the signs were clearer. It was a little difficult to ask for directions since not a lot of people spoke much English over there.

Best shopping mall in Bangkok. 2nd visit since Dec 2011. This time, they have Bangkok Beer Festival just alone the Mall with live band and beer. The famours Thailand beg 'Naraya' is located at ground floor. It is a must to visit while in Bangkok. Do surf their wed site for more info.

Good Shopping & Food. This mall is huge and has just about every type of store imaginable and a lot of familiar brands. It is a welcome change of pace from the heat and bustle on the sidewalks. There is easy access from the BTS via the elevated walkway above the street. Central World also has a gorgeous movie theater at the top of the mall (whatever floor that may be) and plenty of decent places to eat.

Decently huge. Yes it's huge. Packed with branded store if you are tired of hot weather shopping in sweat and look for decent expensive cosy environment. Here's where you go. It's probably the biggest shopping mall in bangkok.
Good location. Good mall with lots of western brands but it's nice to be out of the heat. Very clean and it's laid out well.

Good for food.. During my last day in Bangkok I went here, must say I wasn't impressed. All western brands at more expensive prices. However I was impressed with the wide variety & reasonably priced restaurants to choose from. If your looking for something a little more individual I'd recommended siam square or chatuchak market.

Our favorite Shopping Mall in Bangkok. Definitely our favorite shopping mall in Bangkok. This mall is huge, and has the widest variety of fashionable and latest clothing brands. It is very clean, new, and the walkways for shoppers are spacious. This mall is also a haven for food lovers, as it has 2 huge levels of eateries for us to choose from.This is a must go shopping mall in Bangkok!

Shopping Mall with links to other malls. This is a upper middle class shopping malls with lots of choices.They have tourist card which gives discounts. Ask the information counter for any promotions. During our visit, purchase above THB 5000 you get a very nice 'toot-toot' replica. There are cafés and eateries here as well.Platinum mall (lower class fashions) and other malls are within walking distance from here. You can plan a full day shopping in this mall and surrounding areas, which are linked with overhead walkways

good middle class mall. A nice mall of a decent size. Plenty of space to move around which is good. Shops were well presented. Pricing is reasonable. The building isn't as fancy as others but is tolerable. There is an small ice skating rink inside for those wanting to cool off. This Plaza is accessible to most travelling districts such as Siam and Pratunam.

One of Bangkok major malls. This is not my first review on this mall. It is so huge that I keep discovering places there! It is pleasant, modern, well decorated and there is often much happening there. Like in Siam Center, they sometimes have interesting exhibitions. The food section is worth investigating. They have some interesting restaurants there: Thai, Chinese, Japanese, Korean like in other places but also Vietnamese or Italian. Of course, there are also many places to sit for coffee or tea. Starbucks offer a cosy, enclosed area. I prefer the openness of Coffee Beans & Tea Leaves in one of the two main halls or the quiet atmosphere of the Illy Café near the skywalk entrance. The large esplanade in front of the building holds some major exhibits or events. For instance, they had an interesting photography exhibition on mainland China for some time. Sometimes it becomes a showroom or a night beer garden. And now that Christmas is round the corner, they have started erecting the tallest Christmas tree in town. difficult to escape this place when you are in Bangkok!

One of good malls in Bangkok. I think Siam Paragon and this one are the good ones in Bangkok. I visited this mall several times. It is Big and there are perhaps hundreds of restaurants and cafes (as well as other shops) in it. There are several good cafes in case you want a cold or hot drink.To my surprise, there was an ice skating ground inside the mall. It was nice to sit and watch the youth enjoying it. There is a exhibition section in the ground floor which was occupied by an exhibition about Indonesia, an exhibition/workshop about life planning etc.
Average shopping place.. This is just another of the common shopping places. The plus side of it is because it is huge. Nothing much to recommend.. Try to visit if you have no other place to go.. :-)
Huge. Its a huge mall that contains a lot of brands, but it is very expensive but very luxurious & it will take more than a day to finish

Typical shopping more... nothing special about it.... If you are into shopping, then this will be the best place for you as you can find almost everything here. This is a typical shopping mall just like any other big shopping mall in the asia region. There is nothing particularly special about it.
Heavenly. Great selection of stores. Clean with many amenities. Endless food court. We were thrilled to shop here. I missed out on the food market but have heard that it is amazing.
central world. i liked the vast majorty of shops within the mall and specially ZEN and the spa in Zen and my favorite place was twinning's tea bouttique for afternoon tea with family.

Modern & chic. Large & cavernous with an impressive facade. Centrally located. Well Aircon. New building. Spacious walkways. Clean toilets.Many levels of shopping. 3 floors of food. Large department store Zen. Local produce Naraya on ground level was constantly packed with mainland Chinese tourists.

huge commercial shopping mall. Not much to say, the size is huge, several malls link together, the plaza is clean, best place to hide from the hot weather, great variety of shops however too common and commercial, this is like all other regular malls in Asia, no surprise.
Real shopping. This is worth to see in Bangkok. Mall is very big and u kind find all marks in here. And other shopping malls are really close to it
GOOD SHOPPING MALL. every time i go to bangkok,i would go to this shoping mall.most of brands have shop there,but the prices is not low,but resonebel.
Awesome Shopping Experience. . One of the best shopping plazas visited. Superb atmosphere. Excellent atmosphere. Biggest brands with courteous salespersons. One of the best food courts.

Shopping addicted. I love to shop and this was my heaven, a must is seeing the MAC boys on the ground floor who made me look just Devine, you turn a corner and there is a ice rink. Really loved it and it took me a 2 days to complete

Shoppers heaven. it's a great place to do shopping for both locals and tourists.I actually like this place because it has varieties of products that are brand names as well as department stores.. ZEN and Isetan are each side of the building, the rest of the shops are basically their own brand shops.Great place to visit after wishing well after Erawan corner and not so extremely expensive as Gayson Plaza in front.

Dazzling Shopping Experience. We could not believe the number of upscale stores included in this multilevel shopping mall. You probably could find anything you want in this shopping complex. We thought the prices in many clothing stores were on the high side, but it was still a great shopping experience.

Good and numerous restaurants. Looking for food options outside of your hotel, this is worth the stop. I believe over 40 restaurants are available in one facility to chose from ranging in price based on your budget and interest. We frequented a few and found the mexican food truck simple in decor and excellent in food quality and price - two thumbs up!

What a plush mega shopping mall. Whoa what can I say. It is massive!! It's one of the biggest in the world no doubt. You can find almost anything here. But things can be pricey. We wandered around and when it's time to grab a bite to eat, whoaa, so many restuarants to choose from you wouldn't believe. And contrary to the clothes or other stuff, restaurants here have wonderful food at fairly reasonable price.

Food and Naraya Bags. We went here almost everyday throughout our stay in Bangkok, searching for food. The price for foods and refreshment at the food court are very reasonable. The mango and durian sticky rice are really delicious, must try. Other than food, we went here for Naraya bags (we also called it "Bangkok bags" or "曼谷包“). There is a big shop beside the main entrance of the building, crowded with people every second. Give it a visit and you will surprise seeing everybody buying bags in bulk.

Big shopping mall. A very big shopping mall. You can find almost anything here, but don't expect the things here are cheap. If you want to explore this shopping mall thoroughly, you got to spend one whole day here if not more.

Best Cinema in Bangkok. Have been going here for a couple of years now, having watched movies at half a dozen other cinemas I think this is the best location for number of movies planning and seating selections. Seats range from standard to First Class seats with pillows and blankets ... also food before the movie. Seating in "sofa seat" for two will cost around THB 500 to THB 700 depending the cinema or movie ... not sure why the difference in price.Worth visiting and comparing to other cinema experiences. Used to religiously go to Paragon Cineplex Nokia Screens but much prefer Central World Cinema experience.

Good shopping - nice supermarket too!. My wife and me spent a few hours in this nice mall. It's been renewed and renamed a bunch of years ago. Since then it's been very successful.And it's easy to tell why. Seven floors of stores. You really can get everything here. The usual luxury brands, endless clothing, electronics, instruments, beauty products, DVD's, books, furniture etc. And even a bunch of plastic surgeons are located here (mostly for the face).There are several restaurants with different cuisines to choose from. The cheapest option would be the mall's foodcourt, that's where we went. The food is very basic, but well-priced and offers great views.There's even an ice skating rink if you want to show off your skills.We shopped some clothes and and also some DVD's. The DVD's here in the several stores are nicely priced and original - not these illegal copies (which might not even work properly). If you take time to look you might find some rare movies.The mall also has a great supermarket with lots of fresh veggies and fruits. And some local producers sell their products at some stalls on the ground floor (fruits, snacks, meat and sausages...). Good stuff!You really can have a fun time here. There's something for everybody and for every budget. The layout of the mall is a bit fuzzy. You might get lost sometimes - especially if you look for a particular shop. But there's directories everywhere.Wanna know more about me and my travels? Check my profile (with a link to my website).

Terrible response to my complaint. I live in Bangkok so I go here all the time. 8 days ago I went for dinner and had my fingers sliced open by the lift doors which were both dangerous and faulty. Since then I have had zero response to my complaint from anyone. Be careful at Central World because they'll turn their back on you if anything happens.
WOW. Huge mall with everything needed and more. Food court is an entire floor of full size restaurants...not your average food court! Check it out if you are in Bangkok...pretty fabulous!

All I can say is WOW!. Large and massive 7 floor very clean mall easily accessible from the train or taxi from our hotel and both local and international retail and dining establishments available. Movie cinema and ice rink located inside; package holding area on first floor. The dining food court on the 6th and 7th floors are not to be missed. Also experienced a great Thai massage at Samart Health Care located on the first floor. Also, there are tourists specials when you spend a certain amount and sign up for the tourist discount card (was able to use at Tops Market after spending 500 baht or more). http://www.centralworld.co.th/th/index.aspx

Jewel of Bangkok. Smack right in the middle of the busy Ratchaprasong district, this is another landmark or icon of urban Bangkok. Used to be called the World Trade Center many years ago, this huge mall has always been at the center of Bangkok shopping and entertainment. It has a huge plaza in front of the mall and sometimes you get concerts there. Filled with shops and 2 departmental stores along with numerous restaurants, it is not difficult to see why you have to be here if you think you are really in the heart of the city.

Big Big Big. The place is ginormous with not only a wide range of shops to visit but also eateries. Given that it was our shopping holiday, we got ourselves an excellent stop to spend a good 2 to 3 hours at. Also The Big C supermarket is just across the road, we went there afterwards to get some Thai snacks for friends back home.Just like Siam Paragon, Siam Center, MBK, and Terminal 21, Central World Plaza is also linked directly to a footbridge. You can get to CWP via station E1

Great shopping, good prices, crowded. There are multi-multi-multi level shopping here. Beware of the crowds of school kids. Here there are more "street-like" vendors that are willing to bargain. That's the best. There is food here. This is an all day event. The location is great!

Another Huge Mall In Bangkok!. Another huge shopping mall in Sukhumvit area. It has most of the usual brands, with about the same prices as anywhere else. Good for spending a couple of hours and doing a bit of shopping.

Great shopping and F & B outlets. We always enjoy spending time at Central World Plaza. Sometimes for serious shopping and other times just being mall rats. One can find outlets of all popular regional and global brands in this huge and modern mall. There are many restaurants serving a host of Thai, other Asian (notably Japanese and Chinese) and international fare. If you are a Japanese food fan, this mall offers many choices including on the top floor of the mall's anchor tenant - Isetan.

Another huge Bangkok mall. This mall is massive. It is mainly UK/Western high street brands. I would say that most shops are over priced compared to the UK. Looked at the Fred Perry shop and found a nice polo shirt. It was priced at over £100. Checked online later and could get the same polo for £80 back home.

Huge mall, good for window shopping. I find this mall is really different from other surrounding malls in Bangkok as it offers wide variety of brands, from mass to boutique and upscale brands here. But I found most of the clothing items (for male) here is quite out-of-date. Also the price is not really that cheaper than in Singapore or Hongkong. For a tour around and enjoy the luxury shopping atmosphere, I would say this will be a great place, but to buy fashion brands, there are other malls around that you will definitely found greater items and bargains
Huge mall. Huge mall. Great place to buy all the Wacoal, Naraya and Cath Kidson you like. There a really nice supermarket on the top floor. Lots of nice restaurants. MK steamboat and many more

Fantastic Mind-blowing Mall. My first step her, I was amazed at not only the size of the mall but also the cleanliness, comfortableness, and variety of stores. I love the shopping at Zen, it has a so many cute stuff to buy even though it's a bit over-priced I don't mind. And you must check out Tops supermarket, there's so many things you can buy as gifts for your families and friends and even yourself. And also near the escalator up to the cinema you can watch this guy shape and sting dough into noodles. There was a crowd watching is why I noticed. Amazing talent. I took a look around the cinema upstairs and it's really gigantic like the mall itself, too. I didn't watch because I can't understand Thai (if there's English subbed movies available please let me know!). This humongous mall is definitely the number one place to be. So check it out!

Amazing. This fascinating mall is great... U could find alot of famous brands hereThe environment is perfect for high class shopper but hey! As long as u r there, y not wandering around and taking some picture! Moreover. U might get lost in this big mall since is huge and u can shop til u drop!Highly recommended!!!
Everything is there. All you want from a shopping experience is at Central world Plaza...it is close by to Platinum Fashion mall and MBK in the opposite direction

Fantastic mall. This is one place that has it all - shopping, lots of eating places, fabulous supermarket and cinema and more shopping. The variety is amazing and there is always some form of entertainment in the public hall - we listened to a youth orchestra, which was lovely.

Great Western comfort venue. Its was like visiting David Jones in the old days with overpriced clothes and fashion, as well as an extensive food hall that offered western cuisine both cooked and fresh. Home away from home including an extensive alcohol outlet (check the sales times though) as we did not realise that retail alcohol can only be sold from 9-11am then from 5-10pm.

great!. Location was very accessible from BTS Siam and it is super huge... many shops for the various kind of shoppers... ladies would go crazy gut don't expect the price to be cheaper than anywhere else...

Huge Mall with all kind of stores. Its a huge mall with most every shop that I find in the US anf other local and European brands. This mall also has a lot of familiar US food options such as Dairy Queen and Dunkin Donuts aside from the stores like Nike, GAP, Zara's and as such. I got a latte from the Coffee Bean there which gave me an hour worth of free wifi to catch up on my emails and stuff so it worked out great.
Huge Mall. A very huge mall where you can easily spend half a day there. But it is bit hard to locate where you are. We bump into a big food bazaar outside the mall during our visit

Big and bigger. Just an amazing place with nice and expensive stores.Surely the Dubai malls will be larger, but for Bangkok it's nice if you like shopping. And even if you don't like shopping.Many malls in the neigbourhood, Siam Plaza and Paragon which I like because of a big bookshop and a very large area with all sorts of restaurants.

Typical mall. A mega mall with the usual mid range and high end offerings. There are plenty of food and beverage options as well and a very jaded looking Isetan at the far end of the complex. It is centrally located and accessible via the BTS skybridge. Prices are probably on the high side by Bangkok's standards.

Massive .... Central World is a massive shopping mall ... with everything you could possibly want to shop for. There is every imaginable cuisine in the food halls with some really good (and cheap) restaurants. Remember to sign up for the tourist discount/refund card and to get the VAT refund receipts if purchasing expensive goods (claim back at the airport.)

Spend your money here.. There was a huge sale going on when we where there. Nice thing about this mall is that there are choices for your budget. Lots of restaurants inside. What i remember about this mall aside from the sale was that the attraction in front of the mall during our visit was a food market where you get to pick from lots of vendors. This is where we discovered for the first time the papaya salad dish of thailand.

Great Mall. Wonderful shopping complex. Not as classy as Siam Paragon but certainly way ahead in terms of options for different budget shoppers and diners. Always enjoyed the Laem Charoen seafood restaurant. MK restaurant is equally good and at lower price. Love the NIKE and Sports World shops. The Naraya shop is to be avoided (unless you hit the place at 10 am) as it is swarmed by tour groups. We usually go to the one near the Emporium (Sukumvit) which allows more breathing space. Depending on the period, Central World usually has attractions/promotions in the large front court yard. Beer stations, food markets, music stage bands and preceeding X'mas, they have wonderful displays and lights galore.

Great mall, and also great restaurants.. My family does not like eating in Bangkok's street food stalls. So we often end up in department stores food courts. The Central World department store has many different and good restaurants. Much more choice than eg the upscale Central Department store in Chidlom. If you want cheaper and more exciting surroundings then Terminal21 in Asok is your place.I can recommend Central World's many restaurants.

Great Shopping Mall For Everything You Need. I regret that I didn't have enough time to explore the mall like I normally would. but definitely something to tick on my bucket list the next time I go to Bangkok.

Best mall. This is amazing big mall with everything under 1 roof. We shop here for 3 days and not finished all the mall! Have many choice for food as well and entertainment. If you want shopping on holiday, go here.

Huge mall!. This mall is huge with two department stores, hundreds of boutiques and plenty of nice restaurants. I stayed at the adjacent hotel (Centara Grand), so easy access from my hotel to the supermarket and food halls on the 7th floor. The supermarket has a really good selection of imported goods, I could spend hours in it. But the food court is not too good. The food are weak, too bad really. As for the mall itself, not really my favourite because it's big and quite difficult to navigate.

Luxury Mall. This was the first mall that we went to. I noticed that most of the stores are designer labels and cater to the upper class. If you're into designer clothes, this mall is for you. Not for me though.
Great mall!. Lots of your favourite stores in a huge mall. Great location. Enjoyed the food hall too. The department store was great too.

Upmarket shopping. Visited Central World Plaza just to purchase Wacoal lingerine at Isetan and bags at Naraya. Other than these 2 items, the rest are of the same price as my homeland, Singapore.
Foodwise, there're many choices restaurants on level 6 and 7 ranging from thai, chinese, japanese to korean crusine.
Love it!. A very large complex, but easy to find your way around. A good selection of affordable stores. 2 great department stores- Setan and Zen.

Huge mall. A huge shopping mall. We ate at the food court and thought the variety and quality very good. We also went to the movies. The seats,though luxurious, were not very comfortable. The airconditioning in the cinema was sub-arctic! We wandered around the shops. Some very high-end shops there out of reach of our budget. We whiled away a couple of pleasant hours but not a shopper's paradise unless you have a full wallet.
Amazing shopping mall. Nice and still new shopping mall where you can spend days without seeing the same shop. At the ground floor, everything was to expensive to buy for me but very nice to see.

Shop Till U Drop!! Most Awsomme Place for one and all... I Visited Central World on lazy weekend afternoon.Its very vibrant shopping mall. One will get almost all brands here. The collection was cool and trendy.I liked few things in almost all the stores I visited.The Zen is quite favorite of mine! Its a must visit place while you are in Bangkok.

First Class cinema at Central World really is First Class. If you fancy treating yourself, pay THB700 to go to the 'First Class' cinema. Huge reclining seats and blankets are only the start. For up to an hour before the film starts you can help yourself to a free buffet in a lounge modelled on business class airport lounges. You also order free popcorn and soft drinks which will be delivered when the film starts.For the total decadent feel, we bought a bottle of wine from the reasonable list and felt rather grand sipping it while watching the film.

Middle of the range priced stores. Central World is a massive complex. I shop there for the sort of mid range goods I would buy in shops at home (Australia) such as Myer. I find mens shoes to be good value - got genuine (made in Thailand ) Hush puppies in Zen for $40 which is a good deal. Not as nice as Siam Centre but most definately cheaper. Zen often has good sales.

superb shopping. Great shopping centre and not all of it is pricey. I particularly loved ZEN department store, it's trendy, lots of Thai designers and also a great variety and choice of shoes and accessories. The quality of the goods is also very goodLovely ambiance and store design. The ladies underwear choice is amazing. They had a sale on and they give extra discounts to tourist with the central world tourist card scheme. On top of which you can claim the 7% vat back so in the end I got some super bargains. The food court is superb and the variety of eateries is bewildering.

Nice place to have your tea time and take rest. Very comfortable environment especially with air-conditioned and spacious. Once you get tired of your crazy shopping with cheap stuffs around, just get inside and take a rest in one of the restaurant. No matter you eat, it will be affordable and nicely-presented. Pick a restaurant and take a rest!**Mango Tree Bistro is a nice place to enjoy the night.

Great food & Naraya bag. Went to Central World Plaza for 2 reasons, first is Naraya Bags :) yes, a must buy in Bangkok and the outlet is very packed most of the time, comfortable shopping mall with variety range of international product if wholesale market is not your cup of tea. Second is the food, but not in the food court or any outlet in the building ( there is Ting Tai Feng in KL too, not necessary to have it in BKK) walk out to the mall, towards the Platinum Mall direction, whereby you can see many open stalls selling bbq fish and other thai food, go to the one with most local people sitting, and I guarantee it will be the best with really cheap price and tasty food ! one big BBQ fish is only THB 150 and it is really yummy, and we also had the most tasty tomyam soup there.

Roof top bar. Stay away from the shops all 7 floors of them. Head for the roof top bar in the evening no booking needed or entrance fee, first come first served.
Great night views, with subtle live music, drinks really expensive but its a good experience, plus has cool breeze which make a nice change from the sticky Bangkok heat.
Leaves Westfield for dead!. Very good shopping centre & food court to boot! You can buy anything you want including a very good movie theatre

Good Location, Nice Shopping. There is cinema at level 7, got many restaurants there such as Ding Tai Feng. Used to go there for their Naraya Bag, which is always full of people. The place is quite kinda big, got around 7 floors :)

Great. Great place to visit. the fresh food court was awesome where you could actually buy what you want and then sit and eat. It also has the Toys are Us Store which was awesome and we had a great time shopping. centrally located and a walking distance from Chitlom BTS

Favourite Bangkok Mall. I spent a lot of time at this mall on my last two trips to Bangkok. Lots of restaurants and middle of the road shopping. Very clean and well kept washrooms. Suggest you go to Dairy Queen and try their fresh Mango Blizzard. Afsolutely great!
There is a food court on Level 6 and 7 featuring mostly Japanese restaurants.

Maybe the one we liked the most. Central World includes 2 department stores, Zen with lots of nice designer stuff, and Isetan, very nice food court and also all the regular departments. The mall it self is not that overwhelming, but very nice and not as crowded as some of the other malls - eg. MBK!

Unlikely to find bargains like at MBK but another wonderful shopping mall experience!. Modern & mid range shopper experience with ZEN dept store (similar to Myer or David Jones) over multiple levels mixed in with standalone shops & great food & beverage places & restaurants. We had a wonderful lunch here of Tom Yum Seafood Soup & rice w/ sea bass, reasonably priced (approx AUD $30). Great way to spend few hours indoors during Bangkok's heat of the day! Not for the bargain shopper as most prices are fixed but great window shopping in a nice shopping centre.

favourite hangout for window-shopping,food, movies. this is my favourite hangout on Saturdays, whenever in Bangkok. Its spacious layout allows you to stroll and window-shop at the mostly high-end shops and boutiques as well as grab a bite at one of the countless eateries, just about all of them of high standard. From local fare to Chinese, Japanese, Italian, Indian to outlets like Sizzler and Pizza everything seems too be available. It is probably impossible to get bored there. At the Isetan wing there is this great bookshop KINOKUNYA, on the 7th floor there are the brilliant cinema halls, always worth a visit. Downstairs there's an ice-rink(!) with skates for rent (sessions last 1.5 hrs).Although it can get quite crowded on weekends, it never feels you'll get crushed any time soon, unlike at other malls nearby.Attached to the sky-walk the WTC can easily be reached by BTS (skytrain). Only problem I have encountered on various occasions are the taxi-drivers who are properly pulled in by the staff but then more often than not refuse to take the fare. That, however, is a common problem in Bangkok

Large and middle-of-the-line. This is a modern mall in the sense that it has a similar layout to other big shopping malls in cities like Kuala Lumpur and Singapore. It contains certain flagship stores like ZEN (a bit like Tokyu Department Store in MBK), and big global brands like Pull & Bear, Uniqlo, Fox etc. As for food, there're various well-known F&B outlets like Coffee Bean, Starbucks, Mrs Fields etc.If you're looking for a good bargain you're unlikely to find one here.

Affordable Shopping Centre. This shopping centre is very affordable unlike some of the designer one in Bangkok and doesn't have the market feel like MBK. Its wht I old term a traditional mall with all the favourites Forever 21, Marks and Spencer, Bershaka, etc.To get here get of the BTS at the Siam stop but instead of heading left towards MBK etc head along the sky bridge, it's take you straight to the mall.There lots of eating options especially on the op floor, where the cinema is. My tip would be to walk pass the restaurant and through the food hall, where you can buy fresh food and at the very back is a card based food court. You get a card then enter the food court and have around 30 vendors to choose from, you order you plate then handover our card and they enter the amount you owe on, get a drink and more food then at the end you hand your card in on the way out and pay you bill.Plus the food is fantastic and very very reasonable.

shopping center with good facilities and enjoy the restaurant for dinner there. This is one of my favorite shopping center in Bangkok, although a little bit expensive, but good quality. Some of times to Bangkok I always come to Central World Plaza to shopping here. It was comfort there for public facilities.I also always use theirs restaurant on the 3rd floor for my dinner and they have many selection of menu and we enjoyed all of our dinners. Nice restaurant and we like theirs services.Every time i go Bangkok, I always come to Central World Plaza , convenient shopping Mall , we like it, also theirs restaurant .
Good spend a day there. . This is one of my favorite places to window shop with some good deals. Mostly high end goods on sale. Lots of places to eat.

This place is huge, so pretty!. This is a seven-story shopping complex. There are a variety of restaurants and shops. Although I've never really been a fan of buying clothes from malls in Thailand (mostly because they're overpriced) I very much enjoy hanging out here just because the atmosphere is so pretty! The restaurants are alright. I find that street food tastes better than the restaurants most of the time but if you like high quality food then CentralWorld is a good place to be! I've noticed that a lot of events take place at CentralWorld. I've met and ran into quite a few Thai celebrities here and it's pretty cool! There is also an ice skating rink there too!

Another shopping center in Siam Area. Went here to check the uniqlo...price wise it is not cheaper than singapore but the vary is more than singapore. other than that....there is nothing special about this mall other than the size, i prefer siam paragon that central world because the ambience is cooler :D

Massive!. I walked to this place from my hotel and as I went in the door and looked up I caught my breath. This place is massive! If you come here, expect to take a long time walking round the shops. It is all standard mall affair but wonderful to see in all it's glory. I am afraid I did not find the stuff cheap than my hometown of Vegas so did not buy anything however if it is raining, this would be a good place to come to get away from the weather. Just don't expect to do it in half a day!
nice place. has lots of shops and resturants and cinema and in a line with siam paragon and mbk... all withing walking distance

I love this mall. If you need to get out of the heat, go to the mall. They have everything you want. It's easy to get there, and then get out if you want. You can go anywhere in Bangkok from here. There are lots of shops and things to see around this mall too. It's central location cannot be beat.If you want crafting supplies, you can go hang out and do crafting at the bookstore. You can shop, eat, find desserts, anything. I LOVE going to the international food market, just to look at the sheer variety of food they have. The movie theater is lovely. Central World also has events and festivals throughout the year. It's a good place to catch free (or cheap) concerts. They also have cute displays that are always nice to take pictures with.Because of its central location, it has become a place where political events take place as well. I've been down there on days of rallies. It might be better to stay away when that happens, but even then it's been ok. The only real problem was a few years ago when the rally got way out of control, but since then security has been very tight.

Very Good. *) Open: 10:00-22:00, Nearest BTS: Siam, Chidlom *) http://shopping.centralworld.co.th*) formerly known as World Trade Center*) next door to Siam Paragon which is just 500 metres away.*) Women: Axara, bebe, Bershka, Dorothy Perkins, Evita, Fly Now III, Guilder, January, KATE SPADE, Kyra, La Senza, Living Dolls, MANGO, Miss Selfridge, Pat Ploy, promod, Siam Sawako, Spacegal, Wallis, Yacco Maricard*) Fashion Accessories: Zsiska(Jewwllaer), STELLALUNA (Shoes), MANGO TOUCH (Accessories), Castro(Fashion apparel, shoe, handbag, accessory ), Guilder, *) The new Central World Plaza is another must visit place in Bangkok , if only for the Food Plaza on it's top level, the view of Wat Patum Wanaram from the food court's picture window is very nice.*) Their bananas in syrup for 15 baht cannot be overrated.*) Lovely ice rink on the ground floor, with expert coaches, well worth watching. *) So easy to get to on the Skytrain getting off at Siam Paragon or Chitlom and following the Skywalk pedestrian walkway. *) Once you are here, you might want to check out Red Sky, a skybar located on the 55th floor of Centara Grand hotel which is within CentralWorld itself. Great place for a drink while enjoying the breathtaking views of Bangkok.*) The variety of food they offer is the best, especially Thai ice cream. I recommend trying out Freshy Freeze ice cream on the highest floor (by the elevator near Swensens). The ice cream they sell is fantastically scrumptious! It might get a tad pricey, but definitely worth it. *) CTW is separated in to 3 zones: Isaton, Zen and CTW plaza. There are tonnes of shops and restaurants in this department stores. Moreover, there is a skytrain walking line which is linked to Paragon and Central Chidlom.*) Skytrain Siam then follow signs, 5-10 minutes walk, alternative Skytrain Ratchadamri, exit all, see 4 face Buddha on the way then cross busy intersection and you are there *) Further, from Central Plaza you have direct access to the MRT. This mall is very close (few steps) from Centara Grand hotel.For a detailed trip list feel free to visit http://bangkokandpattaya-itinerary.blogspot.in/

Even better than before. Like a Phoenix reborn from its ashes, Central World is a huge and beautiful mall close to Siam Paragon. It was partially burnt during Thailand's political riots but came back to life even better than before. If you like shopping, you will find anything you are looking for there. But it is also a great place to chill out on a hot day. There are restaurants and many cafés. Some coffee shops are even unique like: Chelsea of London, Whitard, Scone or Coffee Beans (not so common in Thailand). The front esplanade is huge. There are some sculptures there now and a nice refreshing fountain. At times, they open it for a beer festival as well.

Shop here only if you really care about brands.. If you just want to buy nice clothes, go to the Platinum mall (very close to Central World) or to the weekend market. If you want to experience the most beautiful mall in Bangkok, go to Terminal 21.

Best of all.. I had 2.5 half days for shopping in Bangkok and I did manage to see quite a few shopping malls. This one is by far the best if you want a good mix of Western and Far Eastern goodies. I ended by doing all my shopping there.

My all time favourite mall. This shopping mall is so huge with many of variety shops and restaurants as you can spend whole day inside the mall, also you can walk through to the two link shopping malls which are Zen Department Store and Isetan, the japanese style one, Anyway you can even relax from walking around by the movie theaters at 7th floor as well.

Centralworld has everything you need!. This mall offers good variety of shops and restaurants. It's worth to spend a half-day going around as you will no longer need to hop on other nearby malls to looks for something else - it got all you need! The restaurants at the top floor offers different cuisines and wide range of good value meals.

I usually hate shopping malls but...... I seriously dislike shopping malls, Give me a proper street with local shops any day, but this place....it is wow...just so big and so much going on....had a fantastic death metal band playing outside with local teenagers going wild and invading the stage..and then this huge mall, and I do mean huge....but what clinched it for me was the food, 105 restaurants and some really good ones too..sorry I'm used to McDonald's and warmed up pizza in English malls...if they had just ONE of these Thai restaurants I'd be happy...And yes, if you bring your wife/girlfriend, you will spend money.....but in my wife's defence, I had to stop myself going in to the Jim Thompson store or I would never have been able to resist...

Lovely place to shop for quality products. Central World is HUGE. If you would like to browse through every single shop, set aside an entire day for it. You will find it much easier to navigate through the mall armed with a shop directory which can be obtained from the Concierge on the ground floor. The enormous Zen Department Store is a great place to start shopping, especially if you are keen on buying some Thai Royal Porcelain bone china. Being movie fanatics, we found B2S a great place to shop for original DVDs at amazing prices. Ladies must not miss out on shopping at Naraya (albeit a little crowded) located on the ground floor.When you get hungry, do check out the restaurants on the top two floors. The tom yum ramen at a local chain restaurant with an "8" logo is unique and delicious. Fuji Restaurant is also fantastic for reasonably priced Japanese cuisine.Remember to flash the Central tourist privilege card (attached to certain Bangkok maps and can be obtained at Central's Concierge) wherever you go - we managed to save loads by utilising the card's discounts.
we find clothers for our cats and dogs only there.. You may spent all the day long here. So be carefull - it would better go to the most interesting department for you, then to restaraunts.
Average Place. I come from a place where a lot of shopping mall around. So i found this mall quite normal. The place is quite and not so crowded. There are a lot of restaurant here.
Amazing!. I have never seen so many shops in one area-a couple square miles of shopping! I am glad I did not bring my girlfriend, or we would still be there!

Central World Plaza - Quality product. I visited Central World Plaza and found quality product.Due to quality product the price is higher than MBK. If any one wants to buy quality product with minimum price go to Central World Plaza.Easy to go by Sky Train from Sukumvit Nana station and fare is 20 Bahts.
Huge. Great shopping mall and glad the place has been repaired after the fire damage a few years ago. Impressive range of shops and restaurants

oxford tailor. One of the best shopping mall I found, There is like you can find all kind of brand clothes like Armani and G200. watches and bag and especially for ladies is much better for shopping thanks you.

Second to Siam Paragon. Not the first time in bangkok but the first time in the mall. Very large mall with everything you need. Ranging from clothes to furnitures to food. Price range may be higher compare to MBK but its definitely a must visit for those who have not been there. For book lovers, Asia Book store in the mall is the right place for hours of browsing and buying.
it's huge. i think it's one of the largest mal i know. you'll get anything you want here. from food, gadget, groceries, etc

A world Class Shopping Experience. If you enjoy spending money in places such as this and expense is no object you'll love it.It is still a good place to browse for free, I just took photos then shopped at MBK nearby.

must go shopping..... this is my first time in bangkok and first i dun know where is the best to spend my time with shopping and eating and sight seeing.. i almost went to there about 5 or 6 times during 1 week trip..The main reason is i stayed near it..It is not only huge but also has a variety of brands.. and also so many resturants especially japanese and there is a lot of discount when we went there..Under mall, there is variety of photo zones.. really love them♥♥
Huge mall. I'm amazed by the size and quality of the Bangkok Malls. We spend hours just walking around. CWP has a lot of great shops but It's almost too big and confusing.

A very nice place for shopping and spend more than a day. It includes high end department stores and other shops .Right in the heart of city , BTS Siam station . You can find all kinds of food and entertains .if you are not really a fan of branded items do shopping near the Prathunam area, goods are much cheaper there

Best shopping mall in Bangkok. We spent 4 days in Bangkok and we visited all major malls for shopping experience.The best was Central World, even huge and rather hard to explore, you can spend a whole day and not yet seen all.You have to take a Tourist Card - this give you a 5% discount, but also you can find many sales.We found many nice things and for food lovers, there are a lot of choices.It'a a must for shoppers, much better than Siam or Central Chitlom, both smaller.

good place for shopping. love there to go there. good place to buy quality for a good price and to have dinner or lunch. Its a must for all Bangkok visitors. It is good located and reachable good by skytrain

biggest, baddest, best. home to the famous rock candy, havainais shop and some fancy schmancy supermarket on the 7th floor, this place is heaven for shoppers and food lovers alike. you can eat until you explode, shop until you cannot carry any more or just sit and watch the funny tourists splashing cash around. must see, must eat, must go
Package 1. Really good place to shop with variety of stores.... but lesser on eateries... but it can be covered with near by malls... which are jst walkable distance...
Nice plaza. this is another shopping centre in a shopping maze in Bangkok. Its a jungle of shopping here and this complex has anything you need in the fashion to buy and great value

Shop till you drop!. Don't miss this shopping area even if you just go to window shop.
Definitely get to the massive food court and superb supper market located on the first floor. Great place to get lunch. The prices will surprise you.

too big, too messy. Too huge and can't find what you want. map is not clearly enough for let u know which shop is where. Spent one afternoon over there and most of the time was trying to find the way to the shop shop which we want. Never again and Siam paragon is the best for us.

a mall like no other. I thought I had seen everything to see as far as malls are concerned. But Central World is something else. The sleekest, most posh mall that I've ever seen. And the prices are not bad at all. Great place to do some shopping or grab a meal.

huge mall with lots of dining options. In a city full of large and glitzy malls, Central World is one of the largest and glitziest, not to mention one of the newest. The mall is huge and has a lot of shops and restaurants. The interiors are elegant although the lay-out is a bit confusing. There is a hotel attached to the mall, the Centara Grand, so it would be a perfect combination to stay here if you are in Bangkok for some shopping.

Central World. One of the few good places where you can shop and dine at Bangkok There's a lot of boutiques to choose from and near the station The atmosphere is very friendly and relaxed esp. If you just want to stroll or even do some window shopping Outside the mall you can also find street vendors that's selling food and clothes as well Been here August 2009
Huge and modern. Great for shopping or just having a look at the shopping available in Bangkok. Modern , sleek and clean. Wear walking shoes.

wet day?. Spend the day here you will not get bored even if you don't buy anything so much to see plenty of places and choices of food easy access to Sky Rail this is one huge shopping center, if you want to shop you can easy empty the bank account here

Mid Tier Range Shopping Centre. Many affordable brands are located at here. As you may find limited places in Bangkok to buy toys for children. There is a Toys' Rus here. A huge supermarket to stock some snacks or drink to bring back hotel. A Passion Vintage store that sells vintage UK furnitures. Not very crowed. A good mix of restaurants available. In between Siam and Chid Lom bts station.

Massive, Modern, Everything You will Need. Great shopping center right in the middle of the best upmarket and cheap shopping in Bangkok. They have Zara, Gap, TopShop, a Department Store, and many other European mid priced stores. Walking in here made me feel less home sick ;)

A must visit!. Good shopping. Karmakamet has a shop here selling aromatherapy stuff. There is also a Harnn shop and a Thann somewhere in the building too. There are street peddlers outside selling cheap wares and good street food. Many local restaurants nearby too.

Came here for Naraya only. I came here for Naraya in yr 2009. The shopping mall was completely empty on the higher level.This year i came here again for Naraya. It has changed tremendously.
