Branded boutique, department store, eatery. Just window shopping around the mall. Nothing much to buy. What you see there i believe your country has too. So don't waste money unless is dirt cheap. Haahaa. Ok, i bought a lot of pouches from Naraya bcos there is no outlet in Singapore and reasonable price.The boutique is forever over crowded with tourists so be patient at the cashiering Q.
Huge. They have all kind of brands here, I get lost sometimes in Central World. Good place to hang out and shopping
This mall is HUGE!. Central World Plaza is so huge and it's really clean. There's a lot of eateries, high-end brands, just about everything!

The Best!. Central World Plaza was the best shopping mall for me in Bangkok, because it had it all. Unlike the Siam Paragon, which is all too luxurious or the MBK which is all too cheap, at CWP, you get the best brands, the center of the road ones, and even the slightly lower end brands.The food court is huge, spread over two floors satisfying all tastes and moods.It is connected to the SkyWalk as well.
Zara & Top Shop. When you go here this will be a major attraction. I spent atleast 3 hours at there 2 shops only...WOW i'm not a shopper but this is great.
Shopping at ease. Central Shopping, I would consider as one f the best food courts in Bangkok, the supermarket is excellent, like most in Bangkok the prices are excellent.

huge, multi storied mall. It's in area filled with upscale malls of which it is the largest. Part of it was destroyed by fire a couple of years ago during the riots but now it's up and running and back to normal. Plenty of places to shop with restaurants, food courts and cinemas. Sometimes the bigger flagship stores have sales. Sometimes it's hard to find Western sizes.
Nice shoestores. We always go here to buy shoes. It is not so many people here and the service is good. There is also many nice places to have a coofee.

More of the same. Nice mall, many shops including Topshop, Forever21, Zara +lots of other international brands. However, sales were not impressive, and no unique concept like Terminal 21 to lure you to stay. It is in close proximity to Platinum, so you may want to poke your head in on the way..

Best shopping center in BKK. It doesn't have a theme. It isn't super luxurious. But for me, it's the best. It carries products I need. It isn't crowded. Good movie theater. Good restaurants. Good food court on the top floor at the back of the market. Good food market. Everything about this place is good. Much more practical than Paragon, and much nicer than everywhere else.

Central World. Many shopping malls in Bangkok are becoming more like ours at home and therefore less attractive. Central World is in this category. I think tourists like street stalls and smaller malls that still offer wonderful Thai goods at Thai prices.

shop 'til you drop - no thanks.. Sure, this place is heaven for the ladies. Shopping paradise, but for the average guy, I think 1 hour is enough to experience the world of Bangkok supermall shopping.Of course, it is an amazing place and the foodcourt is gigantic. However after 1 hour, I was ready to get out of here and go for a massage.There are only so many clothes and shoe shops you can look at in one lifetime.

Excellent restaurants. Levels 6 and 7 of the Central World mall have a wide variety of high quality restaurants at reasonable prices. This is not a food court like you find in Europe, USA or Japan but a large collection of good places to eat covering a range of European and Thai cuisines. (There are also a few fast food outlets). There is direct covered access to the mall from the Sky Train, or 5 minutes walk from Siam station. It is built under the Centara Grand hotel, which is excellent.

it's a maze. this mall is huge it has everything , great stores my favorite is pink pvssy it sells such cool fashion accessories, bags, jewelry and the displays are amazingSFREE is a ice cream dessert place all sugar free and so good

Much like the malls in USA. This is very clean and has quite a bit to offer but seemed much like the malls in the US. There are plenty of stores and restaurants and there is a movie theater on the top floor.

HUGE Spacious Mall with Everything. This was the mall damaged during the unrest and rebuilt - and what is great job they've done! Love the wide mall aisles, food selection and lots of shops from high end boutiques to everyday brands. Stop by the shrine outside the mall near Isetan Dept store and also contrast the mall before/after rebuilding.
HUGE. One word, it's huge! There are many stores and if you like branded and aircond shopping, this place would be a good choice.

Best Mall Ever. It was such a surprise to find this amazing mall in the middle of Bangkok. I loved how each floor highlighted a specific item and the floors are decorated beautifully. Along with names you'd recognize anywhere there were also many unique stores and boutiques. It was a fun place to shop for souvenirs as the merchandise was different from the same old things that were being sold on the streets and everywhere. And don't leave without a visit to the food court!

Amazing!!!... My favourite Mall in Bangkok. When traveling to Bangkok always choose the hotels next to the big Malls, the Arnoma Hotel, just opposite this Mall or the Centara at Central World, just the same building this Mall.Being one of the biggest Malls in Asia, plenty of top brandedand trendy shops, we still can shop there good value for money.My favourite mall in Bangkok, lots of high level choice within a huge but still charming space, once there you won't go out easily... despite all the other malls en suite -- from the CWPlazawe can almost stroll inside, from mall to mall, up to the Siam Paragon and finally the MBK.

Good food supermarket and great shops.. The top floor has a good food court and cinema complex as well as a food super market.There are plenty of other places to eat on lower floors as well as the usual high end shops Thais love.
Naraya. Bags shopping for the ladies. It is a must stop when you travel to Bangkok. This is their signature ribbon bags.
remember to go BOOTS. never forget the naraya shop! and of course cheap lotions and body products at Boots! really good stuff at cheap price!

Shopping and eating!. A really good place to shop or window shop in air conditioned comfort.My family and I went to the cinemas and they were fantastic - comfy seats and different flavoured popcorn to choose from.Dining options were really plentiful and there really is something for everyone here. Just to wander around aimlessly was interesting enough.

Great place to shop. It was huge! It was worth going in there but its too big to finish walking in one day. There are various brand for every outlets in there, mostly it is branded items but I don't recommend you buy branded items in Thailand. Maybe you can stop by at Naraya in there because it's cheap and nice as well.

great shopping. We were going to Platinum mall via the skytrain and since there is not skytrain directly connecting to Platinum we had to pass by Central World. Very impressive. Great shopping and lots of food also.

Air con respite!. Typical mall with all the high end shops - went specifically to Marks and Spencer - came out empty handed - what are they thinking with their prices?!! Nice and spacious in the walkways and cool respite from the searing heat outside.

Biggest shopping center in Bangkok. It was great to see this big shopping center, after off train you can see this big shopping center with all the kinds of clothing brands, bags, shoes and different kinds. This is really center of all shoppings, hotels, restaurants and other tourist destination in bangkok. That's why when you came here mostly tourists...
A very nice shopping destinations.. Beautiful interiors, top of the class range, little may fit your budget. Look out for value buy during promotions.

Great Place for Brands - too big for one visit!. Central World Plaza sits perfectly in the middle of the shopping mall spectrum. In between the mayhem that is MBK Centre and the uber cool and pricey Siam Paragon/Siam Discovery. I was looking for some sports/oudoor footwear, the choice in the Sports Super Store was incredible. Be warned you can get seriously lost in this plaza. Great restaurants on level 7 too! Shop here for great range of choice of genuine brand items. Teenage girls just loved it! On of the best places to shop in Bangkok.

Just another massive shopping complex. Trendy, modern and full of fashion boutiques so you could be forgiven for thinking you landed in Singapore rather than Bangkok. Didn't appeal to me but the food court and restaurants are worth a trip for the cheap, clean food options.

A refreshing shopping experience. A must. Local & international brands, very user friendly. Refreshing and a mix of high end and high average brands. Elegant and many bargains to catch. Has good food options, on their fifth floor with international as well as Thai live cooking outlets. Very reasonably priced.

Awesome!. What a shopping/dining experience with so much choice it was hard to Know where to go.Furniture, clothing, accessories, electricals, snacks, drinks, a la carte dining..............Beautifully designed on many floors, with plentiful lifts and escalators. Air-conditioning was very welcome.

Fav Shopping. Shop and shop till you drop!! Huge mall with plenty of choices. Name it and the brands are there. My favourite has been Uniqlo, Forever XXI, Zara but there are more and more. Great ambience and one could literally spend the whole day. The food court on the top floor tucked away behind the Baker's Den is fantastic. A wide array of food counters and really really cheap!!!

massive mall with great selection of stores!. probably one of the better malls in Bangkok. this mall has a lot of great stores that vary in pricing. i wasn't even able to see the whole mall in 1 visit. we stopped by around New Years Eve which made the area crowded. the beer gardens outside the mall were great though for a drink. this mall also boasts lots and lots of restaurants, so it's definitely a 1 stop sorta venue. they also have a Top Shop which is great even though the store gets quite crowded. connected to the BTS makes this mall easily accessible.
Has everything!. This place is enormous!!! But it has everything if you have the energy to walk though the maze. I love shopping here :)
Big shopping area with lots of food. This is the 3rd largest shopping mall in Bangkok. Therefore, you can expect to buy most things from here. There are a lot of restaurants for you to choose from.
big and plenty of choice. Fantastic shopping centre,so many shops to choose from,food entertainment,it has the lot please take a look at this centre,
has one of the best food areas. its a very very large mall. and floor 5 and 6 has a large variety of restaurants with one of the best Japanese restaurant selections.

Shoppers Choice. Its a beautiful mall which has most of the brands and can give value for money
However perfumes are more expensive in bkk now compared to INDIA- which is quite strange

Cheap Buffet on Level 6. There is a relatively cheap buffet located on level 6. It's a stone throw away from Cocoa steamboat. Btw Cocoa sucks. Poor service n food is expensive n nt nice. Really regret going there. But the following day we went to a Japanese steamboat buffet restaurant. Per pax 349B. The only downside is, they limit u to inky 1hr 15mins of dining time. But 1 hr is enuff to fill u up. They provide drinks n ice cream too n not forgetting the fresh spread of sushi! Yum yum!!

shopping shopping. save ur money or ur visa and enjoy shooping @ Central. u can buy different brands of bags and use the offers to have discount plus do VAT procedures before u leave the mall. so u win in all cases .
Girl Heaven. Every brand, awesome sales, great cafe's .... A Bangkok MUST !Can be difficult to find your way around in some areas so use the provided maps and signs were provided

Great Food court. Most shopping malls are just shopping malls but what sets Central World out from the rest is the superb range of food and restaurants available.Go into the supermarket on the top floor and you will see inside there is a great super cheap high quality food court.If you want to spend a bit more it is hard to find a bad meal in this place.
abuzz. thousands of locals shop here so just follow the crowds. you can just about buy anything here. Plenty of food stalls and restaurants to choose from

Supermall!. This is a huge mall. ( think its bigger than Siam Paragon). you can walk over the skybridges from Siam or Central Chidlom stations.You cant possibly cover all the floors! ( dont know how many there are!)But it would be pleasant to spend your day here. There are two anchor tenants.. Zen & Isetan dept store. Zen has out-of-the ordinary merchandise (dont forget to check out the food loft on the top floors!) while Isetan needs a revamp!There are hundreds of outlets all along the floors. Go for the special sales that are usually held at the various atriums if you dont have the time.And yes!! bring your credit cards!!
Worth to visit.. Big and alot of shops where you can spend the whole day there. if you are a buddhist, there are two buddhas outside the shopping centre..
The Centre Of The World. Great shopping area, u can get anything from low to high end. U can eat anything u like, but i personally love the Japanese restaurants there.

Amazing sound system, 3 D. Having stayed at the Holiday Inn in Ploenchit, Central World was an every day vist for us. We went to see ' the Hobbit' at the SF Cinema theater. Its located on the 7th floor and buying the tickets was easy and very effcient. 4 tickets cost us 1200 Bahts. However, the popcorn was very bland and I could only find 'traces' of the butter in the so called Butter Popcorn. The theater was clean, the seats comfy and the sound system was amazing. We saw the movie in 3 D and I have to admit it was really amazing. So life like !
Food. Good for restaurants, you'll find something for everyone and fairly reasonable prices for those who don't want to slum it with the street food.

Main celebration point. this is the main celebration point for x'mas and new year. I made a tour to cover both x'mas and new year in Bangkok. In the X'mas day the central world is highly decorated with a big X'mas tree and wonderful water fountain. also many activities for children available over there. These decorations are continued still 31st night.

It's a mall. If you want to go to a western-style shopping mall while you are in Bangkok, this is the place to go. The first thing I saw when I walked in was a shop selling Wrangler jeans. Perhaps not the best use of time for visitors to Bangkok.

You could spend hours here. This is a huge mall with big brands, small independent retailers and lots of eateries. We spent almost a day here. The Zen department store was having a sale, and we ended up buying way too much ;-) Zen has a fantastic homeware department, so if you are looking for nice but inexpensive tableware, kitchenware, home diffusers, gifts, etc, this is the place to go. There's no need to jostle in the markets. There's direct access along the skywalk to Central from the BTS station, so it's very easy to get in and out of, even if you are carrying bagloads of shopping.
Beautiful shops with ok prices.. Beautiful shops with ok prices. Lost of choice in restaurants and coffee bars. Nice mall near pratunam market.
only for shopping. Its a larg shopping mall with many small and big brands should go.the cinema is well organized.there are many resturants there.

It great but there are many more to choose from. It great and higher quality, MBK is good for bargins. Check out the internet for Bangkoks top 5 Malls, they are all slightly different depending on your budget. Bangkok's getting so much like Singapore and Hong Kong !

Up market but some shops reasonable. Huge centre, some reasonable priced shops, very clean. Some shops that we do not have in Perth. Can be a not confusing suggest you get a map which is available at the concierge desk
Good shopping. Has a lot of overseas brands in the all (Top shop, next, clarks) so good if you wish to buy the 'must need' items from the UK!

Not really impressed. We found this Mall OK, but not impressive. Enjoyed lunch at a Hainanese Chicken place on the 6th floor, but did not enjoy the service at the Marks and Spencer franchise, which was the worst ever plus their prices higher than M&S at Central Department Store.
Got it all. Din Tai Fung and Movies are terrific. The whole Shopping Center is clean, easy to get around and has it all!

Many choice of international restaurant. If you want try many choice of food from all the world this is the good place to go . Buffet bei sukishi was ver good and value for money , many Japanese restaurant inside
expensive. when you can shop in the little shops right outside on the streets and buy the same stuff for 75% less this is a miss...

Just love it !. With 2 big department stores, Zen and Isetan. Centrally located and easily access by BTS, just opposite to the Big-C Rajdamri.
Really can spend a day in the plaza. We enjoyed our shopping and dining experience.

Very big mall. This is one HUGE mall. There are many information counters within the mall which confuses us. As we wanted to rent a stroller for a 4 year old, we walked at least 3 information counters before we found the right one, but it's all rented out. Very crowded with a lot of tourist. Free Wifi was also fully given out by the time we got there at about 12nn. A mixture of shops from higher end to small shops. But I didnt managed to buy anything from there. Wanted to try the pedicure as it looked quite similar to most Singapore nail parlor but decided to just chill out at Starbucks instead. Good for people who are looking for their usual brands of Kielh's, Mac, Agnes B, etc. Very convenient as well since it's just walking distance from the train station
Great place to shop. One of the best shopping centres in Bangkok. Heaps of stores to suit everyone's taste. Plan on spending quite a bit of time there as it is very big. A must if you visit Bangkok.
Good mall. This was a nice mall that had high end brands as well as items for the lower spender. Situated in an easy to get to area by either tuk tuk, taxi or train.

Naraya. Go to the big Naraya store, its excellent... and if you don't like quilted boxes and bags; then theres everything from coffee shops, restaurants, a beer garden and tons of shops and department stores to keep you busy; Worth walking through but it doesn't feel like a local Bangkok streetside experience.
awesome mall!. a very big mall! i like this mall so much! especially before you get inside the mall. you can take a lot of pictures., inside the mall, you can see a lot of expensive known brands..
Lots of stuff. Same as any Mall type store around the world. Prices high. Food court area is nice. Easy to get to and find
most stores are on sale!. It's accessible by train. There are alot of shopping stores inside like forever 21, dorothy perkins, etc. Paragon Mall is also near this mall.

Shops, shops and more shops!. Great location for shopping, on 7 different floors. My favourite is Zen, food court, inside Zen department store. Great food, totally fantastic! There is something for everyone to eat there.
Ice skating rink can be found on the lower floor, small but ok, large 14 screen cinema on the top floor, next to Tops supermarket

Shopaholics' paradise. There is every up-market retail outlet one could imagine, as well as a multiplex cinema, and two floors of food outlets. It is also next door to the equally enormous Paragon Mall and the Siam Square Skytrain station. On New Year's Eve, it will be one of the best places to see in the New Year.

7 levels of shopping, discount and voucher scheme. Fantastic shopping, home, auto, clothing, shoes, jewelry, crafts, souveniers, and more. Prices from very high end to mid range. This is not a cheap store, so watch out. They have a somewhat confusing discount and voucher scheme.Each department has it's own cashier. Depending on the total purchase, you get little stickers, and perhaps a voucher. This makes you shop even more. So tricky! Get 1-5 stickers and your next set of purchases is 20% off. You need 6 stickers to get 30% off. Overall a very expensive shopping experience.When you get tired, go to Level 7 to the food court. Get a plastic card, go to whatever counter you want, order, they scan your card and you pay at the end.Before you leave Level 7, go to the VAT counter to get your receipts stamped so you can get the VAT refund at the airport. Be alert! The Tax stamp office is just inside the airport, and you need 1 more stamp before you go through immigration to the actual VAT refund counter on the other side.

Well planned. As my title suggest well planned mall...good brand names...eateries. The double volumn ceiling gives shopper a sense of space and luxury. Not the typical mall where owners wants to just cramp retail space at every corner.

Nothing Special. Just a regular shopping mall with the same shops and prices as back in Europe - nothing special at all. I visited the platinum mall and loved this mall where you could find inexpensive clothing with a mix of local Thai designed clothes at wholesale prices. Definitely worth a trip.

love to shop here. Vast variety of stores , good dept store and great food hall. Lots of deals to be had during Xmas and NY time. Lovely band and bar with food stalls set up in the evening outside it . Highly recommended for cheap good food.

Usual shopping fayre. What can you say, it's a massive shopping mall with all the usual high end stores on a couple of levels. On the top level are a load of restaurants and cafes. The mall is linked by the raised walkways to other malls, hotels and the skytrain.

giant super-mall, good collection of restaurants. it's another HUGE mall with all of the bells and whistles.this one is easy to get access to right off of the skytrain walkway.recommended if you are looking for something more upscale than MBK.great collection of international restaurants in one area for lunch or dinner on the 7th floor!

Good place to shop and eat.. Not as glamorous and does not have the high end boutique stores like Siam Paragon, but still a very nice and modern shopping center that contains heaps of restaurants and shops.

A typical shopping mall. We were dropped off here, following our 3 hour drive from the port where our ship had docked. Felt like the place was a typical shopping mall in Asia, quite expensive with no soul or atmosphere.Food court and bars and restuarants on 7th floor, where a restaurant worker finally took pity on us, before our return to the ship, and let us sit down to have a couple of beers, as it appeared to be impossible to find a bar to do so in central Bangkok.Would not feel the need for a return visit, although was surprised to see Marks and Spencer here....
a nice shopping centre. A big shopping centre connected to the BTS. One can spend the whole afternoon (or even whole day) to shop there.
Lovely atmosphere for peaceful shopping. Lovely mall which has great ambiance. Great to visit it just before X'mas as it was decorated beautifully. Peaceful place to shop & some good bargains.
The Best!!. I've been to many shopping complex throughout the world, but I had to say that this is the best!! i could spend hours here just wandering around doing nothing.

My favorite in Bangkok. Bangkok is now becoming very crowded with malls, however if you have a few days only, this mall offers a lot, with almost 7 stories of shopping levels almost everything is found here.

A nice place for shopping!. Nice shopping place, we were there mainly for Naraya products. The food hall upstairs has good food and great thai iced tea! We went back a few times to shop and eat there and thereafter, cross the bridge over to the Big C supermart to get some snacks to bring back home.

Great outdoor space. There is spacious outdoor pavement at the Central World making it very nice atmosphere to sit around and enjoy the most fashionable district of Bangkok. Concerts and football viewing parties are held at night where beers are sold.

Poor service at Laem cha-Roen Seafood Restaurant. Arrived at 9.15 pm..... Sat down and as we began to order we were told we close at 9.30..... We ordered, clearly they were in a rush to take the order and go as they got the drinks and sides wrong..... What we did eat was good but they gave us the bill as our food arrived.. Once we had paid that was the last we saw of the staff... We dId eventually manage to attract their attention to take the food away.... Would not return here...
Swanky. A great food court!. Conveniently located near the big hotels- had some good shopping and dining options. Loved that you could walk in from the skywalk or reach it easily by train.
Huge !!. This place is gigantic. So easy to get lost in this mall. The prices are not too expensive if we want to shopping but some luxury brands are. Nice place

BRAND NAMES. Missing your favourite brand of clothing, perfume etc. you'll most likely be able to find it in this massively big Mall. Also a great place to cool down on a hot and humid day in Bangkok!
Great shopping facilities.. Lots of food, and great shopping atmosphere. Prayer room for muslims is available. So don't worry. Just ask the information counter.
prices little cheaper than Siam Paragon. Not all stuffs are cheaper, but there are things like shirts I found it cheaper and they are good quality shirts.

Good Place to Shop. Great food hall, do not miss it, great for a speedy lunch or snack. The shops are not as good as MBK shopping center, that really is the place to shop in Bangkok, they have it all at good prices. But we felt we had to support the shops after the rebuilding from the riots, so had a couple of hours.

Cool place in Spicy Hot Bangkok :). A relatively swanky newly refurbished shopping mall. It was razed by the riots years ago...but that's history. This pick up and move on speaks volume of Thais resilience and fortitude. Really clean and modern mall to shop and have a chill out break...many middle to higher end branded shops available for your shopping delights..and as usual wide dining option to settle all your whims...all in cool comfort.I have 1 point to bring up though...just in case anyone dine at this Thai restaurant called Kumpoon, offering plenty of authentic Thai main thoroughfare and desserts. You can request for free WiFi password upon placing your orders, but the second you settled your bill. You will be cut off immediately! So, surf till you had enough , then ask for the bill. That too, our bill for our desserts/water was 189bht. Our change for our 1000bht note came back with 800bht...seemed the waiter automatically rewarded themselves with 11bht ! it's a tiny issue...but it does not feel right though.. So you been cautioned.
Shopping. They have different brands here. Quite a vast selection if you love branded goods. It's a rather good place to come if you enjoy all sorts of things from food to fashion
shopping mall. Large shopping complex close to pratunam hotels, great variety of stores and nice food court, great candy kitchen , first in asia where you can see candy being made

Great Place to Visit. If you are thinking of visiting Thailand for just its temples, you would miss out the modern Thailand. It has more than 100 restaurants, hundreds of shops, and 2 anchor department store Isetan and Zen. But don't fell intimidate, the space is comfortable to wander around. Bangkok's shopping street starts from BTS national stadium station -> Siam station -> Chitlom station. Central World is between Siam and Chitlom station, just across the famous four faced buddha. Personally love to bring friends from oversea here, because it has everything, plus a first class movie theater with flat reclining chairs and butler service.

The biggest Mall. It is the biggest mall. We stayed just across the street from the Central world, but if you are in Bangkok the place to shop is the streets and the underground markets. Nice to visit the mall but not for shopping.
Good shopping. Central World Plaza is a great place for shopping and dining. You can get almost everything if you don't mind the big crowds :D

wow if you not been to central world you have not lived. it was my new husbads first time there i have been before and if any of you out there are thinking of going to Bangkok then you must get tuk tuk to central world wow wow

Looking for variety... of food !. Tons of restaurants within this mall. Just go and look at the menus : italian, japanese, chinese, fast-food.... The only bad thing is you will take too much time to make up your mind and decide where you wanna have your lunch.

Almost everything under one roof!. The Central World shopping complex is within a few minutes walking distance from the Siam Kempinski Hotel where we were staying. We had a value-for-money breakfast at the Central World Hotel’s Zing outlet which is on the ground floor, to the left of the Central World building. The set breakfast which seemed popular and which we ate was 199 Baht for two mini-pastries, butter and jam, cut fruits, an orange drink, and coffee per person.The Central World building was decked for the Christmas season, and in the Atrium, stands a Christmas tree that is several stories high! We spent a couple of hours going through the shops selling mostly branded imported products and what caught our interest was the Central Food Hall. Such a lot to see and browse through at this location. Lunch was at Kum Poon restaurant diagonally opposite the Food Hall and the Thai food there is truly authentic and spicy! We noticed that many locals were eating at this outlet. Prices were reasonable and won’t break your pocket!If you feel too tired out to walk back to the Kempinski, a short Tut-tut ride to the hotel will cost you about 80 Baht. In fact if you bargained hard enough it can cost less. The tut-tuts are available outside the Central World building along the road.

No character. No character of anything particularly unusual or unique or interesting, just loads and loads of shops, mostly the same shops you will find anywhere in the world with the same prices or even higher.

Water fountain. Huge mall in a central location. Shopping-wise, nothing great or special. Ladies flocked to the Naraya store on the ground floor. The mall houses a few good restaurants and other F&B outlets. Our favourites are Nara Restaurant and Freshly Freeze Ice-Cream.Visit at night and make your way to the water fountain outside the mall. The lights and water fountain display is beautiful at night.

Great mall. Where everything you'll need may be found here. I always frequent this mall whenever I go to BKK. I remember it got burned before but they have fixed it quite well. It is spacious, many stores for shopping and a good food court to eat at the top floor. There are many restaurants to choose from. Excellent airconditioning making it very comfortable to the shoppers. Also, they would usually have events right outside the store and you can just sit and watch and get entertained.

wow. We caught the sky train here and only had about 2 hours before closing the station is right outside and easy to get to.Inside is huge.We didnt get around the hole place or even a third i think.Glad we visited and would go back but wouldnt be disappointed if we didnt as is is just a shopping centre but bigger than i have ever seen.good to just watch everyone go about their business.

The food court in the top floor is good. Worth to try the food in the food court. Nice decoration, like a restaurant more than a food court. The shrimp spring rolls and tom yum kung are must try food. Much better than some famous restaurants. Also the price is not food court price, more expensive than other food.courts.

High end shopping.. This shopping complex has it all. But make sure you bring your money. Most shops cater for designer brands. It did have some good food places. And we ate at an Italian restaurant on one of the upper floors.Worth a look.
excellent mall. quite a big mall .. many good shops.. also there are too many food outlets out here which are very good.

Just another mall in Bangkok, nothing special. Liked: It is adjoined to the BTS station. Offers money exchange service at better rate than hotels or credit card.
Disliked: Pricing of goods. Everything is overpriced.

Bangkok's biggest chopping mall. Bangkok's biggest and most popular shopping mall has everything you can think of!
You can go shopping, to dining, visit a spa, watch a movie, grocery shop or even hit the gym; and it's all at one place!
Take your Platinum card. So expensive, like every Central. Ironically, Platinum shopping centre is nearby, if you want clothes. Hundreds of well priced shops there.

Many choices. All kinds of goods and foods are available here with a huge price range. From luxurious boutique to cart seller. It has many new arrival product and also on huge discounts for clearance. More than two levels of food selections from all kinds of restaurants and desserts booth. Also connected to BTS bridge (Siam-Chit Lom).

Tons of Choices. I'm quite a regular visitor to Central World Plaza. I love all the restaurants on the top floor.It has a clever selection of places to dine especially if you're looking for Japanese and they have one of the best Chinese from Shanghai but it takes ages to serve you coz they are prepared by master chef from China and you can see them cooking with transparent kitchen. Beside that they have huge movie cinemas but you have to pay pretty much for it.

Visit for an afternoon tea and something interesting. Visit central world if you are looking for clothes from unique designers. There's an area call Zen which holds shops with clothings from their local designer and don't forget to visit Twining for a delicious afternoon tea:)

Nice break from the markets. One of the biggest malls in Asia is worth a visit and change from the hot, mostly rainy open markets you tend to visit in Bangkok! You also have everything under 1 roof and some pleasant affordable surprises can ne found here too!
You can live here!. a great mall that has everything you need, banks, supermkt, restaurants, shops, coffee shops, and the connecting hotels. i would like to live here!

As good as any major malls in USA. This Plaza is big and centraly located in Bangkok. This plaza houses all major brand stores. If you are interested in buying souvenir this is not the place. I have visited this plaza several times but cannot remember seeing any stores with local sounir products. There are several major chain restaurants hee both local dishes and international. The supermaket on the fourth floor is above average. The entire plaza is air conditioning.
The greates Shopping Mall. I have ever seen. Wow. Everthing is here.Great shopping for cloth and technic. A grand food section and it was not busy at all.
Nice regular mall. Nothing super exciting but large with plenty of food and shopping options. Good way to spend some extra time or if weather is poor.
Great Mall. This mall offers a lot of things. I can spend a day just roaming around because it's so big. It's really nice & clean. Love it!

find discount on 1st floor. there is a small outlets on the 1st floor, which gether some brand discount, like Juicy Couture. Also the famous bangkok brand of bag, NARAYA is also located in first floor, B area. You can spend half day to go shopping here. The Big C supermarket is on the opposite of this mall. Do not forget to request for the voucher of 7% tax refound once your purchase amount above THB3000
Food. Too many Japanese restaurant and the price is not cheap.You can find this kind of shopping complex anywhere in Bangkok.Nothing special except it is very near to the Shrine.
Huge mall. Love the christmas atmosphere, a nice place for shopping , resting & have many restaurants - variety choices of food to choose :-)

Great place to shop. THis shopping plaza had it all! There were so many restaurants to choose from, so many shops to choose from! Could have spent more time there. We went twice it was so good and i wished I'd have gone a third time!

Love the place!!!. This is a great mall, and I loved shopping there! Here are some places that deserve your attention:- Zen Restaurant on the 3rd floor, they have a fantastic list of set menus, especially for lunch. It is not too expensive, but the everything is fresh. Their salmon sashimi melted in my mouth, and the grilled snow fish set was out of this world. YUMMY!- Prann on the third floor, this is a natural line for Thai products, they have a website. I really liked it for myself and for presents to others. Thann on the second floor is very similar, although they have more variety. Very recommended!- I enjoyed shopping some stationary at B2S, I think on the second floor. You can also send some Postcards from the Post-office inside B2S, on the same floor. Convenient!- A nice cup of tea can be enjoyed at Secret Garden, on the sixth floor. It is a very nice little café with a choice of cakes, the pan-cake type being their signature one. I tried the Earl Grey cake, and it was very nice!- And of course everybody can find exactly what they want, since the mall is very big and the selection of virtually everything is great.Have a great time!

huge mall. its a big shopping mall, but its kind of hard to navigate. its set up wierd, but there's plenty of western shops and cool events going on. Im not much for malls, myself, but there are pretty decor, and it feels fancy.
Big shopping mal. Very good restaurants.Outside they had a large christmas tree.Brings a lot atmosphere.A lot of nice shops to

Spanking New Mall !. The new Central World Plaza is another must visit place in Bangkok , if only for the Food Plaza on it's top level, the view of Wat Patum Wanaram from the food court's picture window is very nice. While the mall now geared towards high end shopping , the food at the food court is good and reasonably priced, the bar code paying system is great and convenient , just make sure you know exactly how much you consumed so you won't be short of cash when you are about to leave the area and pay for your bill. The restaurants on the top level looks very chic , pricey I'm sure, but hey you live only once, why not splurge from time to time ? At night, when you want acouple of drinks and are too tired to hit Silom , then the mobile bars outside of the Plaza is there to serve you , with music to boot ! Open air , a beer in hand and people watching ? That is the new Central World plaza gig .

movie time. In addition to being a foodie, culture/history lover, shopper, avid music listener, I also enjoy experiencing the local movie/cinema scene. Process is easy -- similar to booking a plane ticket online: find the movie/time you want to see, select a specific seat, purchase, and get your ticket!
basic tickets are comparable to matinee pricing in the USA.

Everything in one place!. A bit westernised for my tastes, but the thai elements are superb. There is a great open style restaurant with multiple vendors that is just epic, their bananas in syrup for 15 baht cannot be overrated.Lovely ice rink on the ground floor, with expert coaches, well worth watching. Shops are okay, good sports stuff but as I said a bit westernised for me. Rebuilt very quickly after the fire!

Another day shopping.. So easy to get to on the Skytrain getting off at Siam Paragon or Chitlom and following the Skywalk pedestrian walkway. A huge shopping mall on several floors with two flag ship stores Zen one side and Isitan the other. Both very quirky, modern and different. In-between you have everything else from famous western stores to local Thai handicrafts. If you enjoy shopping you will enjoy Central World.

Huge mall but sterile experience. This is the largest mall in Bangkok and it has a good selection of shops ranging from international chains to local specialty stores. Place is comfortable and it is a wonderful place to sit and relax from the madness outside. Prices here are expensive compared to the other malls like MBK or Terminal 21 but what you get in return is a nice, comfortable place to shop.Worth a visit to get a respite from the heat outside. Accessible via the Chitlom BTS station.Once you are here, you might want to check out Red Sky, a skybar located on the 55th floor of Centara Grand hotel which is within CentralWorld itself. Great place for a drink while enjoying the breathtaking views of Bangkok.

Good selection of shops and easier to navigate than some shopping areas - reasonable prices. This shopping area is better than the ones where you cannot move due to crowding. This is a mid range priced place for the most part but certainly not the bargains you get at the markets. If you prefer your shopping in a clean nice environment then this is a good choice. The worst part is that you have to walk a ways from the nearest Skytrain stop.
huge mall. Great mall with international and local brands in it. Easy to access by BTS. And I recommend you to take BTS from there since it will be very hard to take taxi from there.

Could be a mall anywhere. It is a large mall, that is well laid out, but you could really be anywhere in the world. The mall has the same big retail shops as everywhere else and the prices are higher than in Singapore. It is centrally located and has a few good options for food, but definitely nothing unique that would draw me back.
Modern and relaxing. A wide choice of modern design goods in Thailand. Try a cup of coffee when you are tired would be quite nice.

Nice place. upscale and air conditioned.. But most of the things you find here are cheaper to buy on the street from the street vendors. Central World Plaza is fun to walk around in and great places to eat but buying is expensive.

Another Huge Shopping Mall. Nothing special, but it is a nice clean place to walk around if you're looking for a break from the heat and craziness outside. Definitely not an authentic Bangkok experience. Once you're inside, you could be in any other city in the world. Unlike MBK, the food court doesn't have a lot of (any?) uniquely Thai options.
nice shopping mall. Food court is wonder full.many restorants are in that s hiopping mall.many shops ..whatever you want you can find with good quality.I like also supermarket.
conventional high-end mall, well executed. This mall is visually arresting and the range of shops is comprehensive. Elegant Twinings tea lounge on the ground floor. Easily reached by skytrain.

Having heard so much, I expected more. This place is good, but I preferred Terminal 21 at Asok. I had heard a lot about Central World and that it was the biggest mall in Thailand. It looks impressive from the outside but on the inside it doesn't seem that big compared to the others.

too much to choose. Lots and lots of restaurants/eateries, some good book stores, a big crafting department at the B2S, fashions (mainly hi-end), there used to be a cafe with lots of Sylvanian Family displays, I don't know if it's still there

Not the best in town. Thai people are saying the place is cursed... It might be tryue. Great location but not the best in town. Getting better but long way to go to compare to others... Good food court....;

Great for Nightlife.. The mall is okay -- the usual signature stores were found inside. What I like though are the mini concerts outside the mall. When we visited the place a week ago, there were like 3 bands playing all together. The place is huge so it's ok to have 2 or 3 bands playing all at the same time.
Huge shoppingcomplex. I like this mall, especially the ZEN departementstore. In this mall you find it all, not for the real bargainshopper

The place to shop!. It's not so expensive as Siam Paragon and it's not low quality/fake as MBK. It's also huge... you have all the brands you know and some you don't. Prepare to walk and shop till you drop :-)

Just a run-of-the-mill mall. This former World Trade Center (Yep, they renamed it!) is just another mall, geared for the big spenders. Nothing is really special here or a must-see, better spend your Baht elsewhere!
All that you need. Huge shopping mall! Too huge that you need two days to comb through all the shops. Excellent choices of F&B outlets too!
Nice X'mas decorations. Gets you in the Christmas mood with the lovely decorations / carols both inside and outside this large mall. Not all had X'mas sales but perjaps too early when we were here.

Fulfilling for Food Cravers. Beautiful and HUGE mall covering all aspects of shopping, suitable for average breadwinners to money-printing aristocrats. In my personal experience, the variety of food they offer is the best, especially Thai ice cream. I recommend tryin out Freshy Freeze ice cream on the highest floor (by the elevator near Swensens). The ice cream they sell is fantastically scrumptious! It might get a tad pricey, but definitely worth it. (better then Hagen Daaz I might say!)
Great Food court in the top level. The food court in the top level is wonderful - good quality shopping - I bought a nuce coffee plunger for a friend just perfect.

Just another mega mall. If malls are your scene then a visit is recommended. It is big and the usual suspects are there. There is nothing especial about it and the layout is a bit haphazard. I personally prefer the Paragon shopping centre which is just 500 metres away. Then again why not visit both for a bit of overdose.

An amazing shopping experience. To see Harley Davidsons, Porsch's, Mercedes and other cars sold in a Plaza was a surprise. Valet Parking at a Mall was new to me. A sensational Deli and Pastry selection on offer

Great shopping centre. Clean and extremely spacious newly completed shopping centreLoads of designer and upmarket shops and withing walking distance if Siam or Chit Lom BTS stations which means no taxi required to get there!
Shopping at its best!!. One of the best shopping malls I have ever been to. They have it all, loads of shops, plenty of restaurants and even a cinema.
Nice place for Brand Conscious. Nice place for shopping, you can find almost everything in this plaza, brand shops to food courts all under one roof
Excitting place. Take Your time to go through all departments stores. Is huge place and really you can find good things to buy

Shopping!!!. Lots and lots of expensive, yes expensive shops in a very posh plaza. If you have lots of money and want to shop this is a good place to come to. There better things and places to go in this interesting city. There is usually lots going on outside this plaza such as live music and events. On the Skytrain route so easy to get too.

Christmas decorations Amazing!. The Christmas tree outside centralworld is beautiful but even nicer is the additional decorations, massive angel, Christmas houses, lights etc, if you are in Bangkok before Christmas this is a must. It puts the U.K. to shame. They also had live bands this week Monday to Friday sponsored by singha, Chang and tiger beer, food and beer was so cheap. The shopping inside centralworld is great, def give it a try
Usual stuff. It's just like any regular shopping mall in the world. There are some good restaurants though. Nice view in the evenings.
Picture all the clothes in the world in 1 huge mall!. Nicely put together, each floor reserved for different categories of clothing if that makes sense :)
Refurbished mall. Good place for walkies although you have to navigate pretty well. Buns at Sun Moulin, Isetan were scrumptious.

Love this Mall!. You can spend all day here. Great diversity of shops, from Nirve Bikes to high end Apple Accessories, street wear to runway fashion. It provides a "downtown" feel for a city without a real center. A great air-conditioned break from the humidity, and an easy walk to nearby attractions and outdoor markets when you want to dive back into the "real" Bangkok.

Everything could be found here. CTW is separated in to 3 zones: Isaton, Zen and CTW plaza. There are tonnes of shops and restaurants in this department stores. Moreover, there is a skytrain walking line which is linked to Paragon and Central Chidlom.
Great experience !. Nice food court, stores for every style and budget. Dinner was great and then a casual stroll made for a nice evening.

Easily Accessible. It is linked from the skytrain to Central world and it is also near to Siam Paragon.Opposite of Central World is Big C Shopping mall.t has different types of restaurants and also have cinemas on the highest level of the shopping mall.It also have different types of boutique shops to do shopping like Naraya,Uniqlo and etc...

Art and crafting supplies in Central World Plaza. Hi. Visited Central World Plaza today in search of crafting supplies. They had a decent stock of scrap booking supplies as in stickers and some ready kits and lots of button and mosaic for that but no beads for jewelry making or wire for that. Staff didn't understand when I asked them for it and offered me a sharpener instead. Guess my hand gestures had them confused :).

A better shoppingexperience. I like this shopping complex for the good-mix of shops and the 2 big departmental stores, Zen and Isetan. Also, there are many good eateries and restaurants on 7th floor with a supermarket. More spacious and less crowded than Siam Paragon, an equivalent next door shopping complex.

Nice shopping mall. Central World Plaza is at Chit Lom station , need to walk for about est 10mins to the mall. There is Zen Department store & Isetan . Many restaurants & shop are at top level, & a big supermarket . Central Plaza is quite big & has many shops , is worth visiting .

Pure Style. Everything about Bangkoks shopping malls, complexes and stores is truly incredible, Once you get over the bustle and the incredible choices and facilities you can't help but have a wonderful time.

Big with style. It is a stylish big shopping mall just refurbished after the issues last year. Big food court ... not the fast food so much but good restaurants. Shop (and eat) till you drop. as and aside the dim sum on level 5 you may have to queue but it is a great experience

Can I live here??. Loved the shopping here especially ZEN, soo cool! Wish I could've had more dedicated shopping time.. The food court upstairs was good lots of Japanese.. We also visited the cinema went it the first class one.. Sooo different they give you a buffet and free drinks.. We had the cinema to ourselves which was crazy.. The center has lots of different shops and different dedicated floors like clothes, electronics, cameras ect; I really wish time permitted more shopping aswell as my wallet.. :)

Best shopping place in Asia!. It's just a very well thought out shopping mall. Everything is there as well as great places to eat. When it's pissing rain this is a great palce to spend the day in bangkok!

Crowded and Noisy. It is a typical mall. Lots of shops.Leaving the mall is hectic. No clear directions to Taxi Stands. I suggest you cross the road to the nearest hotel and catch a taxi from there. There are many Taxi touts waiting for travellers and they 'charge' crazy prices.

Big....really big. Must see to believe...the biggest shopping mall in SE Asia. Recommend the restaurant on 6 & 7th floor, what a choice! Thais love to eat. Skytrain Siam then follow signs, 5-10 minutes walk, alternative Skytrain Ratchadamri, exit all, see 4 face Buddha on the way then cross busy intersection and you are there

Shopping close to Centara Hotel. This mall is very close (few steps) from Centara Grand hotel.It is not the biggest mall in Bangkok, but it offers everything you might need, from food and beverage to department store and boutiques - and it is not extremely big, so you might not get lost so easily. Further, from Central Plaza you have direct access to the MRT.

Huge but welcoming!!. Thus is a huge mall!! Upscale and other stores, 2 anchor stores, many eating choices, apart from the restraunts and food court. everything you would want they have it! My favorite mall in Thailand. Beautiful with many sitting areas, many bathrooms, very clean!! Many ATMs money changers, pharmacies. Everything! Spacious , beautiful, and very courteous mall staff.

Great shopping mall!. Good location, not cheap shopping, it is more like a "normal" shopping mall, no bargains and discounts, but a clean & fancy mall. The restaurants are good, with food at good prices.

Good shopping. This is a good shopping centre, with many international brands including top end and high street chains. The food court options are great. My only gripe was that I felt like I was in a shopping mall at home and was not overtaken by the need to go on a shopping frenzy as the prices were the same as home.

Big, spacious, dept store, in upscale mall. Plenty of shopping till you drop here. 2 dept store and plenty of branded shops in this upscale mall.
Wear comfortable shoe here this mall is seriously huge plenty of walking needed to cover the miles of shopping floor!
Huge. The place was huge. Loved the grocery on the top floor which had a hidden food court in the back. Food, clothes, toys, movie theater- its all in there
Modern and spacious. Ever since 2008 i go there just to browse. They've interesting shops and concepts. A good place to walk around. Love their bookstore!
Brand name shopping.... If you are after brand names, this is where you will find it, although this is not usually the reason you come to Thailand??

huge mall with signature brands. very nice and huge mall complete with all signature brands like prada gucci armani etc., i visited the movie area where a luxurious james bond car and memorabilias were displayed in preparation of the premier opening. airport-like security screens at entrance, clean toilets, lots of seating area in each floor, with wifi.
One stop for everything. Central World is huge and there are number of shops, cafes, restaurants, entertainment spots ranging from world class cinema to ice skating.

Little cheaper than Siam Paragon. The place is little cheaper, but little off, because you will not find any underground trains, or sky trains plying nearby. Therefore, less crowded, at least that's what I felt. May be they have crowds in some other days. However, the place was not that exciting for me.

Recently rebuilt and offering some of Bangkoks finest stores................. Fairly centrally located and built about a decade ago it is close to all the major hotels,some temples and cornering onto the Amarin shrine so popular with tourists.This enormous complex offers virtually everything a shopper could ask for with new outlets constantly opening upon more than four floors and a huge carpark for easy access.For almost a year the complex was closed and business's went elsewhere as this was one of the locations beset by a siege of the Red Shirts and their rampage of violence including a fire that consumed the entire Zen shopping complex.due to structural flaws after this fire the whole complex was rebuilt and reinforced to the highest standards including a full face lift and it has since become one of the most popular shopping centers in Bangkok.

Bangkok's Shopping Paradise. We enjoyed shopping for branded bags and shoes at the Central World Plaza. The prices are cheap but you also have to look out for imitations. We recommend it for the shoppaholics!

beautiful. the temples in Bangkok are a suprise as they display alot of wealth and craftsmanship are very well maintained, there are many tourists so it pays to go early (also to avoid heat) and avoid weekends if you can.

The Central Food Hall is Brilliant. Go to the 7th floor Central Food Court - brilliant quality and choice! I loved the fruit shakes and the Hainese Rice Chicken as well as checking out what people on other tables have ordered! The air conditioning and couches are a great relief from a busy day on Bangkok. You can walk along the sky corridor from Siam BTS - take exit 6.

Shopping. Excellent array of shops and products although such a massive complex you just about needed to have a GPS to find your way around. I had my eyebrows waxed and died in a beauticians there and was very happy with the result. My Aussie hairdresser thought I was very brave!

SHOPPING!!. This shopping center puts American malls to shame. What a pleasure. Great places to eat. Wonderful shopping. Stop in for tea at the tea shop located near Zara. It's like stepping into another world.

Another mall for a dyed-in-the wool mall rat.. I liked everything about Central World Plaza (my credit card will vouch for it). I feel so at home whenever i visit this mall (apart from SP). Once in a while, you get a chance of experiencing a concert from one of Bangkok's schools, a fashion show, a promotional activity from one of the famous brand, even premium car displays. The long walk from Siam BTS station to this mall can be quite a stretch especially if you come out of the mall with shopping bags. Taxis can be hard to find especially during rush hours. But for all the fun being inside this mall, it is somehow a small price to pay. After all, you get to bring your purchases home.

Huge shopping centre. After the fire last year in June the place is open and as good as before. It's not as crowded as the Siam Paragon because it hasn't got the direct sky train access. But it's a good place no matter if you're shopping for food, clothes, electronics or just wanna have a coffee and relax.

The best shopping center from my point of view and it is huge!. I love this shopping center and it has become bigger and bigger over the years! Take a compass because you may get lost in the maze of sections and floors and buildings. You can buy anything in there from brand names to ice cream comes and you will find some of the best dining options. They also boost a 5 star hotel, convention center, ice scathing ring and and and....oh yes...if you want to buy a luxury car ...you can also buy it! Have a ball of a time....

My Favorite Bangkok Mall. A lot of people favor Paragon over Central World, but this mall is my personal favorite. I think there is a better selection of stores (although Paragon has H&M), it is easier to navigate, and, contrary to general sentiment, I like the Food Hall at Central World much better.
Good shopping centre.. Many shops and it connects to the next shopping mall. Lots of things to see and many food outlets too.

Great Value Pad Thai. Food Court here is very comfortable and well priced local cuisine...do not go pass Pad Thai Goong....55baht and a big serve!We visit regularly as its aircon and not over priced for loctaion
Central World. Very conveniently located from the Hotel. Plus connected to the other Stores like Zen, Isitan, Siam Paragon and so on.

Zen @ Central World has some good discounts!. We did some shopping at Zen @ Central World recently and though it's just another mall with a huge multi-storey department store. There are some good brands and labels there and some good discounts on selected goods too! Currently there is also a tourist discount of 5%.
Trendy mall, clean and big.
Awesome. You can find many interesting items for me was the watches duplicate sure but similar cheap good quality
Shopping. Isetan, Johnny Place and some nice restaurant make my days enjoy the trip there. Lotsa branded stuff on sales all years round

think of biggest the shopping place!!. Anyway, I'm looking forward to the weekend. Apart from catching up on sleep and tackling some decorating projects I'm also intent on spending some quality time with my love “Tories’ Bear”
Brilliant shopping centre. If you like flash shopping centres with a huge food court this is a must, just down from the almost as good Paragon centre, close to the Siam and Siam discovery centres

Walk through the arcades and obtain bargains. This is a mall easily accessed by the skywalk around silom road. Isetan and Zen are good shopping and Zara is here too. End of July and early August are sales times.

Standard shopping. CentralWorld is a great mall for the eateries. The shopping is pretty run of the mill, but if you want it you can probably find it here. The theatre is quite nice, showing Western films in English.
nice place to cool off. mall is awesome, food court is very impressive, movie theater and game room. great place to cool off and shop. lots of choices
Overpriced. If you like nice and expensive things then this is the place for you, luckily my wife is not like that, not that she is not nice and expensive but you know what I mean.
Amazing. Access to the Trimurti shrine and Lord Ganesha's shrine makes this a must visit place. Almost everything is available in this plaza and the size of it will make your head go wow.

Nice place to shop and wide choice of F&B. Nice place to shop. You can find to departmental store at Central World. Isetan and Zen. Also,the biggest Naraya store. Naraya is most popular with tourist as you can find very affordable gift and products made of fabric. Also, if you love Japanese food you will be spoilt for choice.

Wow - this hits some malls in the US. I have been to many malls in the US, but the Central World Plaza is one of the biggest and luxuriest ones I have ever been to. You can stay the hole day in it - air conditioned for sure - and shop around.

Love it, love it, love it. Last time we were in Bangkok was a week before xmas with all the decorations. We were sure we would be disappointed this time but know, it is so easy, spacious and every place your wallet desires. They are tourist friendly and have lots of eateries for every taste

Big, and..... i came here because it's close to my hotel and also, there's a naraya shop here.
achor tenant here is isetan many other shops too.
there's also a buddha shrine outside which many ppl were praying to

Central World !. Has many shops which is very close to the 4 Face Buddha (Erawan shrine).There is always some event going on in the front of Central World like the beer type of festival.Many top name brands with local brands and typical Thai items like plastic flowers. Worth a visit but Siam Paragon more up market and more busy. If for affordable items then MBK is where I buy my stuff but becareful some good imitations ;)

Shoppers heaven??. Shoppers heaven for some, hell for others. Very large shopping mall with plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants. No real bargains to be had when I have visited, and the quality of some of the "quality" items leaves a lot to be desired. Food outlets can be really pricey. I'd rather the Gateshead Metro Centre any day!!

Big mall with lots of international stores. Good and very big mall in the heart of the main shopping district in Bangkok. This mall hosts lots of international stores such as Topshop, Miss Selfridge, Zara, Mango, Forever21. Usually not too crowded and there's also a big food court and a movie theater at the top floor.

still a great mall. People told me this was a good mall to go clothes shopping; grab a bite, and take in a movie...and they were right.It has been overtaken by Terminal 21 as a "posh mall", but I found it much more down to earth friendly..the food courts were so much better than terminal 21, and there were more "market" style areas with great value clothes, etc....There was also an artists market (near to the cinema) where some incredible artists would draw you (or any picture you like) in photo realistic quality..I will be going back purely to get some of their art...Im not a shopping type person, but this mall was comfortable and good...

Another Classy Mall. Another classy mall in Bangkok, walking distance about 5 to 10 minutes from Platinum Mall. I visited Central World for two reasons - shopping and ice cream.The local handbag store called Naraya is situated here. Go get a few bags for yourself or your spouse or whoever. It is very worthy for its quality. And Malaysia doesn't have Coldstone so I headed over to Central World for some good ice cream. Best ice cream I've ever tried so far!
A plaza (no more/no less). Great high end stores for those who can afford the real thing. Lots of UK stores to ease any homesickness but no cheaper than you would pay at home.

too promising,but not giving much!. dont get the taste that i got from siam paragon or mbk. food court is really expensive.besides i had one of my worst shopping experiences here. bought a 'quality shoe' and in 2 months it perished!! it shouldnt be possible in a place like this, i think there is a problem with quality management here. not my taste in general.

Massive Mall- enormous eating options. A true gem - this place has made Bangkok a very nice place to live... it features an excellent and wide variety of imported brand shops and stores, but the real attraction is the eating... the choice of restaurants is truly amazing ... you can literally go here every day for 3 months for every meal and not eat in the same restaurant.... ! What other mall anywhere in the world can say that?And we are not talking just your fast food stuff.. although there is plenty of that if you want... the choice of proper italian, western, thai, chinese, and japanese restaurants is bewildering...

Brilliant. This is a humongous mall. A must visit . Definetely include this in your itinerary. The stores are all of the branded nature so it kinda excludes most of us from any purchases but its still woth a visit for a look at its architecture & interiors . The food court is pretty impressive too.

Must check out Zen. Great shopping experience, but i would always recommend you look at Zen department store before heading to pther department stores. Their prices are always lower than Siam and other stores for exactly the same product. I was able to buy clothing that was close to 50% cheaper at ZenPlenty of variety and you can usually find what you are looking for in this one building.

Great for English books, sports gear.. There's a huge Asia Books there where you can buy lots of books in English. There are also what I would call "normal" shops, unlike the surrounding malls that are full of designer brands most people can't afford.
Great Shopping Experience. The store selection was very good and the price is also quite reasonable.Food selection has a lot of variety too.

Very Thai. A vast mall, rebuilt after the recent riots. But worth a detour this month, just to see Philip Cornwel Smith's massive photos of everyday life gracing the mall exterior. Go in the evening when they are lit in vitrines. (I also liked his book, same name: Very Thai). Globetrotting Gourmet

huge spacious shopping mall. Having already visited Siam Paragon (Ultra up-market mall with luxury items & hefty price tags) & MBK (stall upon stall stuffed with t-shirts & endless rows of places selling phone covers) I didnt think there would be much more to see in BKK. But this city continues to surprise me, Centralworld is huge, with all the usual stores - the recent addition of a Uniqlo is a bonus (cheap basics from Japan); What sets it aside, though, is ZEN. I think most Department stores are a waste of time, you really need to be a local to find what you want quickly - This is quite interesting, though. Wacky displays & the inclusion of stuff from Vivienne Westwood & young Thai designers makes this a stand-out.

Big mall. I went to most of the big malls in Bangkok and this is probably the best of the bunch - a combination of higher and middle end shops and some excellent restaurants. For Westerners, the movie theater is really fun to try as well, you can get a recliner or a day bed to sit on!
Great Mall. Lots of restaurant to choose from. Excellent A/C there. They have everything. They also are accessed by BTS easily. Visited Titanic museum (short time) there.

great shopping. a very impressing shopping mall. Huge shopping. You will find anything you are looking for here. Not cheap, but recommended for those who love shopping. ONe of the many nice malls in Bangkok for that matter

Lovely shopping plaza. This is a great place to experience shopping. It is more upmarket shopping with still good bargains and lovely eating areas. We really enjoyed experiencing the Gold Class cinema complex there!

world shopping centre. This place is enormous, has every retail name, and many more, that you have ever heard of on at least 7 floors. It is light and airy, lots of space and does not feel like there are too many people there. A great place to shop. A good thing is the department store which covers nearly all the floors which has almost everything you could think of in there. There are also lots of food areas. my personal tips are that you need a lot of time to go round this place and also the floors are very slippery as I discovered wearing jandels/flip flops!

Huge mall!. Get BK public transport to drop off nearby Central World Plaza. It was a huge shopping mall has more and more stalls, different products and some cool nice bar to chilled out but beware to get lost.

One of the best malls I visited. Central world plaza is really one of thebest malls i visited. Its huge, and there is good selectios of nice shops. Its also peaceful. Maybe only minus is that is so big, so you get lost easily!

Out of the Rain. This huge shopping complex is really no different from glitzy places in other big cities. But it's a great place to go if you're stuck in the rain, and that's important in Bangkok. Central World is connected to the Skytrain system and other areas by covered walkways. Prices here are higher than some other shopping venues in Bangkok. Budget shoppers should go elsewhere, but looking around is free.

It's a mall. Yes, it's a fun mall, but it's still just a mall. Good place to hang out midday to escape the BKK heat. Go to the 53rd floor of the Centra Hotel in the mall for a good bar with a stunning view.

One of the best. The place is definitely huge, but difficult to compare it with other shopping malls around Bangkok. However, I found it less expensive than Siam Paragon, that’s for sure. Since, I play badminton I picked shuttle corks from that plaza. There were many sporting goods found in that plaza - shoes, and there were a lot of types of shuttle corks, rackets, and other playing accessories. I remember just outside the plaza, they had this huge Christmas gathering, and lots of people were present to watch singing groups rending out Christmas songs, a week before Christmas.

my favorite mall in Bangkok. has a good mix of shops and a great food hall on the top floor. will never run out of things to do here. i even tried watching a movie alone during one of my trips to BKK - their cinemas are clean and well-maintained so i wouldn't mind doing it again.when i'm in Central World, i never fail to drop by B2S bookstore, Karma Kamet (for room scents), and of course, the food hall. and yeah. Zen Department Store too.

This place takes an entire day to explore. Talk about sensory overload. I was there about three hours and only explored a fraction of this mall. I felt very overwhelmed with it's hugeness. It is very clean and modern and there are names from all over the world represented here. If you are looking to find something quickly this is not your place. Do but some gourmate cupcakes you will not regret it.
Excellent Shopping Center. I live in Bangkok and like shopping at Central World. There are many shops where you can find some good prices on all sorts of items.

Nice shopping center. Big and spacious, with good mix of shops and eateries. There is everything you need including cinema, so you can spend a lot of time here. There is a tourist privilege card that offers discounts at many shops, valid till 31 Dec 2012.
Huge. This place is huge...like 5-6 levels and lot of "mall" dining options. It is nice to walk in after walking the humid bangkok streets and get that burst of AC..ahhhhhhhh

Shopping Mall with everything.. Massive building with loads of restaurants, department stores, cinemas, supermarket, very good air con and much more. Sometimes is so hot and humid out in the open that is advised to get into a mall to cool down.

A huge shopping mall.. Well, this IS a big mall. Actually, it's HUGE.We were fortunate enough to visit it while the "100 years of Titanic" exhibition was there, but the mall is a nice place to stroll for some upscale shopping and good Western food, too.
Great place. wonderful shopping experience and the tea room is well worth a visit it was like going back in time to a wonderful bygone time.
Must go. This mall is spacious and has something for everyone..Movies, luxury fashion, value for money shopping , restaurants cheap and expensive, fantastic variety of food,supermarket and more.

For shopping only. A shopping center that you can find in all other countries. For shopping and dinning with western style only. Remember it only if you think you cannot tolerate the spicy Thai dishes.

Nice place to stroll- buy what you want. I bought my cellphones here, my shoes, eat, drink, watch movie Hey this is where I get a life! Very near to my accomodation so I guess I am one of the lucky guys (Rod Stewart says so). If you need a place to show off on your friends, relatives or colleagues when they visit you to Bangkok then show them here. It is a nice place to stroll, classy, and secured.

Best and Biggest in Bangkok!. Located between Siam and Chidlom Skytrain stations just a short walk from Skytrains overhead walkway. ie. If you get off at Siam walk towards Chidlom or if you get off at Chidlom walk towards Siam. Impossible to miss! Lots of restaurants to choose from. My favourite is Laem Cha Reon Seafood. Tasty Thai Shrimps patties (Tawt Man Goong). They've been around for about 30 years with the first one opening in a port city southeast of Bangkok. There's four or five outlets including one at Siam Paragom (Siam Skytrain station). Seventh floor is pretty neat! A movie theatre which like most movie theatres in Bangkok allow toselect actual seats like at a concert! Buy your seats and then go shopping. Prices are cheap $5 or $6 Cdn per ticket. Don't forget to stand and show respect when national anthem plays along with video of King and Queen! It's only a few minutes but very rude to talk or stay seated.Next to movie theatre is Gourmet Market an excellent upscale supermarket which includes some restaurants plus a superb food court with lots of cheap Thai food and a nifty juice bar that makesa delicious Mango slush! There's a skating rink inside on the first floor and B2S store which is part of a chain which offers Stationary, Books, CD's, coffee shop, etc. Cover three floors and is the biggest B2S outlet in Bangkok. Two department store Zen at one end and Isetan at the other near B2S. Isetan is from Japan but sells product from all over the world.They also have a supermarket with a food court on the same floor (5th or 6th). Secret Recipe is a small chain well known for it's cheesecake! They other outlets in Bangkok that are also cafes in Siam Paragon, Terminal 21 and Emporium.Sometimes Central World has special market stalls set up on the ground floor usually with discounts, samples and live fashion and/or live music. Quite the hoot! It's a good idea to pickup the Bangkok Post and English newspaper costing a dollar that has a daily listing of sales, shows, entertainment, specials, arts, restaurant promos, freebies, fairs etc.
Central WOrld shopping experience. Two years after the riots that burned part of this mall down, it is totally re-opened and offers a great selection of all sorts of shops and excellent food outlets!

Upscale and plenty of stores. Upscale shopping mall located near either the Chit Lom or Siam Skytrain stations. A short walk from either station. Lots of name brand stores and many many restaurants from fast food to elegant dining. Also a large supermarket located near the top floor. A nice way to spend a few hours and your money

A huge shopping centre, maybe one of the biggest in South East Asia. When I experience shopping here, I must say that this place will burn your shopping desire. A very interesting lay out and shops with all brands available in Central World Plaza. A very good place to do a big shopping in Bangkok...
Fantastic Mall with UK Shops. Miss Selfridge-need I say more? This mall was fantastic and linked via skywalk to the upscale Paragon mall which was very helpful on the rainy day we visited them.

Has everything you need. Beautiful mall with tons of nice shops... however, it drives me crazy that clothing made in Thailand that have US brand names are more expensive here than they are in America.

a nice spot fro shooping and u can visit Erawan shrine. Bangkok is a place u will find many malls. They sell many interesting stuff . However, what I like from Central world plaza, you can visit a tourist spot called Erawan Shrine which has a statue named Phra Phrom, a four-face- Brahma. Although I am not Buddhist, I enjoyed sitting next to the Erawan, observing local people praying for their god.

landmark in bangkok. some years ago. i remember it to be the famous place to meet and greet.a nice and spacious mall in bangkok standard.but now the shops and the place seems dated.crowd is less,but a calm and peaceful mall.the shops are of good quality.the location is great but very crowded and difficult to reach in peak hours.situated at the main junction of central Bangkok,the traffic is terrifying.some nice food stalls .the outside pavement is now encroached by street vendors at the road side.

cinema and shopping. SShopping is nothing special, however at the top is the cinema. Must experience their gold class-buffet, red carpet and sofa seating with service. Great experience. Just near cinema is the rock shop where you can watch the lost art of rock making, watch them roll the pictures or letters in rock and then reduce it through rolling to small sweets. Taste test and buy various types and favours.

Food, shopping all in one place. Central World is great, they have lots of brands that i like, for instance: Naraya, Cath Kidson, Wallis etc.Central World is also great for food, there's Coca Restaurant, Isetan Japanese Food Street, Korean restaurant etc.I especially love to go there for food and shopping because it's so near to the hotel that i stay at whenever I'm at Bangkok.

A SHOPPING PARADISE!. Many high end shops here in central world plaza. We shopped at ZEN, a flagship stores, many levels. There were many special discounts. We walk through the entire mall and it was huge.When we are hungry, there are many restaurants on the higher levels as well as some in lower levels. Just ask for the mall map. Prices are steep compared to your wholesale market but quality is better. Most of the items are also brand products.Relax and sip coffee at the coffee store in the middle of the atrium. Really nice feeling after all the walking...really "shop till you drop" feeling...;)The first trip there we had KOREAN food and the second we had Thai seafood. Everything you like can be found within the mall. When we went outside, there were some exhibitions and we witness a traditional thai boxing event...dance...very interesting for tourists like us.Further down next to this building is the Platinum mall..a whole sale market for clothe,bags, etc....You can get here by stopping at Siam or Chitlom station. just continue from station and it will lead you to all the famous malls. this is what I like about the mall set up.
