One does not get wet when it rains..all covered and for many miles....smile.Happy Shopping...you get teh high end and whole sale all within this shopping belt!

Massive complex. Central World Plaza is one of the those shopping complexes that is huge – multiple floors, each bigger than a football field. Certainly easy to get lost and the range of shops in immense. Everything is very clean and organised and there were staff and security throughout the centre to help. A nice air-conditioned haven and a busy, interesting part of Bangkok. Don’t miss the two shrines out the front – the Ganesha and Trimurti Shrines that are near the north end of the centre. Also the open area at the front is nice, with interesting fountains and some nice places to sit and watch the world go by. Access to Central World Plaza is very easy – the Chit Lom BTS station is near the south end or it is a short end from the Pratunum ferry stop on Klong San Saep.
Try Laem Cha-Roen Restaurant there. One of the best seafood rest in town. We ordered fried fish, steam snow fish, kangkung veges, lobster. It was delicious. Expect a long queue.

Just another high end mall. Most of the stores are like any other in the United States. They are definitely on the high end adn you don't get a good feeling of the Thai culture. There is still plenty to do and see and it is easy to navigate.
another shoping centre. if you haven't had your fill with shopping... keep going here but there is nothing overly thai nor original about this place

Singapore in Bangkok !. Huge set up and number of brands, the most expensive to not so expensive. Loved the food court on seventh floor. Indian food by Mrs Balbir is an excellent place for home sick gastronomical delight. Too big for shopaholics like me as legs were tired, but not the spirit !
nice mall. Lot of shops and all brands availabe under one roof. Nice place for shopping. You do not have to go anywhere else once u reach this mall.

Good modern shopping centre.. A must visit for your trip to bangkok. I'd recommend that you take in the nearby Pratunam shopping centre for ladies fashion.Easy to access fro Sky Train Chid Lom station. Easy walk from Zen Dept Store over the canal to Pratunam fashion district

Not the place where you will expect cheap stuff. I must say I was in high hope when I came to this place as it was my first time here. I was rather disappointed as most of the stuffs here are pretty much the same price as what I had seen in my hometown. Don't expect to get anything cheap here, but if you're the kind that enjoy leisure shopping, you may considering coming.
Bit expensive, but cool. Great modern design, loads of stuff in there, however not too cheap. Great variety of food on top floor, and the cinema has a VIP room that is unbeatable.. all inclusive.
Good bargains and cheap. The sushi buffet is great not only sushi but you can cook you own soup had a couple t shirts printed with what I wanted and was very cheap compare to UK

Amazingly big!. Central World Plaza is a day-out! I have gotten lost on many occasions. While not as 'cool' as Siam Paragon it is great to walk about and find shops. There is a great array of restaurants, personally the number of Japanese themed restaurants is a bore, enough already!
brand lovers PARADISE. its a paradise for brand lovers ... it has everything you might want and a LOT MORE THAN you might THINK you want

spacious and comfortable. This mall is the most comfortable place to be in Bangkok for excellent layout of shops and restaurants. Not too much to have to spend a lot of time from shop to shop , an excellent choice for shopping , a wide selection of food (especially Thai food) and fresh fruit juices at several places. Good position in the city.

Everything. We found Central World to have a great choice of shops and eateries. Everything we could imagine was available here. Most of the shops had quite high prices and it would be better if they included some small independent retailer shops or booths but definitely a must visit place for all keen shoppers.

Has everything (almost). One of my favourite pastimes in Bkk is to spend a few hours dawdling around the CWP shops, mostly 'window shopping' but occasionally buying a few things that are either not available in my home city, or are clearly cheaper. The highlights for me have to be the newly refurbished ZEN department stone, Isetan and the food hall on the top floor. The Cinema is a joy to visit & still at prices that have long since disappeared in the now ludicrously overpriced & unfeasibly expensive UK. From time to time there are exhibitions, this time it was German Minis & Swedish Volvos at screen prices I hope we wont see in the UK for another 100 years. The highlight of the trip was coaxing my reluctant partner into PNC panache to have her hair (attended to by amateurs previously) beautifully restyled for a mere 700 baht. Whilst I waited patiently a stream of glossy magazines & green tea came my way. Once I explained what it would cost in the UK my partner stopped protesting the price. My only criticism is that at around 3-4pm the coffee & tea shops fill up with large groups of school kids doing their homework communally. It's at this point I only wish that CWP had a Wetherspoon's (or similar) nearby where I could escape to get a pint & a pannini...

Not the Cheapest But One of the Best. The thais amongst themselves qualify it to be a "High So" center as they do the "Emporium"(meaning higher society); Both are for sure a bit more uppity than pany others but quality wise you can't beat them even if a pit pricey.
Love it. So many different types of foods to choose from. They are great. Shopping is super great - remember the 5% traveler discount and 7% VST return.
easy walking around shopping mall. it is just like any other malls in bangkok. nothing really that special . shop for cloth and food . supermarkets , and salons ...
Big & beautiful.. Great place for food, shopping, a movie, or just strolling about. Thai love to shop and hang out. You won’t be alone.

Huge!. Ok and lots of shops and worth a quick visit, but like most tourists we do not go on holiday for shopping in malls! They recovered quickly though as this was where the red shirt troubles happened in 2010

Quality shopping close to the Chatuchak madness. A smaller and pleasant shopping center with quality shops, close to the subway. Lots of restaurants but not a good Thai Food restaurant in the place unless one goes to Tops in the basements where there are a lots of wonderful food stalls.

My favorite shopping center in Bangkok. With Zen and Isetan department stores as well as all the brand stores this is a good place to shop for me, the only thing I miss is a good electronics department but they have Supersport which is a good place to shop for sporting goods, maybe not the best but a good selection of items.

Sizzlers DON'T DO CLAM CHOWDER ANY MORE. The plaza is great place to visit. I go to eat at Sizzlers. Then to my amazment they have taken CLAM CHOWDER off and stuck Mushroom soup in it's place. Shame on you Sizzlers management. Otherwise very nice and staff great

Huge!. So big you could spend days here, so many shops and restaurants. Just the thing on a very wet day!
We really liked the food areas great choice. Excellent supermarket and cinemas on the top floor too.
Wide selection of F&B outlets & shops. Do pay a visit to the Central World Plaza - the complex have a variety of F&B outlets & shops - mostly are middle end to low high end fashion brands.

Like any other mall.. but has Ice skating ring.. Like any other mall.. good for people who are into Ice skating.. It has a big ice skating ring. Apart from that there are good coffee joints and hundreds of shops. Just name the shop and its there. Didn't find it much attractive.
A mall to grab all urban items and accessories. Very nice and modern large mall, but kind of reminds me of shopping malls back at home. Worth a visit still.

Good but pricey. Big shopping mall, plenty of different brands. Same prices as in any american or european mall. I did find some interesting articles on sale, but you really need to look. Personally, i preferred MBK center, as prices are much more interesting. It's certainly not the same brands, but i still found good quality clothes. It's near BTS station and there a lot of other shopping malls in the area.I recommend you go there if you have money to spend or if you want do some window-shopping.
Shop till u drop. What can I add? Great shopping, even if you just want to escape from the heat a mall is good....This is one of the bigger ones, so enough to see (go eat at the foodcourt)

Central World Food Hall and Grocery was very nice. The Grocery on the 7th floor of Central World was nice. We ate in Pepper Lunch on the 6th floor.
There were a lot of restaurants on the 7th floor, but they charge 10 + 7% tax plus over what we ordered.

Great place to shop. This is a great shopping mall . The cleanliness of this place along with its selection of designer shops at great selection of restaurants makes it one of the best shopping malls in Thailand .

I didnt dare to stay there for a long time coz i'm afraid of spending over my wallet. OMG it can be said that im a shopahollic then when i reached there i was like oh this is a big big big shopping mall. I often go shopping in y place but it was awesome to shop in a BIG mall abroad and i wondered if i could see my idol there since she is Thai actress Anne Thongrasom! I just walked aroud n around seeing things with my friend. She bought alot cozz she took more money than me at that time. I felt so pity for that n she even teased me. Anyway as i said i didnt dare to stay there for so long coz i'm afraid of spending my money until the last $ since there were too many thing attracted me.
Just like any other mall. Unexciting (but lots and lots of them) shops in a depressing environment. Attached department store was big but with very little that you would actually want to buy.

Bit too Big for me!. Lots and lots and lots of shops on lots of floors. This shopping centre is quiet and air coniditioned but I found it just too big. A tip - if you shop in the department store then you need to make all your purchase on each floor even though it is one store!

average prices, average brands. This is a huge, multi-level shopping complex that has average brands and some local brands too. Lots of choice here and has easy access to BTS stations and taxis aplenty outside.

Great food court underneath. Great for window shopping, for the real one just go accross the road in the evening, there are plenty of street stores open up.Loads of selection of food at the food court level.

Paradise for Dining!. I really love Central world not because of their shopping, but for their wide choice for dining. So many restaurants and variety of food to choose from. A great place for dining.

Clean, modern mall. Muli-level mall with many name brands and a great little grocery store on the top floor near the cineplex. Easy to navigate, reasonable prices, connected via covered walkway to the BTS.
Quite good. The Plaza was very well set out, clean and busy. I suppose you see one shopping place and you've seen them all. Well worth a visit though.

Meals Galore. The choice of the standard fish and chips to exotic thai/indian/italian from the huge number of outlets in the centre was our main attraction. So clean and inviting without being over expensive.

Naraya, here we come. I love this shopping mall becoz of Naraya. Naraya is definitely crowded cos there are many Chinese nationals snatching goods like there is no tomorrow. there is also a cinema if I dont remember worngly. Its just opposite our hotel so I just love to go there daily.

perfect for a rainy day. we first didn't planned to visit CW but on our way to lumpini park it started to rain so we decided to take a walk in CW and I have to admid that i liked it a lot. They have cold stone ice-cream !!!!!

Very big. Compared to Terminal 21 (where I prefer to go) Central lacks character (although they are the same company). I think Central is just too big (which might sound strange to some shopaholics) but also the way it is laid out just makes it very tiring to navigate.

Good place for shopping, dining, and even sightseeing.. This is a really huge mall. It has so many things in there for everyone. Shopping. There are 2 big malls inside this mall. Isetan from Japan and the local mall named Zen. You would be able to find almost everything in these 2 malls. But wait, there's more. There are hundreds more stores for you to see and shop. Gadgets' store such as iStudios (Apple authorized reseller), World Camera, Big Camera, Samsonite, Rimowa, and so many more. For foreign tourists, don't forget that you are eligable for 7% Tax refund. Just ask for the Tax refund form from the stores. Dining. There are hundreds of restaurants for you to choose from. Ranging from hi-end Thai restaurant called Nara to the cheap local shop in the food court. Most foreigners would be able to find their favourite restaurants in this mall quite easily.Sightseeing. You read it correctly, sightseeing inside a mall. Since there are so many events all year long, you will be able to see many things that you won't find somewhere else. Google and check the mall's website to see what's the current event.Bottom line. If you just happened to be in Bangkok, give this mall a try and you will like it.

Central!. A big selection of shops, from high street to designers, Thai handicraft, bookshop and of course food court (as nearly all malls in Bangkok). Very central with easy access and interesting exhibitions occasionally. Not to be confused with Central.

Clean, sparkling, seemingly endless temple to retail indulgence. I hate malls, but if retail is your thing, then Central World is a must—hence my 'excellent' review. Designed like a casino so you can never find your way out, Central World could swallow you for days. I went chiefly for Uni Qlo and the adjacent sportswear stores. Maybe I'd been in BKK for one too many days but I thought if I had to hear "Sawasdee Kraaaaap!" intoned by one of hundreds of assistants for another 10 minutes, I would have gone completely mad! There are lots of reasonable options for eating on the top floor to fortify yourself for the next few hours of shopping.
Better than Siam Paragon. This mall is better than the more famous Siam Paragon. The ambiance is not so stressful as at Siam, and the shops and restaurant are equally good.
Amaizing Mall. The mall has all the best brands under one roof - the staff is very courteous; the 7th & 8th Floor has all the best resturant chains where you can taste good thai food.A must visit...
A good medium priced Shopping Centre. This shopping centre is excellent, if you are looking for reasonably priced shops, such as Marks & Spencers.
a lot of things to look. Too busy to walk there but nice if you have time to look around or good for shopping and eating and searching for new thing that you never see such as import product

Hard to find exit...maybe thats what they want !. Lovely clothes to look at and some nice coffee shops...we ate at Mr Lee Cafe, was very nice. I found it hard to find skytrain level exit...I think more signage would be of benefit.

well designed shopping center. here you can find anything you need. nice place to walk around and catch a nice movie in the evening. well air conditioned and not so crowded. a lot of great restaurants and ice cream counters.

Ahhh.....Paradise!. I just love this place. A lot of great shops in one location. What is there not to love? I have spent entire days shopping, eating, going to the movies, shopping and eating again. The variety is here to please all budgets and styles.

Great Mall. There's a lot of food choices, they are open til late at night and that they have a lot of stores to choose from. Once you're done shopping inside you can continue shopping in the night market stores just outside of it.
Shoppers Paradise. I travelled here in Sept with a group of friends. We LOVED this mall, it was an amazing place to roam around in, to shop in or simply to eat in.

not just a huge malll... i love it.... when ppl say that its only a shopping mall... i beg to defer... this... is definitely 1 mall i can spend half a day on my own...i've seen it in its former glory.... and when i saw it right after it was burnt down many years ago, my heart sank.... it was a nice mall... and they made it better now... Food --- Plenty... from the local chains like Coca and Sukishi to taiwanese MOMO paradise, Din Tai Fung to the many many smalls cafes and japanese food.....Shopping -- Naraya to Cath Kidson, Uniqlo to sport shops.... many labels available... not to forget... Isetan is connected... =DTHINGS TO DO -----frequent performances at the centre atrium or at the outdoor area- catch a movie (**pls rem to stand when the national anthem plays...^^)- enjoy the many many many cusines available....

Yeah yeah yeah brand names. Gaysorn Siam Paragon Siam Discovery Central World Erawan and so on so forth. There is little more boring than the intense proliferation of big international brand names malls that proliferate all over the central business district in Bangkok.The more I come to Bangkok and it has been probably 15 times in 3 years the more bored I am by the traffic, the noise, the dirt, the crowds and especially the complete embrace of big time international shopping buildings and still they keep on coming.Is there anything that these places don't sell that you can't buy where you live that makes it more interesting here. Perhaps the best thing about these buildings is that they are always cools nd very clean. NOTE COOL AS THAT COUNTS ALONE AS A PLUS!

Central World has Zara too!. While Zara is being refurbished at the Siam Paragon, you can still buy lots of great Zara deals at Central World, it's located only a few minutes away from Paragon by foot.
amazing shopping. just so many things to look at and buy. great dining options and amazing prices and bargains to be had. highly recommend !!!

Great Shopping Centre. The shopping here is great. Lots of different shops ranging from reasonably cheap to very expensive. Lots of variety. Not a markety type of shopping centre. Good food court up the top.

Great food. Great stores. Great Entertainment.. Imax theater. Everything you could possibly want in entertainment ishere. Amazing restaurants on the first floor.! Check out the 4d Movie theater. 500 baht. Worth every penny!

just the same shops. I was told this mall is not to be missed but actually I could have missed it because there was nothing special that I couldnt get elsewhere, it was just like most other malls I have been it, except maybe bigger I suppose.

Best Shopping Complex ever. This is the best shopping complex in Bangkok. There are so many restaurants and cloth stores. Easy to find parking. Not too crowded as the building is so big. Plus, it's near many well-know hotels like Hyatt, Intercontinental, Four Seasons, and so. Who want to do luxury goods shopping can use sky walk to get to Gaysorn Plaza which is just opposite. :):)
great for a little shopping. we visitied central world plaza on a stopover in bangkok. its a great mall with midrange shops and little local stores and a variety to choose from. worth a look

Everything under one roof. This giant mall was partially burnt down and Zen collapsed during the riots couple years ago, but it's now rebuilt and thriving! The only place you need and it's really a mall for everyone.

Very easy to access and value for money. Clean, smart, modern and comprehensive - Central World ticks all the boxes for a visit. Its not too large but nearby you have a further three very large shopping malls (one currently under renovation), all linked by walkways. One boasts some 540 shops as well as entertainment and food courts. Central World has several large department stores and many recognisable shops from London westend. The cinemas and games shops may not be quite so useful but the food courts are clean and smart. They provide a cost effective and easy way to eat with good hygiene and also safely away from the street. The Sky Rail runs by the shopping malls and they have large car parks attached. We stayed at the Centara Grand Hotel at Centre World which I have also reviewed and would recommend. They certainly know how to shop in Bangkok but don't forget to bargain.

Just a massive mall. Central World is just a massive mall. There are loads in Bangkok and they are pretty much the same. Central is one of the biggest and most famous and if you need something (clothes or electronics) chances are you will find it here.

One huge mall. Located between Siam and Chidlom BTS stations, Central World can be easily accessed on foot via the Central World Skywalk connecting those stations.Despite its huge size, there is really nothing special about it. It is just like any other big mall which houses international brands, and a wide array of restaurants to choose from.

A middle class mall which I love. Went to Central World Plaza more than once as it was huge and the shops do not intimidate you with huge price tags. Also located conveniently near Chit Lom BTS (sheltered all the way), the mall is very welcoming and the layout was easy to navigate. One of my favourite malls in BKK.

A must, if you are in the area!. Huge shopping mall, with Isetan as it's main retail tenant, perhaps. It has an ice rink, a cinema, a couple of bookstores (Kinokuniya, anyone?) lots of cafes and restaurants (with most on the top levels, level 6 and 7), lots of international brands, and a very nice supermarket at level 7. One can easily spend one whole day here!

Great large mall without snottiness like Paragon. CW has a great collection of brand name shops off all types. In addition exhibits are organised around themes, like we visited the Titanic travelling exhibition, which was facinating. Plenty of opportunities to eat, but Paragon food court cannot be beaten
Great place to shop. The recently furnished shopping mall is one of my favorite place to shop in BKK, loads to see and buy ! Get the wallet ready

Great shopping experience. We walked here from one of the BTS which i forgot the station.
This shopping malls is kind a new, huge, and from here, you can walked to the platinum fashion mall.
I dont have the time to explore floor by floor, but outside the mall, they have a big statue of the four faces GOD.

Nothing unique. I love shopping but I think Central lacks any character of individuality. It is really really big with many shops and restaurants but can find this anywhere, nothing special here really.

The biggest mall In BKK. This is the biggest mall in Bangkok (it used to be the biggest in Asia, i am not sure if this still stands). And this place is NOT served by a stop of the BTS! You need to walk either from Siam Central(Paragon) or Chit Lom (Central) 5 minutes either way on the elevated pathway. If you need something, it is likely this is on sale here... but where? If you want to spend some time looking around and getting lost, this is a good place. If you look for something specific, you might spend a lot of time before finding it. The choice of restaurants is good: probably here you have a better choice of good Asian restaurants (Thai, Chinese and Japanese) than Paragon, where you have more Italian/ western choice... relatively speaking. Bigger, less crowded than Paragon.

Good shopping mall with easy access. While we go there, normally it's rain in the afternoon.due to our hotel location are in Siam Square area (near from BTS Siam/ Central), we can walk to go there and using the same access from BTS station, more convinience and easy. Don't forget to go to Uni-glo shop, they have a lots of good stuff there with reasonable price

Visit the Gym. This Mall is amazing. However definitely for people with money. I went there really to use the gym in the hotel - which is pricey but a great way to get a bit of peace and quiet and the use of a nice pool in the middle of the city.

Great restaurants. If clothing brands and other store doesn't impress you, you might wanna check the restaurants located on the upper floor, the Thai restaurants near the cineplex are impressive, with traditional thai interior and guaranteed of good food!

Eat in the food court. i Love this mall. venture to the food court for dinner or lunch for some cheap eats which are just as good as the restaurants but more than 70% cheaper. i got a Pad Thai for 40 baht as opposed to 170 baht in a restaurant. it was delicious!!Near by you can see guys in a candy shop actually making candy by hand which looks amazing.also visit Forever 21 shop on level 2, its probably one of the cheaper fashion shops in this more expensive mall and has an amazing selection of young hip clothing.

You gotta do it. If you visit one shopping complex in Bangers it's gotta be Central World. Yes, it's bigger than Ben Hur and can be a bit overwhelming but you will find everything you want here and more.

Impressive Mall. A dizzying selection of shops and boutiques - forget about price comparisons. Restaurants and coffee shops abound on most floors. Cineplex show the latest flicks, close to Chidlom and Siam stations but avoid the taxis during rush hours. Better remain inside the mall while waiting for traffic to become less congested. A lovely high school musical performance during my visit was being staged and added to the fun nature of this mall.

shoppers paradise. i loved this mall and visited three times ,twice to eat at the many excellent food outlets and restaurants.The shopping is good too!!This must be one of the best Malls i have ever visited and would advise a visit during your stay in Bangkok.Easy to reach by Skytrain and skywalk

Recently Renovated. Recently renovated. There area lot of restuarants here to eat in but my tip is if you are on a budget, you can go across the main road and eat in the food court at Big C superstore.

Very Good place to hangout and shopping. It is a great place for the quality shopping and has been managed wonderfully. Not too much crowded like other Bangkok markets. Most of the time some good events are going on. I would suggest everyone if they would like to buy quality products, it is a must visit place.
Mob Dancing. Saw a Lady Gaga style mob dance here back in March. Hug area often taken over for major events like the forth coming Bangkok Elle Fashion shows.

Huge. Very huge mall with good and affordable brands. I spent one day there, and couldn't see all shops. I guess it was on the 6th floor which there were some restaurants... I'm not sure if there was a floor having any other food court. but when there are different cuisines around, it is also expected that a shared sitting area to be available. So for example I can order my Thai food and my friend can get her Japanese and we can sit & eat together. But when every restaurant has a door and its own sitting area you can't do that. We had lunch at Yumsaap Thai Restaurant. Food was delicious and prepared quickly. Prices were reasonable too.Bathrooms were very clean too. I will definitely spend more time in this mall next time. You can also find very good discounted items there.
Do you like shopping?. If you do, than this is the place for you! Even if you don't I highly doubt you'd be bored - as admiring the sheer scale of the place is worth the visit.
HUGE. Do not be in a hurry.So many shops,restaurants,entertainment for the ankle biters,Up market shops for mum and Dad.Arealy good Starbucks,and lots to look at

Best Shopping Stop in Bangkok. Its location is in the centre of the Sukhumvit area making it ideal for connectivity. It has the sky train station Phloen Chit station connected to it which is two stops from Asok station whihc in turn is connected to the Metro station Sukumvit.Has brands like Gap Zara and Zen etc and good variety of food and restaurants too. Great for shopping for all ages and decent brands(not very high end)

Enormous. If you like to shop till you drop this is one of the places to be. It's enormous with plenty of good shops. Very nice food hall on 7th floor. And so many nice restaurants, of which Din Tai Fung is one of my favorites.

One-Stop Shop Mega-Mall. First impressions: It is quite obvious that it is competing with nearby Siam Paragon Mall as well as striving for the Guiness Record for the Largest Shopping Mall. Ever. (But not reaching it..)When the burnt-down Zen Department Store gets completed, then it'll be much bigger.Pros: There's a shop for practically anything...Cons: Immense size and acreage, you can get lost anytime... anywhere...Liked: The food courtDisliked: I hated the endless walks around. You need a golf cart to get around.Verdict: This is a compulsive shopper's paradise, but not for me. I'll pass.

The only thing I really liked was the food court.. Decent shopping mall with all of the shops you would expect. A few local designers would be nice but the rent is probably too high. The food court was my favorite from all of the others ones that I tried on BKK. Good variety, cooked when ordered, and best of all inexpensive!

Too big!. I think it is too big so not really sure why everyone raves about this mall. Fair enough they have a lot of shops and restaurants all together in one place, which in one way is "convenient" but by the time I have traveled normally including getting stuck in traffic, parked, trekked around the place to find what you want, it is rarely easier than finding the specific thing locally, admittedly I don't live too close to Central Mall but even if I did I don't think I would go often.

Just another Mall. We see plenty of Malls from where we hail, and this rates as nothing special. The plus side is that there are oodles of places to eat; 1,000 square metres of dining outlets it claims! From West to East its all here under one roof. From the shopping perspective nothing really stands out to make this a mall different from anywhere else in the world.

this one is a bit too big for shopping. I went to paragon first i think that one is quite nice. Loads of restaurants and cafes on the ground floor. central world is way to big for shopping. most of the stores are empty.

The best shopping center from my perspective. This is the largest shopping center in the tourist area but not as crowded as the others. Good food, All the top end stores, with lots of larger stores as well. Movie theaters here are never crowded.

Elegant modern western style mega mall. They remodeled this huge mall a couple of years ago ,now it very open light and airy ,,very modern ,,all the top name company's for clothing and electronics have shopes here ,,and most items are ,of an higher price range ,,it lends itself to a very comfortable shopping exspirience ,,and if your not into shopping and need some place to get out of the heat ,,and rest up ,,it's good for that ,,too a very restfull place on the eyes and spirit as well ,,,,nice restaurants ,,and classy coffee shopes ,,desert shopes ,,easy access from the skytrain get off at Siam and walk on the adjoining covered walkway backwards past Siam paragon ,,,,it's not as crowded and congested as a lot of the other malls and due to its design ,,you will feel relaxed shopping and spending time here ,,
good hidden food court behind the supermarket. Most of the food is made to order. Lots of choices and less crowded than many others. Nice big windows in the seating area.

Great for kids. 6th floor kids' play area. Most things are free. Rides are only 10b each. We ate at one of the 3rd floor eateries on the terrace too. Nice comfortable clean escape from the noise and smog of the city.
Huge and complete Shopping in Bangkok. I stayed at the Novotel Platinum just 5 minutes walk away....this mall is huge!! and have everything for everyone.....
if your rich. went to centralworld several times and only shop here if you have plenty of money. Siam paragon much more variety and better atmosphere.
round. I just happen to find this place by just walking around and trying to see everything on my last day. it was fun and the prices were ok . the food court card is different
too big ... just a bunch of chain stores. nothing to get too excited about .. a super big mall ... easy to get lost in it ... 2 mega stores - and went across to Big C to buy some snacks
excellent foods. basically i had my dinners at e vast choices of restaurants available here. really spoilt for choices .

International brands galore!. This shopping centre was probably most suitable for myself, as it has all the international brands I love. Forever 21, Topshop, Miss Selfridge, etc etc. These brands are however marked up by about 10-20% from the prices in their original countries. But if your from a country where you dont have them anyway, its no big deal.
Good Combo. Central World is a good place to go shopping or eat anything you want as well. We always go there to shop for some imported stuff and eat at the small restaurants on the 3rdfloor.
Big and some cool places to shop. Good variety, like eating at the Sizzler there sometimes, but it is very big so you will have to do some walking and you can get lost a bit sometimes.

Huge and spacious. A good mall with a large selection of brands which is across the mid to high level price range. It wasn't overly exciting when we visited and we walked away with only an ice-cream cone in hand.
Great shopping centre. Hundreds of great shops and endless dining options. You could spend hours in the department store ZEN - very modern, trendy store with a wide range of unique brands.

Good shopping and dining selection. You can find almost everything here from fashion to electricals, food, etc here. There's also Zen and Isetan here. Also good selection of restaurants, food hall, cafe etc. You will be spoilt for choice!!

Shopping. This is a very modern Plaza and is always busy. When a member of the Royal Family is visiting the shopping centre you will know because the army and security and parts of the Plaza are corderned off. You are able to watch from a distance, but a word of caution, you may not take photo's and you must stand when the member of the Royal Family is approaching.
Mad shopping. Lots of different brands, great food hall, attached to our hotel the Centarra Grand, clean loos, every food available you can imagine

Great place to shop for local brand names. Fashion, food, computer & gadgets, and etc. can be found and bought here! It is also air-conditioned and there are also ' information' and 'taxi services' desks too!! Nearby one can also explore other shopping malls and various shops and stalls.

Nice shopping mall with 2 big dept stores. Good place for shopping with ZEN and Isetan as Department store anchors..located at BTS Station Chidlom. Even they have a small ice ring where children learning ice skating..great place to visit..
convenient. Great places to eat and shop here. Relatively upscale and a good chance to stretch your legs. Sevral walkways take you easily between hotels and over busy intersections.

Awesome shopping and food. Central World has much better shopping that its neighbor Siam Paragon. Go to Siam Paragon for the cinema, go to Central World for the shopping and food. Din Tai Fung is the food highlight at Central World.
Just get lost there. Actually, I like the one nearby better which is called Maboonklong which has more interesting stuff and a lot cheaper
good shopping. Has all the mid range stores such as Uniqlo, Zara etc. Load of eating places. loved the Shanghai dumpling shop, topfloor near isetan

reborn from the ashes. after being partly burned down during the riots 2 years ago, everything is great again, shopping is marvellous and special attractions are always great, like the ice rink, just take it easy not to max out your credit card
Great Shopping. Close to the skytrain and skywalk, this is a shopping centre that is easy to reach and with a great range of shops and cafes.

My Favorite Mall in Bangkok!. I highly recommend a visit to CentralWorld. It is a large shopping center, complete with a movie theater and ice rink. I honestly preferred it to Siam Paragon because it seemed a bit quieter to me. It has many nice restaurant (three cheers for Din Tai Fung!) and a nice department store, good for teens. I really liked CentralWorld and went almost every weekend. It is a short walk from Chit Lom BTS via the SkyWalk. CentralWorld is a nice place to relax on a hot day, I hope you go!

Great place to dine and shop. Love that there are huge food choices! Ranges of western, Japanese especially... there must be dozens of Japanese restaurants there with different specialities. And the Market Hall is fantastic. Lots to see and got lots of imported goods in the Market Hall

Huge is the Word. I Think a day is not enough to cover this place and you need loads of money to do shopping.....excellent variety of food. we ate at Manhattan's grill, excellent VFM place. Also tried Dim SUMS at an adjoining restaurant...................................................................
A little pricey. If you are looking for name brand goods from around the world, this is a good place to shop. A little pricey..but good quality

WELL WORTH A VIST. we have spent many many hours in this plaza for a start its so welcome to walk inside where its cool after the heat out in the main street,There is so much to see and do while walking through,we have eaten in a few places our favourite was the Sizzeler restaurant .I have used the hair dressersat this plaza which is first class.there are so many small stalls selling real nice local craftWhenever we are in Bangkok we always pay a visit to the Plaza,in fact you could spend a day walking around as its quite relaxing

Great place to shop. This is a great shopping centre with plenty on offer but it is right next door to Siam Paragon which is probably better. Still worth a look around if shopping is what you want. It isn't cheap as it full of major brand names. Plenty of choice, good cheap food and a cinema.

bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:. bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence: 50 yet?O no, more nonsence: bloody expensive, 50 words thee we go again, silly nonsence:
Huge Shopping complex. All the shopping and eating outlets you could possibly want. All air conditioned so very comfortable to be in.
An up-market shopping mall with the best food court. The shopping is for the up-market crowd. But the food court on the top floor gives the best value in terms of food quality and costs.
Great. Great place but should have more casual dining places with Halal restaurants. Should also have wi-fi in the building for travellers.

Huge with excellent dining options. This place is huge. Really huge. In my opinion, however, it lacks the charm of its competitor Siam Paragon and sister mallCentral Chitlom.We did no real shopping here, preferring instead to dine at the upper floor where we had at least one meal a day during our 10 day visit to BKK.Try the Thai cuisine on the corner, close to the cinema complex and next to an ice cream bar (they market themselves as one of the best Thai restaurants from 2007-2012, but I can't for the life of me remember their name).

A large mall. High prices.. The prices are like in other high end shopping malls. After the discount, a t-shirt can be found around 500 Baht, a blouse around 800 Baht, a pair of jeans around 1,500 Baht, a pair of shoes around 2,500 Baht. There are personal care stores inside the shopping mall like Watsons & Boots. I often walk to Isetan next door to shop as it's easier to navigate there. Central World Plaza is too big. You can cross the street to shop at BigC, a much cheaper supermarket but product quality is low. It's also near Pratunam so if you want to walk, walk to Isetan direction (away from Siam direction) and walk straight further about 20 minutes. Many buses stop here. If you go by skytrain, go out at either Siam or Chidlom station and need a good walk on the skywalk (quite a long walk, between these 2 stations). No subway station is near there.
Everything you want but could get lost. Need to find bearings so big it is easy to get lostBut every possible shop you need, great supermarket and big cinema complexMust go for modern shopping
Western shops. For those UK residents there is next, Dorothy Perkins and marks and spencers here. Not as busy as Siam paragon.
beautiful shopping mall. This centre is huge!!! I like the modern well laid out stores inside. I like the fact that not all the stores are expensive & upmarket.
One stop shop. All the top shops under one roof. Good food court. Spacious

Be at the Center.. There is a wide assortment of shops and restaurants at the Central World Plaza. It seems to be busy at any time of the day, most probably because of its accessibility. It is interconnected to the Skytrain pedestrian overpass.Fast food was interesting and good. After a daily dose of tom yum and phad Thai, my friend brought us to Kum Poon restaurant to try other Thai dishes. Delicious!From Central World, you can walk to the water taxi station or to other malls and hotels.
Na Ra Ya. Look out for a shop called Na Ra Ya :)))) You will never regret and it is very, very crowded everyday...
Middle of the road costs.. This gives the balance between Siam Paragon and MBK as far as cost and quality. Well worth a visit.

A bit like Siam Paragon, but lower prices. Another shopping mecca for travelers and locals. You will enjoy the prices more than Siam Paragon, and there are some Western treats like Cold Stone Creamery in case you are a home-sick westerner. Also a great place to get the basics -- food, drugstore, necessary clothing.

Suprisingly expensive. We are from Europe and used to high prices, but prices here were really unexpected high, actually higher than back home... negative suprise... Apart from that "little" fact, great mall with some superb shopping experience.

Much Improved. I remember visiting CW over 10 years ago and at that time it was a massive dingy hole that not only was confusing to get around but was full of some really poor and eclectic shops. Well 10 years, a couple of renovations and a 'fire' later it's still huge and still a little difficult to find one's way around but now it's bright, beautiful and has a number of interesting stores as well as a huge variety of dining options, one of the more interesting malls...
Amazing. Up there with the best in the world. Loved it. Has everything and very luxurious
Great for the mad shopper. If you want to spend money ,Top class shops and a great supermarket..Go here
Great shopping and Dining. Newly renovated and recently re-opened. Tens of restaurant offering all sorts of food. You can also find anything to buy from designer labels to boutique shops.
Interesting. Just shopping nothing much... Prices are fixed not negotiable like in the night markets
Great Shopping. If you want all the latest stores and bargains, this is the place.

Can the universe fit into one building?. Central World is the largest mixed-use complex in the heart of Bangkok and the third largest shopping plaza in the world. It is located in the smart shopping district of Rachaprasong The project comprises an area of more than 8300,000 square metres, with over 550,000 square metres contributing to Central World shopping complex, the largest lifestyle shopping complex in Southeast Asia. In terms of its size, it is on par with Siam Paragon.Next to it is the Centara Grand at Central World. This is one of the busiest shopping and tourism areas in Bangkok.In May 2010 it was one of a number of properties, which were set on fire following local anti government demonstrations. Since then, it has risen from its ashes like a Phoenix and it looks smarter than ever. Branded good can be found here but personally other then window browsing, I enjoy coming here to eat. Wherever you happen to turn to, there seems to be a place where you will be able to buy food. The choice is so wide that if you had to visit each outlet and eat at least 20 items from its menu, it would probably take you years.Even if all you wish to do is window shopping, this is one place to visit. The nearest BTS station is Chitlom but it can also be reached by the Khlong Saen Saep Express Boat, which stops at Pratu Nam pier, only five minutes away. Try it, you are bound to find something that will suit your taste.Times of operation: 10:00hrs to 22.00hrs

Enjoyable for whole family. We went on a weekend which was very very busy.  The 6th floor was like the kids floor, many kids boutiques and Zen had a great selection of toys.We ate on 7th floor, had spaghetti, Australian steak and bacon, beef and cheese hamburger, very reasonably priced. Shopping centre is huge and very clean.
Great Mall. Another great mall found here in Bangkok! Other than the shops, you can find a department store here with various brands. Good for window-shopping and strolling around too.

Lots and lots of shops. The place is ideal for those who love to shop: It has everything from brand name clothing boutiques, funky fashion, high-tech gadgets, bookshops and designer furniture to imported groceries, atm and banks, beauty salons, gourmet eateries and even an ice-skating rink. I was exhausted after a few hours but the lady seem to feel like she could shop for another 4-5 hours!

A great shopping complex with everything you will need. You will find just about everything here. Cinema's, food court and restaurants, loads of shopping and you will often find an exhibition too. Each floor is basically focused on a type of shopping, like homeware, children's ware, womens fashion, food etc. We came across shops we'd never heard of, some we have heard of but don't have in Australia and some similar to home but cheaper. It's all genuine so it isn't 'cheap' but we found it much cheaper than we would pay at home.The kids loved the many different ice-cream shops too.Very central locations, I guess that's why it's called Central World Plaza haha. There was lots of security on the entrances to the plaza who were all very helpful with directions. If you like shopping make sure you set a couple of hours aside to have a look through here. Checkout what exhibitions are showing as they have some really good and interesting ones.

An awesome mall. A variety of stores. Clean and modern. Easy access to all levels. Info desk efficient. Different levels have similar outlets, so you dont have to walk great distances to compare goods. A must if you in Bangkok.

Very nice place to spend time in Bangkok. If you want to do some shopping in Bangkok, this is the place to go for "normal" shopping. You won't find so many bargains here (go to the local markets for that). But if you want a relaxing shopping atmosphere Western-style and a place to spend some leisurely time, this is a nice haven in the central city. It is clean, efficient, very safe and has plenty of good food choices if you want to grab lunch or dinner.
Just another Mall. Just another Mall with not much style or flair. Have seen much better. Have a coffee & cake at the Oriental coffee shop.
Best Shopping Centre!. Shopping is great in Bangkok but nothing is better than Central World Trade Centre, great range of international stores annd good prices, enjoy!
Isetan Japanese Dept Store & Zen. Whatever you do in Bangkok, don't miss the opportunity to spend an hour or two in Central World. Isetan Japanese department store & Zen are just the best!
BEST PLACE FOR SHOPPING. I would highly reccomend for shop-a-holics although it is expensive.

Shopping bliss!. I like this mall better than Siam Paragon next door.It's smaller, but has just about everything you need, and it's got a great food section. Plus, check out the massage places inside as well!

Excellent place for quality and fashionable clothes and footwears. Central World Plaza is amazingly renovated after its unfortunate accident. Those who are looking high quality and fashionable clothes and shoes, this is the place to visit. But, you have to pay for it when comparing to other malls. It is worth visiting.
Big. It's big and full of high street shops. You'd need a day to see it all. Very clean and I'm sure if you are sick of the stall stores you'd like to spend the day here.

Great for shopping. Great way to spend a rainy day in BKK. Lots of eateries, shops and market stalls to spend an hour or 2 while the rain goes off. Also has a cinema on the top floor. Half price on Wednesdays!

Great shopping. A really large shopping mall where you find a lot of quality brands.
Just walking around looking is fun, and also a nice selection of restaurants.

Clean and cool. As with all the Bangkok malls it was spotless, well laid out and great air conditioning. Slightly cheaper and a more 'trendy' selection than paragon. To get to it just walk past the fronts of Siam centre, discovery and paragon for 5 mind and you'll find it.

Best food court I have seen. The food court in Zen was (before the damage from the riots) was the best designed one I have ever seen...and I am in the food industry. It's design is not unique, just the best execution I have seen of the concept. The cinemas are easier to get to than Paragon and not as crowded. The downside is you will have to walk (by the Skywalk) from either Siam or Chitlom BTS stations

Fabulous Food. The best bookshop in town for new fiction books,quality of the paper is marginal but if you just want to read a current book and dispose of it ,great prices.Up on the top floors an amazing display of food,great choice of western style or asian and quite a few eating places offering modern style cooking.
an elegant mall. wider choice ,premium mall.many branded items especially for perfumes,cloths and watches.it is a delight to walk thro this mall
A day's worth. Love everything about this Mall. Foods here are great! 7 Floors of shopping.

Shop till you drop. It really is a Hugh shopping centre & you can find most things that you need to bring back home especially in Isetan & Zen. The food outlets really vow you & we had two days of meals there.Travellers should.not miss this one and most staff speaks good UK English.
Central World !!!. 7 stories of great shops, from food to entertainment

A nice place.... ...to hide form the heat of the day! I spent my afternoon there after having spent all morning touring around the ancient part of town. A good option, especially when temperatures reach towards 40° Celsius. A visit to the sport shops is worth it as their articles are really well priced.

Shopping paradise. I would say it is simply too huge for you to shop in there. There is Naraya branch too for those looking for this brand. Just go in there and chill out if you are into shopping or window-shopping.
Great shopping adventure. You can purchase a huge range of goods and the service there was quite adequate.

Some niche stores but overall average.. The Central World Plaza is a big, big shopping centre featuring many name brand stores, Nike, The North Face and many others. Like others shops in Bangkok for western products it is not the cheapest nor is it well stocked. If you are after a certain product from a particular brand then this may a good place to start but there are so many other choices in Bangkok. On the plus side it is easy accessible with the two skytrain stations linking to it, if you don't like Central World you can easily walk to Siam Paragon. Get off at Chit Lom BTS (also accessible from Siam BTS)

Back Alive !. Central World has regain its charm from the fire which burned down parts of the building . It was now better with more retails , top floor restaurants is open up for more choice , connected to BTS.. Don't miss this place in KK

Everything available at one location!. Don't bother going anywhere else, unless you want high-end designer brands. Can't beat CentralWorld for dining and shopping options. We especially loved the Manhattan Fish Market restaurant and their food hall which has all groceries, fruits, snacks, drinks in a huge hall. Spent all 7 days visiting CentralWorld and still didnt see the entire place. Huge!
Newly shopping mall. very big, luxury shopping mall, not so crowded. Not suitable for those who want to buy cheap items but good for window shopping.

Nice. Brilliant ......... Upmarket ............................. Well stocked, huge, open worth a visit with ,mostly international brands outlets , food court is good, Mrs Balbir's Kitchen serves great Indian food
Shopping. Big shopping mall . Easy to go by Bts. Have more restaurant and good service .
way too big. this place is way too big... need like 2 full days in it...

Best Place to shop. if you have time need to go around Zen departmental store to pick items which may be cheaper than smaller shops especially branded goods. One can try women's section for high quality branded shoes, bags clothings at bargain price which are value for money in comparison to those available in whole sale markets such as Platinum mall etc. Men's section also caters to french, English and Italian brands
My beloved shopping mall. It's quiet, clean, high class, and the best shopping mall ever in my opinion ^^ It's even easy to buy just a small gift in the reasonable price here!
Lovely. Liked the layout and all the places I wanted to shop were there
You get what ever you want .... Big shopping mall, you can find a nice stuff here.. Keep always disc pro
Premium Mall. The Mall provided free stroller to shopper with young kid.

Huge shopping center with good shopping. This shopping is center is nice now after the last update and remodelling it got. Plenty of great restaurants inside with just about everything you could want in a shopping center.

Excellent one stop center!. This place is just walking distance to my hotel and we are there almost everyday for dinner or lunch or just shopping. I've got watch a movie in the "sofa seats" which is so good and so cool. There's also a supermarket on the highest floor which has bakery and a wide selection of everything!
Huge!!!. Great variety of shops, spent most of my time on Uniquo but all the main stream global chains, Next, Aldo, Esprit.. the Zen dept. store is fantastic as well, don't miss the ice rink!

For the stationery, pen and art supply enthusiasts. Central World is a great all round mall, in Bangkok. Many other malls focus on particular products (say, fashion, or computer and tech, or even several stories of golf!) but at Central World there is a little of everything. I particularly love it for the huge B2S store, which covers several floors and has a large book store (plenty in English) and also a huge stationery (including Rhodia and Clairefontaine products, and some fountain pens) and art supply floor - all sorts of media (including pastels - though not pan-pastels) and appropriate papers, to big studio easels. There is also an Isetan Japanese department store which has a substantial stationery and crafts section, which also has some fountain pens.

HUGH PLACE. This is a hugh shopping center with many eatery.
Isetan is located here.
Easily accessible via the sky bridge from siam BTS station.

great food hall and more. Whatever your tastebuds want you will find it here. I can recommend using the hair stylists, dont be put off by cheap prices. Good selection of uparket shopping. Loved the ice rink
WOW !. I'm not one for shopping malls but I did actually get lost in this place,extraordinary.
Let's go shopping. make sure that you have left some space in your luggage .... you will find it easy to fill same

Ok - Expensive. Everyone ranted about shopping in Bangkok - I thought everything was expensive. I campared it in the Sony shop with my new camera that i had bought prior to our holiday and it was more expensive!! I would shop before you went and spend your time in Bangkok enjoying other things!
Just right.. Unlike MBK, this mall has no touriststuff and fakes and it even is less crowded which makes it a nice place for some shopping.
Quite good for shopping. Not much here but it is always worth looking in all shopping centres and malls. Hint: Supermarkets are great for cheap goodies - bathroom, kitchen, toiletries.
Selection. I have always found all of the Central chain of stores to be outstanding, I wish we had one in Australia
Great shopping and restaurants. Extremely large mall with over 150 restaurants and a movie theater, supermarket, and department stores.

Wow!. This place is huge and the recently opened Zen department store was fabulous. If you have to see all of it, you would require at least half a day. We spent about two hours in this mall and could barely finish the Zen store. Prices are fixed and there is no bargaining. Most of the things that you find here are genuine and branded. If you are travelling from outside Thailand as I was, please do remember to carry your passport to avail the GST refund. If travelling with your wife, hold on tightly to your credit cards, better still, leave them in your hotel.

If your into shopping. I hated it, really hated it. But outside there is a wonderful pair of shrines, one to the love god, and one for "jobs" so I'm told. Amazing outside this horrendously western mall. I've tipped it excellent because I think if your a shopper it's wonderful, the electronics prices were at least half of these of the uk. Where else could you buy a 3d 42 inch tv for £200.

Fancy!. Of course, as travelers we weren't here to buy anything. There is such a range of shopping to be done in Bangkok that we just enjoyed touring around the different malls and seeing the people shopping.
Shopping!!!!. A great place to shop if you like shopping. My wife loved it, my bank account was not so happy about it!
Excellent. Especially ZEN back, you can see a lot of fun & q items in the shop , i spare 2 hours to watch & shop, they use some materials/ recycle to make a robot
Get great bargains. Got the great bargains shopping there as there were allot of sales on

Amazing place.. Huge shopping mall with all types of shops, not just the designer brands. There is something for everyone and the 6 & 7th floors are mostly restaurants and food places. Found a very reasonable steak restaurant where we went several times. We were there during the week and it wasn't especially busy anywhere throughout although I am sure it gets packed during the weekend. Outside along the street are lots of markets as well where you can buy very cheap clothes and all sorts of items.A real experience to just wander around and watch the people.

Great variety of food. recommend you to try all sweets and variuous restaurant here, really recommend to go on weekdays instead, otherwise you goota taste how bangkok traffic is during the weekends.(if u really need to go on the weekends, pleasse take skytrain or subway then walk a bit, DO NOT TAKE TAXI! traffice was not enjoyable)
Great. Really enjoyed this shopping experience and enjoy how vast the entire complex was...has a bit if everything for everyone.

great shopping mall for everyone. not like the Siam Paragon which is just for high level, the Central World is for everyone. there are lots lots of medium and low end brands here and sometimes they have big discount. if you are a foreigner you also can have a coupon that give you some discount for shopping.The shop Naraya is always so busy and women go mad there for the cheap prices but good quality and nice bags!the food court provide a huge range of restaurants which you definitely can find something attracted
Great Mall. Great Place for hanging around, plenty restaurants and cafe, easily reached by skytrain via either Chit Lom or Siam BTS.

The Place For The Rich & Famous,,,. We only spent some 3 hours there as most shops are selling upmarket branded apparels and leather products.
Go there if you have the extra to splurge on the luxuries, otherwise just to window-shop and see what is on offer!
Shop here. Out of heat and good escalator system. A great selection of shops. We found the top floor supermarket a great spot to purchase small sweets etc. to bring home.
great mall. huge shopping center and can be accessed by the sky bridge. has great shops and cool food outlets.

Yonex Showroom. Excellent Complex with all renowned Brands displayed, I generally visit Central World to buy my Badminton Equipment. The Yonex showroom is situated in this complex and the other huge sports goods store at CW is the SS sports shop where u could buy every brand and every sport item at good prices.
Central World. Within walking distance from Siam BTS Subway station

Business as usual in this HUGE shopper's paradise. Those who remember the terrible events back in May 2010 will no doubt recall the destruction of most of Central World. Two years on, I'm pleased to report the building looks spankingly new and absolutely pristine. This is an amazing mall, a must-go place for every visitor to Bangkok. You will find shops and restaurants that caters to your every need. The food court at the top level serves a wide variety of food at affordable prices. As it's located in the city's most exciting district, there is a palpable buzz to the entire building. You will enjoy the experience there.
The rebuilt central world. The central world has always been one our gratest shopping adventures. Numerous shops and restaurants are there.
good for people watching. A great place for shopping & people watching at the same time,a must for every visitor to BKK

biggest ever.... the mall was just huge. you could spend an entire day walking round the entire mall. but its v commercial. not quite an Thai experience. still worth a visit to see the magnificence of the AREA !
Also amazing. Although Paragon is better known, Central World is just as amazing, and is certainly worth a visit for keen shoppers.

Something for everyone.. Now that Zen has reopened,this is a great shopping destination.Ice skating ring,movie theatres,food,restaurants,supermarket,in fact everything.All price ranges,only problem is,its hard to know where you are sometimes as corridors not square,and easy to get disoriented until you have been a couple of times.Good Skytrain access.
Huge, modern, everything you would need is here!. Nice food in here, do not miss them! Best Japanese food ever in Central World Plaza.

Many brand-name shops for everyone !. There is located in the hub of Bangkok. The traffic is quite not good around this area, so recommend taking BTS reaching there.
Anyway, there are many brand-name shops and also dining out places. Very chic and cool !!
Mall for Rich People. just a bit lookup to the mall, just like another mall in our country for rich people, only high-end brands sell here...haha

Lovely Place. I like this mall. It's modern and very clean and the tenant mix is very good. There's a Tops Supermarket on one of the top floors and a cineplex. There is also a wide range of restaurants to choose from and a Din Tai Fung branch.
nice place. Toys R Us is here and some good shops are around, what else and there is cineplex

A beautiful shopping center. Actually, I like everything in this shopping center. Whenever we visited Bangkok, we had some shopping here ( previously it was named World Trade Center, if I am correct). Isetan is my wife,s favourite for ladies items. This time I purchased an ipad from the Apple store. It is a must visit place for those who love shopping without bargain.
Massive shopping mall. Massive shopping mall that have several floors and lots of shop. There are range of product especially expensive items.
Great shopping center.. On major road and across from another major shopping center.

cost effective and fun from food to many items. Many malls in Bangkok from high end, equal to any in the World to cost effective fun as the Central Mall all medium to low cost bargains, Plan on a few hours to cover some of the many individual shops.Chaing Mai still best and fun city in Thailand for places and things to see without the Bangkok traffic. Lower prices than Bangkok and great markets and zip lining and panda zoo, watts etc.
Massive!. A real massive shopping mall. Great display and products. You need a lot of energy to shop in this massive establishment!
Nice shopping place. Lots to shop and do here and many things u can buy for a good bargain
shopping shopping shopping. just another shopping mall in Bangkok. nevertheless: you can enjoy it and escape bangkok heat and traffic there.

Nice place to relax and spend your day there. The place is never too crowded like MBK or Paragon.The "Grand Canyon Cafe" is a good place to have a cup of affordable coffee. The thai food they serve are also tasty.The japanese restaurant "Otoya" located on lvl 5 is tasty, a bit expensive thou.Yum Saap also located on Lvl 5 serving thai food is also yummy and the price is also on the cheaper side
So Big!!!for extraordinary shopping. many unique store and branded store!!!Love It!!!Happy Shopping!!

Excellent place to spend time. REally good mall, well spread out, lots of variety of shops and eating options. Especially liked the 'Restaurants on the Balcony' - we ate at Talim Pling. The Central Food Hall was a great food store with lovely produce. Enjoyed a movie at the multiplex (be warned, they keep it freezing so best carry a jacket). Was a little irritating that all shops do not uniformly follow the Tourist refund.

A shopping mall with history. Parts of this shopping centre have now been rebuilt after the unrest in recent years. They have done a great job. There are many shopping malls in Bangkok, this one has a large variety and in addition the cinema complex on the u,paper level is very weel managed. Worth some time to relax and wander.
Asia's Biggest Mall. Wow, what a mall. Huge in size; yet small in prices. Had a great time eating and shopping there. Even saw a movie.
Local world trade center!. According to me Central plaza of bangkok is the business origin, if you are a businessman and you are in bangkok then you should have to visit it once.

Upscale Shopping. nice place to shop, eat, and drink. everything you can think of. easy and accessible, The mall is design comfortably for us shoppers. if you want to shop for gadgets its packed in one floor. saves time and energy.

excellent food court. Good shopping and lots of a/c!! Recomend eating in the food court which offers a huge selection of thai and international options. And yes, there is McDs for those who should have stayed at home!!
Brands - way to go. Great place for top end brands. Ice skating for kids. Zen for shoes is massive with amazing options. It just goes on and on

AWESOME!!. spent lots of time here catching up on english movies (was in india b4), shopping, and eating. Live music all the time and I saw a fashion show, concert, bmx competition and a break dancing competition here all just by chance. Its a huge area in the front so theres always cool stuff going on =)

Something for everyone. One of the best malls in Bangkok. Lots of different shops plus an ice rink, cinema and a bunch of restaurants. Each floor has a different feel like fashion, food, kids and entertainment. Try Din Tai Fung so dumplings if you looking for a place for lunch or dinner.

best shopping mall ever!. If you had a choice of 1 shopping mall to go to in Bangkok, make it this one. Did you know that it is the building with the 3 rd largest floor space in the world? we stayed at Arnoma hotel in May for our honeymoon and the hotel is right opposite Central world so it was amazing!. there's nothing you wont find there! My 2 favorite shops in the 2 foor food court were a chinese restaurant that specialize3s in Dim Sum on the 7th floor and a small but very classy pastry shop right next to it that sold the most amazing cupcakes ever!!

A great shopping centre. My wife is a shopping center addict (aren't most women!) Central World plaza is central to a number of shopping plaza's and easily accessed by the Sky Train. Very large and impressive with a large number of excellent food courts - particularly the supermarket area.You will find everything you wish for with floors themed to a particular product category - all furniture on one floor etc. Try the smaller shopping centers in the area around Central World Plaza for whole floors packed with small stall holders with everything you can imagine. Central World is more upmarket. Recommend you start off there, then leave and explore several blocks around for a range of market stalls to top of the range shops. Be prepared for a full day and look at the tourist maps closely. Beware of Tuk tuk's - best advice is not to even bother and that's from locals as well. We are sick and tired of constantly being ripped off, dropped off where we don't want to go because we refuse to be taken to their discount petrol stops, tailors etc. Walk or take a taxi - and even then insist on the meter being on or get out. If you get ripped off or the price suddenly changes when you get there - just pay the driver what you had agreed and walk away and disappear into the crowd

Excellent shopping. The Central World is a must for a serious shopper. It is huge with great variety of shops. There is a Starbucks for tired shoppers, a postal office in the basement for shoppers who shopped to much and a massive Toysrus for moms like me who had to take some presents back for the kids.

Good shopping. One of my fav place for shopping in Bkk. So sorry some areas still under renovation. Lots of brands, lots of sale (often), for every pocket, other activities, good caff on a top floor with good view. Strongly reccommend.

Nice and clean. There were less people in this plaza but all the better as its cleaner. Plenty of food choice and good shopping too! Air conditioned which I absolutely craved especially after spending half a day in Jatujak.

Wow. Love the malls in Thailand. There are huge and have every possible store selling every possible item you may want. Food areas a huge with dozens of restaurant with international chains and local ones too. The place is clean and looks very cool and modern. One stop and a 10 minute walk from Silom BTS station.
Shopping. You will find what you need at CWP. I was very happy to find the brands that I wanted.

It's got everything - though the maps 'in centre' could be better!. Central World is easy to access by Skytrain. It has a huge range of shops, and some excellent Restaurants. It's busy, but service remains very good - and it's easy to get around the Plaza by elevators or escalators.

Nice to wander around but very expensive. compard to other more thai alike things with normal thai prices in Bangkok, the centralworld has a lot of european shops with european prices. Do not expect to do a bargain there!

Good for shopping, and a nice food court.. I think this is the one that burned down, but is open now. Good location near Sky Train, I pass by walking to Pantip Plaza. They have lots of good food, and a less expensive food court. Air conditioned, so that is a plus for many people.
place for shopping. easy to get to but a bit of traffic at the front. You can get all necessary things you need here.

The best Shopping mall in Bangkok. This is the best shopping mall in Bangkok. What you want to find, almost available here. At the top floor, there is supermarket, restaurants and cafes, and cinema. All in one shopping mall

Great shops and restaurants. This shopping centre has all the shops you would want...even has an ice skating rink inside
Check out the restaurants as there are some excellent ones up on the ugh levels

A Shoppers paradise. This Centre anchored by 2 large department stores contains every service and product you would want in Thailand. more than a days visit without even sampling the massive range of restaurants from all corners of the world.
good mall. Good shops and lots of them. Nice restaurants, great for people watching.
In world of shopping malls. If you are looking for a Mall , central world is the one of the better option Bangkok offers , very close to Chit Lom Station.
It air conditioned.. Can bank, see a movie and has a hair saloon on the 4th floor near and to the right of K bank. That does a inexpensive 9 step facial Tx.

An Excellent Shopping Complex. There is nothing you cannot purchase at Central World. The array of shops is never ending. The Zen department store is fantastic and would rate with the best in any city. A superb food court area. Even if you do not wish to purchase anything still very worthwhile just visiting to see the amazing array of goods on offer.
This place is huge. This is one big shopping mall. It is huge and glossy with all the designer shops that you could ever wish for. Just make sure you take your plastic with you.
Best best. The Best shopping mall in Bangkok, location is geat, you can spend one day inside withoutleaving the mall. "Love it"
Must visit. All the work here and goods was done by Thai designers, not imitations and copies. That are all over a must visit if you have spare time

Interesting Collection. Very interesting collection of brands, things to buy, and options to eat out at however, for Bangkok, I felt this to be on the pricier side! Very good quality but quite expensive! But in terms of range of sizes available, you can find them in this mall, which is a little tricky in other malls.

A mall, nothing more, nothing less. Just a mall, like every other expensive mall in the world! A mall that isn't for the average Thai person nor is it for the average person in general. Why would I visit a mall that is just like every other mall in the world?

Lots of variety - from mid-range to high end. I made my usual homage visit to the established MBK - but its not the same any more - only shops offering mostly poor quality stuff, manned by gruff and rude staff. The crowds have moved to other shopping malls. Food court on upper most floor has shrunk.Central World Plaza offered me the best shopping choices - ended up buying lots at very good prices too.
I'm not so sure... I don't know if I went before everything was fully open.. But there were barely any shops open...
Best place to eat. Best place to find something to eat around the Siam area.

Another shopping plaza. Is another shopping plaza there, big...
It look like Time Square in Malaysia.
Thing are cheap if you buy in bulk, you may share it with other customer who just buy 1 or 2 pcs... from there you may get cheaper rate...
The Big C. Perfect place to relax in a cool, clean environment. Although the prices are a bit higher, the atmosphere is much more pleasant than the 104 degrees it was outside.

millenium type shopping mall.... almost everything, every brand under one roof. an 8 floor shopping mall. especially liked the contemporary designers section with a lot of designers. the food court is very rich as well, not only with the classical chain restaurants; but also very nice thai restaurants. worth to visit.
Great shopping in Bangkok. Central World is enormous. It's a great break from haggling in the street markets and has all the big global brands along with some good value Thai arts and crafts places.

Temple of brands. The newly reopened ZEN store is an Aladdin's cave of brands both local and Western, at prices the same or less than the West. If showing a reluctance to buy a discount is often proffered. On the top floors there is an excellent cinema complex and many restaurants although I can't quite understand why there are so many Japanese restaurants offering uncooked fish? There is a lovely Thai/Laotian restaurant very close by the cinema which i recommend. I spent several air conditioned hours here escaping the scalding heat of Bkk.
Central Plaza. It's big unless you really know where and what you want. Prices can be above average.
MUST GO!!. The food level at level & is a glutton heaven. Must go MO MO paradise. Shabu shabu buffet. totally worth it for TBH490++.
Great selection. If you are looking for western goods, then this is the spot.
Great shopping, good shops, lost of restaurants. It is a great shopping destination with lots of shops, food choices, specialty restaurants and department stores.
it's huge. Another huge mall, but lots of choice and selection.

Rebuilt. After seeing the devastation brought to Central World, it was amazing to see it bigger and better once rebuilt - congrats to everyone who made this possible - oh - and the shopping is fabulous!
Great one. Biggest shopping mall in the heart of bangkok city, best way can reach by skytrain.

Yet Another Huge Bangkok Mall. There are so many malls in Bangkok. Big malls. When I visit them, and I often do, I marvel at the people patronizing them, as I realize that Thailand is not nearly as poor as it appears to be on the outside. Nowhere else, in my opinion, is the vast divide between the wealthy and the poor displayed so starkly as in the massive shopping malls of Bangkok. You will not see poor people in them. Even the older ladies who clean the bathrooms continuously all day long, they are a step up, perhaps, from the truly poor. They may not be able to afford to eat at Sizzler, or at Fuji, but they are generally not living in tin-roofed shacks in the Klongtoey slums. Let's list the malls. There are several off the Siam SkyTrain station. Siam Paragon. MBK. There is another whose name I cannot recall, but where I go on occasion, because there is an Outback Steak House there. There is the old Emporium, off the Prom Phong SkyTrain station. This is the grand dame of Bangkok malls, as it was the original deluxe mall with ridiculously expensive shops with bored shop girls in them because their target demographic was so small. There were not, for many years, that many filthy rich people in Thailand. Increasingly, there are. Otherwise, how could so many new and more massive malls continue opening? The Emporium is still well worth visiting, despite brutal competition from other, new malls, mostly because it is more convenient to people living along upper Sukhumvit, and because it is probably the best venue for girl-watching in the entire city. Believe me, I am a connoisseur of the Thai female of the species, and there are more of them to be seen and met at Emporium than anywhere else in Bangkok. You can also do your grocery shopping there, eat at some decent eateries on the sixth floor, and check email over a coffee at Starbucks. The one of the two newest malls to open in Bangkok is one more SkyTrain station down at Asok. Terminal 21 is not much in terms of a mall, in my opinion, but it has the best location in the city, bar none, residing at the nexus of the SkyTrain and the Underground lines. It makes a good spot to eat. Or to go to the movies. One of Terminal 21's great claims to fame are the Japanese toilets. I have no idea how long that the management expects them to continue working, but these are computerized toilet seats that enable you to push buttons and direct gentle streams of water at various sections of your posterior anatomy. So, there is no sanitary hose at Terminal 21, but they have something else, which is a good substitute. Terminal 21 makes a good central location in the heart of the city to relieve yourself.
