The next newest mall is Central Phra Ram 9. It is right off the Phra Ram 9 Underground station, and you can walk directly into the basement level of the mall directly from the station. It is very convenient. This mall is massive. It has two huge floors of restaurants. It has movie theaters. It has shops that will take multiple visits to explore. It is so stupidly huge that you wonder how it can possibly be profitable, considering all of the other competing malls in the city. It is directly across the street from the Fortune shopping center, which is a sort of IT venue. There is another venue opening up, but it is not clear whether it is yet another mall or an office building or both. It is right up the road on Ratchadaphisek road, off the Thailand Cultural Center Underground stop. It is called Cyber Tower. I have no idea what is going on there. It is right across the street from another shopping complex with a Robinson's Department store at its heart. Also at the Thailand Cultural Center stop is the Esplanade Shopping Center. This mall is smaller, it is very convenient to use, and it is steps away from the Underground station. It is a good spot to go to the movies. This brings us to Central World. Again, it is a prototypical Thai mall. It is gargantuan. It would take a week to survey all of the shops. It has innumerable restaurants, including one very popular spot where a flat-rate buffet (330 baht?) entitles you to infinite trips to the bar. This is a very good find for those of us who like to eat. The food is not the best, but it is ok. It is simply cheap. It would be possible to go on and on in increasingly microscopic detail about Central World, but it would be pointless. If you have seen one Bangkok mall, you have seen them all, in my opinion. There is no real compelling reason to favor one over any other unless it is because you are geographically closer to one. They all offer parking. Indeed, it is not uncommon for people to park at one of the malls, and then just leave their car there, while they use mass transit to run their errands about the city. Bangkok gridlock is impossible. You must use mass transit, taxis, and motos, to get around. I highly recommend never using a tuk-tuk. They are not required to use meters, and they are often very adroit at quoting absurd prices. You will certainly get a better deal, and safer, more pleasant transport, taking a taxi. If sucking exhaust fumes and getting overcharged appeals to you, then by all means, take a tuk-tuk. If you know where you are going, and you know what you are doing, and you are relatively close to your destination, take a moto. Hope that this helps. Enjoy.
Massive Plaza!. This place is huge! Everything you want you can find here, but keep an eye out for the maps so you don't get lost.
Big Shopping Mall with everything you need. It's a one stop shop place if you enjoy shopping till you drop!
Lots of stuff for everyone. Nice shops to wander around in, checked out the hotel next door.
Big....very Big. a place to get lost in shopping, watching and just walking around. Don't go here if you have only an hour. Easy to spend a day here since they have basically everything
rebuilt. good shopping and many places to eat cinema with latest films if weater is not so good

Too Big and difficult to find anything. central world is probably the biggest shopping complex in Bangkok. In fact it is too big, and does not offer the range of shops and services that Siam paragon does.It is also difficult to find your way around.If you have plenty of time, then give it a visit. If you time is limited, give it a miss.
Shopped out.. There are so many shops one becomes spoilt for choice. All have banks etc for tourists. Nice and cool.

Mammoth Shopping area. The center had plenty of brands available from high street to chic domestic.. great super market where you could get stuff for the hotel at real prices.. no exobirant markups like the malls.. you have ZARA. TOPSHOP, I was hoping to see H&M but learnt that we don't have a chain in Thailand.

Great for shopping. Fully re-opened after the fire nearly 2 years ago, this 7 floor, 2 attrium extravaganza is the best place to shop for almost everything. Central Department store, a few blocks away, is the best overall department store.
The Place to SHOP. Some name brands you'll recognize and some unique local designers offer an array of fashionable delight!

The centerpiece of Bangkok. The holy-land for shopaholics, Central World is spacious enough to keep everybody occupied for a full day with myriad world-class shopping stores, tasty cuisine houses and other finest entertainment activities. Anyhow, the most outstanding trait of this one-stop mall is its touristy vicinity. Within walking distance, you can reach other enormous commercial complexes, such as Siam Paragon, Gayson Shopping Center, Big C Supercenter and Isetan. Still, you shall be more impressed and interested in the shopping street in front of the Central World building whereat hordes of unique souvenirs, inexpensive clothing and local snacks are ready to amaze your Thailand excursion. What is more, Central World is conveniently neighbored with numerous public transportation stations which are bound for Chinatown, Victory Monument and Khao San (bus), for Chao Phraya River (sky train) and for international airport (express train at Siam station). A stroll to Bangkok, be it short or long, should be tagged with Central World to sightsee a real pulse of vibrant Thai life.
ZEN. unfortunately Zen Department store was still closed for the 2nd year while I was there. Very dissappointing as I had been told it would re-open in Jan.2011

This is a mall!!!!. I remember Central World a good 7 years ago when it was just an average mall. After it was burned a few years ago and restored, it has become a destination. This mall is probably the biggest in Asia. It has 3 atriums, 4 bookstores, an ice skating rink, cinemas, hundreds of stores and restaurants and cinemas. Most of all it houses 2 department stores, one of which is Zen (my favorite), I love this mall!
High security shopping mall.. High security shopping mall.Selling mostly branded but lately tourist attracted to visit NARAYA shop.
Execellent prices. you anted to buy electronic or phones this is the best place to buy and bargain too. there is other things as well ofcourse.

Enormous. Loaded with shops and places to eat. There is something for everyone here. It is not - nor does it pretend to be - a place offering Thai handicrafts and the lack. This is a place for shoppers interested in upscale merchandise.

Great shopping. We liked the convenience offered by getting there on the SkyTrain and the Zen department store offered good selections, quality and value.We bought Arnold Palmer Golf shorts for about USD 18 per pair and the other item worth considering are leather bags by a local Thai brand called "jacob". This is genuine leather and the real thing and you get them for about USD 200.
Amazing mall, makes U.S. malls appear like garbage!. One could spend days in this place and still not see much. The food courts are incredible and the variety of shops is really awesome.

A breath of fresh air. This complex is a refreshing break from the heat and bustle of Bangkok. Large and airy with lots of restaurants and shops, as well as a multi complex cinema. Worth a visit although most of the shops are the same as the UK and cost the same or more ie Marks and Spencer, Zara, Next, Boots, Miss Selfridge, Walllis etc.

in the center of BKK. Central World Plaza is another huge shopping complex near the heart of Bangkok. Many hotels are nearby. Small Buddhist temples are located on the premises. For Americans, Starbucks across the street beside Arnoma Hotel.

Western Food and Bangkok Crowds. This is not a plaza. This is a place to get "Ick"Donalds, KFC and other food atrocities. If you stay outside there is a really good noodle shop and a great smoothie stand.

Lots of choice, excellent food court. Lots of choice, excellent food court. The biggest draw for us was Isetan and the bookshops which were very impressive. All-in-all, a great one-stop shopping location.
wide variety or merchandise. slighty higher prices since catering to more affluent crowd
Many shops and dining options. I love buying there. It has many good clothing shops . The prices are not cheap though

Every shop that you could possibly want. * huge number of shops
* very clean
* large international supermarket with a huge range of products
* great restaurants especially Din Tai Fung

Love this place!. One of our favourite places - not only shopping, but great coffee shops and cafes, cheap eats at the food court as well - and a great movie theatre complex. Overall, something for everyone
huge building with nice populaces. i just had a over view of centra plaza but i was lookin nice next time i'll vist it for sure.
Huge and Disorientating. Its too easy to get lost in this huge westernized mall. Its ok but its like all the others. Its also quite expensive considering what it sells.
Best shopping and resturants. Great place to do your shopping ! They have all the international brands

Good place for lunch. The seventh floor of the Central World is a great place to have
lunch with all types of ethnic foods available at very reasonable
prices.

Great Place. I liked this place coz it got everything you want and on the fourth floor you can find the money changers. The rate they give is just right compared to the rate at the hotel and in the airport.
Still a nice place for shopping and eating. Since they rebuilt it I don't like it so much. Somehow it has lost it's charm.
good shopping, lovely mall. terrific food court with lots of choices, really big mall
Great shopping. Good place to see and have a break from the heat, the aircon was welcoming. Enormous place covering 7 floors

well this is sheer size. as i stay in novotel siam this is a stone throw and like the siam paragon not to be missed ,you can see trhe best brands to the cheap shopping bangkok is renowned for. been there maybe 20 times on different trips.

Better than most malls in America. This mall is huge and has many stores to cater to all your shopping needs. Their food court is expansive, but we found our favorite dining there to be Yum Tum. Prices were good, service was great and the food was excellent.
This mall is easily accessed from the skywalk or street level.
Modern shopping. Reasonable places to eat in the shopping centre. Shopping is quality products so not for the bargin hunter.

shopping heaven!. Whats to say....its a shopping paradise!!....and if you have a female partner I suggest you leave her behind!!...lol....its just so well set up. great shops, food outlets, hotel built in!!....its just all here. easy to get to via any cab,tuk-tuk or BTS skytrain...and a pleasure to shop when you do arrive....just be warned about taking your good lady!!...i have warned you right!!...lolhave a great time,best regardsPerry
The best place to shop. Shop till you drop and don't even bother going anywhere else. Unless you need your LVMH and Fendi fix, this place will have everything you could need...and more.
Shopping, eating and movie. All you can do here. Shopping, eating and watching movie. New and nice shopping mall

Good choice of stuff to do. We went to the cinema there but didn't check the times so ended up going bowling instead. A good night out that didn't involve getting smashed on the Khaosan Road! Don't leave at rush hour though as the taxi drivers will refuse to take you and the tuktuk drivers will charge you a lot - wait til later and the taxi will be 60 baht or so. Well worth a visit.

Average mall. Has a little bit of everything. Numerous restaurants serve virtually any kind of food you could want. An abundance of American restaurant chains if that is what you are looking for. Does have a large modern supermarket with good prices and a Thai food market within.

Huge shopping mall with so much to see & buy!. Love this place, make sure you set aside a few hours to explore, particularly now that Zen department store has re opened. So many places to eat (try out Din Tai Fung on 7th floor for best dumplings ever) fabulous cinema complex, supermarket for groceries, clothes, shoes, accessories, music shops, furniture, hairdressers (go get a blow dry, about B200). Get off at either Siam or Chitlom BTS stops and walk back on the safe and easy sky walk to Central World (its about half way in between, about a 10 min walk above the crazy traffic below). Lots of ATM's, plenty to see and do here.
my fav. the mall is huge and has most brands.zara shopping,meals at pomodoro n sunrise taco are my favorites

Great place for shopping. I really love the location, many good businesses, restaurants, coffee shops, and the mall, and also the design is very attractive. Feels very hip and modern, which is a nice place.

great cinema poor supporting services in central world plaza. First movie was great on first class but with no lifts available to the cinema due to concurrent work on all lifts (poor planning) myself and 22 guests went to I Max. Central world plaza is pushing guests out the door with this action. Cinema is great if you travel the distance on traveling walkway. Metal detectors on all entrances is a distraction and possibility of bag searches discouraged my friends initially.Cinema is greatCentral world plaza is very poor.

It is of my kind. New look, new decor, dazzling interior :). It is a shoppers friendly environment,with ever helping sells girls,more products .I like always like to be in a place which is moving with time and understand the need of the hour. Central World Plaza is one of that kind.
Not What I Expected of Bangkok. Very Westernised shopping centre. Not a lot of bargains but nice and clean and air conditioned with plenty of claen eateries to choose from.

Best Modern Shopping and Place To Beat the Heat. Central World Mall had the best shopping and eating options that I found in my trips to Bangkok. There is everything from bargains to high end shopping available. There is also a wide range of Eastern and Western dining options at every price level. There are department stores and specialty stores and is one of the best one-stop malls in the region. Even if you aren't interested in shopping, it's a great place to relax and get out of the Bangkok heat for a little while. The only bad part is the traffic around that area and cabs will usually charge a higher rate to get there from the older parts of the city. But well worth it due to the many options inside.

Better than Discovery or Paragon. Went there after MBK, Discovery, and Paragon and found it better than the latter two. Central is huge and my guidebook said that it has outlets but I didn't find any. It's more affordable than it's two luxury neighbors but it's not cheap. Again, it's huge so I definitely do not know everything about it. Pros:Very nice food court that has similar choices to the other malls but less crowded. Plus excellent vegetarian stall called Talask--it's a bit more expensive than the other stalls but they make everything fresh to order. They have good mock meat which is better than the one at MBK. I like the Uniqloq here because prices weren't too inflated. Cons:It looks like Zara is very overpriced in Thailand.
Nice. If you like shopping malls it's certainly one of the best in Bkk and not so crowded as Siam Paragon or MBK. The shops are affortable and there are some nice restaurants.
The homegrown department store. Great for knick knacks if you haven't got time to go to the market or strett stalls. Set prices with excellent selection and offering good designers.
This place is huge. I got lost.. Lots of great shops. The movie theatre is a bit confusing though. Be ready to spend some time figuring which show you want.
great food court. A clean, spacious and inexpensive food court with restaurants of every cuisine imaginable
Great place. Good selection of restaurants though they have more Japanese choices.

Long way from what it was. Central world used to be the Walmart of Thailand. Now it has grown into this upscale, very expensive top of the line department store. This is good bad I expect. You can always find what you are looking for but you'll pay a price. You can usually find the same thing out in town at a fraction of the price. But they have made it convenient, one stop shop, movie theaters, food mart, restuarants and your dept store items.

Central World Plaza. WOW if you like Shopping Malls this is a Must see, so many shops and the biggest food hall I have seen any where, the prices are good as well, and easy acees from SkyTrain, Dislike too many people on the weekend especially if it is raining or Hot

swanky shopping in the heart of downtown. might as well just take them all in, Paragon and Central so you can literally shop til you drop. pretty much the same as SP, again with high prices for everything, but the restaurants are good and the fresh market in the grocery store is worthy nosh.the best part of this place - dress business casual in the evening and take the elevator to the top of the hotel and enjoy the best view of the city while listening to jazz and drink a cool smoothie while under the stars...

Big as they get!!!!!. The size of this place is stunning it is a small city if you include the Central world complex behind the main mall. Here is where you go to see important holidays and shows. They do New Years eve and Christmas like no one in Bkk. The two shrines are also really cool. I think one is considered the shrine of luck and love, You can spot it by the 1000's of roses around its base. The mall itself has hosted many different events including auto and bike shows. I had a good chuckle when they had the anime convention out front. They also have ice skating. This is not a fancy ring and has more ruts than the Oregon trail but it is SE Asia so the bar is not set too high. Down the street from Central world is Patunam and Pantip plaza both are great places for the budget shopper if Central world is too pricey. Across the street is Big C <I would not suggest shopping their unless you want to take a tuk tuk tout to get out of the place> The most important thing to remember about this area is the traffic direction. 4 lanes traveling away from Sukumvit 1 lane going towards Sukumvit. There is a canal taxi stop under the bridge and a BTS stop located two blocks in any direction on Sukumvit. I prefer to walk through the luxury of Grayzors to the Chit Lom BTS<Left on Suk>
Wow, huge. This shopping centre was huge and had anything that you would want. We didnt eat there but the food hall was full. We got lost for a while but once you have your bearings its all good.
shopping. the central world plaza was really great, lots of variety, interesting shops and easy to get to from our hotel and the sky train.. lots of great places to eat as well

My wife's 2nd favourite shopping mall in Bangkok. My Thai wife seems to favor Siam Paragon when she is serious about buying clothing for herself, but Central World is a more frequent pit stop for lunch when the family is making a shopping trip downtown. My impression is that Central World has a wider range of restaurants and a bit cheaper prices than Siam Paragon. Going to the movies is cheaper in Central World, too. The drawbacks are more difficult access from BTS Skytrain, a more limited choice in international luxury brands and that the toilets are harder to find.Personally I find Central World less crowded and roomy than Paragon, so it is a nice air-conditioned break from the hustle and bustle of downtown.
Central World. Essentially just another shopping center. Nothing extraordinary to see.

Better off going to Ja tu Jak. This place didn't really have anything that you wouldn't already find at home in a shopping Mall . Better off going to the weekend Market at Ja Tu Jak for a real taste of Thailand .

Central World Plaza has it all.. Wonderful shopping centre with up market stores, a full floor of restuarants with a choice of food fromall over the world!!!! Wonderful cinema complex and even a ice-skating rink.... afull day needed to explore this beautiful complex.

OK ...... I find Central World Plaza has no charm. and little to differentiate itself from up-market shopping centres around the world. If you have a fortune to spend on designer items, CWP will be your cup of tea. I prefer something a little different. Also - it's difficult to find one's way around, with poor signage and less than helpful concierge staff.
Big. Yep! This is one BIG shopping mall. In fact it is so big that I never really worked out the lay of the land. I simply got lost. Clean, cool and lots of toilets...if that's what you need.

All the top labels are here.. Central World was damaged in the uprising and is not yet completely refurbished. Most of the top labels including Coach and Tiffany are here. This is a great shopping center to browse around for a few hours and dream about some of the goods available. Look for a shop called NaYa Ra where the goods are top quality and at reasonable prices. It is on the ground floor.

Self contained. You never need to go outside from Central World as everything you need, whether it's food or shopping is available here. If your using the skytrain, this is inbetweem Siam and Chid Lom stations, so there is a bit of a wal, but at least you're elevated off the road.

It's a mall. This is a very large, modern shopping mall with mid to high end merchandise. This was my first time in Thailand, so I wasn't too excited to go to a mall- but parts of our group were not seasoned travelers and this was the way that we gently introduced them to Thailand. It does have good air conditioning and we could reach it via skywalk from our hotel. My husband went to a motorcycle show here, which he enjoyed.

Great shopping mall and good prices. Unlike its counterpart the Siam Paragon shopping mall, Central World Plaza offers more stores and better prices. I would take at least one day to explore this amazing mall if thats what you are into and at the end see a movie at SFW Cinema on the 7th floor in the First Class cinema; an experience we do not get back home in Europe yet. The price is rather steep though at 600 THB per person per ticket.
Goods were a wow but bit of a pricey. I only went there to have a look.. Swarovski has a lot of goodies there.. Bags and shoes were extra ordinary and the dresses.. Wooo..

Try the heaven on 7th restaurants. We were there for a day shopping and dine in one of the restaurants on level 7. Can't recall the name of the restaurant, was previously an Italian restaurant now turned to buffet style dinner with local and Italian selections. Definitely value for money, good selection of premium foods like ribs, prawn and mussel. Pizza, spagetti, lobster soup, selection of sashimi and local noodles and Japanese food. Good selection of salad, ice cream and drinks. Must try!
Mid-range shopping. Pitched at a level between MBK Centre and Siam Paragon, and geographically that is also where you will find this enormous shopping mall.

Ultimate shopping experience!!. Its why i often travel alone...this place is even more massive than Siam Paragon down the road!! Modern & cool (cold actually) & VERY noisy due to endless trade shows. Guys expect to leave here needing to mortgage your homes if youve got the missus with you!!
Biggest!. Huge, modern and the next best shopping mall after Siam Paragon in my opinion.
Shopping paradise. One of the best department store in Bangkok.Much of brand names and everything you can look for.
Lovely but expensive. The mall is very spacious with a middle- high end feel.
Shopping Center. Middle-class shopping center with many various products available.

This is our "cool down" place..... We actually found ourselves spending a lot of time here seeing it offers a lot of things to do - even for tourists. When it becomes too hot to visit temples and other attractions, we head to Central World to cool down: we ate a lot here, shopped, had a facial and even caught a movie on a slow Thursday afternoon.This mall is easily accessible either via Chidlom or Siam stations (BTS). We prefer the walk from Childom station because of the better view it accords: you pass by the Erawan Shrine to your left, for one. The place is massive with 7 floors to capture your fancy. My friends and I shopped a lot at Uniqlo, the Japanese clothing brand which I liken to Gap. I had my best facial ever (I swear, and I am into facials), at Takashi. We saw a movie at their 7F cineplex and we were impressed. What awed us most was the quality of places to eat on the 6th and 7th floors! Excellent variety.

One of the best lifestyle malls here with a variety of things to do. Here are my favorite things to do at central world. I love to go to fifth floor of isetan department store to taste some Japanese food. I go to B2s for listening to the music and get some arts equipment. Sometimes I visit Zara or Bebe for clothes. There are many interesting things to kill time. But the parking space Is confusing sometimes. I recommend take the sky walk from Siam or chidlom station.

Spent a lot of time here. Because Central World Plaza is not far away from our hotel, so we spent quite some time here, walking around and eat. New plaza in the area, well designed and built. a lot of young people hang out

Shops, shops, shops. There are jsut too many shops in the mall and it can be confusing. The food in the food court is not great. You may do better at the food court in the Central Department Store up the road.
End of trip look. Fine, but won't rave about it. Maybe by the time I went there it was a case of "been there, done that">
Best shopping center in town. You'll find everything you need here. They have grouping the same category in same area, like banking on 4th floor, food on 6th and 7th, easy to navigate throughout.
nice mall. good place for shopping and clean food court for eating
lots 2 do. lots 2 do & c shops galore wat isnt in this place fashion fashion fashion up market complex air con which is handy as sooooo damn hot in Bangkok most of the time.

Huge Shopping Center. Lots of places to eat up on the 6th & 7th floor.
Worldwide shops there, including Wallis and M&S to name just a few. This centre does not get as busy as others.

My Favorite Mall in Bangkok. This mall is great. Check out the foodcourt where you buy tickets and can get great Chinese and Thai food for very cheap prices. The mall has stores for every budget and the cinema is really nice.

It's huge. Just about anything can be found here but you will spend a long time looking for the shop that sells what you are looking for. The mall is huge and a little overwhelming but its a pleasure to shop in. Its very upmarket and has all the international brands you are familiar with plus some local stores. The food court attached to the supermarket upstairs is great for a quick, tasty, cheap meal.
Excellent Shopping. A beautifully laid out shopping centre with direct access to the BTS system. This is one of the best in Bangkok
Fabulous. Great place to shop loved it! This has everything and great food

Limited shopping but nice food court and supermarket. Not as many shops and not as buzzy as Paragon mall next door. But the food court has good options and if you need to buy some essentials, the supermarket is large and well stocked. Also a cinema is located here if you're in the mood for a local or Thai dubbed Hollywood flick.
Another huge mall. Its too big but the events there are happening! New wing was rebuilt and completed end of last year after it was burnt down by protesters..

Great shopping complex. Our hotel is just opposite this wonderful shopping complex. Despite the setback caused by the riots/fire in 2010, this place continued to draw both local and foreign customers with a wide choice of shops, restaurants and entertainment. You can actually spend a full day here without heading elsewhere. December is one of the better months to visit as there are numerous X'mas decorations and trees. Coupled with the beer/music gardens, it is one massive place to soak in the festivities.
Large shopping center. Very large, many food venues. Many local sores, a place to change monies
Another shopping Centre. Although vast and opulent, this seems to be just one more centre like many others round the world. The global village effect has made such centres quite boring.
Recently renovated. Very smart and upscale after being rebuilt from the ground up after the fire during the Red Shirt occupation. Great food court and cinema complex.
heaven on earth. clean, modern , spacious with a lot of varaieties
you can find everything here.. girls shopping heaven, included the famous Naraya shop is available, a Must buy in Bangkok. Because its really cheap.
Good Store. Have every thing u want !!!! and Discount more than my country

Impressive but not as nice as Siam Paragon. This would be an impressive mall by anyone's standard, but after visiting Siam Paragon, you are left wanting. I found the mall to be clean, but not as well laid out or organized at SP.
Check out the toilet. This maybe a shoppers dream, But for a no shopper, like me, CWP is worth the trip just to check out the toilet. See for yourself.

Incredible shopping. Ice skating in a shopping centre - who could complain!?
Amazingly pristine and some good bargains to be found in an 'up market' shopping centre. Also has a lot of good resturants

just another shopping centre. central World is just like any other shopping centre in Bangkok, lots of shops and lots of things to buy, but much more expensive than buying on the street, which is to be expected.
Big CWP. Wow so much to choose from. Better be fit to walk around, it's a big store.

High Price. Good shopping centre but so overpriced, I suppose you can be sure its genuine product, but come on i don't know anyone who can tell the difference between a real and fake whatever, and the street sellers haggle with you, laugh with you and give you good advice, they also need the business more so support them, let those with money to burn buy here.
wow. This a very modern shopping mall very clean more upmarket than MBK has lots of restaurants to choose from be expensive to cheap, plenty of shops for everyone's tastes.
Shoppers Paradise. Another great place to shop and get out of the heat. Also easy to get to on the BTS. Zen department store has just reopened and has an enourmous variety of clothing to choose from.
Good place to shop. Like the choice of food and fashion. Dislike as some shops closes quite early.
shopping excellence. This gigantic shopping expereience was right nest door to our hotel.eight, floors of shops and a giant cinema comlex and two floors of restaurants

Glitzy, huge, very high quality shopping, entertainment and food.. Rivals Siam Paragon as the best in Bangkok. Up in the top end of all malls world-wide.... Younger style compared to some others. Huge range of food outlets most excellent quality. Magnificent cinema complex!

Newly renovated, it is a large and diverse shopping center. With deparment stores at each end and hundreds of small shops in between, there is a great variety of goods and services available. The one big problem is figuring out where you are and how to get to where you want to go. It is a challenging maze to navigate and really easy to get turned around and end up at the opposite of the place you wanted to go. Maps are available on the Internet and printing one before you go will be a big help.

7 floor is favourite). it's a nice place for shopping, easy to find in down town.besides clothes shops they have 2 big book shops, a lot of shops for kids.our farourite floor is 7. a lot of good restaurants and entertainment such as madeincandy shop: guys cook candies creating a real show for people. and cinema which is huge, a lot of films in english. we always buy smothies and ice cream in new zealand natural cafe not far from cinema area - veeery tasty and super natural!we went to other malls in bangkok but it's the most comfortable for us!

Zen is Back !. We always stay in the Ploenchit area next to Central World, which anchors Isetan and Zen. the front area always seems to have something or the other going on as evening descends. Free Concerts, bikeshows, stalsl, you name it, its on.There is a nice place to sit down on right (in front of Zen), near the intersection just under the Sky Walk where you can watch the fountain change colors. My kids find it a Riot ! Zen opened up a few months back. We like checking it out. One of our favorite places to eat is Sizzlers on the 7th (or is it 6th ?) floor. Get there early for dinner. We always have to wait a bit but its worth it. Bad salad bar for the money you pay. After the meal we head upstairs to catch a flick. Great theaters - comfy seats and good pop corn. There is a Toys R Us in Central as well. So, its hard to get out of this buidling once you enter it. I like the other large store that anchors the building on the right, Isetan. A bit pricier but carry's quality name brands ... Not the crap you find flooded in MBK ! Central World has it All !

Too big!. Nothing is wrong with the selection of shops, but the mall as a whole is just too big! And most of what they have can be found in Paragon, Central Chidlom etc. Me and my wife often go there for food, but for shopping we prefer to go elsewhere.
Shop, Shop and Shop soem more!. This is a shopping heaven ! CentralWorld is clean, bright and very well air conditioned. Just be careful you dont get lost in this rather large complex!

Central world. Used to be called World trade Centre before 2001 but quickly & wisely changed it name to Central world after the 9/11 attack on World trade centre in New York. Fantastic mall with high quality goods even better if you stay at Arnoma hotel across the road.
A nice mall very similar to malls in the US. .. You can find much better bargains here than at the other high end malls

Great place to while away the time from the heat or the rain. Largest lifestyle shopping mall in Bangkok. Many UK brands - last weekend there was a great SACIT-sponsored area set up showcasing Thai crafts and handmade products. Also check out the stalls on the street outside - denim shorts and skirts selling at 89 to 100 baht, about half what they charge on the Khao San Road.
all in one roof. nice location, huge shopping mall. great food on the 7th floor, due to size one does not feel too crowed and shopping can be done at leisure

Bangkok shopping malls are no longer cheap. In fact shopping in bangkok is no longer cheap, as it was say 10 and more years ago. Stick to the street shopping if you are looking for good deals. But of course the B word is a must in Big Bangkok. BARGAIN! Some of them will tell you fixed price. walk away.
If you can't fing it here..... Huge mall in the heart of bangkok. The aircon provides a nice respite from the heat. All sorts of shops and restaurants. Open late - ihtink around 10 or 11 pm.
Huge modern mall. Absolutely enormous mall with a million modern, expensive stores, but not much else. Right next door, Paragon has more 'sights' for the visitor to see.

good for shopping and eating. Plenty of restaurants there with lots of variety for all palates. More on the quick food side but the selection is good and you will find something for all tastes and pocketbooks.
International Food Choices on the top floor - superb!. We liked that there were many food choices from different cuisines and providing the best/most popular dishes per cuisine :)

Newly Renovated, Wide variety of stores and restaurants. The store is newly renovated after the protesters burnt down the place. It offers wide variety of foods and stores. Easy access by the skywalk from the BTS. Lot of parking lots. Connected with Centara Hotel
Great shopping. But avoid the Siam ocean world aquarium, tourist rip off, tourists are charged up to four times the price of a local, dont encourage this practice, steer clear
Expensive but fun!. Real brands, lots to choose from, excellent staff!

BIG shopping center. Big shopping center with a lot of international stores. Good price range, and something for everyone.
VIP cinema was fun! Inkluded in the price you get popcorn, soda, fruitjuce and some food. The seats was great to!

Best mall in Bangkok. This mall has a good Isetan department store, excellently stocked, and a very nice Jim Thomson store and cafe within that, but the whole mall has been significantly upgraded, has a fabulous food hall /supermarket with the best cheese selection I have seen outside France, and a fascinating modern library ( TKP-Thailand knowledge park) on the top floor.

Great shopping location with lots of entertainment. Every time I'm at Central World there's some sort of free entertainment on either inside or in the plaza outside. LOADS of dining options. I can't until the repairs from the riots are completed and Zen returns, particularly their restaurant on the top level - Zense. Great food and great views.

What is not to like, HUGE SHOPPING MALL!!. This place is amazing to walk around and shop at the many shops. They also have many restaurants. A great place to spend time to avoid the heat and humidity outside. I visit there on every trip to Bangkok.
Spacious. it is a big mall....with branded boutiques inside..

If you think shopping is part of yr trip, Plaza is ok. I would'nt repeat myself on the shopping centre, but those places are hot releife and relaxing. This is a huge and waste building where you can get lost since it is longer and wider compare most of others malls. Planty of electronic products, first quality brands of fashions and jewerely, bags, watches and tons of others stuff from pin to elepahnts (ko chabg is tahu name). A part from joke you can really buy averythings.
Big Brands and Names - expensive. No atmosphere, lots of alleys to wander down and get lost. must have been designed by an urban planner

All under 1 roof. You have everything under 1 roof here, this was originally the world trade centre before going under a whole transformation, the central food hall is a great place to shop and there is a din tai fung for dim sum, whats not to like ;)
Large.... but expensive. Unlike Terminal 21, there is no nice decor or theme. There is however a nice ice skating rink if you are into the sport. It is occupied mostly by kids though.
Huge. You can get lost here. It's an amazing experience. Unbelievable number of shops and restaurants and as it's new fortunately not so crowded.
Fun place, less crowd. Not as many namebrands as Siam Paragon, but the Plaza has a lot to offer with less crowd including worldclass cinema and the rink.

Shop till you drop. This is a Brilliant place to shop.Why go anywhere else.
You must try the Sizzler restaurant. very Yummy.
Fish ,chicken,Pork Steaks Brilliant salad Bar.Always Busy
Which must tell you something.

love this mall!. i enjoyed their food court with affordable meals
i also found stuff which i couldn't find in other Thai groceries to bring home
less crowded than Siam Paragon and they have everything here too. Everything u need is just right here but it's very very big compare to other shopping malls

Great, even better if staying at Centara. Over many floors with a huge atrium housing the escalators and lifts. A whole floor of eateries, well priced and varied. Great Japanese restaurants - Nobu!
Recognisable European brands - M & S, Gap etc, pricy though.
Supermarket for soft drinks, snacks, medical supplies.
Live music offerings, other live presentations ie beauty pageants etc.
Bustling & fun - go
Designed clothes at realistic prices. Great place to get all your western clothes / shoes etc at sensible prices. Bata shoes are great and only £10 each!
You can find every things you want. Lots of good restaurant. Atmostphere is very good nice and clean. Variety of shops offer and lots of Internation food.
Great !!. This shopping Centre is one of the best. The food is out of this world and the shops are fantastic. A must when staying in Bangkok even better when you stay next door at Centara Grand.

Good choice if you get annoyed with MBK.. Wide range of stores. It has an amazing asian food court, specially focusing in the japanese menu. Much less crouded than it's neighbors "MBK" "Siam Discovery/Paragon" I recommend it since you can actually walk without bumping into everyone else.
nice shops. you can find signature shops here nice interior and relax while shopping

A shopping center. Don't take my review too much to heart, as I've only popped in this place once or twice and never really took the time to really explore it, but it just seems like another typical shopping mall. nothing special that I could find. The stores are on the pricier end of the scale, although not high-end. Meh.
Two hours here. Spent two hours here while waiting for a friend. A nice place for shopping.

Great food court. The food court is a nice stop after a day of shopping. Think I saw at least 15 different countries cuisine represented here. We had Greek and Indian and was pretty good but a little pricey. But over all would come back whenever in the area shopping.

Good stop point to walk to "super rich" currency exchange. We alight at this BTS station to walk to "super rich" currency exchange. It gives better rates than the banks. Just ask the locals and they'll point you to the money changer. It's next to Big C shopping complex.
Choices galore - and great bargains.. Be sure to make a note of weher you entered, it's a huge building and easy to become disoriented. Great bargains, I recommend sho shopping in Central World Plaza
Excellent Mall.. a huge mall with branded stuff only. Worth the visit during a sale.
very convenient. Mall, branded stores, restaurants, attached hotel & convention center. Easy access with the sky train

Is it still there?. This place was an impressive mall. I hope the Red Shirts didn't tear it down. Seems like they might have. But it had every store and every kind of food you could hope for. Very western, though.
WoW!. All in one place, easy to access and it is a paradise for the shoppers and places to dine.
Wow!. Another amazing shopping experience in Bangkok! Mush better than any UK shopping!

Great location and everything you need under one roof. Has always been a great fan of the Central chain of malls around Thailand - Shops are more down to earth compared to Siam Paragon (especially great prices with the sales) and have almost every type of shops and restaurants to cater to all types of customers and budgets. You can pretty much spend the whole day in the mall and will be entertained with the movies (also note the quality of their seats and cleanliness and the cheaper prices during weekdays afternoons) and also the eateries around Central Food Hall and the supermarket itself. Overall mall space seems to be well-designed which definitely help with all the traffic flow during the festive season.

It's a mall; A really big mall!. What more needs to be said. It's a monstrosity, a city block of multilevel shopping and feeding opportunities. Central World has just about everything and anything you need in the shopping world. It also is a fantastic opportunity to cool off, the main reason I love shopping malls in South East Asia.
good. good area , good sopping , best offer, but now zen shop is closed ,
Its massive!!. Very good, huge shopping centre that we managed to get lost inside!!! A very nice food court upstairs too.
good when it was open. this was shut most of the time, but when it was open it was great

A mall is a mall is a mall!. The crowd was as busy as any mall I've ever been in during the busy holidays. The same shops you would find in any mall back home too! What was really disappointing was the ridiculously high prices. No bargains here! Save your money and shop at home!One saving grace! The activities outside the mall in the plaza along the street was interesting - just for people watching!
Incredible place to shop. Huge mall with shops to buy everything at the best prices. Very cheap especially clothing. You can take the entire day to visit.

Go to the top. The Red Sky bad at the top of the hotel attached to Central World is worth the trip into the sky for great cocktails. Get there an hour before the sun goes down and see the colours change across this unique city.
Great place to shop. Nice, clean, airy, a pleasure to walk round. A great choice of places to eat.

great big brand shops with much cheaper prices than australia. We loved the discounts available at these stores. For example, french connection had up to 70% off most if their clothes.Its clean, nice and cool, and a very pleasant shopping experience. It has 2 floors if dining so theres plenty of different cuisines to choose from.It really is huge, it has two department stores which are both fantastic. Zen is a must see for anyone from Australia or new zealand.Well with a visit. You wint find fake stuff here.
Huge. This is a huge and very modern and clean mall. You can find whatever you're looking for. Great food section on 7th floor. Don't get lost, you'll need a compass.
Big. Huge place... great cinema... Loved the weekly friday night bazaar at the foyer....
Great Mall. If you are looking for prices, good brands, and spend your day without getting bored, this is the place to be. Once you have your bags, take a London Taxi back to your hotel.
Great shopping. If you like name brand shopping, this is it. Very modern, clean and just a great place to go window shopping.

Great discount mall and attraction. Besides great discounts for handbags, clothing and fragrance, spectacular lighting attractions were available in front, enhancing enjoyment of our shopping experience.

Very western!. The shops in here are probably much too expensive for many Thai people to even think about shopping in and prices are at least on a par with European capital cities. It's bright and clean and no doubt in the food hall you find a lot of expats buying up Waitrose branded products, they even had frozen sprouts in the run up to Christmas!
Very Nice place ,very cosmopolitan and world class.The fireworks display there was awesome on new years eve.. Lovely place,very well managed despite the crowds.

Massive shopping centre. This is good to visit just so you can appreciate how major shopping is in Thailand. The shops are brands and boutiques and are therefore significantly for expensive than shopping centres like MBK and Platinum

Large shopping mall withall brands. Central worl is progressively re opening after last year's riots and fire. The Food loft of Zen is still not open but shoudl be soon. The mall is huge and many many bands can be find there as well as a food court and all type of restaurants. Not as highclass as Gaysorn and Siam paragon but good shops and an ice skating ring.
Top Notch. 5 star plaza, must visit in Bangkok. Easy access from Skytrain
Central World. I am not much of a shopper, but Central world had enough to keep me entertained. The food in the restaurants was pretty decent too.

One of the largest shopping malls in Bangkok. Although fire damaged in 2010, Central World (formerly World Trade Center) shopping center is back and better, at least redecorated. Located with an indirect walkway connection to both Chitlom and Siam Sky Train stations it is easy to get to. It has a wide variety of mid range and upper range shops both local and chain. The food area is particularly good with many different styles of restaurants and food presentations. The two department stores - Zen and Isitan - are at each end of the long mall. A new hotel is part of the complex for those who don't want to spend too much time getting down to shopping. For those who want to look at the brand names but buy the no-name stuff, the Pratunam shopping area is almost next door with its buildings full of bargains in clothes, leather goods and bags.
Beautiful but expensive. A lovely looking shopping place, but just look, as you cant afford to buy!
Great shopping!. Awesome! Highly recommend it! Take plenty of baht!!!
Nice. Enjoyable array of shops with some bargains to be had with more leisurely scouting.
Large plaza. Large plaza where you can have a lot of things to do. You can be here walking all day.

Nothing special, Paragon and MBK nearby are much better. Didn't care much for this huge mall. The food floor up-top is really nice but didn't care for the layout of the mall. Paragon and MBK nearby are much more worth your time.

shop till you drop. here is everything at great prices, though no more Louis Vitton copy's ...they are gone too much control by louis's people haha but everything else they have it!Suggest you go look for your self if you like to shop you will love Central World

damaged from recent riots still being repaired. one of the huge shopping centre with a good entertainment area, nice brands. some parts are still under renovation but I urge all to give support to this place to see it back to its glory again. :)

Nice places to eat. Huge shopping mall (easy to get lost!) with a nice range of places to eat on the top floor. Reasonable prices. Good way to eat outside the hotel and get closer to 'real' Thai food.
good for shopping therapy. Easy to get to by sky train. Mind blowing array of shops and international top products. Amazing!

Modern , Nice and Clean. This popular shopping mall is done a great job of remodeling to compete with Siam Paragon around the corner.My favorites place to eat are .."MK Gold" .. Good Roast Duck as usual with excellent service, but the price are a little higher than a regular MK. The other one is .. See Fah " .. Thai Food, I always end the meal with a famous Thai Desert .." Mango with Sweet Rice "... You must try it and you'll want more and more...(if in mango season). The Theater on the top floor is SUPER the special seat are nothing to compare. (you can't find in USA). Right now you can have variety cuisines and you can ride on .." Dining Cart ".. will take you to any restaurant of your choice (more 100). You can ride this cart at Floor 3 and Floor 7 , right by the pretty GLASS ELEVATOR.
great deals. you'll find everything here with great deals. ATM's, foreign exchange, VAT refund, Food court are all top class

Good Christmas Fun with Great Food.. A great shopping centre with excellent decorations and activities especially at night when bands play in the courtyard to large crowds. For cheap food visit the Central Food Hall with a huge range of food at extremely cheap prices. Melt Me was also a favourite of the whole family and the top floor cinema was a hit with comfy chairs and the latest movies on show. Overall, very enjoyable!
So Big. It is realy big and you may be loss. On the other hand, I remember that there was a realy big store in that mall, which was called ZEN, it was burned :(

Nice variety of stores and restaurants.. It's a bit of a hassle to get here by Skytrain - with a location right between two stations. They've just finished the renovations after the demonstrations from a few years ago. Great location for sporting goods and electronics.

Typical city mall. If you've been to Singapore, this would look like a ripoff of the huge Singapore chic shopping malls; except the fact that for Thailand standard this is the top!The Plaza is the central point for partying on New Year's Eve. Be there!
Great shopping and great Christmas decorations. Great shopping and great food. You must go to Din Tai Fun restaurant if you have never been before.

>.<Not good either. Seems like prices here are much higher than HK and Canada.
My major point for coming is Forever 21. Variety here is less than Canada but mark up prices.

A long walk along Sky Walk. To access the Central World Plaza it was abit of a long walk from the Siam station. Takes about 10 minutes of a very uneventful stretch. It would have been nice to have a few acts on the way. The mall is extremely large and one needs to be knowledgeable of where they are going. Most high end designer stores can also be found at this shopping mall.

Good shopping in Heart of Bangkok. You will find all kinds of brands from Imported to Local designer...If you are looking at GAP, ZARA, KATE SPADE, ROLEX, COACH , CRUMPLER, NARAYA, JIM THOMPSON ... U will find it here... They have more then 100 shops in there and its connected with Isten and Zen Department store and couple of min walk from Siam Square, MBK and Siam Paragon.

U can find everything. very big shopping mall, nice restaurant on the 6th floor, reasonable price.lots of small stores inside for anything U want.weekend beer garden at the mall entrance.easy to reach with skytrain station Siam or Chitlom and a little walk

Another Big Shopping Centre. If you feel you haven't seen enough big shopping centres then give it a whirl, all the shops you find in every centre like Topshop, H&M, Mango etc.Great location, nice wide walkways, good variety, good for getting out the sun, most likely the best one in BKK

Good mall. We stayed in Centara Grand so this shopping mall joined our hotel. It was good for shopping. No major difference than prices at home though. The food court was good and reasonable. The supermarket is excellent and we often got food & drink there for our hotel room at a fraction of what the hotel was charging. The supermarket has a great bakery, a deli and an Indian take away.
Great Local Stuff. Apart from MBK, this is a good place to get some of the authentic Thai designer stuffs.
Good place to shop. You can find all what you want in here. Tons of choices and low price! I can't stop buying!
Super shopping. All in one shopping, food, and cinemas. Great outlets of all types and items for tourists and thai's alike. super food options - plan to make a day of it

the best shopping in BKK. we have used this venue for meetings, conferences and personally for shopping, entertainment and restaurants - the largest 'mall' in BKK it literally has everything, with a hotel above and an exhibition centre
Just another big fancy shopping center. But a good escape if you're tired of Wats or if you are actually want to shop.
Tourists love this place.. It is spacious and carries many good restaurants in there.
great movie theaters, pricey shopping. you can find great deals during sales on name brand items in a roomy shopping complex. I rarely feel 'crowded' here. Their theaters are great.

SF Cinema at Central world - first class. Paid B$700 to watch Mission Impossible 4 and enjoyed every single moment of it. I enjoyed the movie experience much more compared to the Ultra screen cinema at the paragon. While both places allow you into the lounge 1 hr prior to the commencement of the movie, first class @ central world (SF) has a club lounge concept similiar to what you find in the club floor of hotels. The one at paragon was just a nice regular lounge. Food offered was more extensive at the first class lounge ( mini buffet) whereas we were served cookies and cupcakes at the paragon. First class @ central world also took our order for coffee or soft drink and pop corns (complimentary) which was served during the first part of the movie. This feature was missing at the paragon. (think you need to pay for it if you want it). In terms of comfort and sitting, both cinemas are about the same except with the quilt at the paragon providing more warmth compared to the blanket at First class.

Central World. A neat mall, with a pretty good food court. If you are into fashion, and independend designers, this is your mall. Lots of cute, ghigh-priced boutiques, for teens and adults. If you are looking for the VERY pricey mall (louis Vuitton, gucci, etc.) head across the street... but Central World is much more hip in my opinion!
Modern and refreshing. A nice air conditioned modern area with plenty of shops, restaurants, cinema and other attractions. A place to escape the streets and breathe freely.
Something for everybody. This place has something for everybody. We found it to be the best of the many malls.
Big shopping mall. They often have concerts here during the holiday season. Do people really visit Bangkok to see shopping malls?
Has everything. Good for shoppers, singles, kids etc. Restaurants are excellent, supermarkets world class and a great place to watch people.

A day-long destination...For Family... For those who enjoy high end shopping (still not Rodeo Drive), fine food and entertainment, this place delivers all of it. We reached there at 1130. Shopped in nice stores. By 2 pm, we went to a really nice chinese steamed dumplings place on 7th floor. Really excellent! We chose to for the movie after that. Some more shopping, few cup cakes, coffee, and on to Nobu- the wonderful Japanese restaurant. Outside, there were x-mas and new year lighting and activities for an hr. Did not realize how the day passed by.

too big and too pricy for tourists. I really don't like this shopping center for some reason. Is it because it's easy to get lost or is it because it is so expensive? Whatever the reason I only ever go here when I have to meet someone
HUGE mall, lots of choices to shop + eat + dine + kids. HUGE mall, lots of choices to shop + eat + dine + kids
just Bangkok. Atmosphere and buzz,great food all around, Thai and european as well as bakeries

Love this mall. Central World is just walking distance from our hotel. Very big and complete with branded and local brands.
I just dont like the food court that much. Although I did enjoy the desserts in the area. Mille Crepe is especially good!

Great centre, but keep the receipts. The centre has a number of reward programs that offer discounts. Keep the receipts and claim back the stickers, they are like gold and offer discounts of 50 p cent or more
Great shopping place. It's a good shopping place and a lot of restaurants. A large Kinokuniya to explore. The food court had really small portions for the their food though.

HUUUGGEEEE!!!. This place was a dream for my partner.. She just went on and on untill i had to protest lol..
On a more serious note, this place has literally everything. More than a handful of places to eat, a movie theater, loads of places to shop.
Its a must visit for all those who like to shop.

your fairly standard mall. much like your usual mall that caters the fairly standard brands. there are two shrines outside you might want to check out for photo opportunities. There is a series of street food stalls near it that sells grilled seafood choices at night. That i recommend if you are daring enough.
Rooftop bar. Definatley check out the rooftop bar. A great view with good ambiance.

All you could ask for. The place to go for any name brand good!
Full of high end fashion experience.
Along with lots of restaurants.
Shop untill you drop. Great shopping Center, but compared to my often USA travel more expensive in goods

Very large shopping mall. Despite still being repaired after the arson attack during the riots in 2010, Central World is a very large and comprehensive mid-to-upper level mall. One of its anchor department stores (Zen) is still closed at the date or writing but the other department store, the other anchor stores and the smaller stores are all functioning.Central World had a vast range of restaurants ranging from fast food to gourmet. It also has a wide range of fashion stores with the sort of brands you would expect in a mid-level mall.Central World can be accessed from both Chit Lom and Siam BTS (skytrain) stations via an elevated walkway.

Amazing. This has been rebuilt since the riots a couple of years ago and is one of the largest, cleanist Plaza ever. There are also restaurants/food hall etc and a lovely view if you want to go to the restaurant at the top.... There is also Big C opposite which is great.

Atas Food Paradise @ Level 6/7. At the lower ground, you can find bags like Naraya. THere will always be full of people. If you want to have some dinner, you can go up to level 6. where you can see diary queen, mos burger, pepper lunch over there. At the top level 7, you can find kroean and japanese food. There are sakura, and also Ding Tai Feng. Prices for beef noodle is 240B and wanton soup is 215B. Xiao Long Bao cost from 195B to 245B. So do remember to bring extra cash there. In the 5th day in Centralworld, I have went to the Japanese Restoran which is opposite of Ding Tai Feng, opposite of Fuji Restoran. There are no service charge, and the food there ranges from 5 to 10 Sing dollars. QUite nice and delicious.

Amazing shopping center. If you like a nice shopping center and see where the young and beautiful people are shopping, you have to check it out. It is very relaxing and offers good restaurants, cinema, etc.

Harrods in stages!. The Zen part of the store is still being rebuilt several time bigger than it was before being conveniently burned down during the riots two years ago. Part will be opening on 25 Dec 2011 with the enlarged store fully opening later in the year. basically more expensive shops with little character. Eat on 6th floor.

expat heaven!. living in china we don't get many uk brand names, so this was like a little slice of heaven for us! Next, DP, Body Shop, boots etc etc. Plus huge book shop with english books, maps etc.
The third largest shopping complex in the world. CentralWorld is a shopping heaven in Bangkok. It's got 560 shops and 105 restaurants.http://centralworld.co.th
shopping made easy. If you want to avoid the haggles, then shop here. Good value, and you will only stop shopping here when either your feet or your credit cards give up !!!

Shopping. Convenient and accessible to skywalk and just behind Platinium Fashion Mall for those who likes wholesale and retail outlet including the joy of bargaining and does not mind the poor quality of some outlets. Prefer CWP as one could try out outfits and obtain good workmanship and quality clothings.For sure one get genuine items at CWP and not copied.
Lots of brands available. Good place for shopping , very affordable place , good location one og the best place to shop in Bangkok

I got what I wanted. I took cool pictures of the consctruction workers!I bought something at CC double O. (I usually do...)And there was a 50% sale in Mango which made me spend some more money. This was on the 13th and 14th of December.I also found some Scottish, Dean's butterscotch shortbread rounds. I was in such joy! I am allergic to chocolate and nuts and it is always exciting to find something like these!Overall, I had a nice time by myself at Central World Plaza while my husband was on a business meeting. :-)

Almost too big. Central World keeps getting bigger and with so many floors it can be hard to locate the shop you are looking for. It does offfer some good shopping and restaurants as well as a big amusement area for kids. Zen was still closed when I was last there - but used to be my favourite of the Central Deparment stores so I will return to check out the renovated post fire store next time I am in Bangkok.

Super Mall. This is the shopping mall to end all shopping malls--even if you don't want to shop, it's fun to visit. Don't miss the food hall upstairs and drinks at sunset at the neary Centara Hotel afterwards
Western Shopping Centre. Western Shopping Centre with Western Pricing. Very Clean with all of the name brand stores at brand name prices.

A shopping mall that is too big. The shopping mall is huge with wide walk way. It is very comfortable to walk inside because you won't feel squeezy. However, it is also difficulty to find destinated shops.
same as siam paragon. basically the same as siam paragon mall, there actually right beside eachother.
Huge Mall. Central world plaza has lots to see, from shopping to games. it is based in the heart of Bangkok.

Newly re-opened and has a wow factor. The newly re-opened Central World Plaza has more of a wow factor than neighbouring department stores and shopping Malls.It is very easy to get to using either of the BTS lines and getting off at Siam, the junction station for both lines and then using the sky walk (that links Chit Lom BTS with Siam BTS) away from Siam, about 100 metres or so..Central World Plaza has a great range of international brand names (although prices are not really different to the same items in the main European centres).There are lots of entertainment options including an ice rink and iMax Cinema. The information desk has directories with helpful maps to locate all the stores and entertainment options.

Open again after the riots. We were just there yesterday, and most if it is open again, but there is still construction going on. The charring of the walls from the fires is still visible. Central World Plaza is as much of a city center as Bangkok has. It's a great 30 min. walk on the elevated platform from Siam BTS station to Chit Lom station, over the hustle and bustle of Rachadamri Rd. You can make stops along the way at Siam Paragon, see the Erawan Shrine from above, walk through the Hyatt, and just watch Thais going about their daily business.

the best. Undoubtedly the best shopping mall in Bangkok. I ended up going there thrice in my 5 day stay. Simply love the spiralling elevators and the Christmas tree in the centre made it an even prettier sight. The variety of brands available is excellent. They also have a small but nice '6D theatre' on the top floor next to the central food hall which is worth a try. I strongly recommend a visit to this mall
The Bigger Naraya shop was here :). Naraya is avery famous brand in thailand... can as souvenir for friends & relatives
Nice Restaurants on 7th floor. Some upscale places, and some other less expensive places on the 7th and 3rd floors.

Lots of shops under one roof!. If you are travelling by BTS, stop at Siam Station. When out from the station, using the elevated walkways, follow the sign to Central World. Most of the shopping complexes in Bangkok requires you to pass through the scanner to enter. It is a stroller friendly place, but you may want to take the lifts to go up and down the mall which might take up some time.This is quite a massive mall with lots of international and local brands to offer, ice skating rinks, departmental store, ISETAN, bookstores, Toys-r-us, cinema and lots more. If you are looking for good quality souvenirs at affordable price, head to Naraya at Ground floor. There are also restaurants which caters to eastern or western taste buds at higher floors with a supermarket and a food court next to it. Central World caters for the young and old make sure you allocate at least 2-3 hours here. We spent almost half day here.
Wonderful Malls with Christmas Deco. Large mall with nice food court. During our visit, they have lighted the nall with christmas decoration and concert at the front of Mall.

a shopping treat - for the sheer size along. It's easy to get to and so many shops to keep you entertained. But the real draw for me are all the restaurants. There is such a variety that you can spend the day eating, with a little shopping tossed in. You won't find great Thai shopping deals here. Prices are close to Western, but you find huge variety and great quality options.
Lots of shops, but. just brand after brand - if you want bargains/traditional you should look out the more traditional places/markets like china town (silk/gold etc).

It has everything!!! and better shoe shops!!!!. A great place for shopping browsing, and near to a huge area of clothes shops and bag shops.Super restaraunts and cinemas as well as all the desirable shopping.
Shoppers Dream. Anything and everything you could want to shop for. Very east to spend the entire day inside and not see everything.

Ice skating and a Watsons. I decided to try out the ice skating rink at the World Trade Center Complex. This is not a standard US sized rink, it's more of a 1/3 size of what you may be used to. They rent ice skates for a few bucks and seem to be open regularily from 10am-10pm. The have t-shirts in a case that say "The Rink," but don't try and buy them, they won't sell them to you. rent a locker for a buck extra.

Up Market Brands. HUGE HUGE Mall with tons of brands, it has very expensive and also upper middle class brands. Worth going to this mall instead of Siam Paragon. You can actually find something to purchase here. Name the brand n it is here, right from ZARA to NARAYA...If you find Platinum Mall too cheap n Siam Paragon too Expensive, this is the place to be.

My fav. shopping mall ever!. I love this shopping mall as it's very close to where I stay. You can get almost everything at this mall. It's very conveniently located only a few hundred meters from the main BTS station (Bangkok Monorail) (Siam Square Station). It's also surrounded by other big shopping malls from MBK, Siam Paragon, Gaysorn Plaza, Amarin Plaza, Big C and Central Chidlom all in walking distance. I would highly recommend it to all tourists if they need a great shopping experience in Bangkok!Tip : wheelchair is accessible throughout the mall. (it's also available @ information desk if you need one)

amazing huge shopping mall with good restaurants. Shopping is a big deal in Bangkok. Shopping malls are one of the main hangouts for people of all ages. The former mall at this location was burned down during the political turmoil a few years ago. They rebuilt Central World and it is an amazing huge shopping mall. They have an ice skating rink inside, movie theaters, a grocery store, lots of restaurants. There is shopping for everything from mobile phones to furniture. You can buy western brands and locally made Thai goods. This is a big fancy, modern shopping mall. I recommend the restaurants in the Atrium section - some great food is being served here. Better than you would expect in a shopping mall.Don't try to take the elevator - you will be standing there forever.Do take a good long look at the map - they only put maps at the entrances and it's a long walk before you will see another.

Everything you need is here. Foo? Movie? Brandname Stores?They're all here. Perfect if you're looking for some fancy stuff - but not so great if you want a bargain. Favorite stores is Zara, GAP, Mango, Top Shop to name a few.

don't waste your time- luxury stores only. what a waste of time. it was the same super high-end stores you'd find on 5th Ave in NYC. everything was super expensive and super westernized. not a cultural experience in the least.

Incredible Food Court. The stores looked great (and everything I saw looked open as of Feb 11, though there was construction next door on the damaged part, possibly) but this review is for the 7th floor food court and grocery store. This was one of my happiest discoveries on my trip to Bangkok. Delicious, affordable food - most entrees are between 40-60 baht. We ordered a beef and rice dish, a spicy noodle dish and a soda for $140 baht (under $5). The grocery store is also awesome and stocked with many Western goodies. There are also tons of frozen yogurt shops and individual restaurants on this floor, as well as a cinema.

Nice Shopping Centre. We read the latest review and were unsure whether any shops would be open. However, we were pleasantly surprised. and found it to be a beautiful centre. Only one department store was closed but the other one was open and lots of shops including Top Shop, Marks and Spencers, Miss Selfridges and many more. There are 5 levels and covers a huge area. The shops are more affordable than Paragon Siam but still top quality mechandise.

Majority of complex is closed for renovation...Check before visiting. Visited on 15 September 2010. With the exception of Isetan (Japanese department store), the mall is effectively shutdown. It was severely damaged during the April / May 2010 riots. Before you take the time to visit, specifically ask your hotel staff or knowledgeable locals if it is even open / safe. I tried to check before this visit, but could not get a straight answer online.My first visit was in October 2009. Overall very impressed by its wide open spaces, trendy shops, and great restaurants. Isetan department store looked perfect on both visits. Great source of Japanese gifts, Japanese restaurants, and a pretty complete Japanese supermarket.It is a few hundred yards from Siam station on the BTS SkyTrain system. There are armed Thai soldiers at the Siam station, but I did not notice any others at adjacent stations. The Royal Thai Police HQ is directly across the street from the mall. That explains why the protestors concentrated at that location, and the mall was just an easy target.Felt perfectly safe and would recommend the mall to friends and family visiting Bangkok. There is security checking bags at entrances. Of course, check the local news and avoid, if there is any mention of any trouble.

One of the biggest malls in South East Asia. CentralWorld is the second largest shopping complex in Southeast Asia and one of the top ten biggest malls in the world. It’s located in Pathum Wan district in one of Bangkok's busiest shopping and tourism districts. You can access it by the Sky train as it’s located between Chit Lom and Siam Stations.CentralWorld markets itself as a middle class shopping centre, with the anchor stores of Isetan, Zen, a food court and cinema. There are many brand names familiar to UK visitors such as Next, Guess, Gap, M&S, Body Shop, FCUK.Although stores such as Isetan and Zen were busy, at the time of our visit many of the shopping levels were strangely empty and we were the only ones walking about. It is vast but then you need people inside to give it atmosphere.
An up market Shopping Mall. If you need to buy branded goods and acessories then this shopping mall is for you.But i think Siam paragon is better.

Great Location. WTC, or the World Central Plaza to give it its new name, is a large more upmarket shopping mall, with two large department stores at each end. Even at peak times it always seems fairly relaxed, never packed like MBK, particularly the middle floors.The resturants are great, I love Sizzler!!! The salad bar is well-stocked. WTC is set in a great shopping location so I would only spend a day looking around as some floors are all household items like furniture, etc... Food is usually ground and top floors.A great feature of WTC is usually the weeks around Xmas and New Year when there is a bar festive outside, very western in style. Been there twice for this and loved it completely; sitting there outside after a days shopping, in the heat with a cold beer listening to a band on stage whilst watching English football live on Boxing Day is an example of the pleasure available!!!Great for pushchairs, though didn't use lifts but assume good for wheelchairs. Currently undergoing large scale building work (due to complete 2006) so many shops closed or reduced in size, so until complete may disappoint.M&P&K
